author: {'steamid': '76561198002109870', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1612619428}

author: {'steamid': '76561198124427106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1381, 'last_played': 1709497430}
review:
I just finished this game. Bought it on the same from a YT video saying it's a hidden gem.

Yea, ngl, I was a bit disappointed. This is not really a game that aged that good.

Light play I did with Fighter and Dark play I did with Assassin and Sorcerer.

Total, I agree with the complaints of the hitbox system, it is quite horrendous. Best strategy I found was to disregard the shield completely and go back and forth to hit the enemy.

On the Sorcerer, it was overpowered as hell. Prectically after the 3rd or 4th mission, just switch to the sorcerer and you'll die either from your own fault for not noticing your health or from the game crashing.

And also, from all the classes of the game there are, first 3 seem the base and the rest are purely base plus some extra perks.

The level design was pretty nice, the money mechanic encourages you to explore everything to afford the upgrades. For such an old game, I was impressed by the maps.

Apart from that, gameplay is ok, story seems like the generic dark force vs hero kind of thing(though I liked the Dark gameplay, not sure if many games implemented this)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065321545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1696672080}
review:
[h1]Entre Luz y Oscuridad[/h1]
Desarrollado por el estudio sueco Starbreeze Studios, quienes a√±os m√°s tarde ser√≠an m√°s conocidos por juegos como  The Chronicles of Riddick: Escape from Butcher Bay, Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons y Payday 2. Un ej√©rcito comandado por el codicioso demonio Vatar est√° a punto de conquistar el continente. En un √∫ltimo acto desesperado, el mago Zane crea un insondable abismo y acaba con Vatar. Pero tal acto tiene la consecuencia de separar el mundo conocido en dos, el enclave, una zona de magia abundante conocida como Celenheim, y las tierras exteriores, fr√≠as y oscuras, cuyos habitantes pasan a ser llamados Dreg‚ÄôAtar. Mil a√±os han pasado desde entonces y el abismo ha comenzado a cerrarse, trayendo consigo el rugir vengativo de los Dreg‚ÄôAtar. La historia, aunque con bastantes clich√©s, no est√° mal, con el alzamiento de h√©roes dispuestos a todo y la t√≠pica arrogancia de los altos cargos acostumbrados a la paz que niegan la posibilidad de una amenaza externa con tal de evitar alianzas que puedan debilitarlos. Eso s√≠, el final queda bastante abierto en pos de una secuela que nunca lleg√≥ a materializarse.

El t√≠tulo tiene la esencia de un juego de acci√≥n en tercera persona de ‚Äúla vieja escuela‚Äù, sin un sistema de fijaci√≥n de enemigos, un control un tanto ‚Äúflotante‚Äù y un sistema de colisiones que podr√≠a estar bastante mejor. No suena muy prometedor, pero no es completamente cierto. Una vez te das cuenta que el combate cuerpo a cuerpo sigue un cierto ‚Äúritmo‚Äù sobre cuando golpear, acercarte y alejarte del enemigo, la cosa mejora. Esto se ve incrementado con el curioso sistema de progresi√≥n que tiene. En cada nivel, al acabar con ciertos enemigos y oculto por el escenario podemos encontrar monedas de oro. El total que tengamos nos permite equipar a nuestros personajes entre niveles, pero en lugar de comprar y vender, podemos cambiar libremente el equipo siempre y cuando no superemos nuestro total, lo que incentiva la exploraci√≥n, adem√°s, morir y continuar desde un punto de control conlleva la p√©rdida de una cierta cantidad de oro, con lo que habremos de tener cuidado. Es un sistema que funciona sorprendentemente bien al poder priorizar una buena arma sobre armadura, o intentar tener algo para cada situaci√≥n incluyendo armas a distancia o pociones de curaci√≥n extra. He mencionado ‚Äúpersonajes‚Äù en plural y es que al avanzar conseguiremos distintos personajes diferenciados entre s√≠, ya sea por el tipo de arma, la cantidad de salud, magia o velocidad, da bastante juego ya que ciertos niveles se benefician de un personaje especializado en cuerpo a cuerpo debido a lo angosto de su dise√±o con constantes emboscadas u otros m√°s abiertos donde alguien con arco, ballesta o magia facilitar√° el avance. Adem√°s, el juego ofrece dos campa√±as: luz y oscuridad, aunque la campa√±a de la oscuridad es bastante m√°s corta que la de la luz. Lamentablemente, los personajes que conseguimos en una y otra son b√°sicamente los mismos con un cambio de aspecto y distinto orden de adquisici√≥n. Curiosamente, se supone que al principio s√≥lo deber√≠amos tener disponible la campa√±a de la luz y una vez terminada desbloquear la de oscuridad en una nueva partida, pero yo ten√≠a ambas disponibles desde el principio, igual es por la versi√≥n de Steam. En las campa√±as nos movemos por niveles que podemos seleccionar en un mapa, ocasionalmente aparecer√° alg√∫n nivel extra que consiste en arenas de combate con tres oleadas y distintos niveles de dificultad cuya infusi√≥n de oro, si lo hacemos bien, ayudar√° mucho para avanzar y es que es un juego complicado. Tenemos tres niveles de dificultad: f√°cil, mediano (el juego lo llama as√≠) y dif√≠cil, que no podremos cambiar una vez empecemos sin tener que comenzar desde el principio. Adem√°s del aumento de da√±o, en dif√≠cil se deshabilitan los puntos de control con lo que habremos de completar cada nivel sin morir, lo que puede resultar un tanto frustrante. El juego no dispone de compatibilidad con mando; aunque es posible jugar con uno, rat√≥n y teclado resulta m√°s c√≥modo, en especial debido a la mala colisi√≥n (incluso con ataques a distancia) el juego se beneficia de una mejor precisi√≥n.

Visualmente se nota el paso del tiempo aunque quiz√°s menos de lo que uno esperaba, adem√°s, gracias a un buen sentido est√©tico basado en fantas√≠a oscura, cada escenario se siente diferenciado. El sonido est√° muy cuidado, en especial la banda sonora que cuenta con algunos muy buenos temas orquestales acordes con la tem√°tica; merece la pena escucharla incluso fuera del juego. El juego viene con voces y textos en castellano, el doblaje es correcto sin m√°s, con algunos actores haciendo un mejor trabajo que otros.

La campa√±a de la luz tiene una duraci√≥n en torno a las 7-8 horas, mientras que la de la oscuridad ronda las 5 horas. Una vez terminada cualquiera de las campa√±as podremos seguir en el mapa para volver a jugar cualquier nivel e intentar encontrar todas las monedas de oro. Pese a los a√±os que tiene, el juego funciona bien en sistemas operativos modernos con algunos peros. Es recomendable limitar la tasa de fotogramas para que el juego no se acelere (a 60 va bien). La primera vez que lo pongamos veremos que las cinem√°ticas est√°n con voces en ingl√©s, eso es debido a un error del juego que no modifica un archivo acorde al idioma elegido, si queremos las voces en espa√±ol hemos de hacerlo manualmente. En ocasiones hay un error en la iluminaci√≥n del juego (ese no lo tuve) y la tecla para consumir una poci√≥n de curaci√≥n no funciona correctamente (este s√≠). En la secci√≥n de gu√≠as existen posibles soluciones para estos problemas.

Pese a un sistema de combate bastante tosco con muy malas colisiones, [b]Enclave[/b] ofrece dos interesantes campa√±as, un buen n√∫mero de personajes con los que jugar y un curioso sistema de progresi√≥n que hacen que merezca la pena darle una oportunidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101615964', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1705666427}
review:
I like the level design and the graphics that while aged (of course they are) remind me of Heretic 2, a game I have beaten countless times, so the graphics are not an issue for me. There are unlockable classes and secrets and the game encourages exploration to unlock more content. Evil and Good campaigns, I couldn't play as evil from start, I guess it is unlocked after completing the game once, still nice addition to the title that adds replayability. 

All in all, I like the game, however, there is one main reason for me not reccomending the game which is:

The junky combat with bad hitboxes. I played as the beginner Knight class that becomes available in the first mission and who has trouble landing sword swings on the goblin enemies of the first four levels due to height difference... He kept swinging over their heads and missing hits... Also, I believe, (but I might be wrong) that in confined spaces my sword swings were deflected when striking a wall and were canceled. So imagine trying to fight a goblin as a melee class on a walled narrow sewer canal or it waiting for you at the bottom of a staircase. It is a nightmare. Furthermore while playing as the Huntress class I had instances where I could clearly see my shots passing through the chests of charging enemies, but them not taking damage and continuing to charge me unpertubed while I took 4 seconds to load up another crossbow bolt. Those instances I mentioned took all the enjoyment out of the game for me as killing enemies felt like a chore and I had to keep drinking healing potions to compensate for the damage I often took due to the buggy hitboxes.

The levels also feel short as if cut in half to be spread into more mini levels to trick the player into thinking there is an abundance of them. Everytime I met a new character and was expecting a scripted event or a mid-level cutscene that will give me a new objective for the level, the level would abruptly end instead. It puzzled me.

So that's my review, the game certainly has the old game charm and a lot of nice old school features like: Secret Classes, multiple campaigns, unlockables and interesting compact approaches, but suffers from junky hitboxes that make it frustrating and for its price you can probably find better alternatives, I've heard Gothic 3 is finally patched decently and Dragon Age Origins occasionally goes on sale for less than 4 euros, if you prefer enviromental kills and hack and slash old school fun on budget pc you can get Dark Messiah Might and Magic for around the same price as Enclave, or you can try your lack finding Heretic 2 on some store.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986301871', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1704717044}

author: {'steamid': '76561198151293050', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1628022269}
review:
"Enclave" ist ein Actionspiel, das urspr√ºnglich von Starbreeze Studios entwickelt und im Jahr 2002 ver√∂ffentlicht wurde. Es bietet eine Mischung aus Third-Person-Action und Hack-and-Slay-Elementen. Hier ist eine ausf√ºhrliche Rezension des Spiels:

[b]1. Gameplay: 6/10 - Solides, aber einfaches Hack-and-Slay[/b]

Das Gameplay von "Enclave" ist auf klassische Hack-and-Slay-Action ausgerichtet. Die Spieler haben die Wahl zwischen verschiedenen Charakteren, von denen jeder unterschiedliche F√§higkeiten und Waffen besitzt. Die Levels sind linear aufgebaut, und das Hauptziel besteht darin, Feinde zu bek√§mpfen, R√§tsel zu l√∂sen und das Levelziel zu erreichen. Obwohl das Hack-and-Slay-Element solide ist, fehlt es m√∂glicherweise an der tiefen Kampfmechanik, die in sp√§teren Spielen dieses Genres √ºblich ist.

[b]2. Grafik und Design: 7/10 - Dunkle, atmosph√§rische Umgebungen[/b]

Die Grafiken von "Enclave" waren zum Zeitpunkt der Ver√∂ffentlichung beeindruckend. Das Spiel verwendet eine d√ºstere, mittelalterliche √Ñsthetik, um die Atmosph√§re zu verst√§rken. Die Umgebungen sind detailliert gestaltet, und die Charaktermodelle sind f√ºr die damalige Zeit akzeptabel. Allerdings k√∂nnten die Grafiken im Vergleich zu modernen Standards als veraltet erscheinen.

[b]3. Sound und Musik: 8/10 - Stimmungsvoller Soundtrack und Effekte[/b]

Der Sound und die Musik in "Enclave" tragen zur Atmosph√§re des Spiels bei. Der Soundtrack ist stimmungsvoll und passt gut zu den mittelalterlichen Umgebungen. Die Soundeffekte sind solide und verst√§rken die Action auf dem Bildschirm. Die akustische Gestaltung tr√§gt dazu bei, eine immersive Spielerfahrung zu schaffen.

[b]4. Einzelspielermodus: 6/10 - Lineare Level und begrenzte Variation[/b]

Der Einzelspielermodus von "Enclave" bietet lineare Level mit begrenzter Variation. Obwohl es verschiedene Charaktere gibt, die gespielt werden k√∂nnen, √§ndern sich die Missionen und Ziele nicht stark. Dies k√∂nnte zu einer gewissen Monotonie f√ºhren, insbesondere im sp√§teren Verlauf des Spiels.

[b]5. Technische Aspekte: 6/10 - Gemischte technische Umsetzung[/b]

Die technische Umsetzung von "Enclave" ist gemischt. W√§hrend das Spiel auf den meisten Systemen stabil l√§uft, gab es w√§hrend der Ver√∂ffentlichung Berichte √ºber technische Probleme, insbesondere in Bezug auf Bugs und Abst√ºrze. Einige dieser Probleme wurden m√∂glicherweise in Patches behoben, aber sie k√∂nnten die Spielerfahrung beeintr√§chtigen.

[b]6. Wiederspielbarkeit und Langzeitmotivation: 5/10 - Begrenzte Anreize[/b]

Die Wiederspielbarkeit von "Enclave" k√∂nnte begrenzt sein, da es nur begrenzte Anreize f√ºr wiederholtes Durchspielen gibt. Die lineare Natur der Levels und die begrenzte Variation k√∂nnten dazu f√ºhren, dass Spieler nach dem ersten Durchspielen das Interesse verlieren.

[b]7. Community und Support: 5/10 - Eingeschr√§nkter Support nach Ver√∂ffentlichung[/b]

Die Community und der Support f√ºr "Enclave" k√∂nnten nach der Ver√∂ffentlichung eingeschr√§nkt sein. Da das Spiel √§lter ist, sind m√∂glicherweise weniger Spieler aktiv, und der Support seitens der Entwickler k√∂nnte abgenommen haben.

[b]Fazit: 6.5/10 - Solide Hack-and-Slay-Action mit begrenzter Tiefe[/b]

"Enclave" bietet solide Hack-and-Slay-Action in einer d√ºsteren mittelalterlichen Welt. Die Grafiken und der Sound tragen zur Atmosph√§re bei, aber das Spiel k√∂nnte in Bezug auf die Kampfmechanik und die Abwechslung der Missionen etwas flach wirken. F√ºr Fans des Genres und diejenigen, die nach einer nostalgischen Erfahrung suchen, k√∂nnte "Enclave" dennoch eine unterhaltsame Option sein.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970819359', 'num_games_owned': 1089, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1702484524}
review:
Absolutly stuttery. It looks like the frametime is all over the place, even though MSI Afterburner shows me that I have an absolute flatlined frametime and stable 60fps at all times. I can't recommend this game to anyone based on this technical limitation.

I can't tell you anything about story or gameplay because I am unable to play this game before I get motion sickness because of the stutter.

My rating -1/10, vomit inducing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022854959', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 383, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1674517626}
review:
Enclave is an action-packed fantasy game that immerses players in a world torn between the forces of light and darkness. This hack-and-slash action RPG offers a unique blend of fast-paced combat, character choices and challenging gameplay.

Unlike traditional RPGs, Enclave focuses on intense battles rather than extensive quests or dialogue. Your primary objective is to eliminate every enemy and collect as much gold as possible. With gold, you can equip yourself with better weapons, armor and more potions to aid your battle against the darkness.

The game offers a diverse range of character classes that you can unlock as you progress through the missions. Some classes become available after completing certain levels, while others are accessible by collecting all the gold hidden throughout the game. These classes, including knights, assassins, mages and more, each have their unique abilities and playstyles, ensuring that the combat remains varied and dynamic. The combat system itself is simple yet satisfying, demanding skill and strategy for victory.

As you progress through the game, you'll face a variety of challenging enemies and bosses. The difficulty level of Enclave steadily increases, ensuring a relentless challenge that keeps you engaged. The overall balance between exploration and combat is well maintained.

Enclave's complex level design keeps the gameplay engaging and offers a non-linear structure with multiple paths and secrets to explore. The game also provides two campaigns, the Light and Dark campaigns, each with distinct storylines, characters and missions. This dual-perspective approach enhances replayability and allows you to experience the game from different angles.

The hauntingly beautiful soundtrack adds depth to the game's art direction, which has aged remarkably well. Each level presents diverse environments, including dark castles, eerie forests and otherworldly landscapes, creating an atmospheric and captivating experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402660560', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1699989757}
review:
Ah yes, this game again. I remember my dad coming home with a new CD game when I was 5 years old and I saw this gem right away. I played a lot as a kid, was difficult back then. Then I went to steam many years later, and I had to play it. From the first time when I started the campaign, I just went HARD mode, since it's really the same like medium, but without any checkpoints on map.

Next thing, it only costs 5‚Ç¨ so it's literally free, graphics don't really matter in games like these, because all I need is just to get that nostalgic feeling again, and in that, the game succeeded successfully.
All things considered, if you want to have a good time in my opinion, buy the game, it's still awesome, just like it was 20 years back.

PS: If you're having problems with "mouse speed makes my game go faster than normal", just set your "Mouse Polling Rate" to 125hz instead of having 1000hz. It fixed the game for me. I still encounter some random crashes on Windows 11, but that doesn't bother me yet.

TL;DR - You won't regret buying the game. It's awesome nostalgic feeling. If you have mouse interrupting the game speed problem, read the postscript.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983742943', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1829, 'last_played': 1702874508}
review:
Dear developers,

I want to let you know that Enclave is one of my all-time favorite games. It's the only game I'm obsessed with. There hasn't been a year since 2003 when I haven't completed it at least once. Usually, I play it through, collecting all the gold, several times a year.

I'm still not bothered by the graphics in it. I think the animations are still amazing. Motion capture technology has kept the game from aging. Perhaps sometimes, the sky could be improved, but that's about it.

Of course, it's full of imbalanced characters and weapons, which is why it's impossible to turn it into multiplayer without changing the characteristics. But that's exactly why I love it. When I have the Staff of Darkness or the Fiery Sword in my hands, I fear nothing in the world, and I become unstoppable. It allows me to feel like a mighty warrior in life from time to time, and I thank you for that.

I'm aware of your other wonderful games too. So, whenever Sweden comes up in conversation, I remember Starbreeze.

It would be great to get a sequel or a remake on a modern engine, but I'm not asking for that. There's only one thing that saddens me.

This game no longer runs properly on modern computers. It's not hard for me to limit the game to just one core of my processor, but that doesn't solve all the problems. There are issues with brightness, as well as how characters behave in water. Actually, it's problems with character movement in general, but it's most noticeable in water; they just sink like Tommy Vercetti.

I don't know what's causing this. I simply request that you create a patch so I can continue playing this game fully on my computer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245647512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1704211739}
review:
[h2]Disclaimer[/h2]

I have to start by saying that i can not be in any way objective about this game. Everything you will read in my review is completely and utterly subjective due to the fact that this is the first ever game i have ever played and beat on my own, when i was a "[i]wee lil' lad[/i]". Only 3 years old i was when i first touched this game and 4 or maybe even 5 when i 100%ed it. So hope you'll indulge in my nostalgia. 
[hr][/hr]

Enclave is an absolute gem of its time. Made by the people of Starbreeze Studios, same ones who brought us the emotional [b]Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons[/b], the horror of [b]The Darkness[/b] and the fun times of [b]Payday2[/b]. Even back then, in the early 2000's they were people with sensible taste and a knack for developing simple ideas into fully fledged masterpieces. They seized the opportunity to make a game for the (back then) brand new Xbox and wanted to showcase the consoles potential. So they made this beautiful game.

When it comes to gameplay Enclave offers a third-person 3D hack-and-slash action adventure experience. Many (even Steam) consider it an RPG, but it truly is not. Just because you can choose whether to have your character upgraded or stock, doesn't really mean that you are "[i]playing a role[/i]". There is no real choice in the matter. The progression is there, but i can hardly consider it offering you a role to fit in. 
But what this game lacks in buzzword features makes up in enjoyable moment-to-moment combat encounters and varied enemies and environments to interact with. I cannot stress this enough but... [b]FOR ITS TIME[/b] 25 levels and 12 playable characters was more then enough to keep you entertained for a long time. Even now you can spend up to 10 hours trying to find the best-fitted fighter for any particular mission at hand.

The maps are vast and highly reword exploration with either in-game currency, a hidden access path to skip an encounter, or even a bonus map. Even more, a curious player is reworded for their thoroughness the moment when they collect all the gold pieces scattered throughout all the levels of the chosen campaign. On the Light Campaign you get the [i][b]9320 Battle Droid[/b][/i], and on the Dark Campaign you get [i][b]Fetica[/b][/i]. These are just overpowered characters to help you destroy your enemies in a much more enjoyable way.

Coming to the story element of the game, it is just a classic good versus evil story, but lived from both perspectives. Sadly, none of them are nuanced in any way. The good guys are good for the simple reason that they oppose the bad guys and vice-versa. They don't even try to show the bad guys from an other perspective when you play as them. If you actually pay attention and listen to the cutscenes, you'll get an actual reason for all of the events unfolding in the game. But the inciting event that triggers everything is just a classic "[i]evil demon wants to conquer the world for the sake of being evil[/i]". And don't get me wrong, it was/is/will forever be enough for me, but don't come to this game hoping for any sort of character development.

In conclusion this game blessed my very early years of gaming with its simplistic core mechanics and with its potential for replayability. The artstyle is charming for its clarity in designs and the theme and tone of the game match very well with its core idea. I would never be where i am without this here piece of software.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973439503', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1706587758}
review:
Ugh.  If you have a newer system build - no amount of tinkering will enable you to play it.  Not RTSS, dgVoodoo, or mouse polling can slow down your system enough to prevent a single keyboard click moving your character like the flash or having in game sequences start/finish in less than a second.  I even tried running it in VirtualBox and it was still janky.  
I guess there is at least one good reason not to upgrade your system if it's working fine.

Unless of course, someone has been successful and just hasn't posted it yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042177598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1689488556}
review:
Another one of those titles that are buoyed by nostalgia. Enclave is mediocre at best, bogged down by a lackluster story, TERRIBLE combat, and some of the the most ridiculous, janky enemies you'll ever fight. Ranged combat, with exception of a few staves, is downright atrocious. The melee is just as bad, and a lot of the times you'll be swinging wildly at the air as your foes jank around you. As you get into the latter portions of both campaigns, you mostly just end up sticking to one class and weapon, as the rest are entirely useless. Pick this one up on sale if anything.

P.S

ABSOLUTELY WORST SWIMMING MECHANICS IN VIDEO GAME HISTORY

author: {'steamid': '76561197964866568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1685890378}
review:
It's an anjoyable action game that feels pretty good, supports 4K (but highly support getting dx8to9 wrapper to have real vsync). Also 4gb patch is recommended.

The game levels are pretty short, but they are very well crafted and interesting.
Sadly, the movement is pretty bad, combat rather random - while you can target different body parts for different damage, you can't really target them directly, with exception of bows and crossbows (which feel pretty clunky too).
You collect gold, which is unlocked later forever, for you to be able to choose better loadouts.
In fact, finding gold and not dying is what the game rewards, so it is expected to replay some levels just to get more gold. Thankfully it's not gamebreaking when you fail a bit, but still feels nice to have more things to choose from.
Story is... there. But it might as well be kill everything and loot everything.
Game crashes, especially if you select replay level, apparently going back to map and trying again that way makes it happen less.
You unlock a bunch of characters you can use from light and dark campaign, so there is no issue that you are going to get bored I think, though some characters are plainly easier to play as.

For the price, it offers great deal of content I think, so I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199491238185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1682620830}
review:
Enclave is a medieval fantasy action game developed by Starbreeze Studios and published by Conspiracy Entertainment in 2002. The game takes place in a world divided into light and dark factions, each fighting for control of the land. The player can choose to play as a member of either faction, with each side having unique weapons and abilities.

The game's graphics are impressive, with detailed environments and character models that bring the world of Enclave to life. The controls are simple and intuitive, although some players may find the combat mechanics a bit clunky at times.

One of the game's major strengths is its replayability. Each side has its own unique story and levels, so playing as both sides is recommended to get the most out of the game. Additionally, the game features a variety of difficulty levels, so players can decide how challenging they want the game to be.

Overall, Enclave is a fun and immersive action game that will appeal to fans of fantasy and medieval settings. While it may not be perfect and has some flaws, it's still a solid game that provides a satisfying experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048321710', 'num_games_owned': 1172, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1681524715}
review:
I can`t believe this gem is already twenty years old. It`s still enjoyable these days (even without nostalgia). Great design of levels without too much backtracking, simple, but quite interesting story you can play for both, "good" and "evil" side.
Runs well on modern OS (tested on W11) in full HD without mods. Yes, there are some minor glitches, mostly with textures, but nothing serious to wear off the immersion. Price of 5 eur is a bargain, you`ll have hours of fun.
Highly reccommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060765195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1680280633}
review:
This is one of those games where the nostalgia holds up. One of the games that should be brought up when discussing a hit that wasn't recognized for it's greatness. 

The lore is absolutely unmatched along with its storytelling. A story in different perspectives on different sides of a raging war. 
Gameplay is dated for its age but still feels fun to hack and slash or use a spell on your enemies.
Graphics are to be expected for a dated game obviously but it doesn't take away from the story nor the combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198963046802', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1675272588}
review:
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099458236', 'num_games_owned': 1664, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1672372522}
review: What you see is what you get: a 2003 third person action game. You progress through a level by exploring the map, beating enemies and clearing objectives. There is a very basic upgrade system. Don't worry about the story. Overall, it's old, kind of barebones, but still a lot of fun. Runs well on modern systems and does not require a lot of fiddling around to set up properly. Absolutely recommended if you're looking for a simple, straight to the point action game to play in short bursts and don't mind games from this era.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048148054', 'num_games_owned': 1279, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1494196022}

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 602, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1673381007}
review:
Enclave is a simple action RPG released back in 2003. It takes place in a medieval fantasy setting, far from unique. It has a decent story, and you can experience it from two opposing perspectives, in a Light and Dark campaign.
Gameplay is in third person (with the option to swap to first person), and combat is mostly melee attacks, with a block option, or ranged, either with arrows or magic. It will heavily depend on your class, with some levels better designed to some styles. It‚Äôs clunky but considering its age it‚Äôs not too bad. It‚Äôs completely playable, and can be fun.
During levels, you can collect gold, which basically acts as a loadout limiter. You don‚Äôt buy anything, but the more gold you have, the better you can equip each class. You also get gold just by progressing, but the more you have, the better because the game is hard at times, even on the medium difficulty. Collecting all gold also unlocks an overpowered class for some fun replayability.
The graphics are ok, considering it‚Äôs an older title, and the music is also ok. However, there are issues like limited resolution options, regular stuttering, poor controller support and a tendency to crash on Alt+Tab. These are more common for older titles, and I notice these more that aging graphics.
Considering it‚Äôs a game frequently on sale and sold in bundles, it‚Äôs pretty alright. It lasts around 10-15 hours, depending on your exploration. If you like the genre, and have its age in consideration, you can have a good time. It‚Äôs nothing special, but I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008724226', 'num_games_owned': 1927, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1673125083}
review:
+
Nice graphics, for 2003 that is.
Druid's ass is 10/10.

-
Everything else...
Controls are garbage, I don't know if this game was made for consoles and I'm too lazy to google it, but it fucking feels like it.
Mouse sensitivity is very weird. Feels like X and Y axis have different sensitivities and also both suck.
Yes, there are two campaigns, but classes are basically same. Assassin from Dark campaign is Elven Archer from Light. Druid - Sorceress, etc. Feels very cheap and dissapointing.
Hitboxes are garbage, 90% of my misses from bows and crossbows shouldn't have been misses, but game just decided "fuck you".
Hitboxes are so horrible you'll be missing even in melee.
Story is somewhere there... I stoped caring during first cutscene.
Can't save during missions. Died? Go back to checkpoint.
Retarded money system. Every mission has maximum money that you can find. Problems are: unless you use guides or spend shitton of time to explore every inch of the map, you'll only get 50%-60% amount of money. Also, every time you die you lose 10 coins. If you die too many times - you'll get nothing after you finally beat the mission.
AI is horrible. Imagine a quick match in Overwatch where everyone is jumping around and move completely randomly. Multiply it by 2 and you get Enclave. Enemies randomly jump and wiggle only to start moving straight at you despite you shooting them in the face.
Ridiculous amounts of "Got you, bitch!" traps. After every corner hides an enemy, every few seconds - a trap. Unless you know and remember about all that crap - you'll constantly lose health and die very quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034601961', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 417, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1668342748}
review:
Enclave is a good classic RPG but playing this game now, could be very frustrating.
I'm a casual player so mostly I play SP games in easy mode. In this game, enemies are super aggressive even in easy mode.
Though Enclave has 8 characters to play, the melee combat is clunky and aiming crossbow must be very precise. There is a checkpoint inside each level but it doesn't work if you exit the game and relaunch it, checkpoints will only work for that playtime.
I'm not willing to sit through the whole game, but thumbsup for this entertaining game and t'was worth killing some time :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037717715', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1652, 'last_played': 1664686358}
review:
Calling Enclave an RPG is a little bit like calling a Sniper Elite game a Point-and-Click adventure. You're technically right, but it's not quite there yet. 

Enclave is a medieval fantasy action game with a focus on using the gold you collect during levels to customize your character(s) before heading into the next area. The gameplay, at it's core, is satisfying and precise, and the game was an early adapter of the dynamic hitbox system that we see being used in newer action games. Unfortunately, that is where my praise for the game ends and my indifference towards it begins. If you're expecting a grand adventure full of interesting characters, heartfelt stories and unique locations, then I'm afraid you won't find it here. Enclave is filled to the brim with story and levels that are bland and uninteresting, but inoffensive enough to the point where you can ignore it if you like the gameplay well enough. 

Overall, a good time-killer, and certainly worth the $5 price tag that it sits at now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148676717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 541, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1662436127}

author: {'steamid': '76561198272930717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1662064433}
review:
[u][h1] Enclave : une vieille relique enclav√©e de ma m√©moire √† pr√©sent [/h1][/u]

Aujourd'hui, j'ai termin√© ce jeu pour la deuxi√®me fois dans ses deux campagnes et j'en suis sorti avec un avis mitig√©, pour ne pas dire compl√®tement n√©gatif...

[i]Enclave, c'est quoi?[/i]

Enclave c'est un action-rpg en vue √† la troisi√®me (mais si on veut aussi √† la premi√®re) personne dans lequel vous incarnez un prisonnier  (qui s'av√®re √™tre chevalier) ou un assassin ( assassine? bref, qu'importe on voit pas sa tronche) selon l'une des deux campagnes. Par la suite on d√©bloquera d'autres personnages qui sont malheureusement pas personnalisables physiquement. Le jeu s'av√®re √™tre plut√¥t jeu-couloir, je dirai m√™me jeu-terrain car d√®s qu'on sort d'une limite (invisible), nous avons 5 secondes pour retourner dans le champs du jeu au risque d‚Äôabandonner compl√®tement la mission et adieu la sauvegarde (√ßa m'est arriv√© 1 fois, c'√©tait bien chiant quand m√™me). Chaque "map" est en fait une mission, avant chaque mission, on s'√©quipe avec le personnage et les armes que l'on veut (on a assez de choix mais cela reste restreint).

[i] C'est quoi le soucis?  [/i]

Cette partie est purement subjective, mais je vais essayer de faire part d'un minimum d‚Äôobjectivit√©. Pas habitu√© du "old-gaming", je me retrouve √† me frustrer par beaucoup de moments du jeu, j'en ferrai pas une liste compl√®te, mais ce qui m'a le plus √©nerv√© est la difficult√© du jeu. J'ai eu comme "bonne id√©e" (c'est faux, je voulais juste pas me faire chier) de commencer le jeu en facile (Pour ma premi√®re partie, c'√©tait dans la campagne des lumi√®res, donc les gentils, wouah qu'est-ce que tu nous apprends mec) . Le jeu paraissait simple au tout d√©but puis les choses ont commenc√© √† se corser, ce n'est qu'apr√®s avoir compris l'astuce de l'arc que le jeu devenait "plus plaisant" √† oneshot ses ennemis. Mais la gal√®re √©tait toujours pr√©sente pour ma part. Autre point noir (pour moi) dans ce jeu, c'est le syst√®me de checkpoint. Vous devez commencer du tout d√©but tant qu'un checkpoint n'est pas activ√©. Le challenge en plus avec √ßa, c'est d'avoir des pi√®ces car r√©appara√Ætre ne se fait pas gratuitement , vous perdez une petite somme (si vous mourrez beaucoup, √ßa fait quand m√™me une somme cons√©quente) , bref, sachez qu'avant d'activer un checkpoint, il faut avoir un peu d'argent sur soi. L'argent se fait en cours de "map" (je dirai mission √† pr√©sent) . C'est de l'or √©parpill√© un peu partout dans le lieu de la mission mais aussi r√©cup√©rable sur la mort des cadavres (plus que de l'or, √ßa peut √™tre des gemmes). L'autre probl√®me du checkpoint et qu'on peut vite rouler sur les ennemis, car oui une fois mort apr√®s avoir activ√© un checkpoint et qu'on est  √† bloc niveau thune, l'ennemi qu'on √©tait entrain de battre, n'aura pas sa vie de r√©cup√©r√©, vous √™tes juste avantag√© tout court pour le coup. Bref, j'aurai peut-√™tre aim√© les saves manuels qu'on appuie sur une touche F tout en faisant nous m√™mes gaffe... 
Finalement, mon autre d√©ception sera la deuxi√®me campagne (campagne t√©n√®bres) l√† o√π on joue au m√™me jeu dans la vue des m√©chants en somme... L'id√©e est honorable, je me suis quand m√™me forc√© tout en voulant rester neutre dans ma d√©ception, tout au long du jeu (Je l'ai fini en normal, j'ai essay√© de me respecter un minimum). H√©las, l√† o√π on avait une fin "√©pique" avec le campagne lumi√®re, la fin de la campagne t√©n√®bres est bien d√©cevante. J'en dirai pas plus. En bref, je vois un jeu exp√©rience √† jouer peut-√™tre une fois dans sa vie et s'en faire une avis plus concr√®te que moi. Le jeu n'est pas mauvais, mais plut√¥t frustrant voire illogique par moment. Et j'aimerai finir en point n√©gatif avec le bestiaire. C'est assez vari√© (pas √©norm√©ment mais suffisamment pour un jeu de l'√©poque). Vous aurez des ennemis plus rebutants que d'autres √† tuer (faites gaffe aux archers surtout, par piti√©, et ces mutants-gorilles je sais plus quoi qui foncent √† la vitesse de la lumi√®re sur vous). L'IA peut para√Ætre parfois conne mais quand les ennemis deviennent r√©actifs c'est autre chose.

[i] Des soucis mais... [/i]

L√† je dirai ce qui m'a plus : Honn√™tement graphiquement, c'est devenu moche, mais pour de l'√©poque, j'ai rien √† dire, c'est le jeu moyen (dans le sens g√©n√©ral) qu'on pouvait avoir , donc c'est d√©j√† un bon point, √ßa aurait pu √™tre plus moche , je me dis... Le physique par contre m'a plus ou moins bluff√©, je ne sais pas si beaucoup de jeux avaient des structures qui pouvaient se casser (bon nous on peut pas, par contre le d√©cor pr√©destin√© √† se casser selon les missions, je trouve √ßa bien fait, m√™me si √ßa peut-√™tre casse-noisettes parfois...).  L'histoire du jeu est plaisante (m√™me si √† vrai dire j'ai pas tout bien compris alors que c'est pas quelque chose de pouss√© avec un lore et tout, ou alors je suis pas au courant...) mais la campagne qui vaut le coup c'est la campagne lumi√®re comme j'ai pu le dire un peu plus haut dans le n√©gatif (oui c'est pas l'endroit ad√©quat, j'admets... mais fallait que j'en parle sur le coup...) 

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Je suis content d'avoir pu finir ce jeu, mais d√©√ßu de mon exp√©rience ... c'est dommage, car je sais qu'un jeu comme √ßa a du potentiel pour ma part, mais j'ai pas √©t√© le public vis√© pour un jeu aussi ancien. Si vous √™tes fans de vieux jeux, le jeu peut vous plaire, sans compter les probl√®mes que j'ai pu citer, autrement si vous √™tes quelqu'un de la g√©n√©ration actuelle, vous perdez pas grand chose √† part une exp√©rience... qui saurait peut-√™tre vous ravir.

review: Fighting system, the most important thing in this game just doesn't work. Most of time you spaming attack button and pray to hit an enemy. Playing as distance character is just a little bit less annoying. From time to time enemys just kill because why not. They don't hit you critically. They just kill you when you have half of your health bar without any possibility to even hit because you are too far from them. But game don't give a shit about that. Also distance enemys can shoot you when you behind a wall. Of course you don't have such a great power. Calling this game RPG is also some sort of mistake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139640733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1659197941}
review: I hated this game on the Xbox as a kid. Because of the weird controls it was very difficult to do anything.  Trying it on PC is so awesome! When the controls work well this game is a lot of fun with a unique and rewarding progression system that really welcomes and encourages experimenting with different characters and play styles with no punishment for doing so.  It also encourages and rewards exploring. Such a hidden gem.  I will say if you are the type of player that only wants to stick to one character and play style and just run through the story and missions once than this game is still made well but it will end up rather lack luster and bland. The intent here is to play around with variety as every character levels up regardless of which you play and you can switch out gear as freely as you wish with no penalty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107212373', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1549527441}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057801593', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 1336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1658409664}
review:
It's an addictive third person action game very similar to dark souls. Some pretty tough missions but they're so much fun to play so you'll always come back for more multiple times until you emerge victorious. It has its small share of "jank" but it never gets in the way of the satisfying action at all. 

Enclave is a very fun action game with emphasis on combat and exploration. You can choose to play as multiple races each with their own strengths and weaknesses. It'll take some getting used to at first, but after a couple hours you'll be right on your way to becoming the perfect killing machine. You can choose to play as both the "Light" and "Dark" side of the story each side having its own set of missions, story, maps and objectives.

Produced with an eye for detail, the graphics still amaze to this day. Beautiful textures and very varied map design as well: dungeons, towns, castles, caves, the underworld etc. Music is alright and goes very well with various situations and missions in the game. Sound design is also done very nicely especially the voice overs. If you like the idea of a very fun third person action game with a Dungeons and Dragons aesthetic and an emphasis on bloody combat using TONS of different awesome weapons such as swords and axes and bows as well as several magical staffs while taking dozens of hours to master and conquer, then go ahead and get this game.

I've put just a bit shy of 100 hours into Enclave on multiple platforms in the past years; and still when I see it on my games list, it puts a satisfying grin on my face before wanting to play it again and again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035695029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 1705100826}
review:
WARNING: (If you want to play on Windows 10, you HAVE to do the following every time you launch the game! Open Task Manager and go to the Details tab, then right-click Enclave.exe and click Set Affinity; this will let you change what cores are being used for the game. Make sure that only ONE core is being used!)

If you told me this game came out last month, instead of 2003, I wouldn't doubt you for a second. That's how well this game holds up to more modern standards.

The music, the set pieces, the sound effects; it all creates an adventurous feeling, like you're progressing through a strange and alien world. Combat is incredibly simplistic, but not dated; with directional attacks depending on how you move while attacking, and some directional attacks having a three-hit combo capable of massive damage! Every class/character also has access to some (surprisingly beefy) ranged weapons, with very generous ammo reserves across the board.

The game is also BRUTAL on Hard difficulty, removing its checkpoint system entirely and not hesitating to throw you in the dirt. It expects you to understand what is and what is not a broken strategy at this stage, because it will not hesitate to throw max-level melee warriors wielding end-game fireblades and heavily armed master snipers at you.

It expects you to do the same to it, so fair's fair on that front.

All-in-all, I highly recommend it. The core gameplay is fun, and the different classes/characters are all distinct enough from each-other that you never feel like they're copy-pasted. There's also a few challenges you can do to make the game harder, like going through the whole game without armor, or attempting a level with 0 health potions.

But for just the base, core gameplay loop; I can not recommend it enough.

10/10, very few games have stood the test of time like this one has.

(PS: read the manual that comes with the Steam purchase, there's a surprising number of tips and tricks in there that'll make your life easier.)

review:
Ho giocato solo di recente a questo titolo, e purtroppo devo dire che sente il peso degli anni passati dalla sua pubblicazione.
I men√π iniziali, fatti con piccoli FMV, risultano forzati e anacronistici. La grafica tutto sommato √® decente, mentre personaggi secondari e doppiaggio risultano involontariamente comici. Ma √® il feeling durante i combattimenti a risultare davvero pessimo, approssimativo. Amo gli scontri corpo a corpo, amo il fantasy, amo i giochi d'azione, ma Enclave, se giocato oggi, non riesce ad essere interessante. Per me √® un "no".

review: Right, so this is an oldie but a goodie. Hack & slash fan? this ones for you! Enjoy finding secrets & unlockables? This is for you! Magic & wonder? Yup// FPS? uh- theres even room for you guys, believe it or not! so... there are a few jumping spots that are altogeather stupid... some of the loot can fall into places that will kill you if you attempt to retrieve it... some enemies can 1 shot you (not kidding) and some very strange death hangups in a few places... 1 boss fight, early on that is altogeather DUMB. but quirks and quarks aside, is an excelent game that Ive enjoyed for many years and will continue to enjoy for years to come, buy it, you wont regret it// its fun, dark, challenging, you will definately get your moneys worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068174012', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 384, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1649157583}
review:
Enclave (2003)

Nothing better then running around and stabbing guys with your swords. This is a third person game where you hack and slash your way through enemies. You can shoot them as well and you got some magic weapons for the stronger enemy encounters. During missions you can choose a different character and your gear load out but that costs gold. You earn gold from just playing the game and exploring. There are some puzzles as well along the way. Story was good. Only thing I did not like personally is that there is some backtracking, like you tend to run back to areas you already explored to access new areas after you fetched a key or something. All in all, its a pretty fun game.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198062827907', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1645335590}
review:
Honestly didn't expect this game to be as good as it is. I never played this as a child, so there is no nostalgic value for me, but I do appreciate a lot of older games, so I gave this one a try and I wasn't dissappointed.

You play a selection of different levels with different characters, all with a different skillset. 
Each level is wonderfully crafted and absolutely rewards you for exploring and thinking outside the box. Not once was there a corner I couldn't check and find something cool.
The game also uses a lot of interessting triggers and mechanics, especially for its age.

I had a lot of fun with this game, the only thing holding this back is that the steam version is slightly buggy, but this is an easy fix with community patches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148474523', 'num_games_owned': 1532, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1644440073}
review:
1st time playing this 2022,  missed this game back in the day somehow, if your old like me  you should  love this game, cant actually understand why I love this game so much  but I do, will I ever find all that gold, some of its really well hidden, love the level design and being able to upgrade characters, for 2003 this is a well made game and it gone on my all time classics list.
Now the technical bit, Game runs perfect for me with no glitches, the map screen and character screens are small but the actual gameplay the screen fits the whole screen, Windows 10 64, Ryzen 7 3800X, 6800XT, 32 GB Ram.
Its great when an old game just runs without and messing around.

author: {'steamid': '76561199109542434', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1641762781}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 42.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.
After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

author: {'steamid': '76561198011184099', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1641606839}
review:
Mi era stato consigliato come titolo "simile" all'ottimo RUNE, ma sono rimasto parecchio deluso.
Una storia interessante, una bella atmosfera e qualche donnina mezza nuda, non bastano per fare di questo Enclave un buon prodotto. Tanti, troppi i difetti, a partire dal sistema di combattimento, vero fulcro del gioco, che si dimostra per√≤ troppo basilare e impreciso, complici anche le varie hitbox, che definire "approssimative" sarebbe un complimento. 
A peggiorare ulteriormente la situazione, ci pensano la buona quantit√† di bug e i frequenti crash durante le missioni.
Enclave √® un occasione sprecata, un titolo mediocre, che non merita il vostro tempo, se cercate un buon titolo fantasy d'azione, guardate altrove. 

Voto: 5\10

author: {'steamid': '76561198087410341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1693658207}
review:
If you read this, you probably have great memories of this game, but I don't, because I've never played it before.

Here is how the first 15 minutes look like:
- The camera skips when you move it and increases the the game speed.
- The walls go vanta black If you approach them with a torch, scaring the hell out of you.
- Gnomes make some disgusting sound

It aged like milk technically and I'm not spending hours fixing it up.

The game itself is fine for 2002, but 20 years later I cannot bring myself to play it.

Do not think you will have a better experience on Linux. Their "Linux update" is a joke. I could not get it to run well enough to play it.

I just won't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113848693', 'num_games_owned': 1170, 'num_reviews': 345, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1527281865}
review:
[h1]Comentario Rob√≥tico-Anal√≠tico: "Enclave" (2002)[/h1]

Entre 1997 y 1998 comenzar√≠a el desarrollo de Sorcery, el t√≠tulo debut de Starbreeze cuya cancelaci√≥n casi lleva a la empresa a su bancarrota. Por suerte Lars Johansson, de O3 Games, lleg√≥ con su aclamado t√≠tulo "The Outforce" para acabar por fusionar su empresa con Starbreeze y desarrollar t√≠tulos como "The Chronicles of Riddick: Escape from Butcher Bay" o la cita del d√≠a de hoy, "Enclave". 

Se trata de una suerte de RPG en tercera persona de car√°cter Hack and Slash cuya mayor particularidad es la posibilidad de jugar entre una de dos campa√±as distintas, diferenci√°ndose entre "Dark Campaign" y "Light Campaign", adem√°s de contar con una buena calidad visual y sonora para la √©poca.

Es un t√≠tulo muy b√°sico y el modelo jugable se resume a matar hasta ganar, pero eso no es algo precisamente malo, la simpleza puede llegar muy lejos pero para ello debe estar bien aplicada, y Enclave sufre de...

[list]
    [*]Un combate donde hits que deber√≠an darse no se dan (Sucede especialmente en personajes melee).
    [*]Una kinestesia muy mal elaborada.
    [*]Una IA tan mala que a ratos resulta graciosa.
    [*]Crasheos constantes.
    [*]Dise√±o de niveles bastante lineal.
[/list] 

Incluso le√≠ una rese√±a de alguien que dec√≠a que jam√°s cerr√≥ el juego, s√≥lo esperaba a que crasheara jajaja.

Cuesti√≥n, que Enclave es en realidad un t√≠tulo entretenido y podr√° divertirte durante unas cuantas horas, pero no es un buen juego y para disfrutarlo hay que saber tolerar bastantes carencias suyas.

[b]¬øEn conclusi√≥n?[/b] Recomendable en oferta y para pasar una tarde, no mucho m√°s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037502679', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1638897725}
review:
A bit of a rough little game.

There are 2 campaigns a Light and a Dark one.
You have to play through the Light one first to get a "code" to unlock the Dark one.
I recommend doing it in that order because the Dark campaign is harder at the start so get used to how things work in the Light one first.

There are different classes that get unlocked as you progress through the campaign.
You get access to better weapons, armour and such as you progress.

The stuff to collect like gems/gold are at times hidden so look around the level you go through. The more gold you get the better upgrades you can afford.

Using anything ranged can be a true hassle unless you go for the "shotgun" way with a bow which still can be a hassle with some enemies never being still enough and keeps shooting while moving around.

I recommend using medium difficulty for the first time as you get checkpoints then. They do cost 10 gold to use if you die. If you play on hard you play without checkpoints and it can be annoying since there are enemies that can 1-shot you or you fall to your death trying to get that gem/gold in a hard to get spot.

Enjoyed the game with the fixes below to get the game to run well. Never had any crashes whatsoever.

To get the game to run well I had to set the mouse polling rate to 125Hz. Without this turning the character made things go really weird and enemy behaviour was really odd. Found out about this on PCGamingWiki.
I also used the d3d8tod9. If you google it, it should be on Github.
To get the game to run in 1920x1080 I just edited the config file environment.cfg and set VID_MODE=1920 1080 32 60

author: {'steamid': '76561198020225761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 1758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1758, 'last_played': 1580339817}
review:
One of those numerous B class games which did not give you any unrealizable promises, but in fact was fun enough to spend hours after school. Back in the days I played Enclave from my friend's disc. Good memories. Later I got new PC, while he somehow managed to break his disc. Thus, I lost an access to the game for a rather long time... And it was great to find the game on Steam years later. 

There was no any innovative gameplay mechanics or mindblowing story. I'd say that most aspects here were typical for such kind of games. But still, it had a lot of classes to try, gear to choose, and secrets to find. It had some replay value. You could play both as good and evil. Different classes could change your gaming experience drastically.

I decided to give it a try not so long ago and for it's age, I must say, it looks surprisingly good. I finished one campaign, found all the secrets, and it was interesting enough. The game is rather hard (by today's standards), there is no check poihnts, so keep it in mind. I did not encounter any bugs, but sometimes had rare crashes.

As to adware controversy... Well, yeah, ugly situation to say the least. I bought the game not so long ago and thus, was rather late to the "party". But from my side I can say that at this moment there is no adware and it doesn't redirect you anywhere. Thus, the problem was fixed and it is safe to get the game.

review:
Enclave, was damals im Jahre 2003 durchaus zu den besseren Rollenspielen gez√§hlt hat, √ºberzeugt nach wie vor mit einer tollen Soundkulisse & guter Atmosph√§re. Nach all den Jahren nagt dennoch teils der Zahn der Zeit an diesem Spiel. Was dem Spielspa√ü aber nicht hinderlich ist. Grafisch geh√∂rt es zwar ebenfalls l√§ngst zum alten Eisen, l√§sst sich jedoch auch hier immer noch recht ansehnlich spielen.

Das Spiel verf√ºgt nach einer gewissen Zeit durchaus √ºber einen knackigeren Schwierigkeitsgrad, weshalb man vor jeder Mission  abw√§gen sollte welche Charakterklasse man nimmt. Da man nach Abschluss der guten Seite auch die b√∂se Seite bespielen darf, verf√ºgt das Game √ºber einen hohen Wiederspielwert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198444101910', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1633977405}
review:
[h1] YANOGA REVIEW [/h1]

[b][u] GRAPHICS -  ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÜ ‚òÜ [/u][/b]
The little ''Open-Worlds'' are well made and you feeling that the delevoper made it with heart and vision. It feels like a ''Retro-Fantasy-Game'' but definitly in a good way. Only the animations and characters looking damn ugly. 

[b][u] MUSIC - ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ [/u][/b]
Really atmospheric fantasy music. Gives you the Lord of Ring Vibez. One of the best parts of the game.

[b][u] STORY -  ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÜ ‚òÜ [/u][/b]
Typical fantasy story. Orcs invading the lands of magic in this case Celenheim. It was good enough to hook me but this game shines with his atmosphere. Big Plus: You're playing the Good and the Evil Side.

[b][u] GAMEPLAY -  ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÜ ‚òÜ  [/u][/b]
Yes the hitbox is trash. But every level or ''Mini-Openworld'' feels really open and well made while being linear at the same time. It really gives you that adventure and mystery feeling. But at Level 13 this game got so fucking hard that I quit it. I will definitly play it again at some time but at easy. 

[b][u] WORTH BUYING - ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÜ ‚òÜ [/u][/b]
When you're a fan of Old-School RPG's and don't borther and kind of dumb Beat-Em-Up Gameplay than you should definitly check this game out. But be aware - this game is hard kind of Dark Souly sometimes. But I will recommend It and come back at some time. I already watched a YT Video for making me an opinion on the story.

 [b][u]    LENGTH [/u][/b]          : Played 5 Hours, complete the game would take 10-12

[b][u]    BUGS    [/u][/b]      : None
  
 [b][u]     PRICE [/u][/b]       : Paid 2‚Ç¨
  
 [b][u]     DIFFICULTY [/u][/b] : Medium-Hard (Except Level 13 this is some Sekiro Shit)

[h1] FINAL: 

72 / 100 [/h1]

If you like that sort of Review, check out my Profile for more! 
Recommending every game over 60

author: {'steamid': '76561199012295242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1705041046}
review:
This game has no right to be as good a it is.

Plays perfect on my Windows 10 laptop, the graphics still hold up well today.

Gameplay is fast and smooth, tons of heroes and villains to play as, all unique and fun. The levels are a masterclass in game design. 

If you missed this game back in the early 2002's its one of the few action games from that era that really hold up well.

Think Hexen + Quake + a little Dark Souls and you get the idea.

Another fantastic game from Starbreeze

author: {'steamid': '76561198038737104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1707783939}
review:
In Enclave, hundreds of years have passed since the high wizard Zale saved the people of Calenheim from the brink of defeat at the hands of the evil armies of Dreg‚ÄôAtar by creating a massive rift to permanently separate the forces of good and evil. Now the rift is closing and it is up to an unlikely hero to rise up and fight. Will this aspiring adventurer succeed in his quest to fight for the Light and slay the demon king Vatar? Or will a minion of the Darkness take Celenheim for the forces of evil?

Enclave is set for a fall 2021 release on PS4, Switch, and Xbox One, and includes:

+ Immersive, fast-paced feudal-era combat
+ A massive narrative scope, including two distinct campaigns with alternate endings
+ More than 25 unique missions, plus additional bonus content
+ 12 diverse unlockable characters, each blending elements of traditional character classes in a one-of-a-kind way
+ Challenging boss opponents, each requiring different tactics to defeat them
+ An interactive gameplay tutorial that gets you into the action fast
+ Three different difficulty settings provide the right level of challenge for any player
+ A plethora of varied weapons, collectible objects, consumables, and magic items
+ Surprises around every corner with dozens of scripted event triggers to keep you on your toes
+ Captivating soundtrack paired perfectly with atmospheric sound effects


Enclave is a third-person action RPG with intense medieval combat, an epic soundtrack, and two separate story-driven campaigns which have the player fighting for the forces of Light or Darkness. Each faction offers six distinct character options such as Knights, Wizards, and Druids on the side of Light, or servants of the Darkness like Berserkers, Assassins, and Goblins. Wield swords, magic, and bows to wage war on your enemies and decide Celenheim‚Äôs future.


Time to update the pc branch

This game can be pretty difficult, so definitely grab it if you like a challenge.

review:
Enclave to gra akcji w ≈õwiecie fantasy kt√≥ra zawiera ca≈Çkiem du≈ºo r√≥≈ºnych mechanik czy element√≥w urozmaicajƒÖcych rozgrywkƒô. Gra ma bardzo ≈Çadnie wykonane menu i przerywniki filmowe, niestety sama oprawa graficzna mocno siƒô zestarza≈Ça i raczej nie ma siƒô czym zachwycaƒá, chocia≈º fatalnie nie jest. Gra ma fabu≈Çƒô i ciƒÖg wykonywanych misji jest z niƒÖ ≈õci≈õle zwiƒÖzany a dodatkowo mamy do rozegrania dwie kampanie, dla tzw. jasnej i ciemnej strony konfliktu cokolwiek to oznacza. 
Niestety ju≈º od samego poczƒÖtku mia≈Çem problem z rozgrywkƒÖ, przez czƒôste wywalenia gry do pulpitu co niejednokrotnie powodowa≈Ço u mnie dosyƒá du≈ºƒÖ irytacjƒô, gdy≈º gra nie posiada zapisu stanu innego ni≈º autosave w konkretnych miejscach. Jako ≈ºe gra jest podzielona na etapy lub jak kto woli misje, kt√≥rych jest ok. 13 dla ka≈ºdej ze stron - plus je≈ºeli znajdziemy specjalnƒÖ mapkƒô na jednej z plansz to otrzymamy dostƒôp do dodatkowych misji nie powiƒÖzanych fabularnie (areny) - to mogƒô ≈õmia≈Ço powiedzieƒá ≈ºe gra wywala≈Ça mi siƒô dwukrotnie w ciƒÖgu gry pojedynczego etapu czyli ponad 50 razy. Co do samej rozgrywki to na ka≈ºdym etapie zbieramy znanƒÖ wcze≈õniej ilo≈õƒá monet co nie jest wymagane ale bardzo pomaga gdy≈º zebrane z≈Çoto pozwala rozpoczƒÖƒá kolejny (lub powt√≥rzyƒá poprzedni) etap z lepszym uzbrojeniem. 
Problemy gry niestety nie ko≈ÑczƒÖ siƒô jedynie na czƒôstych wizytach na pulpicie ale w samej rozgrywce jest niestety sporo niedok≈Çadno≈õci czy po prostu niedopracowania. G≈Ç√≥wne moje zastrze≈ºenia budzi walka mieczem i skok. Podczas walki broniƒÖ bia≈ÇƒÖ nigdy nie mo≈ºemy byƒá pewni ≈ºe przechodzƒÖcy przez wroga orƒô≈º dzier≈ºony przez protagonistƒô zada mu obra≈ºenia. Animacja nie pozostawia wƒÖtpliwo≈õci, ≈ºe bro≈Ñ przeszy≈Ça wroga, niestety ten bywa niewzruszony. Co do skok√≥w to za ka≈ºdym razem mo≈ºemy wyskoczyƒá na zupe≈Çnie innƒÖ wysoko≈õƒá, co w niekt√≥rych sytuacjach, jak przeskoczenie dziurawego mostu, ko≈Ñczy siƒô naszƒÖ ≈õmierciƒÖ, a skakaƒá tutaj bƒôdziemy dosyƒá du≈ºo, zw≈Çaszcza je≈ºeli kto≈õ ma ochotƒô zebraƒá ca≈Çe z≈Çoto z etap√≥w. Gra po niemal ka≈ºdym etapie odblokowuje nam nowƒÖ postaƒá kt√≥rƒÖ mo≈ºemy graƒá, ponadto niekt√≥re elementy otoczenia da siƒô zniszczyƒá, np. drewniane wie≈ºe strzelnicze czy niekt√≥re ≈õciany. Poza tym czƒôsto wrogowie bƒôdƒÖ na nas zrzucaƒá skrzynie czy kamienie. 
Co do przeciwnik√≥w to jest ich ca≈Çkiem sporo i sƒÖ pomiƒôdzy sobƒÖ r√≥≈ºni na tyle ≈ºe nie czuƒá tu znu≈ºenia. Od walczƒÖcych w zwarciu, strzelc√≥w i mag√≥w po duchy i boss√≥w jest ca≈Çy podstawowy wachlarz przeciwnik√≥w kt√≥rzy ostrzeliwani z broni dystansowych nie czekajƒÖ bezczynnie tylko potrafiƒÖ siƒô kryƒá czy atakowaƒá grupƒÖ a nawet siƒô mocno odgry≈∫ƒá bo czƒô≈õƒá ze strzelc√≥w dystansowych jest zab√≥jczo gro≈∫na. Mimo wszystko nie ma tutaj wiƒôkszych emocji. Ca≈Ça walka jest mocno jednostajna.
PodsumowujƒÖc, grƒô odradzam g≈Ç√≥wnie ze wzglƒôdu na b≈Çƒôdy (wywalenia do pulpitu i s≈Çabe sterowanie) kt√≥re mnie powoli wyprowadza≈Çy z r√≥wnowagi. Og√≥lny wyglƒÖd i zawarto≈õƒá gry zdaje siƒô byƒá solidna i brakowa≈Ço by tutaj trochƒô oszlifowania bo zdecydowanie czuƒá potencja≈Ç. Jest prosta zar√≥wno w za≈Ço≈ºeniach jak i rozgrywce jak na starsze tytu≈Çy tego typu przysta≈Ço.

author: {'steamid': '76561198998262497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 437, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1625696689}
review:
ENCLAVE

A unique third person isometric RPG from 2003 that still holds up today graphically and game play wise, honestly some of the graphics felt like elderscrolls morrowind and I like that the loot you collect goes to an overall pot which each level you can get better gear for the next Fight.

The music and sounds are awesome, very classic of the time. The only major problem I have is the hit detection, sometimes I will be swing at a guy right in front of me and never hit.

I switched to the ranged druid and all problems went away.

Got it for a steal so don't pay full price.
Works fine on W10 with graphics on ultra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154950866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1620025915}
review:
This game is the definitive mediocre fantasy action game. It's not even that bad, and considering it's only $5 I can't honestly say it's entirely a waste of money, but there are better games that cost the same amount on steam. 
The only positives I can really say about Enclave are a) it's short so it doesn't draw itself out too long, b) some of the music is honestly really good, and c) they at least tried to set up a new fantasy setting, but whether or not they actually succeeded in making an interesting one is another matter entirely
I have to say the negatives outweigh the positives. For starters, the combat is just bad. I went through the game as the knight so maybe other classes were more interesting but for the knight you just do the exact same thing over and over again. Block, wait for attack, slash a couple times, rinse and repeat. That very repetitive approach is all you do for almost the entire game, the only exception being when it's necessary to use the crossbow. Next, the plot is piss poor. It has no stakes, flows terribly, and honestly seems unfinished, as if there are missing pages from the script. Finally, the last boss battle is just poorly constructed. It goes from being tedious to anticlimactic.
I wish I had more positive things to say about this game, but even after a second playthrough just to see if I felt differently after giving it some time it still disappoints. If you're a fantasy nut like me I'd say it's at least a novel experience your first time through, and if you just happen to have five dollars and four-five hours to spare there are worse ways to spend them, but there are definitely better ways as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981584030', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1598776970}
review:
This game is Awesome.


 Why?  - because it harkens back (lol harken) to the days when 'games were games',

 meaning they had a sense of adventure, excitement, lost in land of beauty and danger.

 Graphics may be simplistic compared to 500k res nowadays, but whatever the res they have a beauty and aesthetic that's getting harder and harder to find in modern games.

 Real 'action' controls means you feel like you're there, no 'click-a-skill' nonsense here.

 Beautiful characters and art that have depth and feeling to them, if I remember correct there were mininal (if any) 'cyborgs' in it as well,
 
 meaning if you want to play a game where you are lost and adventuring (though in a 'linear' stage by stage fashion) with danger around every corner and in a beautiful and cathartically pleasing environment,

 get this game now.

 I bought it on sale for a dollar,  and honestly I regret it,

 I should've bought it full price to give the devs some credit.

 (I already have the boxed version though, has some of the most beautiful box art of any game, search it in google it's a guy holding an axe)

 (Some incredible music in it too - it really creates that mythical 'magical' feel retro gamers were lucky enough to experience back in the day.

 Lucky are those who know what I mean by that compared to the trash-grind "gaming" we have nowadays.. )
