author: {'steamid': '76561198847128336', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1615130227}
review:
Oh boy! I never criticize classic games because I'm aware of their age, so take this just as my own experience when launching the game right now.
Too much collision flickering when trying to do some parkour or hitting some objects, controls freezing forcing to reload, which did not happened because the game crashed and amen...
Camera made me dizzy in both visuals. Combat looked wonky, never had the feeling of hits being delivered.

Worth a try and so I did but still...

author: {'steamid': '76561198034701137', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1614377643}
review:
Enclave is a really fun hack and slash. It's simple but enjoyable gameplay sees you travel through 13 different missions which are basically "kill everyone and get to the end" with sometimes a fairly simple secondary task thrown in.

As you play you unlock new weapons, armour and characters. Which character you choose for which mission can really affect how difficult it is, especially in the early game. The magic characters, however, are totally OP, even with their base gear.

It's really cool that you can play both side of the story, the Light and Dark, and both are well worth experiencing. Unfortunately, the game's hit detection is a really off, especially when playing melee characters. Hits that should hit don't and if you're on the higher point of a slope to your enemy you'll just swing over their heads while they hack at your knees. There are a few levels, particularly in the Dark campaign, where this becomes a real problem.

There are also a few other weird instances like enemies being stuck in scenery and the game "compensating" by throwing them across the room. One level with spiral staircases causes all kinds of craziness. And enemies will often jump off cliffs to their deaths, which is admittedly funny.

Still, it's not enough to totally ruin the experience and if you can get it cheap it's well worth the 12-14 hours to play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995466528', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1614295064}
review: It was mediocre back in the day and not much has really changed. It looks and sounds nice for its time and the character/campaign selection is an interesting concept but the gameplay is very janky, levels are linear and often boring, story is all over the place, along with the voice acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198992186955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1613502823}
review: After having played through both the Light and Dark campaigns 100%, I can comfortably say that this game is absolute dogshit. It's bad, but in a good way. The game reeeeally did not age well, and it shows immensely. The combat is clunky, the movement is aggressively painful, and everything feels like it's built to withstand nuclear fallout while simultaneously dishing out damage similarly. Despite all this, the game is actually somewhat enjoyable and the story was engaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039225683', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1611100176}
review:
Awkward combat and animations. With such shitty hitboxes you can never tell if your hit is going to land. Bows suffer the same - arrows often fly through the target. The mages were the only playable class because of their summons. Bosses are jokes designed with unreasonable strategies for beating them (magma boss for example). The levels literally have nothing except for enemies and bags of gold. Killing monsters might have been fun, but not with such silly combat. The game is generally too dull and empty. 
The visuals and atmosphere are the only strong sides.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166709598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1615996369}
review:
This game is fun. Its nice and short. 6/10

The melee mechanics aren't as good as advertised and kind of tedious at times. I recommend using the druid or huntress at the start for their range capabilities to make it a bit easier.
The graphics kinda suck and don't hold up at all.

The interaction button is right click, the same as your special item use (idk what to call it), so you have to look at the top left to see if you are really interacting with it.

But the level design is easy to follow, but many of the fights I'm forced to back out to actually have a chance in the fight (due to the tight spaces the enemies may spawn at).

The story is pretty shit from what I've seen of it, but it does give an excuse to half of what you are doing in a level. But at least there are two campaigns

I also have to mention that if your mouse has a "high" polling rate, when you turn your mouse from side to side your character speeds up their actions. Weather it be walking faster or swinging your sword faster, this is  referred as "wiggling" in the speedrunning community and taints your experience of the game. To fix this problem you will need a program to limit your polling rate to somewhere lower, I have mine set at 125. But this process requires a bit of caution, this messes with the drivers in your mouse and could break it. It may be worth it just to use an old / non gaming mouse for this game.

Overall this game is pretty shit, but its paced really well and thus fun because it doesn't drag on with sometimes annoying areas. Also a lot of replay value due to the preparation before a mission (chose class and their weapons) 

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197968560421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1603064004}
review:
**update** only gripe is the game has pitfall traps that can not be avoided unless you have played the level before. So you can spend a whole hour collecting all the gold in a level. Just to have the floor vanish and you are not even given 1 millisecond to respond. And the enemy mages are literally 10 times more difficult than any other enemy type. You will get rage.

WTf? This is one of the best games ive ever played

HUNDREDS of different weapons, armors, enemies, like 25 levels with the best non-open world level design i have ever seen in my life. One level is underwater encased by glass hallways and swimming lizard men

Theres like 15 different charactrs to choose from all having different run speed and armor sets and crossbows

The combat is awesome, if a sword or arrow hits your shield (even if you are not holding it up) it blocks it. If You pick a tall character and swing a sword the small orc enemies actually duck under it. Sometimes you need to crouch and swing your sword to not miss. Some swords you unlock are like 10 feet long!

One review said the bows take forever to reload LOL! Dude there are automatic machine gun bows if you kept playing a bit longer

And the best texture diversity ive ever seen used in any game ever, every new level feels like a new video game

It is a directX8 title, whenever i come across a DX8 game i drop this small file into the installation directory and it converts it to DX9 https://github.com/crosire/d3d8to9/releases/download/v1.11.0/d3d8.dll (ive yet to come across a dx8 game this doesnt work with)

i highly suggest you disable the vsync in-game and instead enable it in nvidia control panel (also enable triple buffering too which is basically stronger VSYNC as it buffers 3frames instead of the usual 2)

Dodatkowo ≈Çadnie wykonane lokacje (szczeg√≥lnie natura) czy przeciwnicy a na du≈ºy plus zas≈Çuguje tutaj czƒô≈õciowa mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá destrukcji otoczenia co w wiƒôkszo≈õci przypadk√≥w wyglƒÖda genialnie.
Oprawa audio zdaje siƒô taka jak wszƒôdzie, spokojna, dopasowana do klimatu i zmieniajƒÖca tempo w przypadku napotkania przeciwnik√≥w. Na plus r√≥wnie≈º podk≈Çadane g≈Çosy postaciom, dobre, przyjemne i dopasowane.
I teraz najwa≈ºniejsze - fabu≈Ça. Enclave posiada dwie kampanie - ≈õwiat≈Ça i ciemno≈õci - ka≈ºda jak ju≈º wspomnia≈Çem, posiada w≈Çasne postacie odblokowywane w trakcie postƒôpu fabularnego. Ogromnym zaskoczeniem jest to, ≈ºe obie kampanie siƒô r√≥≈ºniƒÖ - odbywajƒÖ siƒô co prawda czƒôsto na tych samych lokacjach ale z czasem i tu pojawiajƒÖ siƒô r√≥≈ºnice, co na tamten okres czasu wydaje mi siƒô powiewem ≈õwie≈ºo≈õci - najczƒô≈õciej gra "dobrƒÖ lub z≈ÇƒÖ" stronƒÖ sprowadza≈Ça siƒô do grania w tƒÖ samƒÖ grƒô ale robiƒÖc z≈Çe lub dobre uczynki co i tak nie mia≈Ço najmniejszego wp≈Çywu na przebieg historii.
Dodatkowo, system postaci i "awansu" jest do≈õƒá niecodzienny - nie zdobywamy kolejnych poziom√≥w pokonujƒÖc przeciwnik√≥w; zbieramy na ka≈ºdej z map z≈Çoto, kt√≥re jest dodawane do og√≥lnej puli, co umo≈ºliwia nam ekwipowanie coraz lepszego wyposa≈ºenia.
Wartym zauwa≈ºenia jest r√≥wnie≈º system walki, choƒá mam co do niego mieszane odczucia - przede wszystkim jest on bardzo ruchliwy, nie mo≈ºna staƒá i machaƒá broniƒÖ liczƒÖc, ≈ºe uda siƒô zabiƒá. Dodatkowo ≈õwietnie dzia≈ÇajƒÖce tarcze - je≈õli mamy jƒÖ wyposa≈ºonƒÖ to chroni od strony w kt√≥rƒÖ jest zwr√≥cona.
Niestety, na minus walka dystansowa - ≈Çucznictwo i magia z przeciwnikiem, kt√≥ry podejdzie blisko (a podejdzie, a to z zaskoczenia, a to po prostu bo magowie sƒÖ powolni) jest koszmarem, pociski najczƒô≈õciej przelatujƒÖ przez korpus i trzeba kombinowaƒá jak strzeliƒá aby trafiƒá. author: {'steamid': '76561198262569406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1606237308}
review:
Combat is clunky, bow and arrow/cross bow is border line useless unless there is a large area to be within. Story is ok at times. Can kill allies which makes no sense. I also completed levels where I feel like I shouldn't have, like I just had content stripped away from me, in the middle of fighting goblin creatures and boom "Level Complete" screen.
Constant sound loops and dull cinematic scenes. And ally AI that is just something else.
+ You can just jump past every enemy without having to kill them
Yes I know its an old 2003 game but I received this product from a gambling website. But even then, if you wanted to buy an old game to just pass the time, this is not the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984380951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1606316019}
review:
Game hurts to play. I can forgive everything if it weren't for the combat. Arrows take so long to shoot that anyone in melee range will destroy you. Also, arrows seem to lag (never seen this before on any other game) where it doesn't matter if the enemy is where you shoot but where they will be 0.5s from the time you shoot. So you have to lead your shots even at point blank range (seriously wtf? lol). Magic is cool and basically acts how bows should act, except you're still wide open to melee. This wouldn't make a difference in most games except in this game you are extremely slow and a lot of enemies spawn in front of you.

That makes the only viable character the knight. He has a shield to block, cool! Except even then The enemies can hit around it randomly and you have no real way to control it. Not cool. Also, even with the knight, HIS MELEE ATTACK HAS DIFFERENT ANIMATIONS WHICH HIT DIFFERENT AREAS. You can literally hit over short enemies. EVEN THEN the hit detection is rather poor and sometimes you'll see the the swing of your weapon model literally go through the enemy but not get hurt. If you get around all of that the combat results in you walking forward to hit an enemy, backing up with the shield up, and waiting for the terrible AI to miss their swing before you approach them again.

I wanted to like this old classic style ARPG but the painful combat, which is what 90% of this game is, makes it impossible. It hurts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082706574', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1606212005}
review:
I just discovered this game and it sold me in the (light side) intro. A lot of old games don't hold up, especially if you didn't play them in their time, but that intro made me feel like [b]THIS[/b] is its time. Like whenever I came upon it is the perfect time to play it.

That intro has LOTR vibes, warm and cozy and storytell-y, the world it presents isn't too original but the narrator is passionate about it, and it immediately invested/immersed me in the faction I picked. The one joke in it was classy and impressive on several levels.

I intended just to dip my toe and see how to categorize the game in my library, but now I want to keep playing to show the other faction what for, and see how the world develops. I'm just as hyped now as if I had discovered it at launch, it would have been a worthy contender for my attention against Gothic, Max Payne, Jedi Academy, and other solid stuff. Instead I'm playing it now over games like Shadow of War, Witcher 3, and Senua's Sacrifice.

P.S. The dark campaign was locked for me and apparently it's not supposed to be, found the workaround is to add the line [b]CAMPAIGN_DARKCAMPAIGNUNLOCKED=1[/b] to the [b]options.cfg[/b] file in the game's directory.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993316696', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 60726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30256, 'last_played': 1701822144}
review:
[b]Full Disclosure[/b] I have so many hours in this game because I have been speedrunning it for 6 years. I've made several videos about this game as well. If you have ANY questions about the game at all, even technical, reach out to me and I will have an answer. This game is basically my adopted child at this point, so [b]this review IS BIASED.[/b]

[h1]What a Terrible Game[/h1]
Enclave is still totally beautiful. This hack and slash Action RPG was ahead of its time when it originally released in 2002. Starbreeze had a great engine, and a great team working on it. The level design is fantastic and non-linear, so there's a lot of depth to the levels, and you'll get lost exploring the engaging scenery and all the twists and turns of wherever the world can take you. There's 2 campaigns with a combined 31 levels total to go through (including bonus levels). The music is phenomenal and smoothly transitions based on if you are in combat or not. The game uses a money progression system in lieu of RPG levels so you can afford better equipment on future levels to deal more damage and take less. Finding the money is a hunt and one of the main challenges. If you find all 13,000 gold, you unlock a chick with a Rocket Launcher. 

A main complaint is about combat, but actually hit detection is true to the mesh of the characters and objects, which can unfortunately mean there's lots of missing. Aside from this, the 12 different classes you get to play as all have their own playstyles, especially with the Druid/Lich (Caster / Summoner), Huntress/Assassin (Archer / Sniper), and Engineer/Bombardier (Bombs and Bombs). Some classes also have advantages through their speed (Halfling / Goblin) and unique weapons available to them (Godly Poison bolts).

The story is kind of boilerplate fantasy. Here it is:
The lands are magical, and the demon lord Vatar wants to suck up the magic. There was a war 1000 years ago because of this. The wizard "Zale" put a halt to everything by causing a circular rift in the world which created the Enclave of Celenheim. The people of Celenheim got lazy and stupid over those 1000 years and forgot that the outlanders wanted their magic lands. Now the lands are healing themselves, and Vatar is like "Oh hey now we can cross again" so now there's a big battle ensuing over the land. Celenheim needs help from their allies if they want to stand a chance, but the allies are so isolated and far away, also there's a big outlander fortress blocking their way back. That's what you take care of on the Light Side. On the Dark side, you help some goth chick named Mordessa summon back Vatar through making a virgin sacrifice of the Celenheim princess, then you siege the hell out of them.

[b]The Assassin is the best character because she wears a mask, and so should you.[/b]

[h1]How long will you be entertained by this $5 game[/h1]
About 3-4 hours if you're just wanting to play through something casually. Get it for a day, stream it, have some fun. You will have fun.

Also, everyone plays as the druid because of her butt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 797, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1424281343}
review:
[h1] Information / Review English [/h1]

Enclave is an action adventure game developed by Starbreeze.

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

In the world ruled by magic, the peoples of light and darkness were separated from one another by an infinitely deep rift that split the earth as a result of war thousands of years ago. The land of Celenheim is rich and thriving. It forms an enclave of sincerity and order, surrounded by the disfigured and barren wastelands of darkness, the war-torn plains of the so-called Outlands. Over the centuries, however, the deep rift began to close again, and skirmishes between the powers of light and darkness along the border areas soon became commonplace. Now it is only a matter of time before these disputes turn into a merciless war.

Celenheim is fighting for survival. A group of men and women are sent on a dangerous journey in hopes of saving the enclave from destruction. Their adventure takes them through hostile territory in search of the people of Meckelon, their ancient ancestors, from whom they were separated long ago. Perhaps they will find in them the help they so desperately need.

But Mordessa, the dark and mysterious leader of the Outlands, plans to bring the old demon Vatar, who was then responsible for the division of the world, back from the depths of the underworld in order to claim the magical lands of Celenheim. To do this, she sends her servants to acquire an artifact of forbidden knowledge that has hitherto been hidden from humanity: the Book of Souls. With the contents of the book, she would hold the key to the underworld and powers beyond the ability of mortals.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ solid graphics
+ several playable characters
+ 2 campaigns
+ over 20 missions
+ good mission design
+ challenging boss fights
+ lots of hidden places & treasures
+ a touch of Shadow of the Colossus
+ manageable menus
+ purchase of equipment and weapons
+ Trading cards

[h1] Contra [/h1]

- Game is too hard
- can only be saved at the end of the level
- Objects hardly destructible
- stuttering sound

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Enclave offers you a varied and wonderful fantasy slaughter festival, but with rough edges.


[h1] Information / Review Deutsch [/h1]

Enclave ist ein Action-Adventure, welches von Starbreeze entwickelt wurde.

[h1] Gameplay / Geschichte [/h1]

n der von Magie beherrschten Welt wurden die V√∂lker des Lichts und der Finsternis durch einen unendlich tiefen Riss, der vor Jahrtausenden als Folge des Krieges die Erde aufspaltete, voneinander getrennt. Das Land Celenheim ist reich und gedeiht pr√§chtig. Es bildet eine Enklave der Aufrichtigkeit und der Ordnung, umgeben von den verunstalteten und unfruchtbaren Ein√∂den der Finsternis, den kriegsverw√ºsteten Ebenen der sogenannten Outlands. Im Lauf der Jahrhunderte begann sich jedoch der tiefe Riss wieder zu schlie√üen, und Scharm√ºtzel zwischen den M√§chten des Lichts und der Finsternis entlang der Grenzgebiete geh√∂rten schon bald zum Alltag. Nun ist es nur noch eine Frage der Zeit, bis diese Auseinandersetzungen in einen gnadenlosen Krieg m√ºnden.

Celenheim k√§mpft ums √úberleben. Eine Gruppe von M√§nnern und Frauen wird auf eine gef√§hrliche Reise geschickt in der Hoffnung, die Enklave vor der Zerst√∂rung zu bewahren. Ihr Abenteuer f√ºhrt sie durch feindliches Gebiet auf der Suche nach dem Volk von Meckelon, ihren antiken Vorfahren, von denen sie vor langer Zeit getrennt wurden. Vielleicht werden sie in ihnen die Hilfe finden, die sie so dringend ben√∂tigen.

Doch Mordessa, die dunkle und geheimnisvolle F√ºhrerin der Outlands, plant, den alten D√§mon Vatar, der damals f√ºr die Aufspaltung der Welt verantwortlich war, aus den Tiefen der Unterwelt zur√ºckzuholen, um die magischen L√§nder Celenheims zu beanspruchen. Dazu sendet sie ihre Diener aus, um ein Artefakt verbotenen Wissens zu erlangen, welches bisher von der Menschheit verborgen wurde: das Buch der Seelen. Mit dem Inhalt des Buches bes√§√üe sie den Schl√ºssel zur Unterwelt und zu Kr√§ften, die das Verm√∂gen der Sterblichen √ºbersteigen. 

[h1] Pro [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198224334100', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1666827509}
review:
([i] Author's note: I played almost exclusively as this game's warrior classes (knight, bezerker) in my experience, along with only playing in easy mode. I have also completed both campaigns as of writing this. [/i])

Enclave is a classic medieval fantasy action game, which offers two campaigns, multiple classes, and a decent story line. In beginning this game, you will only be able to play as the good guys; The evil dudes are unlocked after completing said campaign. Naturally, these campaigns are different in their respective ways, but the classes have the same play style. 

As you progress further, different classes are unlocked. These include the standard warriors, sorcerers, and thieves, but also include unique characters like bombardiers and golems. Purses jam-packed with gold coins and shiny gems are scattered across the different levels. It is said that if you gather all of the loot on all of the levels, you will get a special character. 

The story was a bit odd. I found it hard to follow; Thus I find it hard to explain. However, I still enjoyed the story. 

In all, I give Enclave a 8/10. It was enjoyable, but not outstanding. 

P.S. Roll your R's when pronouncing Vatar[spoiler]rrrrrrrrrrrrrr[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197966108344', 'num_games_owned': 1050, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1599055125}
review:
I can *maybe* see myself enjoying this in 2003, and it's certainly seemed to have found an audience on Steam with over 2 million owners (this may be due to it being so cheap and frequently going on sale for under a dollar)...

But the combat is this janky mess of spamming your attack button and praying you hit the near non-existent hit boxes. Swords flying through enemy heads, arrows somehow passing straight through orcs, etc. None of the combat has any weight, or feels satisfying. There's a good foundation here, but I don't think I have the patience to watch my warrior flail around for 8 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334656136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1598972438}
review:
This is an action fantasy game that emphasizes dueling. The story revolves around the war of good and evil. A land called Celenheim is attacked by hordes of enemies, and your task is to help the queen defeat these enemies. The plot itself will not surprise you with anything. But the game offers the opportunity to enjoy this conflict from the perspective of both warring parties.
The game is divided into individual missions, where after completing one, the other will be automatically available to you. You start with a warrior, but then you get the opportunity to play for other characters, such as archers or druids.
The missions take place in relatively small locations and their content is usually simple. Usually you have to walk from one end to the other, and along the way find something or kill someone. You can also look for gold coins that are usually hidden in dark corners or in hard-to-reach places. Sometimes you will also come across a healing potion that will come in handy, because health regeneration is not at stake here.
This brings us to the main content of the game, which consists of duels. They are fun, but not particularly elaborate. The left mouse button is used to attack, the right to defend using a shield, that's all. You won't see any special combat skills, you just mow and hope to hit. But if you prefer long-distance combat, the game will suit you. Most characters can also use a firearm, either a bow or a crossbow. An exception is magic characters who use bullets fired by magic wands.
So if you are in the mood for a dueling action game, then you have my recommendation. But don't expect anything else, otherwise you will be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964249168', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1668495821}
review:
OK, first of all, this game is not really an RPG. I know it reads up there on the genre description here on Steam, but this game is more of an Action RPG then anything else.

So, basically you enter this world where humans are fighting against demons and vice versa. In your first playthrough you start playing on the Light campaign, as one of the humans. The controls function like any other RPG, except here the combat is more fast paced. You don't go around and do quests and there is very little dialog. What you do is basically kill everything you see, and collect as much gold as you can. With the gold you collect, you can equip better weapons, armor, and bring more potions with you each time. There are quite a lot of races/classes that you gain as you play (some by completing levels, and some are special classes that you get after collecting all of the gold in the game).

The game itself is fun. It's obviously not a modern game. The graphics are dated, but they're not ugly or anything. The soundtrack is lacking, with only a few songs that you keep hearing over and over, but hey, at least they're good. The gameplay is simple and intuitive, but I have to warn you that the hitboxes are very small, and the game can be a bit difficult sometimes. I finished the game on medium but even then I had to replay most levels quite a few times. After you finish the game for the first time, you can play the game now on the Dark campaign and get a different perspective.

Even though the game is from 2003 its It puts a lot of new games to shame. It's challenging, fun, and has a lot of content.
I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049908729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1644249175}
review: It is a step down from Severance in the class of PC ARPGs from the early 2000's, but quite enjoyable - short, straightfoward and with a nice money-based progression system that adds replayability. Unfortunately I couldn't stop it from crashing every 20 minutes or so in my Win 10 x64 machine - I set the core affinities to one core only, put the graphical options on barebones, used compatibility mode, none of it worked, so beware. Managed to get up to level 4 on Hard, where mission start getting bigger - you will definitely need more than those 20 minutes from then on. A shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122699896', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1596448254}
review:
This game is an action RPG with level progression and a cool point system where all the gold you pick up goes into a total which can use to select gear before missions, making it easy to test all the stuff there is. You can repeat missions to try to get all the gold in every level. When you die you lose 10 gold, if you get 100% in all levels you unlock a special character at the end of the game, there's one for each faction.

There's 2 faction stories, with several characters on both sides.

Game starts out quite easy but gets quite challenging later on. 

Don't alt tab the game as it will crash, otherwise it's very stable.

Definitely recommend this old school gem.

Edit: Things I find really annoying: jumping is buggy not only can't you jump properly it also makes the camera go crazy, another one is the hard to avoid instant death traps right the end of the levels that are so outrageous I will not give the game a thumbs down because I don't care about 100%.

Edit 2: the dark campaign is simply unplayable, using the archer you'll soon realize the hit boxes are broken and half your arrows fly through enemies without doing damage.

When you get to level 5 you get an horrendous level full of spellcasters that can easily one or two shot you in melee range and all the same with the traps. You also have to kill a boss using mounted crossbows but guess what, he can also easily 1 shot you. THIS IS NOT HOW YOU MAKE A GAME:

Good riddance. Now I understand why there's no enclave 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990918023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1594721133}
review:
The idea of having a good and evil side of the "story" is a good idea. Thats about it with the positive things.

The story is boring and cliche. bad demon is sealed away by good elve queen and wants revenge.

The gameplay is bronken and barely functional.

Both melee and ranged attacks pass throu the enemy around 60-70% of the time dealing no damage.
melee atacks have unreliable swing patterns that have no clear hitbox so besides missing all the time you sometimes hit someone 10 meters away.
ranged just passes throu the enemy unless they stand perfectly still and you can aim direktly at them. even then there is no guarante you will hit.

The only way to play this game if you are forced to do so, is to use ether target seeking magic or any weapon that deals splash damage.

The enemys are also plaqued with problems.
ranged enemys sometimes shoot throu walls and can easily oneshot you for no reason. some of them have full auto crossbows and just gun you down.

melee enemys can eather deal 15 damage to you or 250 killing you almost instantly sometimes.

The game also loves to just flood you with overpowered enemys like werewolfs. one werewolf is enough to kill you early game. 

even for its age i do not understand how this gamedesign could pass throu playtesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029887543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1593991768}
review:
[h1]My first RPG that I've ever played back in 2003: Enclave.[/h1]

[b]I loved to play this RPG when it was released in 2003 on PC, but also today. Altough the game and its graphics has aged and the gameplay is a bit outdated (e.g. clunky controls, linear world etc.), I like its atmosphere and story, the character system and the epic soundtrack. This very game was my first RPG I've ever played, and I had an awesome experience.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198013081630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1598513743}
review:
I'm only into Enclave 75 minutes , no problems running game.
This retro game is great, not real complicated, Iv'e been investing in a few of these older games and its worthwhile.
So the Graphics aren't as pretty as the AAA Games or new games due to age, but I'm finding that a lot of the design and art work are good and does not detract from the game experience.

I like my games a bit Linear and not HUGE like some of the open world games ( SkyRim and other elder scrolls games) Although I was addicted to FallOut 3 and finished the game and DLC's, I just found myself wandering about in SkyRim and nothing really happens unless i get lucky .

Strange, an old game for $1.99 has been more entertaining in 75 minutes than 5 hours of Skyrim.
Thats just me, I know...Its not Skyrim many love that game but I dont have time to get lost in the mountains for 40 minutes just to find a fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992824915', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 2301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1703527909}
review:
A real classic (XBox I), still funny as a pure arcade & hack'n'slash, with an amazing soundtrack, lots of good ideas, lot of atmosphere and interesting lore, beautifully voiced book intros, Light and Dark campaign replaying the same story on the opposite faction (!!).
In 1080p at ULTRA settings still looks decent (considering its age), with some evocative locations...
Recommended classic!

Full fixes for modern systems in my Steam Guide https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=418308035

author: {'steamid': '76561198181328170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 3778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3778, 'last_played': 1591176473}
review:
Played through this game on a lower end laptop :
CPU: AMD A10 4600M (QUADCORE)
GPU: RADEON HD 7660G 
RAM: 6GB DDR3 800MHZ
SSD: : HP S600 (520/500-read and write)

Experience was quite enjoyable. For a game that was designed in the early 2000 I can't complain about the graphics. I had no texture clipping , no invisible walls etc... AI was fun to battle. Although I was expecting credits to roll after the animation ending... (candle fades out ) Instead I just got kicked out to the NEW GAME  menu..

author: {'steamid': '76561198089123908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1427, 'last_played': 1699773637}
review:
Enclave is a good bit of mindless fun.
I don't know why the RPG tag is on this though. It's essentially a hack and slash with adventuring elements. The game probably lasts about ten hours if you're playing as the halfling/goblin and sprinting through every stage. 
Don't take it super seriously, mute the soundtrack and blast some metal in the steam overlay.
Also gotta love the early 2000s character designs. The druid's got CAKE check the community hub lmao

author: {'steamid': '76561198071357475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 391, 'playtime_forever': 1953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1708534692}
review:
fantastico!!!! Lo unico que venia jugando y que mas me habia gustado de starbreeze fue  the chronicles of riddick. Otro que no me gusto nada fue the darkness. Ese ultimo lo odie por ser demasiado soso a pesar de su ambientacion que era fascinante. Pero nunca pense que antes de trabajar con Vin Dissel esta compa√±ia sueca ya venia haciendo juegos fantasticos. Y este es uno de ellos. Me ha encantado como con las limitaciones de la epoca lograran crear una fantastica campa√±a hack and slash con el mejor frenetismo al estilo Rune. 

La historia es muy buena. La verdad no es tan narrativa como para darle un oscar ni mucho menos. Pero es sumamente interesante porque es acerca de una guerra entre las fuerzas de la luz y la oscuridad. Y no te cuenta solo del bando de los "buenos" sino tambien del lado de los "malos". Ambas con un viaje extraordinario a los confines de ese mundo ya sea para salvarlo o para destruirlo.

La jugabilidad me ha parecido increible. Quiza para esta epoca ya esta totalmente obsoleta pero lo grandioso es que tenes que tener mucha habilidad para atacar a los enemigos y tambien para defenderte. Debes tener cuidado de no morir en ciertas ocasiones porque si no conseguis puntos de control perdes la partida. Tenes que explorarlo por completo los niveles si queres conseguir todo el oro para comprar mejores armas. Y salvar a diversos compa√±eros tuyos de la guerra para despues elegirlos como personajes jugables que los vas desbloqueando a medida que cumplis todas las misiones. Podes elegir sea el bando que sea desde guerreros hasta asesinos. Elegi al que mejor se adapte a tu estrategia de juego. 

El apartado artistico me ha parecido fascinante tambien. Un amplio lore de ejercitos de muy variadas especies y bandos desde humanos hasta muertos vivientes. Y tambien un muy original concept art de la ambientacion sin tener que recurrir a los tipicos recursos esteticos de la fantasia tradicional. 

El sonido tambien me ha parecido espectacular. Con las limitaciones de la epoca lograron crear una espectacular orquesta epica que te acompa√±a en cada cruzada. Los efectos de sonido tambien estan espectaculares. Destaco mucho el sonido de las armas al chocarse y tambien al cortar la carne. Le agrega aun mas intensidad a la campa√±a.

Estoy muy contento de haber podido jugar otro juego de esta compa√±ia ya que en su momento the darkness me descepciono un monton. Totalmente recomendable. En especial a los mas fans de la fantasia y los hack and slash.

Acualizado 19/7/2023:
Recomiendo encaricidamente jugar a la version HD. Mejora drasticamente la experiencia del juego.

review:
I bought this one partly off its positive reviews.  I have no idea what game they played, but I expect it wasn't Enclave.  If I'm being obscenely generous my review would simply state: It‚Äôs mostly functional.  

It feels unfinished.  Attacks go right through enemies, getting stuck in the geometry is common, the gameplay is basic to the point of being baby‚Äôs first adventure and nothings polished.  On top of that it looks terrible, 2003 may not have been a banner year for 3D visuals, but this has aged horribly.  Had to return this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020313592', 'num_games_owned': 984, 'num_reviews': 574, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1584594101}
review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
[b]Enclave[/b] is a third person fantasy adventure originally released in 2002 for PC. The game takes place in a world divided in two main regions, the Lands of Light and the Outlands, by a magical rift which originated as a consequence of an ancient conflict. As ages passed, this gap started to progressively close, so this brought once again the forces of Light and Darkness into an inevitable clash. Offering separate campaign for both sides, players will either impersonate agents of Good or Evil and eventually experience the conflict from both sides. 

üü© [b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Good diversity of classes, weapons and equipment types to use, each suited for specific situations and enemies. 
[*]Several secrets to find in each level, sometimes even unlocking bonus levels as a result. 
[*]For a 2002 release, above average visual quality.
[/list]
üü• [b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Running this game without issues on modern systems requires an external 3D Wrapper and other tweaks.
[*]Melee combat is a completely broken mess, while ranged combat proves to be inaccurate and gimmicky.
[*]Level design is overall very linear, without much interaction with environments or secondary areas apart from secrets.
[*]The story itself feels generic and uninteresting, despite being narrated competently.
[*]Despite a seemingly good enemy variety, most foes will actually behave in the same manner with very basic patterns. 
[/list]
[h3]Rating: Mediocre[/h3]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2548409603]Click here for the complete Rating Chart[/url]

On the good side, Enclave's best feature is the diversity of classes available throughout both campaigns and how they progressively get more equipment types, as each can be customized before a mission. From the classic sword and shield melee warrior, to more exotic characters such as Druids using magic or Dwarves with advanced weapons, the game has a lot to offer in this sense. Level design is linear but has several secret areas to find and reach, all skin to very small jumping puzzles or hidden spots. Graphics are quite good for 2002 as models and textures look detailed and well made - the same can't be said for effects and animations however.

On the bad side there sadly is a lot more to say. Before even opening the game, to run it properly you'll need to install DgVoodoo and configure it properly - otherwise you will get crashes and glitches frequently. There are guides for this however. As for the game itself, the worst flaw is nothing short than the entire combat system, divided into melee which is an inaccurate mass of janky animations with some of the most unreliable hit detection i have ever seen, for both you and the enemy - making it all a game of luck and frustration. 

Ranged is just slightly better, as many times you will aim at an enemy and see your projectile, be it arrows or magic, simply pass through it or dealing no damage - incredibly unreliable and badly made. The design of levels, even with multiple secret areas, which are mostly just small nooks and crannies, is still very linear and uninteresting. Story narration is pretty good but the actual plot feels generic and fragmented, won't hook players to characters or the lore. The fact enemies are varied is good, but the fact they behave pretty much with two archetypes, ranged and melee, all being the same, gets boring quite fast. 

[b]Overall, Enclave is an adventure game with some good ideas and decent graphics for the time, that is held back a lot by multiple flaws and design oversights, to the point of becoming mediocre. It will take you around 8 hours to complete the game, and despite the current budget price of 5‚Ç¨, I cannot recommend getting this game because it aged very badly and its flaws ruin the gameplay too much.[/b]

[quote]Liked this review, and want to see more of the same quality? Check out [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39323490]Tamaster's Review Archive[/url] to see all my Reviews in a single, convenient location.[/quote]

[h1]In-Depth Breakdown[/h1]
üéÆ [b]Gameplay Analysis[/b]
The gameplay of Enclave is divided into Preparation, Exploration and Combat. 

[b]Preparation[/b] 
To a mission is done in the world map, where various dots indicate the various areas where quests take place. Most of them are unlocked as you progress, while some others are secret and need you to find specific treasures in levels. Once you select a mission, a screen will allow you to select your preferred class among those unlocked so far, and equip it by spending the Gold earned from previous levels. Gold is individual for each class meaning you'll have a separate budget for each of them. Once equipped, the mission can start, with you playing as the selected class. There are weapons, ammo and accessories unique to each class and they are unlocked with progressing the story.

[b]Exploration[/b]
Is performed on foot and often your way will be barred by fallen debris, or threatened by traps. Characters can jump and crawl in small spaces, this will prove vital to access all hidden areas containing gold or consumables, each level has a gold count to summarize how much coin that level has in total. Some secrets are fairly simple to access while few can require some more convoluted jumping puzzles or perception. Exploring can also lead you to encounter some additional enemies.

[b]Combat[/b]
Is the main activity of Enclave but sadly is also a mess. It plays out in third person, with either melee or ranged weapons, all class can use both but definitely only one is their strong suit. The melee system relies on a directional system, changing your attack swing based on your current movement direction, but it results pretty awkward and clunky to use, with several patterns being more harmful than useful. If this wasn't enough, melee hits have horrendous detection and both yours and hostile ones will end up missing right through bodies half of the time. Animations are a mess and haven't even a constant speed, the jankiest you can imagine.

Ranged combat is a bit better but still flawed, and while generally more powerful and less broken than melee, it still proves unreliable and clunky since the aiming "dot" is too large, projectiles have bad hit detection and will pass straight through enemies half of the time without damaging. I found that ranged classes especially mages are much more potent than melee or arrow based ones. 

üî© [b]Technical[/b]
[u]PC Specs: RTX2080Ti, Ryzen 3900X, 32GB RAM DDR4[/u]
To run properly the game needs the DgVoodoo wrapper and some configuring. Once this is done, it runs without any issue in 1440p, 85hz. GIven the game's age, it should run comfortably on even today's low end machines and integrated cards. 

[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
Enclave is an adventure game with some good concepts that is however overwhelmed by design and technical issues, resulting ultimately underwhelming and mediocre, also given the many alternatives of better quality the market offers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080166791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1661377824}
review:
Played this when it came out in 03 or 04?

Fighting is clumsy as hell if you go melee, but sniping with a bow or using magic is fun. Despite it's age, it has beautiful graphics (on very high settings) - voice acting is for the most part very good and it's not bad storywise.

You can, right from the start, choose to play the good guys or the bad ones. Unlocking more classes for each campaign is done by playing the campaign itself. 

It was fun then and still is now, for it's price, you can't do anything wrong in my opinion. Just keep in mind that the game is old, so don't expect very good combat animations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277158792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1581607142}
review:
First of all: this is not an RPG. It is fantasy - high fantasy, but it isn't an RPG at all. There are no skill trees or character development, only gaining gold and buying better weapons between missions. 
This is an Action/Adventure game instead, set in a dark, high fantasy universe, and pretty short, although once you finish the story, an evil campaign unlocks (didn't play that one). Game reminded me of Knights of The Temple.
A nice little game, but not an RPG game more then Lord of the Rings is an RPG book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262452338', 'num_games_owned': 1861, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1196, 'last_played': 1548660485}
review:
[b]Enclave[/b] is a third person hack and slash game from 2002 (ported to PC in 2003). Back then there was, of course, no Dark Souls, the closest games would be [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/210950/]Rune[/url] (2000) and [b]Severance: Blade of Darkness[/b] (2001). And older folks might even remember titles such as [b]Die by the Sword[/b] (1998) and [b]Dark Vengeance[/b] (1998).

The game features 2 different campaigns (good guys and bad guys), each with its own levels and characters. There's a total of 12 characters, 6 per campaign, but they're all essentially variations of only 3 archetypes: warrior, archer, mage. The game has no real RPG elements, you don't level up and don't have an inventory etc. You just choose your loadout with available gold before a mission and that's it.

Now, I'll just say it, the combat in this game was never good, even at release. The game wouldn't be so unknown otherwise. The dev team was more experienced with making shooters and was actually working on their own multiplayer arena shooter more akin to [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/2200/]Quake III Arena[/url], but then for one reason or another decided to scrap all that work and make Enclave for Xbox (and PC) instead, on the very same engine. There's still a lot of leftover code under the hood and all the enemies are technically multiplayer bots with fantasy skins and melee weapons.

Naturally, out of all the play styles Enclave has to offer (melee, ranged and magic), the bow combat is the most developed and fun to play, as it basically plays like a third person shooter. Melee is very very basic, you just get 2 buttons, attack and block, there's no lock on or any evasion mechanic, you just spam your 3 hit combo and pull back when the enemy does theirs. The hitboxes are awful and melee characters will have a very hard time going through the game on harder difficulties. Magic is again pretty basic, you get a bunch of staves, each with its own 2-3 spells, and you just stand back and spam those. But archers get a huge selection of arrows, ranging from poison, fire and explosive, all the way to sniper arrows which have a zooming scope (yes) and let you target specific body parts for locational damage. And the game makes a distinction between all the different materials you can visually identify on an enemy, e.g. bare skin, cloth, metal armor etc. But wait, it doesn't end here, you can nock multiple arrows and loose them all at once like from a shotgun blast. It's a very fun mechanic and I've never seen it in another game.

Now, the reason I'm spending all this effort to review a seemingly mediocre game from 2002 is that I actually liked it a lot! Yes, the combat is meh if you don't play as an archer, but those level designers were damn good. Enclave features some of the best level design before Dark Souls became a thing. Castles under siege, wizard mansions, lush forests with log cabins, massive structures in a volcanic land, the game has it all and it's very thick with atmosphere. There's a lot of talent put into this game, the texture work is still impressive to this very day. And the layouts are not just hallways or silly video game labyrinths, but more like actual living spaces with hidden nooks and crannies everywhere. Even the soundscape is commendable, I actually unpacked the game's files and there's like 5 sounds of an arrow hitting something, per each material. The soundtrack was composed by Gustaf Grefberg and it's easily some of the most original and haunting music in video games, mixing orchestral and folk music.

There was a lot of love put into this game, and it's really a shame that the gameplay turned out so half-baked. It definitely needed more time in the oven. But Enclave is still very much worth experiencing, in my opinion. Even without the nostalgia goggles.

P.S. You might need to use [url=http://dege.freeweb.hu/dgVoodoo2/]dgVoodoo 2[/url] for better compatibility on modern systems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094712311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1578067616}
review:
I went in with no expectations and i still was impressed with how incompetent this game is.

Right of the bat you game several minutes of exposition you know nothing about full of wierd names you dont understand what are supposed to be, skipping this you are greeted by a lady in black robes talking shit to you and how dead you are, mid-sentence shit gets blown to pieces by a siege weapon at the other side of the wall, its quite funny actually but thats were the fun in this game ends.

The first enemy the game throws at you are goblin like creatures that are considerably shorter than you, imediately the problems with hitboxes are aparent as your sword seems to go right over their head every single time unless you look at the ground.

After the first mission you are introduced to the level selector which in my opinion destroys any chances of the game being immersive. So the second mission starts, you get  hold of a crossbow and... its useless, damage is absolutely horrible and the hitbox is so bad the best place to aim it is at enemies groin and you will still miss most of the shots.

For the third mission you get the option to play as a huntress, supposed to be good with bows... isn't that what we want the most? To deal with some of the worst hitboxes ever with no backup plan? Btw daggers are useless. 

Ok i decided to never touch the huntress again, forth mission, i finaly died for the first time and the game doesn't even have an animation for it, it simply uncerimoniously cuts to black and you immediatly respawn at the last checkpoint, the thing looks very bad even for the time.

After that i gaveup, this game is tras. I didnt find a single thing it does well, from history telling, writing, combat, exploration, immersion, nothing works. I can't suggest this game to anyone unless you want to give a trollish gift to a friend or you are into pain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091405737', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1577849164}
review:
Enclave, a story about the Enclave. Your mission is to serve the Enclave through various quests that the queen gives you. You have to do this because you were caught not paying your taxes. 

One of the first missions, the queen sends you to protect a merchant. Shortly after you are requested to get the conveys supplies back for the merchant you saved. So far it's been pretty bland. The graphics are okay for their time, but the story telling seems very weak.

I do like the sound track. 

Fighting is painful. It seems like there is a problem with the hit boxes. Because you are so tall you have a hard time hitting goblins. It would be easily remedied by swinging your sword down, but unfortunately the sword seems to like going left and right. 

I would probably skip. It was fun for an hour haha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319049618', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1579076667}
review: Why Ziggurat decided to remaster this game for every platform but forgot PC is something I'll never understand. This port have many problems so I would advise you to buy the remastered version for consoles instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054316965', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1578846203}
review:
Enclave is a 2003 game, very similar to games like Shrek 2 on PC. Everything about the game is quite minimal, stripped down, it does the job. Levels can be completed multiple times to try and get all coins, each level gives you additional items in set locations - it really doesn't resemble modern roleplaying games.

What I enjoy is that you could run this on a potato at 1920x1080, 32 bbp and 60 Hz. My computer has trouble running other games of this era at maximum settings, but perhaps due to how simple the game is I'm able to run this at maximum settings. Environments aren't breathtaking, but it's not actually terrible graphics.

I'd recommend this if you want to play a game like Shrek 2 on PC or any of the XBOX or PS2 era platformers - typically linked to a single franchise. Not great, but charming in its simplicity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153534895', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1574934924}
review:
*This game is kind of boring (not gonna lie the story is interesting). I get the fact that is a game from 2003 or even old but I could not see me playing more than 4 hours. The combat is so clunky and the DMG system is so broken, the movement as well.
*Could not finish it, I just can't, but there are some interesting concepts that might be an inspiration for another games (BTW props for the ability to brake windows).
*The variety of the items you can equip is too low, again I understand it's an old game but there are even older games better than this.
*As for sound it's OK, I mean the soundtrack it's quite nice and the voice acting ( before being a thing) it's OK.
*BUT still I do not recommend this game in this time and age. Maybe somebody older will remember this game and will start playing for the sake of the old days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198397464077', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1574888701}
review:
N√£o sei dizer como foi a recep√ß√£o de Enclave na √©poca do lan√ßamento, ou como ele era visto, porem hoje ele se encontra datado em todos os seus aspectos, o que √© um pouco compreens√≠vel por se tratar de um game de 2003. Os gr√°ficos, como eu disse, s√£o antigos, particularmente isso n√£o me incomoda, vejo certo charme neles, me fazem lembrar da inf√¢ncia. Mas o que realmente pegou, foi a mec√¢nica de combate, ela √© bem estranha, o jeito que o personagem balan√ßa a espada √© tosco, e sem fluides, o que acaba tornando isso bem cansativo.

O game apresenta 14 cap√≠tulos para campanha Light e 13 para campanha Dark. Com 12 personagens diferentes que s√£o abertos durante a hist√≥ria. A trilha sonora √© muito boa, com v√°rias musicas √©picas.

Bom, o game tem, para mim, seus altos e baixos, como eu disse, a mec√¢nica de combate me causou bastante estranhamento, joguei ate metade de uma campanha, e talvez, eu continue. Vi que muitas pessoas gostam, e que ele tem seus pontos positivos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046877246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1687615557}
review: Playing as Huntress using a bow that's where the fun is. Bow mechanics are exremely simple, burst arrows to use like shotgun in close range, sniper arrows for head shots in long range, explosive arrows to get rid off armored minibosses, fire arrows to ignore. Play as huntress, press G to first person and play this game like its heretic, than it becomes a wonderful experience. I can't see the arrows on the bow (some display problem don't know why, don't matter) but, putting 8 arrows on your bow and unleasing a volley the first enemy that jump you... that is delightfull. I only wish there was an fps game like that or if the Skyrim's bows worked like they do in this game. I love weird games like this with mechanics like no other. Enclave, Blade of Darkness, Soldier of Fortune, Cultures and all that, gimmicky stuff but really fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993676094', 'num_games_owned': 2033, 'num_reviews': 714, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1572999598}
review:
The game crashes randomly, you can fix this by setting the affinity of your cpu but then when you alt+tab into the game its way too dark. Also you need to set the mouse polling rate to 125 otherwise your character walks like a disabled man. 

Hitbox detection is a mess, its a shame you need to do so much to just run the game properly. Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154240130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1569603314}
review:
I have only played up to the fourth level. However, I have to drop the game since the combat system is frustrating. Playing as a melee, the hitbox is rather small and you will end up mashing the attack button repetitively. While playing as a ranger is awfully hard as you will end up shooting moving enemies while they are bashing you.

Overall, the graphic and audio itself is ok (passable for a game released in 2003). But, I couldn't recommend this game for the frustrating combat system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071930151', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1569609253}
review: If you can appreciate a game for what it is in a contex (and for this game that contex would be an OG Xbox game from Starbreze, the good-ol Starbreeze, The Chronicles of Riddick, Darkness and Syndicate Starbreeze, the "The what? Oh, yeah, I remember this one, it was great. Shame no one bought it" Starbreeze, not the Payday 2 Starbreeze) this one is a timeless classic. Janky, a bit ugly (but with some nice posteriors, I mind you), running a bit weird on modern systems - physics seems a bit off, hitboxes and hitdetection seems a bit off, lighting is a bit off but it's fixable, you can dash around like sonic "gotta go fast" hedgehog if your mouse polling rate is higher than default from early 00s 125hz but it's all nothing because at least it's actually running. But even if it's janky it's still great because the concept is just to good to pass - "dual" campaign showing same extremely generic fantasy story with classic "5 minutes of pure exposition" cutscene at the begining from both good and evil sides, and showing you "what if they win" from the both sides as well and on top of that you get a full roster of your classic fantasy races to play - humans, elves, halflings, dwars, orcs, goblins, evil humans and etc. which are representing some typical "RPG Class" like warrior, mage, druid, archer, stealth archer, demolitionist and etc. That's probably the best part of this game - ability to play any level with any of those wastly different in playstyle characters. That is something worth forving this game all it's problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158729213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1567974427}

Ele cont√©m v√°rias classes que se vai adquirindo ao decorrer do jogo cada uma com sua jogabilidade.

review:
Es muy buen juego, si te gusta la fantas√≠a oscura, el estilo g√≥tico y los rpg es un juego ideal, la historia me pareci√≥ original, al igual que los escenarios y dise√±o de personajes y armaduras. La m√∫sica te mete al ambiente g√≥tico y dram√°tico del juego mejorando la experiencia. 
Con respecto al gameplay, presenta varios estilos de juego dependiendo del personaje y de c√≥mo lo equipas, pero quiz√°s la c√°mara aveces se sienta un poco rara, pero en realidad no es algo que afecte mucho la experiencia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995985473', 'num_games_owned': 2618, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1668110439}
review:
I actually do enjoy this game despite its shortcomings (overly small hitboxes, excessively long potion drinking animation, questionable A.I.), and it really is visually impressive for 2002, but the constant unrecoverable error/crash to desktop that's left me stuck on the same level for hours is another story.

The original Xbox version may not be as pretty or run as well despite topping out at 60 frames in a lot of locations, but it's a hell of a lot more stable to say the least. I'd pick that one instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287302928', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1562342798}
review:
Enclave √® indubbiamente un ottimo titolo e una scelta quasi obbligata per tutti i possessori di Xbox. Ci√≤ nonostante, √® vivo il disappunto per ci√≤ che avrebbe potuto essere il gioco con alcuni minimi accorgimenti che l'avrebbero elevato alla condizione di capolavoro. La straordinaria realizzazione tecnica, una trama coinvolgente e la spettacolarit√† delle missioni sono sicuramente le note pi√π positive di un gioco in cui a stonare sono per√≤ alcuni elementi dannatamente fastidiosi anche se non fondamentali. Se per√≤ desiderate vivere in prima persona un'avventura fantasy degna dei romanzi di Tolkien, allora Enclave √® probabilmente il miglior acquisto estivo per la vostra console. 

Pro:

Atmosfera fantasy di grande fascino
Divertente e spettacolare
Longevo

Contro:

Motore grafico non sempre all'altezza
Alla lunga un po' ripetitivo
Ingiustificabile la mancanza dei salvataggi

Voto : 7

author: {'steamid': '76561198091451306', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1540853451}
review:
[Critique tir√©e de mon SensCritique !]

D√©couvert totalement par hasard dans les catalogues Steam, lanc√© par simple curiosit√© et appr√©ci√© surtout par le biais d'un let's play, Enclave est tr√®s certainement ma claque vid√©o-ludique de cette ann√©e. Un jeu remontant √† loin maintenant (2003 tout de m√™me), ancr√© dans de la "pseudo"Dark Fantasy - plus Fantasy √âpique √† mon sens m√™me si c'est totalement discutable.
N√©anmoins, si ce jeu a √©t√© une v√©ritable r√©v√©lation, il va sans dire que le jeu parfait n'existe pas et qu'il y a tout de m√™me des choses √† pointer du doigt, en bien et en mal.

Dans ce jeu, il nous sera possible de contr√¥ler des protagonistes des forces du Bien et du Mal, mais dans tous les cas, le puissant Vatar sera au centre de l'histoire. A nous de le d√©livrer, ou de le renvoyer dans les T√©n√®bres d'o√π il est venu.
Pas plus de spoil, comme √† mon habitude.

Commen√ßons par le commencement, et par cela je d√©sire parler de l'ambiance des menus du jeu. Ils sont absolument sublimes ! Le fait de nous pr√©senter les diff√©rentes options par les mouvements d'oiseaux m√©caniques ou √† moiti√© en armure est une id√©e √©trangement fraiche et originale ; je dois avouer mon coup de foudre pour l'oiseau qui nous pr√©sente la carte de jeu qui est juste parfait !
Pour ce point l√†, rien √† dire. Une super et bonne id√©e.

Passons au jeu en lui-m√™me avec l'histoire.
Comme r√©v√©ler dans le bref r√©sum√© ci-dessus, nous avons la possibilit√© de jouer soit les membres des arm√©es du Bien, soit les membres des arm√©es du Mal. Suivant le choix, l'histoire va - bien √©videmment - varier et l√†, nous touchons d√©j√† un l√©ger probl√®me qui reste, certes tr√®s personnel mais quand m√™me : la campagne des T√©n√®bres est bien plus int√©ressante, voire travaill√©e, que la campagne de Lumi√®re.
Ceci peut s'expliquer logiquement. En partant du principe que Enclave devait, et est, peut-√™tre un jeu d√©sirant faire √©voluer le joueur dans les forces du Mal, on peut comprendre pourquoi la campagne du Mal est plus int√©ressante. Mais tout de m√™me, la diff√©rence est frappante.
Si la campagne de Lumi√®re est admirable, bien pr√©sent√©e, avec des soldats √† contr√¥ler fort int√©ressants, elle ne peut pas rivaliser avec la campagne des T√©n√®bres qui propose la m√™me chose mais en cent fois mieux : beaucoup plus de cin√©matiques, des personnages contr√¥lables bien plus jouissifs, une histoire plus travaill√©e avec des d√©cors √† couper le souffle - litt√©ralement, ...
Outre ces deux factions et malgr√© la diff√©rence de travail, les deux campagnes sont plaisantes √† suivre et assez intenses pour nous immerger dans ce monde rong√© par la guerre.

Pour rester encore quelques instants sur les protagonistes que l'on peut incarner, on est satisfait du nombre de possibles personnages : un large panel s'offre √† nous, nous proposant diff√©rentes approches dans nos missions. Mais le point extr√™mement positif √† ce syst√®me : c'est la "personnalisation". Entre guillemet car c'est plus de l'am√©lioration que de la personnalisation a proprement parl√© : en effet, durant les diff√©rents niveaux, nous ramassons des sacs d'or qui nous permettront d'am√©liorer notre √©quipement pour la mission prochaine. Et je dois avouer que - pour absolument chaque personnages, quelque que soit sa faction - l'am√©lioration maximale est juste g√©niale ! Des armes compl√©tements puissantes aux armures, tous les personnages finissent avec la parure des plus grands g√©n√©raux de Fantasy ; mention sp√©ciale pour l'armure maximale de la Liche !
Outre les personnages jouables, il est int√©ressant de remarquer que certains P.N.G. et ennemis sont attachants et effroyablement repoussants ; jamais eu autant si peur d'un type d'ennemi que dans ce jeu, allez voir pour vous m√™me si vous avez assez de courage.

A pr√©sent, le c√¥t√© technique du jeu.
Question difficult√©... M√™h ! Il est vrai que si certains boss ou passages sont assez barbants, il faut avouer que la difficult√© n'est pas totalement un probl√®me, m√™me en difficile. De plus, il est possible de d√©bloquer des personnages litt√©ralement immortels pour clore les niveaux donc... Difficult√©, o√π es-tu ?
Pour la maniabilit√©, l√† aussi, √ßa se corse un peu : les attaques de nos personnages sont "durs" √† placer, surtout durant les combats dans les escaliers o√π si on descend et attaque des ennemis qui montent, c'est fini, jamais on arrivera √† toucher qui que ce soit. √âgalement, on a plus de chance de se faire tuer par des explosions, des √©boulements et autres accidents que par des ennemis. A partir de l√†, on peut peut-√™tre s'interroger un petit peu.
Pour les graphismes... Bah, c'est un jeu de 2003. Il ne faut pas sp√©cialement s'attendre √† des graphismes extraordinaires m√™me s'ils sont loin d'√™tre affreux. Cependant, une mention tr√®s sp√©ciale pour les diff√©rents d√©cors forestiers de la campagne des T√©n√®bres qui sont tout bonnement magnifiques !
Ce qui peut rebuter, c'est la pr√©sence minimale de point de contr√¥le, permettant d'y r√©appara√Ætre si jamais l'on vient √† mourir. Il n'y a en pas tous les deux m√®tres mais ils sont si espac√©s qu'on en vient parfois √† paniquer lorsque l'on est dans une situation d√©licate.

Mais la v√©ritable force de ce jeu, comme √©norm√©ment d'autres jeux selon moi, c'est le soundtrack qui est plus que percutant. Le th√®me est sublime, magique, hypnotisant et les diff√©rentes s√©quences musicales nous plongent avec aisance dans le jeu.
De plus, j'aimerais attribuer ici une mention sp√©ciale aux bruitages (portes verrouill√©es, cl√©s ramass√©es, ...) qui sont loin d'√™tre extraordinaires mais qui font relativement bien le caf√© !

Pour conclure, Enclave, qu'est-ce que √ßa vaut ?
Pour ma part, c'est un jeu qui poss√®de quelques probl√®mes r√©currents, qui peuvent rapidement exasp√©rer. Mais l'univers, l'histoire, l'attention port√© aux personnages et la musique sont des points que l'on ne peut n√©gliger ou mettre au second plan pour appr√©cier ce jeu. Enclave vaut vraiment qu'on lui porte une attention, ne serait-ce que pour l'essayer ; car l'essayer, c'est l'adopter !
On ne pourra que regretter, si la passion du jeu vient √† nous prendre, de constater l'abandon du deuxi√®me opus, opus discr√®tement annonc√© dans la cin√©matique de fin de la campagne du Mal. Trop de mauvais retours, pas assez de budget, abandon pur et simple, ... Impossible de r√©pondre, si ce n'est ma d√©ception de devoir me contenter de ce premier Enclave, jouissif √† souhait.
Et n'oubliez pas que la Fantasy nous appartient !

author: {'steamid': '76561198006963719', 'num_games_owned': 10063, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1565807338}
review:
Enclave was one of my childhood games, and I'm glad to find out that it's available on Steam. I've gladly replayed it and I must say that the game was exactly how I remembered it.

The game is very simple at its core, and it's basically what you can see on screenshots. It consists of two campaigns, around 15 missions each. Missions are quite unique in terms of the maps, but there are no real objectives apart from "reach some generic goal while killing everything on your way". While doing the above, you collect gold that you can spend on equipment upgrades, you also unlock different characters that have slight variations in terms of weapons and skills. There are also a few secrets to discover.

The game aged well considering it was made back in 2003. While graphics show clear sign of being designed over 15 years ago, they still look good enough on highest resolutions and they're OK to look at. Gameplay, while very simple and repetitive, is satisfying and considering the fact that you can find a lot of games today that run on the similar concept (e.g. dark souls), enclave has its own charm, huge polish and attention to details.

I can recommend it for the nostalgia feel and playing something else than usual. I believe Enclave was always a bit underrated game, especially on Steam since it was being given away for free a lot of times in the past. I'm glad that I gave it a try back in 2003, and that I managed to replay it today in 2019.

---

If you liked my review, you can find more of them on [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/ArchiPL/recommended/]my profile[/url][/b] and on my [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/10639590/]curator page[/url][/b].

author: {'steamid': '76561198202529859', 'num_games_owned': 1686, 'num_reviews': 2354, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1562432387}
review:
Enclave is the kind of game that has been put a lot of effort into but never got a chance to show off its beauty as a whole. It's an action role-playing game released by Starbreeze Studios, the masterminds behind the Chronicles of Riddick, The Darkness or their most popular creation yet: Payday 2. Before the multiplayer scene took over, there was the era of singleplayer-themed titles with plenty of content and unlockables. You would have to search every nook and cranny to acquire better gear or just simply find health and other miscellaneous collectibles. Enclave wants to be just that and it really works. 

We are given 2 campaigns, consisting of 20 levels each, 1 for the good and the other for the dark side. The plot is pretty rich for an action title of that calibre and is delivered by some decent voice acting. On the side note, every single cutscene is skippable and makes replaying feel more fluid. Each fraction holds a set of playable characters which you unlock as you complete the missions, giving you the chance to experiment if a certain class doesn't get the job done. Every chapter can be accessed through a well arranged map, keeping track of your collectibles as well. Speaking of, the game encourages you to explore for gold in exchange for better gear. There is no checkpoints and you can only hard save upon completing your objective so you will need that. To balance that out, the length of one level varies between 5 and 15 minutes to crank down on frustration. 

Difficulty-wise, it's almost perfect. The gorgeous environments are wonderfully crafted and laid out, with sharp textures, showing little age for a 16 years old game. The soundtrack is hauntingly beautiful and so is the entire art direction. It does however suffer from minor hit-detection problems, as well as mouse rotation quirks, causing your character to move fast at times. But none of that will lessen the joy of this classic fantasy-driven journey. Released on Xbox, later ported to PC and strangely to the Wii, this is easily the best variant and it goes without saying. Thanks to the re-release on Steam in 2013, it has sold over a million copies, expanding on the following this gem really deserves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050988070', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1565363753}
review: I don't think this game is all that bad but it can't hold a candle to titans like Rune or Severance: Blade of Darkness. It's just goofy Dark Souls by today's standards. Pretty cool how you have 2 different campaigns with tons of characters to choose from but the combat is so flawed and the levels are so poorly thought out that it completely undermines any attempt at engaging the player, not even the story is remotely interesting. I could recommend it if you've never played a game similar to this one but, if you know how a great action RPG looks like, you're not missing out on anything here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314291626', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1685889389}
review: This game, even though it is old, buggy, and some missions are just really annoying, still manages to keep me playing for multiple hours before it gets boring. Any pc can run it nowadays, and the story is decent. The characters and gold system is amazing in my opinion, and just destroying enemies is so much fun. I got this game from a "5 steam keys" thing on amazon, and this is actually one of the only games I still return to now that I am no longer addicted to gaming. It is just a casual single-player game. I would reccomend this game a lot. PS: If you buy the steam key on a site like G2A you can get the game for like 0.42 euros instead of 5. Really, for 50 cents this is the best value game you could get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065020788', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1640342515}
review:
This is quite an old game, and I've never met anyone who has heard of it. Personally I love it, and can't recommend it enough. Each mission gives you more gold, which you can use to upgrade the gear on your character of choice. Unlike in many games the choices you make have quite an impact on how combat effective you are, and making the wrong choices can lead to certain levels being very challenging. It's also one of the few games where you can actually hide behind a giant tower shield while advancing at an army of opponents raining arrows down upon you, which is a cool feeling.

One class however is quite overpowered, especially once a certain weapon is attained.
