author: {'steamid': '76561198302487921', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1564634473}
review:
Enclave is a game I started playing with minimal information about it. All I knew about the game was what I had read in a small article in a PC Gamer issue from the early 2000s, and a couple posts in some forums, which I might add had a tone of "yeah... [i] that [/i] game...". Basically, I knew it was a fantasy hack and slash game, and that it probably wasn't very good (although not terrible either).

Then I saw it on Steam on a hefty sale (80% off!). It didn't have a very high rating, but then again, Summoner, one of my all-time favorites, has a barely above average score on both Steam and Metacritic, so I could have a hidden gem in front of me.

It wasn't the case, however (IMO).

The story is your run-of-the-mill fantasy schlock (although I thought that the bit in the intro about the wizard basically splitting the Earth in half with a spell was pretty cool), and one told by some of the most boring characters I've ever seen in a videogame. None of them seem to have any personality whatsoever, and to make matters worse the musical score is incredibly generic.

Ok, but maybe the gameplay is its saving grace? Nope. It's... basic. It's not bad per se, but the melee combat consists mostly on hitting your opponent, quickly retreating so you don't get hit, and doing the same thing again, as many times as necessary. You also have the option to equip a shield so you can block incoming attacks, but considering how unreliable they are, they might as well not be there. I didn't really use the other weaponry for any reasonable amount of time, so I can't comment on it.

Some of the levels are actually pretty interesting, with interconnected layouts and even some side stuff you can discover on the way, all of this accompanied by some nice scenery. They do, however, hold the one aspect that made me lose my patience and quit the game before I could finish it:

The checkpoint system.

You see, the game has a gold system where you collect gold (duh) spread throughout the levels, and that dictates how much and what kind of equipment you get to use in future missions. Now, the problem is that these checkpoints don't make you go back in time, so to speak, like in most games. Instead, what it does is resurrect you for the sum of 10 gold. See the problem? If you want to take the greatest amount of gold possible (so you can have the best possible equipment), you have to finish every mission in one go, which means dealing with the less than perfect hit detection and insta-kill traps. Yes, there are some traps that can kill you instantly, usually in the form of rocks collapsing, which by the way is something you'll be seeing quite a bit since the very first level, presumably because the devs wanted to showcase their (admittedly impressive for the time) physics system. That was what made me quit, actually. I was just walking and bam, a rock fell on me and insta-killed me.

Take all of this with a grain of salt, of course. I never finished the game, so it could turn into a masterpiece by the end for all I know, but even if it doesn't, it might interest you if you really like the genre. You may want to pick it up during a sale though, and try to play it before the two-week period for refunds ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972836357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1563299078}
review:
Unpolished, generic, repetitive and forgettable. "Enclave" is one of the last 6th gen titles, a hack-n-slash dungeon crawler that Starbreeze pooped out without any QA or playtesting. You remember the days between the end of the XBOX and the start of the 360; everyone got into the game, farted out some substandard title and made bank.

Enclave could've been great; it offers a multitude of classes. Despite the linearity of the levels, there's some charm in the standard "dark" fantasy setting. There's a lot of different weapons to choose from, which you can purchase with gold you pick up during gameplay. The story is trash, but that's not a big problem.

Unfortunately, the game suffers from tons of technical issues. Inconsistent and outright broken hit-detection. Slippery movement controls and combat. Unreasonable spikes in difficulty, compounded by the lack of proper mid-level checkpoints. Bugs and glitches. These aren't problems that can be blamed on the game's age; they are problems stemming from anemic development.

I generally take to these smaller titles, made by studios with love and care, despite their technical issues. Sadly, Enclave simply doesn't offer anything and I doubt it ever really did. I got it dirt-cheap on a sale, but I'm not sure I'd repeat the same mistake. I suggest you don't, either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401857189', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6754, 'last_played': 1562349665}
review: A clunky and at times pretty infuriating third person action "RPG" that is better than the sum of its parts! This one has two campaigns, neither of which really makes any sense. The controls aren't that good. The level design isn't the best around. The difficulty can be frustrating at times. But despite all that, Enclave is still a nostalgic classic that should at least be tried once.

review: A clunky and at times pretty infuriating third person action "RPG" that is better than the sum of its parts! This one has two campaigns, neither of which really makes any sense. The controls aren't that good. The level design isn't the best around. The difficulty can be frustrating at times. But despite all that, Enclave is still a nostalgic classic that should at least be tried once.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992671669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1550872770}
review:
Horrible

The game is divided in small levels where you collect resources to upgrade your characters. The problem is that those upgrades (aside of armor) are pretty useless.

Melee combat: Mash your attack button, whether or not you block with your shield is rng...
Magic: Hold your attack button, aim in the general direction of the enemy and backpedal...
Ranged: Attacks with Bows  are the only form of offensive that require you to look at your screen (it still isn't fun though)...

Stopt playing after I got softlocked in a flooded room, drowning to death over and over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086796541', 'num_games_owned': 705, 'num_reviews': 1291, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1571433375}
review:
*Update*10/16/2019*: Giving this game another chance its not that bad, i can recommend it to see for yourself if you like it or not.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Some of the steam trading cards look cool i guess... Uhhhhhhh, game is hard to get into tbh, but the cutscenes are cool. the game play is.... alright i guess. A little clunky but nothing to hard or frustrating. The female hunter is cool to play as with a bow and arrow and a short dagger. I dont know overall a 3/10 game tbh, cant recommend unless you get this game in a bundle like I did. 

Oh be sure to turn your graphics all the way up to max in options, the game is hard to look at if you dont. It still looks really old and out dated with max graphics but it helps get you through some levels atleast. 

My biggest complaint is how tiny the orcs are, the goblins i get, there supposed to be midgets, but the orcs look like hobbit orcs, i dont get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416188624', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 498, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1561547540}
review:
It's really a great game for most part.

+ Level design in most levels is really good. Linear and with detail.
+ Game shop is nice, you upgrade your gear as much as much gold you find in levels.
+ This game is full of secrets. Like it really has a ton of them in every level. It's really fun to discover them and also the more secret treasures you find the better items you'll be able to buy.
+ Dark ampaign recycles many levels from Light campaign, but you start in opposite corner of map, fight different enemies and all secret treasures are now in different locations and there are also new areas available, which were blocked in Light campaign. All these things really makes those levels fresh again.
+ Boss battles. Some are generic, but still fun. Some are really unique, I really liked them.
+ For it's time graphics are really good, it's sad that many people complain about them.
+ There are many unlockable playable characters and each feels different.
+ It features both first and 3rd person cameras. Both works fine, It's a shame that in first person you can see through your weapons. So first person was made for lookout only even through game plays much better with it. It really could've and should've been fully intergrated into the game.

- Hit detection is weird. With melee it's hard to hit enemy especially on first peson. With ranged weapons it has a bigger hit box than the enemy, so many many times I hit enemy while I shouldn't.
- The camera view on different person perspective changes a lot. On first person camera it's much harder to know when to hit enemy with melee. On 3rd person camera many secrets are easily revealed, it ruins fun, because of that I have played the whole game in first person.
- Storyline is so simple, so generic. All characters are very generic and bland. Whole plot is very unmemorable.
- In each level enemies become stronger and stronger. In mid game they become too much of a bullet sponges
- In Dark campaign mission 11 at the end of the level game spawns two teleporters instead of one. Go in the huge black one. Cause the green one is a very shitty begginner's trap. It triggers a cutscene in which you die... AND YOU HAVE TO REPLAY THE WHOLE LEVEL AGAIN... There is no hint or anything about what's behind the teleporters so it's clearly luck guess. Shame on developers for that.
- Torch is really underused item in this game, you only need it for one tunnel in each campaign in the whole game... You can't even equip it later on.
- Many mini-bosses later becomes your average enemy, it wouldn't be a huge problem, but they are a huge bullet sponges at first until few levels later you unlock better gear.
- Very crappy cliffhanger in both campaigns. So crappy I don't have a slightest interrest in continuation of storyline.
- Game likes to crash. The funny thing is if I don't die, I can beat 2-3 levels and only then it crash, but if i die game will always crash in the next minute after restarting the level (respawning at a checkpoint does not trigger crashes)
- Very poorly balanced, at least on "easy" difficulty.


8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198824302304', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 551, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1559408101}
review: Pretty nice puzzle RPG with some platformer elements if you want to get all the loot. The graphics of the game are okay, and it has not so many bugs. The only problems I had were that I couldn't start the game on the first day I tried to play it. After multiple start-up crashes I gave up, but the next day the game worked fine as did it all the days after. The second problem are that the game doesn't properly register when you hit an enemy if you are not on the same level, so avoid fighting enemies while you're on stairs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086684060', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1244, 'last_played': 1524320315}
review:
Un gioco ch'√® un po' vecchiotto
ma divertente da giocare,
questo Enclave √® un bel prodotto
che mi sento di consigliare.

Un fantasy di vecchio stampo,
genere poco originale:
anche se lontano nel tempo
non sembra poi invecchiato male.

I livelli si susseguono,
aumentan le classi degli eroi,
mentre trame si infittiscono
e a dipanarle saremo noi.

Combattimento scudo e spada,
balestre e archi che menan strali,
o la potenza d'una granata,
o meglio ancor magie ancestrali:

La scelta d'armi assai √® varia,
e fa di certo divertire
usar nemici a mo' di cavia
in mille modi di morire.

D√† a sto gioco un'occhiatina,
ma non leggendo recensioni.
Facci tu stesso una partita,
abbi tu le tue opinioni!

author: {'steamid': '76561198840982970', 'num_games_owned': 1723, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1683610709}
review:
I realy enjoy this game
I'm pretty nostalgic for it 
But a few things always annoyed me...
There is no depth whatsoever to the melee combat so you better play ranged and i remembered it pretty fondly but damn you always miss them for some reason (sometimes you get lucky tho and it feels great) so as a ranged char you move backwards all the time while sum orc hits you constantly (at least on hard) and it isn't that fun at all. also i hate how your weapon fades away in first person. it always bugged me. A miner complaint is the lack of controller support so i had to use antimicro.
I enjoy the game nonetheless.
I really like the art style for the most part (the knight looks horrible tho) especialy the gobblins. I don't think the story is generic. Back in the day I even deemed it pretty outstanding. Lots of atmosphere good music and a fair price. The gameplay isn't as bad as i've made it out to be but going back I really was a bit underwhelmed.
GET IT (especialy if you like mid 2000 games like i do) 
PS. I never understood why it is labeled an rpg there are (almost) no rpg elements in this game. Its a hack ands slash in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004916866', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1675538257}
review:
Had a bit of nostalgia trip and decided to replay this game again.

Enclave was one of my first PC games and, uh, that's probably the only reason why I remember it. Also for atmospheric soundtrack and few nice locations. Combat here is either boring (if playing as melee) or annoying (if playing as archers) and story is a generic fantasy.

There is also a challenge to collect all gold, and its kinda fun to explore locations, but that's it. I'm sure Enclave was good like, 15 years ago. But I can't really recommend it in 2019.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052898329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1558818387}
review: Great game for 2003, well worth $5 at full price in my opinion, and you can get it for less on sale. Graphics and gameplay are decent, good for the time, with the AI being excellent for a game of this type. However, the story is lacking, with huge gaps in the plot. An interesting play through so far, would recommend to any fan of classic fantasy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020441981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1590200609}
review:
This game is five bucks but is easily worth $30 or more, despite being 16 years old. It's a high quality hack-n-slash, RPG-lite fantasy adventure game in which you can play as a number of different character classes, through a bunch of really well built levels that are atmospheric and detailed with very good art design. The gameplay is smooth, responsive, and satisfying. Each character plays differently, adding a great amount of variety to the game. The story is swell, and to make things even better, there are two campaigns, not only one. In the light campaign you play as the good guys, fighting evil and laying waste to their plans; in the dark campaign you play as the bad guys, often times playing levels that you've seen before, but from a different vantage point, overlapping with the events that occurred in the light campaign. Both campaigns can be played through, and all their secrets found, in under 20 hours. 

This is a game that feels big and epic, but with a straight forward design that makes it a breeze to play through and fully explore in a couple weeks. However, the replay value is high, warranting more attention than one playthrough can give. This is a really well done game that I never heard about when it was released. 

The graphics, the music, the gameplay, and the combination of character styles and level design/aesthetic all come together to make a tight, superbly crafted action adventure fantasy game with semi-RPG elements that is endlessly fun, and always worth revisiting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000439002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1657747633}
review:
Sure, A review, Why not.

This game is really quite fun. Combat is okay at best. Their are collectables to collect, some of which are hidden throughout each level. Each level can be played with whoever you choose (as far as you have unlocked) which can make each playthrough of a level slightly different at least. Each character can each have their own loadout of equipment depending on what you have bought from shop with collectable gold you have found.

The crux of why I do not recommend is because, for me, It simply became unplayable. I tried, and I tried and I tried again to get passed the level with the Necromancer summonings, in the level where you switch valves for water level, in the room where you fill it up with water to reach the top.. Being in the water kills me within 2 seconds, 1 swim movement/animation. I have no idea if I'm in the wrong here or if it is bugged, but, due to this I just had to stop playing, it was too annoying.

PM me if you have an answer for this :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198019542583', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1681534013}
review:
Neat game from the days of the original xbox. Surprisingly advanced for its time, but it doesn't hold up very well today. Combat is awkward and chunky. While the combat does add some elements which makes it feel less like a hackfest against the enemy, it tends to get repetitive real quick. Trial and error is required for some levels which are effectively impossible without the right character/gear, also with no real numbers to go by except what's displayed in-game, finding out which gear is good can be a chore. That being said, it has nostalgic value and it is fun for a few hours. 

Make sure you can adjust your mouse's polling rate before buying, if you can't the game may be unplayable for you unless you can find a really old mouse to hook up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162368960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1550462924}
review:
Avanzas, te sale un goblin, das un espadazo, retrocedes, espadazo, retrocedes, espadazo. Muere. 
Das la vuelta a la esquina, te sale un orco. Espadazo, retrocedes, espadazo, retrocedes, espadazo. Muere.
Rep√≠tase la misma f√≥rmula una, y otra, y otra vez durante todo el nivel.

Una vez que lo pasas, entras a un nuevo escenario en donde la misma f√≥rmula anterior... se repite. 
As√≠ sal√≠an esta clase de jueguitos gen√©ricos hace unos 15 a√±os, a montones. Mundos lineales que daban la impresi√≥n de ser inmensos pero que en realidad todos los callejones estaban bloqueados, y que sal√≠an los mismos enemigos una y otra vez. 
La cosa es que no hay estrategia en los combates y al cabo de unos cuantos minutitos todo se vuelve incre√≠blemente mon√≥tono. No hay necesidad de crearse una estrategia porque los enemigos siempre morir√°n igual. 
La parte "dif√≠cil" en realidad est√° en superar todo lo bugeado que est√° el movimiento de tu personaje. Te puedes quedar atascado donde sea, los saltos son poco responsivos, el movimiento es patoso, y cuando peleas, las hitboxes est√°n de locura: puedes estarle dando un espadazo al cuello al enemigo y no bajarle puntos de vida. O puedes solo acercarte y apenas desenfundar la daga para que el enemigo reciba da√±o m√°gicamente. 
El arco y la ballesta no tienen uso, porque los movimientos de los enemigos son tan err√°ticos que con mucha suerte atinar√°s una de cada veinte flechas que lances, y todo para que bajen un da√±o min√∫sculo a menos que las uses en multishots.
Las voces son en espa√±ol de Espa√±a, y si no te gusta ese doblaje te friegas porque el juego no te da la opci√≥n de cambiar de idioma. Bueno, tendr√°s que irte a la carpeta directamente y borrar el archivo correspondiente...
Por √∫tlimo, la trama es simplona, b√°sicamente lo mismo de todos los juegos de este tipo: el bien contra el mal, la luz contra la oscuridad, tu primera misi√≥n es escapar de una mazmorra, etc. 

En fin, este juego te hace bostezar tanto por la trama insulsa, como por las mec√°nicas del juego tan repetitivas. Yo aguant√© un poco m√°s de una hora y ya me estaba revolviendo de la desesperaci√≥n, ¬øen qu√© momento llegaba la parte divertida de jugar a esta cosa?

El √∫nico punto positivo del juego es en la m√∫sica, que es buena. Ni siquiera en los gr√°ficos, que para la √©poca no puedo creer el prerrenderizado tan pobre del fondo.

review: Been having a nostalgia for days and this game came to mind! At first I haven't remembered its title but fortunately could manage to find it through google searches. I was like 12-13 years old when I first played it and at that time it was a frikken amazing game! Well it hasn't changed a bit! For a 2003s game, it's almost perfect. author: {'steamid': '76561198043200509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1900, 'last_played': 1550098171}
review:
I strongly advice anyone and everyone to play through both campaigns at least once. Enclave, one of the best games of my childhood. If you look at the negative reviews because its an old game, or kinda glitchy you will rob yourself of a good game. The PC port didn't lock the framerate to its original 30 fps, this can make the game pretty glitchy because it wants to be running at 30 fps. As a kid I logged hundreds of hours, as an adult I was happy just beating both campaigns on hard twice and checking if i still had every single gold spawn memorized. I did.

Tips:
 Light campaign you start as the knight, after mission 2 you unlock the huntress, in mission 4 you unlock the druid, in mission 5 you unlock the halfling, in mission 6 the engineer, and then finally you unlock the wizard another magic character. If you are really bad at the game and want to have success, pick a magic character like the druid from mission 4. Right click is a shield, Left click is a your attack, and if you are using the Astral Staff of the druid holding left click channels a summoning spell for a golem, the golem has a fairly short duration but infinite life and good damage. The Engineer is pretty gimmicky but good, he has grenades and molotovs, can't throw them to save his life but they're powerful. Huntress is everyones #1 choice, the only problem is that hitboxes reflect a game from the year 2000; oh and arrows follow your characters momentum, if you fire a burst arrow and then side step you can watch the arrow curve a bit. so try not to panic run while firing, unless you learn to wield it to your advantage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1548863432}
review:
Un gioco carino che per l'epoca poteva andare bene, ma adesso un p√≤ meno. Non √® uno spettacolo ma fa il suo lavoro, ossia divertire. La cosa bella di questa versione sono i filmati con doppiaggio in inglese e sottotitoli in italiano, ma nel gioco c'e il doppiaggio in italiano. ^^; Il gioco vi mette a comando di un personaggio che √® stato catturato e messo in cella, fortuna vuole che un attacco dei nemici vi libera distruggendo le sbarre della prigione. E qui inizia il gioco, con voi che dovrete fuggire dalla piccola fortezza dove eravate rinchiusi. I livelli del gioco sono composti da: Tot di monete fisse, ossia 50, 100, 150 per singolo livello, e non potrete averne di piu di quelle che ci sono nel livello. Al massimo, ne avrete di meno perch√® non le avete raccolte tutte. Queste monete si possono avere sia dai nemici caduti che piu probabilmente nascosti in qualche anfratto del livello. I nemici sono finiti ossia che non rinascono una volta uccisi. E checkpoint a seconda la lunghezza del livello. E qui inizia il problema piu grave, tentate di arrivare "se c'e" al piu vicino checkpoint, se non lo fate e morite, sarete costretti a ripetere l'intero livello dall'inizio, dialoghi non skippabili inclusi. Il primo personaggio che comandate sar√† di classe guerriero, ma andando avanti nei livelli e aiutando i vari npc salvandoli da morte certa, loro vi offriranno il loro aiuto e quindi potrete cambiare classe. Tra druido, halfling e altri personaggi. In piu, il gioco permette di rifare le missioni piu e piu volte, nel tentare di prendere tutte le monete nei livelli, questo far√† si che piu monete avrete preso nei livelli + potenti saranno le armi e armature equipaggiabili.  Graficamente √® superiore alla ps2 direi quasi xbox, ma i controlli solo tastiera senza possibilit√† di usare un controller, lo penalizzano. Per√≤ per il prezzo a cui √® venduto direi di dargli una chance anche a prezzo pieno, ma non aspettatevi miracoli. ^_^

Lo consiglio a chi vuole fare un'avventura di stampo medievale e si trova bene con i comandi da tastiera, e a quelli che collezionano le carte steam, tutti gli altri possono passare oltre, anche se la longevit√† di questo titolo √® sulle 7 ore bene o male per fazione. Si, si hanno 2 fazioni, il bene e il male. Ma all'inizio non c'e possibilit√† di scelta e sono 13 livelli. Esclusi i livelli bonus che danno altre monete al di fuori della storia. ^_^

Avviso: C'e un piccolo bug che a volte capita quando si rigioca una missione gi√† fatta. Succede che non carica a video la scelta del personaggio per la missione. Se succede, non dovete dfar altro che fare la combinazione ctrl+alt+canc e poi nel menu seguente cliccare annulla, per ritornare al gioco e vedere la scelta del personaggio. ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198253117444', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1540112126}
review:
ENCLAVE GAME REVIEW
Also known as: Jack's first experience with a really unbalanced and unfair game.

I'm only five levels into the game, and on Medium, died twelve times so far.
Now, why is that a problem, you ask?
Let's dissect this thing.
Be aware that I have completed this game on Easy before, and even then, I had similar issues just with less dying.

The first major flaw this game has is a checkpoint system, activated only at certain locations on a level. You usually get one or two depending on how long a level is. 
This wouldn't be that big of a deal if dying didn't mean losing 10 gold every time (which you DO need for stuff, will explain later). 
This respawn does nothing but restore your health to full. All the ammo and healing potions you spent stay spent, and the enemies you met prior to your death are all dead or as damaged as you left them.

Next, the gameplay. Oh boy, this one's a real pain in the ass.
Due to how ridiculously small hitboxes in this game are, you'll find yourself wondering why your reticule was red but you still missed that shot, many times. Well alright, maybe trying to go the archer route is a bit unplayable, let's switch to sword and shield for the Knight, or magic attacks for the Druid. 
Nope! The hitboxes are horrible even then. The Knight swings his sword twice in an X motion, and if your enemy starts jittering all around you, this can make the experience feel less like you're in control and more like an RNG decides whether you land the hit or not. 

The same rule DOES NOT apply to the enemies. Even your shield barely helps, as half the time, they will still land a hit on you even if you can see that their weapon hit it and not you. Have I mentioned some enemies need 10+ hits to die, and they can kill you with about 3-4?

Ranged enemies will ALWAYS hit you unless you actively hide behind something where at that point they'll be forced to come close for a clear shot. An assassin and goblin archer will have the same bullseye accuracy, even though they're vastly different in terms of skills.

Their movement pattern isn't programmed properly at all, and you'll see assassins and giant armored Orcs alike moving at the same speed, rushing you while sidestepping no matter if you're actively attacking them or not.
Ranged enemies try to keep their distance, while melee ones run into you and mindlessly attack you, fully knowing you don't stand a chance.

The entire game, if you prefer going as an archer, will have you shooting, missing, then backstepping the entire map to take care of 3-4 enemies that you alerted. Again, not fun.

Coins. Every level has a preset amount of coins you can find in it, so dying is out of the question if you're like me and want to 100% a game. Adding salt to the wound is the fact that you need the maximum amount of gold in the entire game to unlock a secret campaign-specific character, which means you actually have a reason to 100% the game but it actively prevents you from doing so.
This means that if you die once and want the 100% coin amount, you'll have to restart the ENTIRE LEVEL which can range from anywhere between 10 to 30 minutes of playtime.

The music, story and graphics of the game are all great, considering the time of release. Unfortunately, without proper gameplay following it, I can see why the planned sequel never happened.

Even though I have some really hard nostalgia with this game, I can't recommend it as a fun and balanced experience at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067418609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1546814596}
review:
Enclave is the sort of game where I wish Steam had a recommendation option that was somewhere between thumbs up and thumbs down. For a 3D game, the graphics surpisingly hold up well, but the combat is awkward and frantic. This is a problem because combat is everything in this game.

More like the Heretic series than a full-fledged RPG, Enclave's design in 2019 isn't that interesting: No character customization akin to attributes or skill points. A lack of enemy diversity. Instead, you progress along arcade-like beat-em-up stages where you collect gold in order to buy equipment for classes that you unlock as you reach certain points in the story. The classes do play differently enough, but the core gameplay isn't so different: frantically click the mouse until the enemy is dead, back-stepping in order to avoid getting hit.

When you complete the game, you unlock the Dark Campaign, where you can re-play the game from the perspective of the villains. After reading that the Dark classes are basically the same as the Light classes, I didn't have much interest in it. The Light Campaign took 5 hours to complete, so I imagine the Dark Campaign would amount to the same.

Nevertheless, Enclave does present a decent challenge even on the medium difficulty, sometimes on account of the combat's awkwardness but often times for legitimate reasons. Ultimately, I lean toward recommending the game in support of the recent trend where studios revive their old products for Steam. And I can't ignore that despite the game's flaws I still felt compelled to finish the campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001321518', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1682943019}
review:
I originally got this game as a demo from a PC Gamer magazine back in the mid 2000's. It was stunningly beautiful and ran well at the time since it uses the Unreal Engine. 

Today? In today's standards, its dated, yes there could be more, however if you have your expectations in check, this is still a great game to play through. How often in a game do you play both as the good guys, and the bad guys, in 2 completely different roles in the same timeframe scenario?

Combat is simple, either you're swing and dash, or shooting arrows and crossbows at things. Drink potions and find gems and coins so you can get better equipment at the start of each mission, including special weapons found throughout the game. So there are rewards for going places you think you shouldn't go.

On sale for a dollar, or even at full price at 5 bucks, and if you enjoy this kind of genre game, you undoubtly will have a fun experience.

review:
En underrated oyunlardan biri.

Ya hatƒ±rlayan √ßƒ±karmƒ± bimiyorum ama, bu oyun zamanƒ±nda H√ºrriyet gazetesinde (?) kupon ile i√ßinde 50 oyun bulunan bir kutuda veriliyordu. O zamanlar hayatƒ±mda ilk defa kupon biriktirdim, kestim, bi√ßtim. El i≈üine bu kadar ilgim olmasƒ±nƒ±n sebebi bu oyun olabilir hani. Neyse o 50 cdlik oyunu alƒ±p o heyecan ile t√ºm oyunlarƒ± bilgisayara kurmaya √ßalƒ±≈ütƒ±m. Bazƒ±sƒ± √ºyelik istiyordu √ßocuktum anlamadƒ±m, bazƒ±sƒ± benim k√ºl√ºst√ºr√ºm√ºn kaldƒ±rabileceƒüinden fazla grafik detayƒ±na sahipti, bazƒ±sƒ± ingilizce eƒüitim oyunlarƒ±ydƒ±, aralarƒ±nda en son bunu kurdum, kƒ±lƒ±√ßlƒ± falandƒ± bende o zaman y√ºz√ºklerin efendisine bayƒ±lƒ±rdƒ±m. O zamanlarda tabii √ßok k√º√ß√ºk olfuƒüumdan Y√ºz√ºklerin Efendisi serisindeo orklardan goblinlerden uruk-hailerden √ßok korkardƒ±m. Bu oyunun ilk iki b√∂l√ºm√º bunlar ile doluydu ve √ßocukken o b√∂l√ºmleri ge√ßemeyip oyunu bƒ±rakmƒ±≈ütƒ±m. 

Aradan 10 sene gibi bir zaman ge√ßti tam hatƒ±rlamasamda, steamde bu oyunu g√∂r√ºr g√∂rmez tanƒ±dƒ±m ve g√∂z√ºm√º kƒ±rpmadan aldƒ±m. Tek g√ºnde 14 saat oynayƒ±p bitirdim ve s√∂yleyebilirimki Oyun hi√ß de k√∂t√º deƒüil, hikaye falan bo≈ü tamam ama oynanƒ±≈ü da √ßok k√∂t√º olmasƒ±na raƒümen a≈üƒ±rƒ± eƒülendiriyor, ne diyeyim hi√ß sƒ±kƒ±lmadƒ±m oynarken, oyun zaten her 2 b√∂l√ºmde bir √ßok farklƒ± tasarƒ±mlarƒ± olan yerlere g√∂t√ºr√ºyor, √ße≈üitlide yani. 2 b√∂l√ºm √∂nce bir aktif volkan daƒüƒ±nƒ±n i√ßerisindeyken ≈üimdi bir bakmƒ±≈üsƒ±nƒ±z √ßi√ßekli saraylƒ± Roma'yƒ± andƒ±ran bir mekandasƒ±nƒ±z. Karakter desen yok zaten ama se√ßilebilir karakterler √ße≈üitli ve farklƒ±. Oyun ilerledik√ße kendini yeniliyor, en azƒ±ndan her zaman farklƒ± karakterler sunuyor ve oyun bitince karanlƒ±k tarafta oynayabiliyorsunuz. Yani daha ne olsun?

author: {'steamid': '76561198087642562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1709416831}
review:
Well, what can i say?
Even thought i've got a original hardcopy of this gem lying around here somewhere 
in my homeoffice, i've just bought this game once again here on Steam for a mere 0,99 ‚Ç¨.

It's a solid good old fashinoned straight foraward 3rd (or 1st if you prefer) person hack & slay
and it's still - even after all this time, i mean 16 years!! Come on!! - a ton of fun to play.
I'm not going further into greater detail here, just give it a try if you're intressted in games like 
this, it's worth it, even when not on sale.

Currently running this pearl on my old "workhorse" laptop with a monitor attached.
If you care for specs, just check the web, it's an unmodified 2014 Acer V3-772G, running 
Win 8.1 as OS and the game is running just smooth as silk. No crashes, hickups or anything.

What's left to say? 
If you have a knack for older games: 
Go and GET IT! By all means! 
It's quite worth it!

Best regards
Hawk

author: {'steamid': '76561198102935860', 'num_games_owned': 952, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1590104267}
review:
Enclave √© um jogo antigo, tem uma jogabilidade bacana - melhor que muitos jogos de hoje, acredite, ele tem - e no geral √© um jogo bacana, eu realmente curti e, dependendo da sua build o jogo pode ser muito... mais muito dificil.
√â claro, tem seus defeitos, eu n√£o irei falar aqui porque n√£o quero quebrar sua experiencia no jogo, pode ser um "defeito pra mim" mas pra voc√™ pode ser algo que nem se quer voc√™ vai perceber.
Se fosse pra citar um, eu diria que o primeiro defeito √©: n√£o ser mundo aberto. Cara, o Enclave √© t√£o linear que te da uma sensa√ß√£o de "eu j√° passei aqui?!", enjoa mesmo, √© tenso. se pelo menos tivessemos uma maior liberdade no mapa do jogo, rapaz, seria algo que iria agregar bastante no geral.
E um ponto forte dele √© que possui duas formas distintas de jogar o game, os chamados: Caminho da luz e Caminho da Escurid√£o, jogue e voc√™ vai saber do que estou falando, eu achei isso foda de mais. Al√©m disso, ele possui diversas classes (arqueiro, guerreiro, assassino, mago, engenheiro e outras mais, e no final o jogo te premia com presentinho kk) que voc√™ pode mudar sempre no come√ßo da fase, estas que s√£o adquiridas ao finalizar certos capitulos.
Eu mesmo joguei com todos os personagens, mas nas fases finais fui obrigado a mudar para assassino (Halfling), cara, sem essa personagem fica quase impossivel tu zerar o jogo (fica a dica kkk).

Os cenarios s√£o bacanas, eles s√£o bem distintos um dos outros e ao mesmo tempo lindos (e olhe que √© um jogo bem antigo, √© bem relativo, pra mim... s√£o lindos), principalmente as fases finais. Se voc√™ j√° jogou Oblivion, e for jogar agora o Enclave, voc√™ vai perceber umas semelhan√ßas entre os cenarios dos dois -- e ressaltando: Enclave √© um jogo de 2002 (mesmo ano do MOrrowind, respectivamente, e o Oblivion de 2006), ser√° que rolou um vazamento de informa√ß√µes entre os funcionarios? enfim, deixa isso pra uma outra discuss√£o (kk) -- o que eu achei realmente bacana, confessso que fiquei surpreendido com os cen√°rios do Enclave, s√£o bonitos mesmo, poderia ser mais trabalhado √© claro, mas no geral, eles s√£o agradaveis.

Vale a pena comprar? Sim, vale, tente pegar numa promo√ß√£o. Pode ter certeza, voc√™ n√£o ir√° se arrepender, √©  um jogo bacana, n√£o espere muito coisa, ele n√£o foi feito pra ser o jogo do s√©culo, mas ele faz bem em ser um "bom jogo".

Ent√£o, divirtam-se! Bom jogo a todo, sejam feliz^^

review: This game shows its age. Not necessarily in the graphics or sound department as I actually quite like the earlier days of 3d adventure type games, but the gameplay itself is really quite bad. For the first few levels its quite fun to slash through enemies and collect bags of gold. Then as you get further into the game the map design begins to become quite bad and needlessly frustrating. Not to say that all the maps are bad but when you combine the maps with insanely overpowered enemies and a sense that your character can never quite keep up with the insane damage that late game enemies dealt... Yeah It made me quite disinterested in continuing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188232697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1640053616}
review:
My wife bought this one for me as a birthday gift thinking this was an ARPG, and seeing the tags I also thought it was an ARPG, unfortunately it isn't. Enclave is misstagged as an RPG, although it has nice visuals and a simple progression system, I could never call it that way, instead this feels like an arcade, beat'em up, button-mashing fest; as I enjoy such games like The King of Dragons and  Knghts of the Round in the SNES this also swings right up my alley.
Note that as I'm writting this review I haven't finished the Light Campaign.
The game is conformed by several missions which formula basically is going from point A to point B; then retrieve, release, fight, or activate something and then going to point C or returning to point A, all of this while fighting a plethora of monsters, dwellers, mages and the like; now this really isn't very bad, but there is not much enemy variety, and you'll be pretty much in a clickfest every mission while traversing the level, as I like old beat'em ups this is not a problem for me, but it might be a problem for some people. 
That said, I really like the visuals; the graphic design of the levels might not be the best in the world but it feels very claustrophobic and despite the game palette resembling a crude brown wall in most places, some of the open areas look really great. 
The character selection system also adds a bit of replayability as it's quite fun to play as each of the characters and finding which one suits better your game style, each character gets different types of weapons and armor that are unlocked via the gold you get, either the one you collect from each mission or the one you get awarded after completing the mission, how are you rewarded it is my guess honestly.
The storyline is your generic "save the world from evil" one; it's not bad, it doesn't get in the way, but it's there as a justification for what you are doing. Also the way the people in-game say Dreg'atar is a little bit distracting but that's just a nitpick. 
All in all I received Enclave thinking I might get a new epic story with lots of characters, customization options and a lot of characteristics, attributes and mechanics; instead I got an enjoyable fantasy based button-masher with a lot of characters and simple action.
I know it's not for everyone and it has some bugs here and there, some crashes to desktop, and some problems with newer PCs, but overall its a great game.
Oh! and despite the tag being wrong, my wife did certainly hit the bullseye with this gift! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198005969299', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1538679772}
review:
Really enjoyable third person fantasy game. Many characters to choose from with customisable equipment. Looks really good for the year it was made and plays smoothly. Quick saves would be appreciated, there's only saving at the end of the mission.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996495980', 'num_games_owned': 5273, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1537933875}
review:
Surprisingly fun hack&slash.  Note that the genre tag is a lie - this isn't an RPG.  There's no experience, level ups, or  skill upgrades/trees/whatever.  It's a pure fantasy action game with equipment, nothing more.

You find gold in levels and get more gold for beating them, and this gold increases your "gold pool" that you use to "purchase" equipment for each mission.  No sense saving it up - it's replenished every time, whether you fail or beat a mission.  If you didn't find some gold in a mission, you can replay it and find what you missed.  Can't farm though - gold you found before won't increase your pool.

As you beat missions you also unlock additional classes, and once unlocked you can use that class on any new or old mission.  The starting "Knight" melee class seems to be completely eclipsed by the Halfling class that uses all the same weapons and armor but moves twice as fast.  Honestly, not sure what the point of the Knight class is at that point - maybe it has more HP?  In any case, this is the only game I've seen where Halflings and Goblins run around swinging gigantic battle axes.

Once you beat the Light Campaign as a good guy, you can start a Dark Campagin, which is an alternate retelling of the war between Good and Evil, except your one of the bad guys now.  All the levels are different (well in a few cases it's a map based on one from the Light campaign but plays very differently) though the classes are almost exactly the same (goblin = halfling, assassin = huntress, etc).

One thing to keep in mind is that there are no checkpoints or mid-mission saves.  If you die or otherwise fail a mission - you gotta start it all over.  Maybe try a different class, or different gear, or go back to another mission to find more gold to afford better gear, or check a guide.  Guides are important, they'll keep you from being frustrated by some of the less appealing elements like failing a mission at the very end because you threw the wrong switch (Wizard rescue - seriously, read the guide for this one.)

Played the game perfectly in almost 1080p.  I say almost because for some reason that's the only resolution for which there was no 32bit option, only 16bit.  So I used CCC to create 1912x1076, which worked like a charm.  No AA or AF options in the game, so forced them through drivers - also worked great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006105685', 'num_games_owned': 1148, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1536761258}
review:
Que se puede decir sobre Enclave, pues que es un juego sencillote de acci√≥n en un mundo de fantasia, eso es lo b√°sico, pero hay m√°s en este juego, tiene sus luces y sus sombras. El apartado gr√°fico ha quedado muy atr√°s por lo que no esper√©is de √©l un juego espectacular, cumple pero muy justo. La m√∫sica apenas importante en el juego, solo unos pocos sonidos de combate y gru√±idos de los enemigos. El juego est√° en Espa√±ol tanto las voces (con buenos actores de doblaje) como los subtitulos, la introducci√≥n del juego est√° narrada en Ingles pero subtitulada en Espa√±ol. El combate consiste en dar espadazos a diestro y siniestro, disparar con la ballesta o intentar cubrirnos con el escudo. El juego en si mismo consiste en misiones diferenciadas es decir carrilero, aunque con objetivos claros, pero hay veces que el camino por donde llegar al objetivo no est√° nada claro lo cual puede hacer que el juego se vuelva frustrante.
Lo recomiendo si quereis un juego mezcla de rol y acci√≥n en un mundo de fantasia y no os importa que no tenga unos gr√°ficos punteros.
Buenas partidas!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012469706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1536495558}

Und auch jetzt hat es immer noch den gewissen Charme, okay es ist alt - gute 13 (!) Jahre, aber mit den richtigen Einstellungen bei High-End-Ger√§ten, gibt es so gut wie keine Abst√ºrze oder Ruckler (so wie hier oft beschrieben). Ich finde "Enclave" immer noch super und da kann ich auch mit guten Gewissen und ohne √úbertreibung, dieses Spiel empfehlen. Nur: man darf nicht zu viel erwarten, die Graphik im Allgemeinen ist hal√∂t nicht mehr so. Aber, das Nostalgische ist das was z√§hlt.

Este juego ya tiene su tiempo,y la verdad es que al principio mola,mucho,pero la curva de desagrado se hace pronunciada,es bastante monotono,a la mitad del juego,te das cuenta de que repites las cosas de manera continuada.

Aun asi se puede jugar bien,pero eso si,es un juego antiguo con lo que graficamente es lo ques y la musica tampoco es como tirar cohetes,para un par de dias esta bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996334868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1534389351}
review:
I was VERY positively surprised by this game.
The intros were stiff but reminded me of the first Gothic game.
When the game actually started and I was greeted with intuitive controls, I was hooked by the level building

No shit, the level building in the first two levels is simple but perfectly used for surprise events and I'd say a lot of world builders should go back to this dense style more often.

The ingame graphics are solid, mechanics are clever and the gameplay is actually fun!
Will definitely come back to finish it

author: {'steamid': '76561198114563111', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 377, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2144, 'last_played': 1531412687}
review:
From light comes darkness and from darkness light !! 
'tis an old game. Keep this in mind.

Simple gameplay. 

Decent graphics but can involve a bit of work to get right. 
My game kept crashing in 1920x1080p so I just settled for a slightly lower resolution.
Music is pretty great. A bit like Two Steps from Hell.

Melee is a bit off. Hit, hit, miss, miss, miss, miss, hit. 
Enemies have an easier time hitting you.
Ranged is much more desirable. Overpowered in some cases! 
Go ranged if you want it easy... In some cases that is. Not all... 

Definitely some WTF moments. 
Some really annoying enemies. One particular (maybe more) enemy has a DOT (damage over time) ability for which there appears to be no cure or defence against and it seems to stack. Brutal, especially when playing on the light side. Thankfully, they appear only late - end game. Some may be described as kamikazes.

You get to see the story from two perspectives. Always a great thing!

Various classes to choose from. All have their own unique strengths/weaknesses.

Decent amount of armour/weapons to customise your character with and therefore, there's always an incentive to collect the many gold coins scattered about each map to "purchase" them with, except you don't actually lose the coins when you purchase them. More coins equals more, better and powerful stuff. It's more like borrowing. :-)

Overall, a pretty awesome game. Quite enjoyable. "Old but gold". Definitely recommended.

[h1] 8/10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197991163504', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1694880087}
review:
(I got this game for free from a promotion of a German game site, but I own this game on disk as well.)

The core gameplay is really enjoyable. This game mixes hack-and-slash, exploration and some jumping puzzles in a solid package. The missions are spacious and crafted very beautifully. There are treasures to find, secret levels to unlock and much more.
The game offers 2 campaigns, one for each side, with multiple unlockable characters to unlock - each with their own strengths and weaknesses.
The combat is really fun and there is a plethora of swords, axes, bows and magical staves to choose from.

But why did give this game a negative review, despite me praising it?
The game runs horribly on modern operating systems and computers.
Input lag, bugged controls, infinite loading screens, sudden frame speed ups and slowdowns and random crashes to the desktop make this game a very mediocre and sloggy experience, forcing you to replay a whole level after a crash.

This is a hidden gem, but with the massive mount of gamebreaking situations I cannot recommend this game in its current state :(

As primeiras miss√µes s√£o bem faceis, para voce aprender mais sobre o jogo, mas depois melhora, o jogo tem resposta rapida e esta muito em conta! aquele pre√ßo que cabe no seu bol√ßo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052007123', 'num_games_owned': 6823, 'num_reviews': 1307, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1532877832}
review: Enclave is kinda outdated, some gameplay mechanics feels weird but somehow, this game have something magical. Maybe it's that "retro" RPG vibe. Each level is short but most of them are very well done - these are fun to explore, and finding secret spots / hidden gold is very enjoyable. There are lot of character classes so everyone will find someone who's fun to main. I also like the music in this game. This might be hard for new players, but if you somehow missed a chance to play Enclave back in old days, you might want to give it a shoot now. It gets very cheap on sale, so just wait for one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152081965', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1535119038}
review:
Experience incredibly atmospheric and intense medieval combat action! 
Go ahead and enter a new world, the award-winning world of ENCLAVE!

The people of Light and Darkness are divided by a bottomless rift that split the earth many millennia ago. The lands of light are an Enclave of truth and order surrounded by the twisted and barren lands of the dark, known as the Outlands. Over the centuries the rift has started to close‚Ä¶

And now it is only a matter of time before the forces of Light and Darkness will clash in an unprecedented, merciless struggle for survival!
Remember... When a storm comes up, for some it‚Äôs better to keep out of its way‚Ä¶ while for others it‚Äôs time to block its path!


FEATURES:
Breathtaking combat action
Amazing 3D graphics with latest Shader technolgy support
2 separate story driven single player campaigns: Light and Dark Campaign
25+ highly detailed fantasy themed missions
Secret bonus games
12 different playable character classes 
5 mighty end bosses
Epic musical score and impressive sound FX

‚ÄúEnclave on PC is illegally beautiful; in fact, I'd venture to say it ranks among PC's best-looking ever if you have the power to run it optimally.‚Äù
90 ‚Äì Play Magazine

‚ÄúStunning visuals, a classic soundtrack, original campaign ideas, what is not to like. [...] Enclave fell a few steps short of perfection.‚Äù
92 ‚Äì Worthplaying

‚ÄúThe game is fun, with great environments, fun weapons, tight controls, and quirky enemies.‚Äù
84 ‚Äì GameZone

author: {'steamid': '76561198029585520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1531566569}
review:
Quise tenerle paciencia, quise convencerme a m√≠ mismo que era un juego grato, pero ac√° estoy, a punto de no recomendarlo y con razones suficientes.
 Primero que nada, a buenas y a primeras parece un gran juego, me record√≥ mucho a uno de mis juegos favoritos; Drakan: Orden de la Llama, pero muy lejos de igualar el carisma y singularidad de √©ste.
 Enclave se presenta como un juego ambicioso, con gr√°ficos muy bien logrados para la √©poca, escenarios gigantescos por momentos y una m√∫sica excepcional que ambienta a la perfecci√≥n la trama de corte medieval fant√°stico. Lamentablemente eso no le hace justicia, y flaquea en los siguientes aspectos:

[list]
    [*]Combate extremadamente mon√≥tono. Todo consta de la misma estrategia una y otra vez, sin la posibilidad de ejecutar alg√∫n combo o golpe cr√≠tico o que incluso alg√∫n arma te permita llevar a cabo movimientos o habilidades especiales, con alguna pat√©tica excepci√≥n.
    [*]Movimiento tosco y lento. Casi todos los enemigos corren m√°s rapido que vos, pero dada la inteligencia artificial un tanto piadosa, vas a poder defenderte sin problemas (aunque no te conf√≠es, por momentos puede sorprender como los enemigos siguen tu patr√≥n de movimiento y escalan cajas o lugares que ni vas a creer que iban a poder). 
    [*]La trama adem√°s de ser gen√©rica y confusa, est√° dotada de todos los clich√©s habidos y por haber en historias del mismo g√©nero.
    [*]Los escenarios son demasiado lineales, y a pesar de su inmensidad, en su mayor√≠a se sienten demasiado vacios; -aunque debo reconocer que es agradable encontrar alguna bolsa de oro escondida en un pasadizo que en rara vez te lleva a alg√∫n lado-.
    [*]Por √∫ltimo, lo m√°s contundente y el motivo crucial por el cual me decid√≠ a no recomendarlo; el juego desgraciadamente cuenta con varios errores diferentes que lo hacen una experiencia detestable. Trabas del tipo ¬´stunlock¬ª en donde vas a quedar a la merced del enemigo, muertes s√∫bitas, la imposibilidad de controlar el movimiento de tu personaje el cual se dirige sin rumbo, teniendo que reiniciar el juego. Y la peor de todas: cierres inesperados en -literalmente- cualquier momento (aunque me sucedi√≥ pocas veces).
[/list]

 Si bien muchos argumentan que tiene una decente rejugabilidad, lo √∫nico que es de destacar es que se consigue nuevo equipamiento y personajes nuevos, pero eso no va a cambiar en casi nada la jugabilidad, por lo cual, no lo recomiendo mucho.
 La duraci√≥n est√° m√°s que bien, algo que ya no se ve tanto en la actualidad.
 En s√≠ntesis, Enclave es un titulo s√≥lo digno de aqu√©l que est√© fascinado por las historias de corte √©pico en donde abundan los guerreros enchapados en hierro y los magos de hechizos fulminantes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061214576', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1531375769}
review:
Calificaci√≥n: 6.5/10

Enclave es un juego de accion-aventura que recuerda a titulos como Blade: The Edge of Darkness o Rune. No entra dentro del grupo de los rpg asi que no hay que tomar a este juego por lo que no es.

Pros +
+Es entretenido
+La jugabilidad es basica, pero fluida y satisfactoria a la hora de matar enemigos
+Amplio arsenal de armas
+Varios personajes jugables con sus cualidades y armas caracteristicas
+Una buena duraci√≥n ya que posee dos campa√±as.

Contras -
- El juego en general es algo burdo, y esto se denota m√°s que nada con los enemigos, ya que son muy...torpes, s√≠, esa es la palabra.
- Ni la m√∫sica ni los efectos de sonido brillan en este juego
- Si bien la historia es sencilla, no es mala. El problema radica en que uno en ning√∫n momento se siente parte de esa historia.
- La dificultad tiene muchas oscilaciones; los primeros niveles son sencillos, luego algunos se vuelven casi injustos, luego vuelve a ser sencillo... y los finales (recuerdo que hay dos campa√±as)... [spoiler]son demasiado sencillos y adem√°s un asco[/spoiler].

Conclusi√≥n: Quiz√°s apele a la nostalgia de los t√≠tulos de esa √©poca y de ese estilo, pero Enclave es un juego con sus falencias y a√∫n asi sigue siendo entretenido. Bueno para pasar el rato y hacer catarsis  destrozando orcos, goblins, brujas y dem√°s enemigos. Un hack and slash cl√°sico de pura acci√≥n.

This is not one of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198224122680', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 567, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1542411096}
review:
The Enclave is like a clumsy grandchild of a better RPG.
Story is pretty lame, with the narrative only taking place during cutscenes, environmental storytelling is basically nonexistent, since locations are mostly empty. Standart early 2000s game storytelling.
Graphics are 2003, so...
Environment design is actual pretty nice,but nonsensical, it's a shame, that most locations are empty.
Level design is very linear, although there are a few strange shortcuts, that aren't used properly.
Combat is terrible, you have one attack and one block and nothing else. The attack sometimes goes into a multi combo strike, meaning you can't raise your shield during these. There is no heavy attack, no roll or anything that would require some skill beyond mashing the attack button as quickly as possible. Learning enemy patterns is not exactly possible either, since their telegraphs are too short. Dying is meaningless. So combat is repetitive and and boring.

Only try this, if you are really, really, really interested in  15 year old RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245580236', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1560437142}
review:
Enclave. A really charming little game that, in my opinion, receives more negativity than it deserves. Personally, I am enjoying the hell out of it. I will go ahead and say that the melee combat absolutely sucks so you're better off picking up a ranged character. Huntress really works out for me. The game is level based but each level has secrets that you can find such as bags of gold, diamonds that are worth a few more bags of gold and maps for secret arena style levels as well as keys for chests with gold or whatever else. In some levels, helping out a character in need and not letting them die will reward you with that character becoming playable. 

The soundtrack shines out, making every level more interesting and worth exploring. There are also little puzzles here and there to do, not too difficult but just difficult enough. The enemy units are quite smart, again, for the time that the game got released. A clear example is the ranger enemies moving around after taking a shot instead of just standing in place like sitting ducks. It's little things like that which make the combat more fun. 

At the end of the day, your question is, is this game worth it? I personally say it is. And if you don't wanna go for full price, get it on a sale, it'll more than make up for its reduced price :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970815344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1529969578}
review:
Want to know why you didn't play this back in the day? Because its trash and you knew better.

The gameplay mimics that of Rune, but adds in unlockable playable classes, items for purchase with gold found in levels, and some arena minigames. Level design is usually good, and there are times it can be fun. So, if you liked Rune why wouldn't you like this? 

-Platform mechanics are terrible. I slipped/fell/skidded through the world and to my death countless times for no reason other than that I stood on a block that I couldn't tell was 'bad'.
-Crosshairs on ranged weapons are poor, never line up, don't allow for leading, and do minimal damage even as a ranged class, making ranged mostly pointless. Enemies will rush you regardless.
-You piss through potions because your constantly taking damage from invisible enemies, ranged enemies, etc.
-Save points are lame as hell, wheres the quicksave? 
-Melee combat is essentially - move forward, swing, move back. Repeat. Try not to die from getting hit from the swings they didn't make, and try to do damage when your swing went right through them and didn't connect. Hitbox issues for days.
-Ambient sounds can be loud as f@#k while the rest of the world is almost silent.

I got this on sale and I don't recommend it, even for nostalgia. The game has moments of enjoyment but doesn't feel well tested. Unfortunately, the frustration and disappointment ruled out over any enjoyment for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090763675', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1709590118}
review:
I will recommend this game. This game was great back when it came out and it hasn't changed a bit. Admittedly the game is clunky, the fighting is weird and bizarre to get used to. Once you get it though, it feels good when you get the hits on enemies. It has a good variety of characters, so it has replayability, plus a couple secret characters.

A main issue I had was the game running too fast, I know that sounds bizzare but that is a thing I guess, I got around 3000+ frames. Just locking the frames with vsync in the options tab in-game did not work for me, so I am assuming it doesn't work for everyone. 

To lock it you must go to your Enclave folder in the steamapps (For those who don't know how to get to it Go to Program Files -> Steam -> steamapps -> common -> Enclave. OR Right Click on Enclave in your Steam Library -> Properties -> Local Files Tab -> Browse Local Files.) Open Environment.cfg with notepad or notepad++, look for VID_RENDER and change the direct3d8 to OpenGL, then lock your frames in the game with Vertical Sync. It SHOULD lock your frames to a non-astronomical number. Hope this helps someone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005499995', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4125, 'last_played': 1690921743}
review:
(Before the review of this game, a special tip:

If you are looking for old, classic games with knights, fantasy creatures and exciting, challenging combat, then i rather recommend you search for "Severance - The Blade of Darkness", "Rune" or "Drakan: Order of the Flame". 

- Severance: intense melee and boss fights, long and challenging game, 4 different characters, strong atmopshere 
- Rune: nordic setting
- Drakan: melee but also flying and fighting with a dragon)



ENCLAVE:


One of my absolute favorite games!

Sadly, although most of reviews don't match my personal feelings for this game, they are reasonable.

CONS:

-Absolute brainless AI
-Combat is clicking until it dies. Better play on harder difficulties.
-Short game.
-Boring tube like level design.
-Very few Bosses, which are easy to defeat.
-Generic, shallow good vs evil story.

PROS:

-Array of playable characters.
-Fully playable evil side.
-Some minigames, secrets and unlockables.

SUMMARY:

There is nothing realy excitable in this game and it can't be recommended unless you are searching for something to relax on. I like it, because of nostalgia and the playble evil fantasy creatures. Thumbs up in acknowledgment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100592313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1474132726}
review:
Imagine you are making a game about swinging swords. Well you need to keep gamer entertained. Probably need diferent atacks types and some combos like 10 or 15 of them. Well... no. Enclave proves that you can keep player engaged with 3 simple swings.

[h1]Pros [strike]are[/strike] and Cons[/h1]

[i]Visual design.[/i] Location and character design is good, but of course graphic went far ahead during past 15 years.
[i]Atmospheric.[/i] I guess it would be right to call it dark fantasy. Over all it gives the feel of forsaken civilisation at dusk of its age. 
[i]Characters.[/i] There is 6 character for each of two faction. But two pairs have same gear so u don't feel much difference except visuals.
[i]Fights.[/i] Mainly combination of shield block and simple swings as you try to maintain distance(enemies will step back sometimes). Mages and Rangers have some kind of nuke but die faster. But levels are not easy considering that except limited amount of potions you have no means to regain hp.
[i]Plot.[/i] Storytelling is kinda short. Mainly you are told what to do with small insights on why you have to. Main part of world history you will get to know from starting cinematic and short narration between mission. But I would point out that e.g. Darksouls is prised for its limited, insight kind of story telling, so from other perspective it might be not actually bad.

[h1]Recomendation:[/h1]
If you like oldschool feeling of game or fan of slash games, you should definetly try. As well I would to point out that it hard to find some other game that feels like Enclave, wich is makes it very memorable.

...and be cautious whyle crossing Rift.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157464080', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1447267409}
review: Although it's not a terrible game, Enclave have a lot of problems. The levels are very linear, the story is mediocre if not bad, the voice acting is awkward, some weapons are way too op and some of them are useless (e.g.: the daggers). On the positive side for a 16 year old game the graphics looks decent, the classes are fun to play and there are some interesting areas in each level with hidden coins. But for an RPG that you can complete in less than 6 hours on both light and dark campaigns,even 5 dollars seems a bit too expensive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007486006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1528408694}
review: A third person RPG like many... It plays vaguely like an Elder Scrolls, but with levels: you are dropped in a mostly linear scenary, have an objective to fulfill and when you reach the end of it you are given a summary (gold and objects obtained during the mission). This does not work well in comparison with modern RPGs. Generally speaking, this game has fifteen years and it looks and feels old from many points of view. If you are passionate about old classics, you might be interested, otherwise there are so many better games in which you can invest your money and time nowadays.

review: Wenn man bedenkt, dass Enclave aus dem Jahre 2003 ist, dann ist es ein sehr gutes Spiel. F√ºr damalige Zeit sicher spielerisch und technisch gut, wenn auch eher heute schlecht gealtert an manchen  Stellen. Aber es lief zumindest und macht durchaus Spa√ü. Wer etwas lineare Action-Adventure  mit RPG-Elementen mag, der sollte sich Enclave auf jeden Fall mal anschauen. Gerade im Angebot f√ºr 99 Cent bekommt man einer eher unbekannten, aber dennoch guten Klassiker. Wer allerdings wie manche Steamuser hier, das Spiel mit heutigen Spielen vergleicht, der sollte es lieber nicht kaufen, da Enclave da niemals mithalten kann. Ich finde diese Vergleiche auch etwas absurd und ungerecht. Ich meine, das Spiel ist von 2003! Also es ist ca. 15 Jahre alt! Was erwartet ihr da?

review:
The only reason I'm not recomending this game is because of one reason.
The combat is not that good, all you do is mindlessy spam attacks. Sure you can block attacks, but its pretty much useless, the enemy wont be stuned if you successfully block an attack and will just keep attacking you. Also even after an enemy has attacked you, there is barely any time to move in and counter attack. The game basically requires you to cheese the AI, Instead of looking for weakness or patterns. If you do decide to purchase this game play it on easy, I chose Medium difficulty and still had alot of trouble playing. Also you may find it easier to use ranged classes, so you don't have to deal with fighting a enemy up close.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991860447', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1527459313}
review:
Enclave is the kind of game that has been put a lot of effort into but never got a chance to show off its beauty as a whole. It's an action role-playing game released by Starbreeze Studios, the masterminds behind the Chronicles of Riddick, The Darkness or their most popular creation yet: Payday 2. Before the multiplayer scene took over, there was the era of singleplayer-themed titles with plenty of content and unlockables. You would have to search every nook and cranny to acquire better gear or just simply find health and other miscellaneous collectibles. Enclave wants to be just that and it really works. 

We are given 2 campaigns, consisting of 20 levels each, 1 for the good and the other for the dark side. The plot is pretty rich for an action title of that calibre and is delivered by some decent voice acting. On the side note, every single cutscene is skippable and makes replaying feel more fluid. Each fraction holds a set of playable characters which you unlock as you complete the missions, giving you the chance to experiment if a certain class doesn't get the job done. Every chapter can be accessed through a well arranged map, keeping track of your collectibles as well. Speaking of, the game encourages you to explore for gold in exchange for better gear. There is no checkpoints and you can only hard save upon completing your objective so you will need that. To balance that out, the length of one level varies between 5 and 15 minutes to crank down on frustration. 

Difficulty-wise, it's almost perfect. The gorgeous environments are wonderfully crafted and laid out, with sharp textures, showing little age for a 16 years old game. The soundtrack is hauntingly beautiful and so is the entire art direction. It does however suffer from minor hit-detection problems, as well as mouse rotation quirks, causing your character to move fast at times. But none of that will lessen the joy of this classic fantasy-driven journey. Released on Xbox, later ported to PC and strangely to the Wii, this is easily the best variant and it goes without saying. Thanks to the re-release on Steam in 2013, it has sold over a million copies, expanding on the following this gem really deserves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161437572', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1663541736}

review: A ver, edito la rese√±a para escribir por que me pareci√≥ un muy buen juego. Es un juego viejo, no esperes demasiado graficamente, pero la inmersi√≥n es increible y justamente es el viejo motor gr√°fico el que hace que los mapas sean tan hermosos de ver. Todav√≠a me sigo acordando de una escena donde un enemigo sub√≠a una escalera en una torre, el decorado, las texturas, las luces, todo se ve√≠a genial y daba una sensaci√≥n acogedora. Al menos as√≠ es como lo percib√≠. La historia es interesante, y la jugabilidad no es una locura pero es lo suficientemente buena para que el juego no aburra, pero todo va de la mano con el mappeado, decoraci√≥n, texturas, sonido, ambiente, etc. Eso es lo que hace al juego una obra maestra. Si me pregunt√°s, te digo que lo compres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361507394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1524983307}
review:
Enclave es un juego de rol y acci√≥n (del a√±o 2003) que pas√≥ sin pena ni gloria por el mercado y que, a pesar de tener aspectos positivos o aprovechables, en general, tiene bastantes carencias.

Empezando por su jugabilidad, hay que decir que el control es simple y tosco. Por otro lado la dificultad (aunque al principio es relativamente asequible) al llegar a los niveles finales es exagerada, entre otras cosas, por el p√©simo sistema de guardado que tiene y que a esas alturas m√°s complicadas del juego puede frustrar bastante. Otro aspecto negativo es la nula interacci√≥n con los personajes. En el lado positivo hay que destacar que cuenta con una buena variedad de personajes y armas/armaduras.

La mejor parte de Enclave es todo el apartado audiovisual. Teniendo en cuenta los medios de la √©poca, este t√≠tulo cuenta con unos gr√°ficos notables, con escenarios de gran belleza, personajes bien modelados y algunos efectos bien currados. Por su parte, la parte sonora es bastante buena tambi√©n, una gran banda sonora y un buen doblaje.

Por √∫ltimo decir que la historia la podemos jugar desde lo dos bandos (luz y oscuridad), lo cual hace que tenga una buena duraci√≥n. En cuanto a la narrativa en s√≠ no es nada nuevo ni sorprende, y la verdad es que no se desarrolla mucho, pero lo que cuenta a m√≠ personalmente me gust√≥, me pareci√≥ una historia bastante aprovechable y atractiva.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1526355346}
review:
a Remaster of a old classic and favorite game,this game is worth it whether it is on sale or not.  It comes from old days,so there is no comparing it to today's games or gameplay.

I'' be honest to admit that the game may bot have aged well, but your either here to see what games were like back then or your here like me for the nostalgia and memories that this little beauty offers, life back then was so much simpler.

I won't go into detail on how the gameplay is or the graphics, as we determined the game is pretty old and it can't be compared to today's games, but for a game of it's time it was pretty amazing, super fun and very enjoyable.

You will either get this game as +1 to your collectors status or as a remembrance of days gone by.

review:
This game is a bit old, but the graphics still hold up nicely today.  Ahead of its time for sure.  

Gameplay is a lot of fun too, but I just wish the hit detection was better.  I'm shooting my bow and arrow a lot at different enemies, the game says I'm not hitting them, but I find that hard to believe since I'm dead on.  The arrows just go through the enemies sometimes.  Other than that, I still play this game now and then because it's that good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999888555', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1522403399}
review:
Ahh I remember this game... let me tell you my story...

>stroll into my local GameStop
>looking to pick up maybe a copy of just this game, my lust and passion has craved for 
>grab the game and gallop towards the register when my trained eye notice a charming maiden
>-"Pardon me, milady....but could you ring me up? A Shame I don't have your number, or i'd ring you up instead..."
>she giggles and takes the game, blushing as her fingers brush mine due to my fingerless gloves
>her eyes widen as she reads the game's title
>"Wow, I've never seen anyone buy this before! You must have a special taste!"
>I smile and ready a witty response when... SUDDENLY a voice rings out from behind
>-"AHAHAH look what this ****** is buying! That's not EA Star Wars Battlefront! What a piece of ****!!!11one"
>I quickly turn around, my cloak billowing behind me, to discern the source of the rude outburst..
>generic dudebro caricature with a sports team cap and "the guy that beat you up that one time behind the school in early October" shirt is standing there guffawing..
>-"Excuse me sir.....you may disparage my person if you wish, but it is untoward to swear in front of a lady"
>-**** you ******!"
>I smile quietly and tip my fedora low across my eyes, concealing them...
>-"As you wish..."
>I quickly swing my cane into his kneecap before he can react
>he bellows and charges forward
>I expertly sidestep him and the cashier screams as he crashes into the counter
>I draw my sword-cane and mutter a quiet oath as I drive it deep into his back
>-"...requiescat in pace...."
>As I clean my blade the girl walks out from behind the counter, twirlig her hair with her fingers, bumping up in front of me and I inhale as her lady parts jumps up and down like my heartbeat..
>-"So... maybe you'd like to come over to my place to play that game sometime...?"
>I smirk, and whisper "No thanks, milady. I prefer single player. Besides...."
>I sheath my sword..
>-"You're not my type."
>*grab my dew and dorros, skate away on my Heelys*
