author: {'steamid': '76561198272065482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1701215811}
review: Back in the day i used to play this on the original xbox when it came out, so playing this game again brought back nostalgia. This version of the game had MUCH more checkpoints than the original there was only two on the xbox version(that i know of) of this game. The different characters that you unlock throughout the game give different fighting styles, like the wizard for example, he uses magic from different staffs you can get or he'll pull out a dagger of your choosing, 'cause you don't have unlimited magic. Sure the difficulty for some people can get people mad, but there is one campaign that supposed is to be hard and challenging and that one is the dark campaign. What is not to like about this game (aside from what i just said about the difficulty) there is a good story and variety of weapons that you can choose. One of the better older games that i ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121371584', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2078, 'last_played': 1522513410}
review:
Hermoso titulo, arcade de pura acci√≥n y toques de RPG que desaf√≠a a pesar de los a√±os que tiene arriba.
La historia esta decente pero el punto fuerte es el avance en sus niveles y su dificultad, dependiendo que character seleccionemos y nos especialicemos (podemos especializar todos los que vayamos desbloqueando a medida que avanzamos en el juego) el juego se va a poner dif√≠cil, bastante dif√≠cil.

En una √©poca en donde estamos acostumbrados a avanzar de la mano y a pura ayuda (BLEH), en este juego te vas a dar la cabeza contra la pared mas de una vez, la insistencia es la clave, aprenderse los recorridos de los enemigos, donde buscar, etc etc.

Termine la campa√±a LUZ en dif√≠cil (Sin checkpoints) y la verdad no tiene desperdicio, para que lo sepan, si mor√≠s empezas todo el nivel denuevo, no se en las dem√°s dificultades pero en dif√≠cil es un lindo desafi√≥ la verdad.

Muy recomendado para aquellos que les gustan los juegos retro, desafiantes y al que le gusta buscar todos los secrets en el nivel, ademas de disfrutar de una joya de su epoca.

Abrazo grande :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198077353576', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1435945778}
review:
Like the first time having sex, it's almost all over too soon. Enclave is one of those classics that didn't get enough recognition, it's dark and griddy, the story and voice acting is corny yet entertaining, and the combat is intense like an old hack and slash should. Where it falls short is it's buggy hit boxes, crashes, and really short story.

I'm telling ya, the devs have got to release the tools for this game. Allow the imagination of the modding community to create off of the foundation of a great mechanism. The real short coming of this game, is the missed potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021800223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 476, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1518114880}
review:
Everybody knows how much similiar Enclave is to The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
But how many people does know how much better Enclave is than The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim?

Just like The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, Enclave has simplified combat and boring story
but unlike The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, Enclave the combat is actually fun, challenging and story is kept simple and memorable.

Every single swing in your combo does a different hitbox, damage and swing arc making it far more unique and satisfying than....whatever goofy gestures you do with your hands while clicking a left mouse click in The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim in hope for winning a video game someday. 

Yes, Enclave sadly does not feature a big, bloated, boring open world that takes millions of hours to explore like The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim but that is not necessary a bad thing because Enclave does something that The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim does not - a good level design. 

When The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim has fail to has a good variety of unique classes,
Enclave on the other hand does a good job at this with its in depth class system and equipment selection on every single character and level giving a player lots of possible ways to play the game in different ways instead of simple locking you into a single class or race like in The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.

Enclave may not be such a big source of gems like "arrow in the knee" memes or "haha funny bug" compilations or "wacky mods XD" videos on the internet but I didn't found it to be a bad thing considering the huge amount of polish it got when comparing to The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.

Replayability. One of my favourite things about video games.
Does The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim has it? No because nobody wants to play that sh*t twice in row. Even people who claim otherwise. Especially people who claim otherwise.
So here comes Enclave and stomps on The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim all over its grave with
the possibilities.
Heck, you can even replay older levels with new unlocked characters and new gear, allowing you to finish those levels even easier and faster while finding out new missed secrets.

Grinding for stats vs actual skill and tactic in combat. 
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim vs Enclave. Who wins once again?
Obviously Enclave for simple not allowing you beat the game by over leveling up your character like a baby coward.

Is The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim perfect? Of course not. 
Same with Enclave. No video game is perfect. Well, except for Undertale and Resident Evil 4.
But y'know what is close to perfections more than The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim?
Enclave. I mean, DOH!

So is Enclave a better and more fun video game than The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim?
Just as subjective answer is "yes", the objective answer is also "yes".

But thats probably because any kind of video game is better and more fun to play than The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.

Even the title and logo of Enclave is 100 times better.
Such shape, such color, such elegant design.
Now look at boring The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim logo? 
Heck, The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim is so bad that even the title sucks balls
and self-proclaimed The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim fans perfectly knows that. 
You don't believe me?

Well, I am pretty sure I did say more times "The Elder Scrolls V" in this review than any self-proclaimed The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim fans in their whole goddam life (because all they say is "Skyrim").
If that is not a sign for a horrible title such as The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim then I don't know what it is.

Enclave ma pomimo i≈º bardzo kanciaste, to jednak wystarczajƒÖco atrakcyjne konstrukcje lokacji - to wa≈ºne. Klimat ro≈õnie z ka≈ºda mapƒÖ (kt√≥ra dane mi by≈Ço zobaczyƒá. Walka kuszƒÖ - ca≈Çkiem atrakcyjna nawet je≈õli przestarza≈Ça do b√≥lu. Mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá wybierania postaci kt√≥ra przechodzimy etap i dozbrajanie siƒô tak≈ºe na plus.

Lewitowaƒá potrafiƒÖ te≈º przeciwnicy. W og√≥le zar√≥wno nasza postaƒá jak i przeciwnicy potrafiƒÖ lagowaƒá jak gracze w grze mmo z przeciƒÖ≈ºonym serwerem i widaƒá to choƒáby po nogach naszej postaci. Przeciwnik√≥w jest do≈õƒá ma≈Ço - sƒÖ za to do≈õƒá wymagajƒÖcy co w otoczkƒÖ audio-wideo tworzy fajnƒÖ atmosferƒô, niestety nag≈Çe pojawianie siƒô przeciwnik√≥w dra≈ºni, zw≈Çaszcza tych z bombami.  Walka orƒô≈ºem nie nale≈ºy do atrakcyjnych niestety, wp≈Çyw tarczy do≈õƒá niemrawy i nic nie poprawia. Nie da siƒô zej≈õƒá po drabinie - trzeba na niƒÖ skakaƒá liczƒÖc ≈ºe postaƒá siƒô jej z≈Çapie. Wchodzenie tak≈ºe jest zbugowane bo czƒôsto ju≈º przy szczycie spadamy. Zbieranie kasy czasem opera siƒô o bezmy≈õlnym i byle jak najszybszym wciskaniu klawisza skoku - aby przeskoczyƒá.

review: Um jogo simples, com uma hist√≥ria de constru√ß√£o inicial √≥tima, mec√¢nicas simples, por√©m, divertidas. Recomendo para quem quer passar o tempo e descobrir jogos antigos de boa qualidade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116537984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6093, 'last_played': 1469692592}
review:
Like the first time having sex, it's almost all over too soon. Enclave is one of those classics that didn't get enough recognition, it's dark and griddy, the story and voice acting is corny yet entertaining, and the combat is intense like an old hack and slash should. Where it falls short is it's buggy hit boxes, crashes, and really short story.

I'm telling ya, the devs have got to release the tools for this game. Allow the imagination of the modding community to create off of the foundation of a great mechanism. The real short coming of this game, is the missed potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1399, 'num_reviews': 753, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1517248969}
review:
Enclave Gold-Version 
Die V√∂lker des Lichts und der Finsternis m√∂gen sich nicht so wirklich. Und wer h√§tte das gedacht, es kommt zum Konflikt zwischen den beiden. Du kannst beide Seiten Spielen. Dies sind zwei komplexe Einzelspielerkampagnen.
Dieses Spiel ist ein Mix aus alten guten Spielen. Der Aufbau ist wie beim alten DOOM, spielbar wie Duke Nukem und gemacht wie das alte Half Live. Ist f√ºr die heutige Zeit etwas ungew√∂hnlich aber gut umgesetzt. Ist kurzweilig und gut gemacht. Bestens geeignet f√ºr zwischendurch. Es macht Spa√ü und ist je nachdem welche Einstellung man w√§hlt auch recht anspruchsvoll. Au√üerdem kann man ja auch noch zwischen 3 Charakteren w√§hlen.
Zudem gibt es auch die M√∂glichkeit im Mehrspielermodus zu Spielen. 
Hier habt ihr dann 12 Charaktere aus verschiedenen Charakterklassen die ihr nutzen k√∂nnt, dazu kommen noch Bonuscharaktere. 
Mit denen k√∂nnt ihr rasante Mittelalteraction erleben und √ºber 25 Fantasy-Missionen erledigen, einige Bonusspiele gibt es zus√§tzlich..
Ich m√∂chte es Empfehlen da ich wie schon gesagt es gut gemacht finde. 
Inwieweit die zahlreichen, geskripteten Events tats√§chlich stets f√ºr √úberraschungen sorgen ist nicht vorhersagbar.
Probiert es einfach mal. Viel Spa√ü dabei.

Enclave Gold version
The peoples of light and darkness do not really like each other. And who would have thought that, there is a conflict between the two. You can play both sides. These are two complex single player campaigns.
This game is a mix of old good games. The setup is like the old DOOM, playable like Duke Nukem and made like the old Half Live. Is for today something unusual but well implemented. Is entertaining and well done. Ideal for in between. It is fun and depending on which attitude one chooses, it is quite demanding. You can also choose between 3 characters.
There is also the possibility to play in multiplayer mode.
Here you have 12 characters from different character classes you can use, plus bonus characters.
With them you can experience fast-paced medieval action and do over 25 fantasy missions, plus some bonus games.
I would like to recommend it as I said I said it was well done. The extent to which the numerous, scripted events actually always provide surprises is unpredictable.
Just try it. Have lots of fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107912572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1515918675}
review:
Edit: I played some more and it's pretty fun. I'm changing my review to positive, but I'm still on the fence about recommending it. All of my criticisms still stands, but you do unlock new classes after certain missions. 

As another reviewer mentioned this game is like a "run and gun" shooter because the melee is kinda meh, but some classes you can make melee work (I think) if you want.

Sh**Boxes...
idk, it's a 15 year old game so it's worth a shot if you want to play a rough game. I might give it another try because I do like that you can just jump in and start fighting rather than a bunch of plot and NPC dialogue. 

I actually found it pretty difficult (edit: I didn't understand how to activate checkpoints so maybe it will be easier as I was essentially playing on the hardest difficulty), but that's partially because it's hard to aim ranged attacks with my control setup and melee was also kind of difficult to use. I tried blocking attacks or jumping to dodge melee attacks, but I got hit most of the time.

I love Dark Souls so there's a part of me that wants to grit my teeth and keep going, but I have such limited time and games like Dragon's Dogma I haven't played. Let me know if this game is worth trying. I'm kind of intrigued, but also bu**hurt >.<

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 434, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1514740899}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : pfff.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Aucune id√©e !

[h1]Rejouabilit√©, achievements[/h1]

Aucune id√©e !

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Le port Linux est pitoyable en multiscreen.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

Le port Linux utilise wine. Je n'ai aucun probl√®me avec √ßa, surtout pour les jeux aussi vieux. C'est une bonne mani√®re d'amener de vieux jeux sur la plateforme, mais... seulement si c'est bien fait.

Car l√†, c'est une catastrophe. Dans l'ordre :

Le jeu ne se lance pas car les link des libs wine semblent √™tre fait n'importe comment : libwine.so n'est pas un lien symbolique vers libwine.so.1, mais un link NTFS qui ne fonctionne pas chez moi. Il y a un message d'erreur dans le log √† ce propos. Refaire les link r√©pare ce probl√®me.

Le jeu change le r√©glage gamma du bureau. A chaque d√©marrage. Le script qui enrobe tout √ßa le remet correctement √† la fin. Mais... le jeu a donc un gamma √† 95% tout le temps. C'est hideux et injouable. J'ai r√©gl√© ce soucis l√† en configurant un bureau virtuel de la taille de mon √©cran principal avec winecfg. Je ne sais pas exactement pourquoi, mais du coup le script fourni change le gamma tout de suite au lieu d'√† la fin.

Le jeu ne capture pas la souris quand il est en plein √©cran. C'est l√† que le b√¢t blesse. Car en multiscreen, la souris se barre sur l'√©cran de droite au moins mouvement (le pointeur semble rester √† droite de l'√©cran de jeu, m√™me quand on se dirige vers la gauche)... et donc on ne contr√¥le plus le jeu !

En mode fen√™tr√©, il la capture, mais qui veut jouer en fen√™tr√© √† ce genre de jeu... et donc en conclusion : NOPE, vraiment pas adapt√© au multiscreen.

OS: Linux Mint 18.3 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075324976', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 688, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1591452984}
review:
This is a very straight forward action-rpg

Levels are small and fairly linear, not huge open world

You pick a character (you unlock several eventually) and his gear (based on what amount of gold you have unlocked up to that point) and then play each level

As you progress you unlock more levels. You can replay them to achieve max gold unlock if you missed any the first time. You get more characters and weapon options as you get deeper.

It's 15 years old, it's showing its age, but it's a nostalgia trip and there's some aspects of it I wish we would see more often in current games.

Picked it up for 50 cents just for the memory trip, I put a lot of hours into this on consoles back in 2002.
---

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2558, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1512754236}
review:
[h1]Klassiker-Review[/h1]

"Enclave" ist ein Third-Person Action Spiel im Fantasy-Setting aus dem Jahre 2002.

Die V√∂lker des Lichts und die der Finternis wurden vor Jahrtausenden nach dem gro√üen Krieg durch einen unendlich tiefen Riss getrennt. Das Land Celenheim ist reich und gedeiht pr√§chtig. Es bildet eine Enklave der Ordnung, umgeben von den unfruchtbaren Ein√∂den der Finsternis. Im Laufe der Jahrhunderte schlo√ü sich langsam der Riss und K√§mpfer der Finsternis drangen vernichtend in Celenheim ein. Wird Celenheim √ºberleben?

Die Story ist bestenfalls ganz nett, Fantasy-Ged√∂ns halt, aber sie erm√∂glicht einige interessante Settings und Charaktere zu begr√ºnden.

Im Kern ist das Game allerdings kein tiefgr√ºndiges Storyabenteuer, sondern ein dumpfes, lineares Haudrauf mit einigen besonderen Passagen. Ein Konsolentitel, der durchaus Spa√ü machen kann, bei dem man aber das Hirn nicht einzuschalten braucht. Vor jedem der recht zahlreichen Level w√§hlen wir, mit wem wir den n√§chsten Abschnitt bestreiten wollen. Es gibt nat√ºrlich den nahk√§mpfenden Schwertschwinger, aber auch die Bogensch√ºtzin oder die Druidin. Und rein gehts in den n√§chsten linearen Abschnitt. Vor allem m√ºssen wir uns gegen zahlreiche ork- oder goblin√§hnliche Viecher erwehren. Auch die haben teils Nah- und teils Fernkampfwaffen am Start. In den Burgen und Katakomben stehen auch hinter jeder Kiste Heiltr√§nke oder Golds√§cke rum. Mit letzteren k√∂nnen wir uns vor dem n√§chsten Level bessere Ausr√ºstung leisten.

Die ist auch durchaus notwendig, denn allzu leicht ist das Spiel nicht. Wer das einzusammelnde Gold ignoriert wird rasch auf Probleme sto√üen. 

Mechanisch funktioniert das Kampfsystem simpel, aber gut. Die Portierung auf Maus und Tastatur ist sauber, wenn man auch den Gamepadursprung noch durchsp√ºrt.

Grafisch war das Spiel zum Erscheinungsdatum f√ºr die Konsolengeneration richtig schick. Heutzutage matscht vieles und wirkt doch einiges recht h√§√ülich. Wirklich gut gealtert ist der Titel nicht. Vor allem die Animationen in den Zwischensequenzen wirken staksig albern.  Auch der Sound ist sauber, wie man es von einem gr√∂√üeren Titel des Genres erwarten kann, ohne wirklich Besonders zu sein.

Spa√ü macht der Titel dennoch heute auch noch. Mechanik und Umfang gehen in Ordnung, Pr√§sentation und Atmosph√§re sind nett gemacht. Auch die Missionen sind recht abwechslungsreich. Zumindest in der Behauptung, denn auch Besch√ºtzerlevel arten in einfach alles Wegkloppen aus. Aber immerhin kann man nach erfolgreichem Absolvieren der Lichtkampagne noch eine gro√üe Kampagne auf der Seite der Dunkelheit durchzocken. Ein bi√üchen Hirn ausschalten und Draufloskloppen geht aber doch immer. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 Atmosph√§re
7/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
6/10 Spielmechanik
6/10 Balancing
7/10 Spielspass
(technische Wertungen beziehen immer das Erscheinungsjahr ein)

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Recht unterhaltsames Haudrauf.

[h1][b]7/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561197968694779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1511545909}
review: This is a weird but great classic action RPG. It was fun to play good and evil sides and overall it's a well designed game. I still have the original CD's and fond memories of it (it has an install disc and then a disc for each campaign with cool graphics on it). Graphics do show their age of course but I still found it fun to play and finding secrets as well as location diversity. It is still fun and honestly not many games can match it. It's hard to describe what the game but if you're into action with RPG elements, you will probably like it. It's a deep RPG and character progression is not complicated but this is actually a good thing since it is focused more on the action aspect I guess. Great game to pass up some time with style. :)  Definitely one of those hidden gems (old skool goodness)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059034300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 988, 'last_played': 1510409119}
review:
Enclave √® un GDR fantasy in terza persona pubblicato per pc e Xbox nel lontano 2002. 
Una versione per GameCube era in sviluppo ma venne cancellata nel 2003 e una per Wii venne rilasciata nel 2012. 

Nonostante non sia particolarmente recente, Enclave presenta ottimi lati positivi: 

	- Ottima trama, coinvolgente e incalzante. 
	- Due fazioni giocabili, possiamo iniziare con la campagna della luce e sconfiggere i ''cattivi'' di turno oppure possiamo impersonare i malvagi con la campagna dell'oscurit√†. 
	- Ogni fazione ha un buon numero di classi che sbloccheremo livello dopo livello: cavaliere, cacciatrice, druido, halfling, ingegnere, mago e golem di fango per i buoni. Assassino, berserker, strega, goblin, artigliere, lich e gnomo di pietra per la fazione oscura. 
	- Le ambientazioni sono rese molto bene, dettagliate per essere un gioco del 2002, ogni mappa √® abbastanza estesa e possiamo divertirci a trovare diversi oggetti come pozioni, soldi o frecce. 
	- Buona colonna sonora.
	- Discreto doppiaggio anche se per pi√π personaggi viene utilizzata una sola voce.

Non pochi sono i lati negativi:

	- Un mostruoso bug nella camminata. Come la maggior parte dei videogiochi su pc del genere noi ci muoviamo con WASD mentre il mouse lo usiamo per cambiare direzione‚Ä¶il problema √®  proprio nel momento in cui cambi direzione, al minimo movimento del mouse il tuo personaggio schizza in avanti improvvisamente come se stessimo laggando.
	- Diversi glitch grafici possiamo riscontrarli in elementi come il cielo, le montagne e l'acqua. 
	- Il combattimento ravvicinato risulta molto noioso e ripetitivo, poco impegnativo. 
	- Il sistema di equipaggiamento non √® uno dei migliori poich√© possiamo comprare pochissime armi e armature ma solo a fine missione. 

Tutto sommato penso che valga la pena giocare ad Enclave, nonostante difetti abbastanza pesanti, possiamo comunque divertirci per poco pi√π di una decina di ore e vivere una bella esperienza grazie ad una ottima trama. 

6.5/10 

Ps: consiglio l'halfling nella campagna della luca e la strega nella  campagna dell'oscurit√†.

review:
Enclave to gra  z gatunku fantasy. Fabu≈Ça jest stosunkowo prosta. Gdzie≈õ istnieje kraina, w kt√≥rej w wyniku walki dobra ze z≈Çem powsta≈ÇƒÖ rozpadlina, odgradzajƒÖc jedno z ksiƒôstw. Ludzie, kt√≥rzy tam ≈ºyli byli dobrzy, a sama kraina op≈Çywa≈Ça dostatkiem. Poza niƒÖ nie by≈Ço ju≈º tak piƒôknie. Pozosta≈Çe tereny zamieszkiwa≈Ço z≈Ço, kt√≥re oczywi≈õcie na tytu≈ÇowƒÖ enklawƒô mia≈Ço chrypƒô. Po wielu latach rozpadlina zaczƒô≈Ça siƒô zmniejszaƒá doprowadzajƒÖc do tego, ≈ºe mo≈ºna jƒÖ by≈Ço ju≈º gdzieniegdzie pokonaƒá. ≈ªyjƒÖcy dotychczas w spokoju mieszka≈Ñcy enklawy musieli zaznaƒá smaku wojny, broniƒÖc siƒô przed atakami sƒÖsiad√≥w zza miedzy. Tutaj wkracza gracz, a jego rolƒÖ jest uratowanie tych dobrych przed z≈Çymi albo na odwr√≥t, poniewa≈º gra daje te≈º takƒÖ mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá. 

Mamy tu kilka klas postaci do wojownika po czarodzieja. Nie wszystkie sƒÖ dostƒôpne jednak od poczƒÖtku gry. Nie bardzo wiedzia≈Çem jak jƒÖ zakwalifikowaƒá, ale jest to co≈õ w rodzaju takiej taktycznej zrƒôczno≈õci√≥wki. Og√≥lnie to biegamy naszym ch≈Çopkiem i walimy po g≈Çowach niemilc√≥w. Czasem co≈õ trzeba prze≈ÇƒÖczyƒá lub znale≈∫ƒá jaki≈õ klucz. Misji jest og√≥lnie po kilkana≈õcie dla ka≈ºdej ze stron, ale nie sƒÖ one jako≈õ szczeg√≥lnie d≈Çugie. Przy czym gra jest naprawdƒô wymagajƒÖca i uko≈Ñczenie niekt√≥rych nawet na poziome easy nie jest ≈Çatwe. Tu i √≥wdzie mo≈ºna wprawdzie znale≈∫ƒá chechpoint-y, ale dzia≈ÇajƒÖ tylko do wyj≈õcia z gry. Je≈ºeli zrezygnujemy, zaczynamy misjƒô od nowa.

Grafika jak na rok wydania (2003) jest naprawdƒô niez≈Ça. W wysokiej rozdzielczo≈õci wyglƒÖda to naprawdƒô dobrze. Jest trochƒô kant√≥w itp. Ale trudno siƒô dziwiƒá z uwagi na jej wiek. author: {'steamid': '76561198081457364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1509435382}
review:
I mean. . . it's pretty good looking for 2003. but really. you can feel the age, when you shoot an arrow and watch it pass through the enemies head for the 30th time you REALLY start to feel the age.  honestly the game was not all that intresting though, your VERY basic run and gun. but with a cross bow. . . i mean, you CAN use your sword, but afer the 100th time of watching it pass though an enemy, ya just say, screw it and pull out the cross bow. 

if ya miss 2003 then by all means, take to it, but the fact that games from the N64 had 100 times more depth says a hell of a lot in my opinion. there are some intresting none standered stuff. like you find new characters though out the game and go back and replay levels with the new chars, and that the gold you get is what you always have to kit out your "hero" and you can just keep adding to it and adding to it. pretty neat. 

the story it's self, wich is the BEST reason to get the game is that kinda high fantasy, where it is more like. . . Super into its self high fantasy. to where most of it feels more like elves are the high class, and not a completly diffrent race. happens a lot, and i hate ta see it. but see it i do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130164116', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1509384581}
review:
[h1]Enclave[/h1]

SchodzƒÖc z du≈ºej wysoko≈õci trzeba zeskoczyƒá na drabinƒô i liczyƒá na to, ≈ºe postaƒá zdƒÖ≈ºy siƒô jej z≈Çapaƒá przed uderzeniem w ziemiƒô. Grafika wraz z muzykƒÖ nadajƒÖ unikalny i mroczny klimat jak z horroru. Mnogo≈õƒá orƒô≈ºu oferowanego dla ka≈ºdej z klas postaci, kt√≥rych jest siedem na ka≈ºdƒÖ z dw√≥ch kampanii, jest bardzo satysfakcjonujƒÖca i urozmaica grƒô. 

Fabu≈Ça to najmocniesza strona Enclave. Opowiada nam dwie historie. O ocaleniu jak i o zniewoleniu ≈õwiata. Kampania dobra sk≈Çada siƒô z czternastu misji, za≈õ z≈Ça z 13. Do wyboru mamy 6 bohater√≥w (Rycerza, ≈Åowcƒô, Druida, Nizio≈Çka, In≈ºyniera i Czarodzieja) i 6 potƒôpionych (Zab√≥jcƒô, Berserkera, Czarownicƒô, Goblina, Bombardiera i Licza). Po zako≈Ñczeniu ka≈ºdej z kampani odblokowywuje siƒô jednostkƒô specjalnƒÖ - ≈ªywio≈Çaka.

ReasumujƒÖc, do plus√≥w gry mo≈ºna zaliczyƒá:
- poprawno≈õƒá w sferze fabularnej
- czas potrzebny do zako≈Ñczenia wƒÖtku g≈Ç√≥wnego
- unikalny klimat

Natomiast do ewidentnych minus√≥w gry trzeba zaliczyƒá:
- brak mo≈ºliwo≈õci u≈ºywania kursora/myszki w menu
- problematyczny silnik fizyczny.

Moim zdaniem Enclave jest grƒÖ wartƒÖ uwagi i godnƒÖ polecenia, ze wzglƒôdu na sw√≥j oryginalny klimat oraz wciƒÖgajƒÖcƒÖ fabu≈Çƒô.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025321433', 'num_games_owned': 1159, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1508852711}
review:
Disclaimer: I have only played through most of the Light Campaign before stopping, so take what I say with a grain of salt.

The game is not bad, there are two different campaigns available (Light and Dark) and it plays very fluidly and well. The devil, however, is in the details, and under the shiny and well-functioning hood lies a buggy engine. Arrows often phase through enemies, sword hits don't actually hit the enemy sometimes despite you standing right in front of them. On the other hand, enemies can hit the statue next to you but you still somehow get damage, and swing their sword through the air and still slice your ears off despite not visibly hitting you.

The active battle system is sadly the biggest drawback of the game. When it works, it works well, but when it doesn't work, it is annoying and makes the game much harder and frustrating than it needs to be, which lead to me quitting the game. One of the last levels throws hordes of enemies at you, and after seven attempts of hitting them with my huntress' bow and the arrows only hitting them half the time before getting swarmed, I frustratingly gave up - changing to another class didn't help much either. It is sad, too, because the game was really fun before this last stretch. I am not sure how much changes in the dark campaign, but I was not motivated enough to find out. This was all on medium difficulty as well.

I still upvote the game for several reasons. The music is fantastic, moving around and swinging your sword feels fluid and good (if you hit someone, at least). For an old game it runs surprisingly well without any major technical hiccups, despite the rare crashes I have experienced. There are multiple character classes with equipment and the game has an exploratory feel to it that just makes you want to look into every nook and cranny of the (very well and fantastically designed) levels.

If you have a high tolerance for frustration, this is a good game to check out. Only buy if you can look past the frustrating inconsistent battle system as well as the cheap difficulty of throwing enemies at you until you drown in them in later stages.

review:
Gra akcji z elementami RPG stworzona przez szwedzkie studio Starbreeze i wydana przez Topware Interactive w 2002 roku na pierwszego Xboxa, rok p√≥≈∫niej przeportowana na pecety.
Akcja gry zosta≈Ça osadzona w ≈õwiecie fantasy. Historia zaczyna siƒô od ataku  potƒô≈ºnego demona Vatara na siedzibƒô si≈Ç dobra. Ziemie te posiadajƒÖce w sobie magicznƒÖ moc od zawsze interesowa≈Çy ≈ºƒÖdnego w≈Çadzy potwora tak wiƒôc postanowi≈Ç on z pomocƒÖ niezliczonej armii zwolennik√≥w zagarnƒÖƒá je sobie si≈ÇƒÖ. Sprzymierzone armie ludzi elf√≥w nizio≈Çk√≥w i gnom√≥w nie mog≈Çy sprostaƒá napierajƒÖcej hordzie tak wiƒôc w akcie desperacji potƒô≈ºny czarownik Zale za pomocƒÖ specjalnego zaklƒôcia stworzy≈Ç szerokƒÖ rozpadlinƒô kt√≥ra powstrzyma≈Ça atak. Sam Vatar dos≈Çownie zapad≈Ç siƒô pod ziemiƒô a jego armia zosta≈Ça po drugiej stronie szczeliny pozbawiona jakichkolwiek mo≈ºliwo≈õci kontrataku. Tak powsta≈Ça tytu≈Çowa Enklawa jednak≈ºe moc zaklƒôcia z czasem s≈Çab≈Ça a przepa≈õƒá robi≈Ça siƒô coraz wƒô≈ºsza. W ko≈Ñcu z≈Çolom uda≈Ço siƒô jƒÖ przekroczyƒá, na dodatek sam Zale zaginƒÖ≈Ç a i Vatar planuje zemstƒô. Wiƒôc jak zawsze gdy wszystko siƒô wali do akcji wkracza nasz bohater. Uwiƒôziony w lochu przez nag≈Çy atak uwalnia siƒô ze swojej celi, naszym pierwszym zadaniem bƒôdzie ucieczka z oblƒô≈ºonej twierdzy. 
Gra jak na slashera ma do≈õƒá du≈ºo fabu≈Çy i o ile jest ona nieco sztampowa to na plus wychodzi osadzenie jej w ≈õwiecie dark fantasy. To nie wr√≥≈ºki i jednoro≈ºce a surowy i mroczny ≈õwiat pe≈Çen niebezpiecze≈Ñstw. Og√≥≈Çem fabu≈Ça wypada ca≈Çkiem nie≈∫le. Dodatkowo gdy sko≈Ñczymy kampaniƒô tych dobrych mo≈ºemy te≈º przej≈õƒá drugƒÖ z perspektywy si≈Ç z≈Ça kt√≥ra bƒôdzie nieco trudniejsza. 
Graficznie gra wyglƒÖda≈Ça bardzo dobrze w dniu wydania a i dzisiaj prezentuje sie ca≈Çkiem ok. Wra≈ºenie robiƒÖ szczeg√≥≈Çowe modele i og√≥lna ilo≈õƒá detali. 
D≈∫wiƒôki i voice-acting te≈º sƒÖ niez≈Çe choƒá w przypadku g≈Ços√≥w u≈õwiadczymy przypadek jednego go≈õcia dubbingujƒÖcego kilka postaci.
Muzyka jest do≈õƒá typowa dla fantasy i przez to nie zapadajƒÖca zbytnio w pamiƒôƒá. Zapamiƒôta≈Çem jedynie kawa≈Çek z credits√≥w kt√≥ry brzmia≈Ç naprawdƒô fajnie.
Od strony gameplayowej gra jest trzecioosobowym slasherem z elementami RPGa. Wybieramy postaƒá kt√≥rych jest 6 i przechodzimy liniowe poziomy kampanii zbierajƒÖc po drodze z≈Çoto za kt√≥re kupujemy lepsze wyposa≈ºenie. System walki w grze jest podobny do tego w Rune czy p√≥≈∫niejszego Condemned, mianowicie ciosy r√≥≈ºniƒÖ siƒô w zale≈ºno≈õci od kierunku w kt√≥rym siƒô poruszymy, mo≈ºna te≈º tworzyƒá proste combosy. Walkƒô wzbogaca te≈º du≈ºa ilo≈õƒá broni: mieczy, topor√≥w, maczug itd. Poza walkƒÖ wrƒôcz mo≈ºemy te≈º graƒá  na dystans u≈ºywajƒÖc kuszy i ≈Çuk√≥w albo po prostu typowo dystansowymi postaciami np. ≈ÇowczyniƒÖ czy dzier≈ºƒÖcym magiczny kostur czarownikiem. Potyczki z poczƒÖtku sƒÖ fajne i emocjonujƒÖce jednak pod koniec gry stajƒÖ siƒô chaotyczne i trochƒô irytujƒÖce, wtedy gra rzuca w nas wieloma przeciwnikami naraz i jedynym wyj≈õciem z takich sytuacji jest spamienie jednego combosa w k√≥≈Çko i okazjonalne zdejmowanie wrog√≥w z kuszy po cichaczu. Ostatnie poziomy sƒÖ naprawdƒô trudne i to w≈Ça≈õnie wtedy jeste≈õmy zmuszeni graƒá w taki spos√≥b. Nie jest to wielki minus bo jest to wykonalne ale odbiera urok temu systemowi walki. Opr√≥cz broni kupujemy tak≈ºe tarcze pancerz mikstury leczƒÖce i be≈Çty do kuszy czy strza≈Çy do ≈Çuku. Poza walutƒÖ wydawanƒÖ na ekranie sklepu z≈Çoto wykorzystywane jest tak≈ºe do aktywowania checkpoint√≥w je≈õli zginiemy odradzamy siƒô w takim punkcie kontrolnym tracƒÖc troche z≈Çota, je≈õli sko≈Ñczy nam siƒô z≈Çoto bƒÖd≈∫ nie dojdziemy do checkpointa zaczynamy poziom od nowa. Przej≈õcie jednej kampanii zajmuje jakie≈õ 8-10 godzin je≈õli chcemy uko≈Ñczyƒá te≈º drugƒÖ zajmie nam to oko≈Ço 20 godzin tak wiƒôc gra jest do≈õƒá standardowa pod wzglƒôdem d≈Çugo≈õci.
Bardzo spodoba≈Ç mi siƒô w Enclave klimat. Kraina dark fantasy, stonowana paleta barw i og√≥lna do≈õƒá europejska architektura. Wolƒô zdecydowanie co≈õ takiego ni≈º cukierkowego Warcrafta czy przesadzone Final Fantasy. 
PodsumowujƒÖc: Enclave to dobra gra. Jasne, model walki jest do≈õƒá chaotyczny a pod koniec gra robi siƒô wrednie trudna ale mimo to bawi≈Çem siƒô dobrze. Nie jest to jaka≈õ zapomniana pere≈Çka godna 10/10 ale solidna produkcja stworzona z pasjƒÖ i zaanga≈ºowaniem dla mi≈Ço≈õnik√≥w mrocznego fantasy i slasherowej walki opartej na ruchu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303462559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1523850280}
review:
Others have said the game does not work well , crashes random or can't alt tab out , or it's not a proper linux port running under WINE. Well, game works fine for me ...loads fine, runs fine under WINE. i like the dynamics of the game and think the game is worth the purchase. For those not getting things running right under linux ...make sure yer openGL is working well and make sure yer video drivers are up to date , and if ye need any firmware for chipsets make sure thats working well too or ye may have video driver issues. I think a proper setup linux system supporting graphics properly will run the game fine under WINE. as for the ALT-TAB issues ....when i alt-tab out i get a little Enclave icon like i would if i was running a wine desktop but on my native desktop ....click that twice and the game full screens again. so not even an issue with alt-tab.
GOOD JOB FOLKS , THANKS FOR A GREAT GAME !!!  :>

author: {'steamid': '76561198172868970', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1504131230}
review:
A very amazing game, truely old but gold!
This definitely brought back some memories of the previous generations of gaming, with the moderate difficulty and classic combat system that these kind of games used to have back than.
The story is pretty straight-foward yet amazing at the same time, these Swedish developers sure knew what a good game was back than!
Just amazing! Played a ridicilous amount of hours on this game, even after completing it I was still hooked!

Pro
+Supports high resolution
+Simplistic play
+Great enviorments
+Great medieval sound
+Two campaigns
+Steam game cards

Con
-Ranged combat is an uninspired joke
-Typical hack'n'slash
-No advanced maneuvers

Note, This game was amazing 10 years ago. Can feel a bit outdated at todays standard.

8.5/10, Good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402521885', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 1711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1521933234}
review:
I like this game. Good old style look and feel, solid story to explore. Reminds me of TES series. If you're a fan of Morrowind, Oblivion or similar games definitely you should try Enclave. Don't forget a price tag :) it's cheap and you can easily find -90% off coupon if you're reluctant. 

However, I have to give this game a negative review in general and I'm NOT recommending it to anyone who wants to play it on Linux. here's why-

- game refuses to run from NTFS partition, make sure you install it to ext4 partition or it won't run due to issues with wine and its permissions - something that have to be fixed but it wont happen from what  I can see

- even if you enstall it on ext4 it will run once and then will refuse to start for unknown reason. it does not show up in processes so you can't kill it. the only way to get rid of it is to restart your desktop.

This wine wrapper, and it acts way worse than you will get while running it in your own wine. If you're looking to play it on Linux just don't bother and save your good mood. This s*t is not playable. I write this review while the game stuck in my steam as Running so I'll need to reboot again. 
I hate developers who sells "games for Linux" in such quality. I wonder what would happen if their windows game will fail to run. I'm sick and tired of such attitude from game developers. if you have no idea how to make working Linux port then don't advertise it as a Linux port! If lame wine wrapper with issues is the only option you have then don't bother!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009127959', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1595613379}
review: Extremely good game. It requires a lot of skill, You don't level up, You can get different gear and all that but basically You have to be really agile, know how to dodge and be precise. The only flaw in this game is that there aren't any real saves or checkpoints, basically the game saves automatically every mission, if You die during the mission ( no matter how far close You've come to finish the mission ) You start the mission all over again instead of coming back to a previous checkpoint because there isn't any.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360860426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1688700835}
review:
Enclave is a great game if you like hack n' slash medieval games and can handle older graphics and occasionally wonky combat.

The gameplay is overall very fun and satisfying.  Sniping with the huntress / assassin was very fun.  Unfortunately the melee attacks seem to miss more than they should, especially if your character is tall.  I'd recommend mostly ranged or mage characters if you want to have the best time.  Halfing or Goblin Warrior can be super fun though with a good axe and well timed attacks.

The game offers some exploration element in the form of finding gold hidden throughout the levels.  The gold can be used to unlock better gear.  One thing I appreciate is that you get full price back for selling old items and consumables give you the listed amount at the start of levels.  This means that there is essentially no grinding!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013066581', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1502285994}
review:
It would be a pretty decent game in 2003. However, it's not that enjoyable today with that kind of graphics, UI, voice acting and especially combat. They're just bad. Otherwise, if you want a nostalgia rush then feel free to try it out.

[h1]4.5/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063592473', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1502477494}
review:
OMG!!! This old game is amazing!!! How is this possible?? The graphics sucks, the UI sucks, clunky animations, but the game is so good. It is really like a Dungeons & Dragons adventure! A lot of elements like dark souls (traps, bombs, ambushes, etc).

The game design is by missions that in each one of them you can choose a different class to play that you unlock as you go foward. The combat is simple, but it has depth, the story is nice, the music is good, and the game gives you feedback about what you suppose to do, so even if you are stuck you know your objective.

Where the hell is Enclave 2, 3??? I'm so sad now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122163777', 'num_games_owned': 1846, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1502230257}
review:
This game shows its age, to be sure, and definitely is missing many options that players have come to expect from the action RPG games of today.  And yet there is still a degree of charm in these older games which were trying out new concepts in the birth of the action RPG genre.  Instead of mashing complex button combos, the meat of combat is in moving your character to optimize hitting your foe while dodging and blocking incoming attacks.  The layout of terrain can hinder or help in your endeavor, so positioning yourself is key in making your attacks count.

For an older game it runs fairly smoothly, although it does have some graphical flashing and your characters can get stuck on terrain at times.  Still, each mission is designed nicely, offering a variety of objectives throughout the game, and each level has its own secrets to find in order to collect all the gold in the game.  Missions are also replayable so that you can go back and get the gold you missed in previous playthroughs.

Instead of leveling up your character with stats and gear, there are a handful of different characters to unlock as you progress through the story who each have their own weapons to use.  Weapons do get traded up for better versions of themselves, but there are not many upgrades throughout the whole game.  This game relies more on your ability to hit and dodge than on progressivley making your character more powerful.

I find this game a bit of a refreshing break from all of the stat driven action RPG's out there today.  No skill trees.  No abilities to tweak.  It's just simple, hack-and-slash fun.  It has its own difficulties with aiming and hitting enemies, but learning to master those difficulties is where the skill in the game lies.  It's not a traditional action RPG in today's standards, but it is a fun game in its own unique way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090172103', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1501983721}
review:
Combat in this game (especially melee) is terrible. It's like 2 people who can't dance trying to do the samba, going in circles trying to hit each other, except you will get the worst of it, since the CPU always seems to hit you first and takes a huge chunk of your energy bar. And what's the point in all the cool different looking weapons if they all behave the same way except for range somewhat?

Then there's the awful checkpoint system. It actually takes gold from you for using it!

Trying to get all the gold for the unlocks because if not you will finish this game in a few hours?
Let's say you got all of the gold except one bag and you die because of some cheap death towards the end of the stage.
You would like to think that you start at the middle point of the stage and you only have to get the bag you missed right? Nope. Even if you finish the stage with the 240/250 of the gold left you have to repeat the whole stage and get all the gold for it to count as 100% complete 250/250 for that particular stage. So expect to replay some of them a whole lot. Unnecessary frustration.

There are better games of this type out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073475448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1501443409}
review: This is one of my favorite RPG adverture games and it's aged really well. The characters, levels and enemies are really dynamic. The enemy AI was ahead of its time and still better than some new games. The game gets hung up from time to time, but typically pressing alt tab and then back will fix it. I just beat the light missions 100% on medium and I'm going for the dark missions next. Definitely got a ton of enjoyment out of this game considering it's only 5 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119873711', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1590128197}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988367888', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1501078565}
review:
Enclave is an action adventure were you play an adventurer who slowly increases his numbers to accomplish a quest he was given to.

While i really liked it to gather more people, money and weapons to play in different playstyles, most of the time there is only one or two definitive choices to pick due to the combat system.

The combat system is broken. It would have been nice if it wouldnt be so broken. Most of the time enemies are smaller than you, basically goblins or orks. The swing animations are so stupid, you literally always make a swing above the head of the enemies . You will always swing above goblins as a knight or any similliar tall adventurer. My choice was to only play the halfling because he is atleast small enough to hit the goblins faster. Also you cant really choose what kind of swing to take, so you do a 3x combo to get the overhead strike to kill a goblin or you just use the crossbow in the first levels of the game until you got the halfling.

I really liked the soundtrack tough, especially the main theme is really good.

Story is a confusing mess , many plotholes and pseudo fantasy cliche stuff. The idea with the enclave is okay, but much of the story bits that are explained to you arent enough, Later on people mention things you have no idea about.

Game runs very unstable i had tons of crashes.

You can either play the bad or the good side, the bad side has no real explained reason to attack the enclave except get the magic of the land? Despite on the other side of the sea , there is a huge land which still has magic. And whats this magic of the land about? They just tell you that the baddies want the magic of the land, despite being able to have tons of sorcerers and teleportation magic going on in the bad side.

Cant really recommend this game, while i liked the idea to slowly gather more adventurers, playing either bad or good side, the mess of a story, broken combat and crashes made me the game a pain to play trough. There is no reason to play it whatsoever so stay away.

3/10 Bad game

author: {'steamid': '76561198231899636', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1556316343}
review:
[h1]Enclave Review[/h1]

Enclave hat einen gewissen Spielspa√ü. Au√üerdem eignet sich dieses Spiel auch sehr f√ºr schlechtere Notebooks/Computer, da das Spiel relativ alt ist und die Grafik dementsprechend nicht so gut. In dem Spiel kommt ihr in einzelne Level, in denen ihr Gegner besiegen sollt. Allerdings finde ich die Story nicht so interessant. Aber die Steuerung ist gut. Einen Multiplayer-Modus hat Enclave auch nicht!

author: {'steamid': '76561198188184794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1499637482}
review:
This is an underrated gem. The controls are fixed (compared to the Xbox version), and that improves the game overall, leaving intact the excellent level design, physics, graphics, and gameplay that already grace the PC version. This game is quite old, and yes, it crashes sometimes (Actually now seems fixed by removing v sync) frame rate is embarassing same is the camera angle, but still I think the game itself is quite enjoyable: Many characters to play with, many weapons, 2 different campaigns. 
The graphics are not that bad for a game of more than 10 years ago, and some effects and plot twists are almost surprising. 
It has even the right level of difficulty. In particular, it is damn hard to find all the coins in all levels, but doing so is unsuitable and annoying 'cause of backtracking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008303595', 'num_games_owned': 893, 'num_reviews': 554, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1472783493}
review: I think it is an atrocity that there is absolutely no multiplayer, and the lack of save points make the game utterly unbearable at some points. In anycase, if you're looking for a decent RPG that delivers an above average experience, Enclave should fit the bill quite well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052728410', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1499071994}
review:
I had moments of fun with this game, but it's probably the most generic hack and slash game I've ever played in my life.
The story's a joke, so the gameplay's all it's got going for it.

If you're simply going to beeline through the game, I'm sure you'll have a great time, but should you decide you want to collect all the gold for the sake of completion you'll quickly tire of this game's overly simplistic mechanics and annoying difficulty.

For the record, I'm sure someone would enjoy this, but I personally wouldn't.

DISCLOSURE: recieved for free via a third-party promotion

author: {'steamid': '76561197994506042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1499053089}
review:
I like to think that I am by no means a pushover when it comes to difficult video games. I like a challenging game every now and then. There's nothing wrong with a game being hard on the player, so long as the player feels like it is a challenge that can be surmounted. To overcome a situation under difficult circumstances lends itself to a very unique kind of satisfaction. Same is true with video games. Now, as much as I hate to bring it up, Dark Souls is a good example of this. It's hard, punishing even. But even at its worst, Dark Souls is a game that still remembers how to be fair to the player. It's hard, but not superhuman hard.

On to the actual game proper. Enclave is a action RPG game released in 2002. It graduated from the Quake/Painkiller school of design with flying colors. Textures are dark and muddy, with very few areas being exceptions to this design. Get ready for browns and reds, because this game is jam packed full of it. I'd almost describe this setting as heavily gothic, but that doesn't really come close to the level of blackness one would encounter during a session of play. The darkest sludge of Dark Souls wishes it could be this broody and depressing. 

The visuals pull the bulk of the weight for establishing the setting of the game; because the exposition itself sure doesn't. Within the first few minutes of the intro, someone's already throwing around fantasy names while reading me a story book. Slow down! I haven't had time to visualize Gargoth Urbus and his magical staff of Bablethall; much less what's actually going on, and where its going on. So, someone's sieging the castle, and its up to you to repel the invaders of Jabandaistall, lest they claim the aforementioned staff of Febinghast.

So, like a typical Bethesda RPG prisoner, you're forced to fight the invaders alongside your would be prison wardens... All two of them. Starting off in Enclave, you'll need to familiarize yourself with the controls. To wage war, you must click the mouse button. To drink the healing water, you must press button. And that's all you really need to know. It's pretty simple, and for 2002 I wouldn't expect much else.

Let's talk about what I like. The game feels like an adventure. You build up a band of misfits throughout your travels, and most of the time, you have the option to find and help party members mid mission, effectively adding to your roster in a meaningful way. There's also unlimited lives in this game, provided you find a checkpoint before you die, and you have 10 gold. I'm in love with the finer points of this game. It makes it feel as though this game is more arcade-like. You're always incentivized to keep looking for hidden gold to build up your treasury and stock up on extra lives if you need them. By the end of the campaign, decking my heroes out in heavy armor and enchanted weapons felt pretty gratifying for me.

However, there's a darker side to this game. It's... woefully unbalanced, unfortunately. Some mobs do ridiculous amounts of damage, even with heavy armor equipped. I played on medium, and I struggled through some pretty odd difficulty spikes. One level, I'd be mopping the floor with 50+ Orc raiders no sweat. The next, I'd be struggling to fight assassins who were dealing my entire health bar in headshot damage. I still clung to the vain hope that it might ease up, but it never really does. The last 3rd of the game is brutal. The enemies keep getting beefier and beefier, adding multishot abilities, enchanted weapons of their own, and even poisoning effects to their arsenal. It's just too much to handle.

Even the checkpoint system I praised earlier ended up giving me grief. You see, you can only respawn if you activate a checkpoint. Some levels don't have checkpoints. Other levels have their first checkpoint a good deal into the level, forcing you to conserve your health like crazy to make it through the onslaught. If you die before reaching a checkpoint, you need to restart from the beginning, no matter how much gold you amass. That, combined with no manual save option is just plain garbage in my opinion. 

On the whole, the level design is good, with traps and physics objects being utilized. Health potion coverage is sufficient; but at the end of the day, it just feels like enemies were dropped into the levels by the dozen. It really is you VS. the world on every map. Either you're fighting droves of orcs and goblins, or you're the one fighting hordes of heroes. It gets tedious. Almost no assistance is provided for the player, even when you're on a quest to save the world. It seems like your only ally throughout all of this is just the health potions you can manage to scrounge up. Something like adding additional ai allies to the maps would've helped tip the scales just enough to put it back in very difficult territory; but alas it was not meant to be, and I broke down on the last two levels of the light campaign and enabled god mode. Shortly after, I lost interest in attempting to complete the second campaign, dark.

This game has some very interesting things going for it. It just suffers from a lot of strange balancing choices that just snowball after awhile. I can deal with fighting assassins with disgusting range and impeccable accuracy, but when they're coupled with tanky orcs, and liches with poison death spells, AND I'm assaulting Targashama the Terrible's castle by myself; that's when I throw in the towel. It's not a bad game per se, it's just punishing as all hell. Some hardcore action RPG aficionados might like it; but for my tastes, I'd liken this to Beyond Darksouls: the special fantasy hidden path, prepare to get your healthbar forcibly torn asunder edition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349677633', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1499008497}
review:
I absolutely recommend this game for oldschool medieval fantasy fans:

I used to play this game when I was 11 years old. I played it at least 100 hours back then.

I'm surprised to see how good this game still is:

Graphics are dated, but not some puked textures or anything it does create the atmosphere. 

Combat system is actually amazing, it takes some time to master but not much, for example to hit the opponent on top of the head with hammer or mace you need to go backwards and trigger the hit before moving forwards to actually hit the enemy. It might seem like brainless hack and slash but it is only if you play same level for too many times using exactly same class. Having no shield allows faster weapon switching. As well as for example triggering hit to the left and then going the same direction to which hitting while catching an opponent coming against the hit maximizes damage, ofcourse for combat without a shield its better to choose faster moving class then knight. 

However animations might not fit with actual damage, but once you understand combat system that doesnt really bother you anymore, because you rarely miss, the thing of being unable to hit close moving targets with ranged weapons is very realistic, even if animation shows that arrow supposed to hit the target, it's nearly as hard to shoot in close range as in real combat as well as daggers has best accuracy in close range, which is quite realistic, you cant really swing some weapons effectively in very close range.

Read the item descriptions some clearly says that weapon is awkward to swing in close, due long spike or something, but if you start swing from far and go close to target while swinging it's no longer awkward.

9.5/10 as for game released in 2003 I would love improved and new enclave, probably would be something as dark as dark souls, just easier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048867601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1456362160}

Tem uma varia√ß√£o legal de personagens, mas basicamente s√£o todos a mesma coisa, o que mudar na forma de jogar vai depende do jogador e das esclhas de equipamento antes de iniciar as fases.
Em certos momentos do jogo d√° pra passar muita raiva, principalmente quem quer pegar todos os itens, porque alguns est√£o na beira de precip√≠cios e como a movimenta√ß√£o no jogo n√£o √© 100%, as chances de voc√™ cair s√£o grandes.

Anyway, pra jogadores casuais que est√£o procurando um game relativamente antigo mas divertido, Enclave √© um bom t√≠tulo.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198273224687', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1451759214}
review: What an interesting game. I feel like it's a cross between Fable and Rune: Classic. It serves an interesting class system, though limited. However this does mean you can replay the game several ways. Also there's the Good and Bad story, which adds even more customisation for how you want to play. I really enjoyed this, and highly recommend it for RPG players looking for something straightforward, but good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128607641', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1514760892}
review:
I find this game quite enjoyable, despite the dated graphics.
I had never played this game before until my grandmother bought it for me on steam so here's what I think of it so far.
Pros:
-I think the bird screens are quite cool. Kind of reminds me of Oddworld in a sense.
-The combat is really easy to get the hang of.
-It can be pretty challenging, at times.
-It is a Medieval kind of Hack n Slash. 
Cons:
-The dated graphics.
-The gold system in this game. Just not really a fan of it.
-Same goes with the store system.
-Escort mission.

Rating: 7/10
It is fun but I wouldn't pay more than a dollar for this. I recommend it if you like games that give you a sense of nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033623422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1497624023}
review:
The game is okay. It feels like an arcadey hack and slash game.

The levels are quite short but difficult.

Melee combat is a bit 'floaty'. Its difficult to tell if you are in range of hitting stuff. Just swing like crazy and move in close when you are swining and away when they are swinging. Blocking is for the weak. Ranged combat is awful. Headshots are really effective but most enemies constantly move around like they are on crack so its very difficult to hit them at all. RIP ranger class.

You get a steady progression of unlocks and upgrades but its hard to tell if it makes any difference as the enemies you face are always different.

Its not a bad game for its age but I wouldn't recommend it today,  there are much better things to do with your time than play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991657927', 'num_games_owned': 1410, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1499829672}
review: Enclave isn't a BAD game by any means. It's a 3rd person hack n slash with minor rpg elements. The storyline seems well formed if uninventive. The problem is that it hasn't aged all that well and the graphics and controls are chunky and clunky respectively. If you pick it up cheaply or in some bundle then it may be worth a few hours of your time but otherwise, unless you are one of those that enjoy the retro feeling or have some nostalgia for this particular game, I would suggest it is past its sell-by date even at its low full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010707755', 'num_games_owned': 1081, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1497314895}
review:
Highly recommended for mindless hack and slash fun. 
I played this on the original Xbox and couldn't believe my eyes when I saw this on Steam. I really enjoy how your load-out progresses with the money you can potentially collect in each stage. It offers a bit of replay value to the stages if you want to get some extra gold and there are even bonus stages to help you out as well. I also enjoy how characters are unlocked as you save them from some situation through the story missions. The combat is a frantic flailing about which I actually enjoyed. It's less strategy and more button mashing, which is sometimes a great relief if you're in the mood for something that's simple and fun to play. I was also impressed that I could play this in 1080 resolution. For a game that's over 15 years old, that's an impressive addition that many older games don't offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115086953', 'num_games_owned': 1375, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1496396091}
review:
Enclave is a classic fantasy combat game. It offers various unlockable classes, challenges, unlockable gear, good/evil stories, and simple combat. 
The story is a typical classic fantasy story of good versus evil, you will collect gold to help build your character, and once unlocked can use any character of that alignment at your strategic disposal (you cannot switch while in a level however),  Be warned as the difficulty curve can be extreme and inconsistant.  You might fly through a level, or find yourself being punished over and over again until something happens to work, but it is not game ruining.  Once you beath the Light story, you can then move onto the dark story as a loyal minion to the mighty Mordessa and Lord Vatarr.  Though with two different alignments, you will run into very similar character types (archer = assassin for example).
Recap:
+Classic good/evil story
+Simple enough combat
+Enjoyable gameplay and diverse classes
+Challenging
-It can become very difficult very certain moments, as well as dependent on your class
-Story can be boring to some
-Mouse and Keyboard only (unless you find some way through a third party program perhaps)

I still recommend this classic game and have no real bugs or technical problems to report.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975685495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1496290193}
review:
The combat in the game is simple but understandable, and the graphics and presentation make for a nice unique medieval style action game.

My main complaint is that at many points in the game the difficulty level doesn't feel right, and you're put through some punishing sequences that can often feel unfair, leaving you replaying sometimes entire levels.

I really like this game though, and the weapons you get in the later levels can be a lot of fun to use. The controls are a bit touchy, but they're at least sharp.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043435298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1494177486}
review:
Enclave is a simple and somewhat short action Rpg

Pros:
-Graphics may be dated but are still pretty good
-Gameplay and controlls are really simple and easy to use
-Option to play in third person or first person
-Two campaigns to pick from (Light or Dark)
-Options to get upgrades for weapons and armour
-Decent amount of classes
- Sound and music are well done

Cons:
-Skipping cutscenes would cause a minor bug where you can't move your character for about 2-3 seconds

-At the end of completing the game after the end cut scene the game would bug and stay on a black screen (tabing out and backing in would fix this and return to the menu)

- Story is pretty good but could have been made clearer, Hardly any real dialogue spoken from the selected classes and very few cut scenes explaining what is happening. All you get is a bit of small text from the start of each level.

-The classes could have spoken more, not much is spoken.

Overall I feel this game is really good for the time it came out, it is not too long so you don't have to invest 100's of hours either, like other action rpg's. Just wish there could have been more cutscenes with the heroes/villians to help their deveolpment of character as well as them having more to say. Overall great little Action RPG and must have looked amazing the time this came out.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198215404089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1565468647}
review:
Nie gab es mehr M√∂glichkeiten, B√∂sewichte mit den Lichtgl√§ubigen und Lichtgl√§ubige mit den B√∂sewichten zu kloppen!

Enclave ist zwar alt und eher ein Nischentitel, aber es macht immer noch einen Heidenspa√ü! Die Story erscheint zun√§chst genretypisch einfach, aber einige Anmerkungen w√§hrend des Spieles lassen darauf schlie√üen, dass sich hier doch jemand Gedanken gemacht hat. Und davon abgesehen, gibt es die M√∂glichkeit die Geschichte auch von der "dunklen Seite" zu spielen  - und entsprechend zu ver√§ndern.

Die M√∂glichkeiten sind dabei, wie eingangs erw√§hnt, vielf√§ltig:

In der Kampagne des Lichtes stehen neben dem Ritter, der J√§gerin und der Druidin als das ultimative Fantasy-Dreigestirn Krieger, Sch√ºtze und Magier auch noch ein Ingenieur (Zwerg?), der als Bombenbastler fungiert, ein Zauberer (der √§hnliche und andere St√§be als die Druidin verwenden kann und umgekehrt), ein burischkoser und ziemlich peppiger Halbling (echt flink unterwegs und √Ñxte schwingend) und auch noch ein Erdelementar zur Verf√ºgung. Dies sorgt f√ºr verschiedene, immer wieder neue taktische Spielweisen und erh√∂ht den Wiederspielwert.

Die Kampagne der Finsternis wartet da mit √§hnlichen, aber deutlich ... sagen wir, h√§sslicheren Charakteren auf: Assassine, Goblin, Bombardier, Zauberin, Berserker und Lich, die den Licht-Klassen nachempfunden, aber dennoch mit einzigartigen Gegenst√§nden versehen sind.

W√§hrend der Missionen wird Gold gesammelt, mit dessen Hilfe man die Ausr√ºstung verbessern kann. Beginnt man also zun√§chst mit dem rostigen Zahnstocher-Schwertchen, endet man irgendwann mit wahlweise einer magischen Eis- oder Flammenklinge und einem magischen Schild sowie einer maximal ausgebauten Panzerr√ºstung. Einzelnen Klassen stehen dabei auch bestimmte Waffen zu, zum Beispiel kann nur die Druidin den der Natur geweihten Astralstab benutzen und nur ein Lich einen sensenf√∂rmigen Schattenstab.
Auch die Fernk√§mpfer sind mit gew√∂hnlichen, Feuer-, Gift-, Bomben- und Distanzpfeilen bestens ger√ºstet, sp√§ter gibt es sogar magische Pfeile und entsprechend auch Bolzen f√ºr die Kategorie Armbrust. Wichtig hierbei: Auch die klassichen Nahk√§mpfer k√∂nnen Armbr√ºste verwenden, allerdings mit Einschr√§nkungen. Fernk√§mpfer wie Bogensch√ºtzen und Zauberer dagegen werden mit Dolchen ausgestattet.

Ist man findig, kann man auch bestimmte Karten entdecken, die die Chance auf "Mini-Spiele" der Art: t√∂te Finsterlinge in einer Arena, beh√ºte eine Burg, indem du mit einer Kanone Goblins zur H√∂lle bombst usw. liefern. Hierbei gilt es auch wieder, ordentlich Klimpergeld zu sammeln, um die Ausr√ºstung zu verbessern.  Das Gold bzw. die Edelsteine sind manchmal versteckt und verlangen ein offenes, wenn auch nicht gerade ein Adlerauge.

Die Kampagne der Finsternis wird erst nach Beendigung der Kampagne des Lichtes freigeschaltet. Zwar tauchen in ersterer einige bekannte Schaupl√§tze wieder auf, allerdings mit deutlich anderen Missionszielen und ja, auch die Goodies sind hier nicht immer an den selben Ecken platziert.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist durchaus nicht unfair, aber fordernd. Draufkloppen macht zwar Spa√ü, endet aber vor allem f√ºr Fernk√§mpfer und Blinde (Welcher Assassine legt 8 (!) Pfeile auf die Bogensehne und jagt sie mir alle mit einem Schuss in den Leib?!) schnell mit dem Tod. Gespeichert werden kann hierbei nur √ºber Speicherpunkte, von denen es maximal drei pro Level gibt. Euer Fortschritt bleibt hierbei, aber ihr m√ºsst wieder von der Speicherplattform aus starten. Zur√ºcklaufen kann da schon nervig sein, gerade weil die Gegner nicht respawnen und der Weg dadurch echt √∂de ist.

Cutscenes und Vertonung erz√§hlen die recht einfache Geschichte sehr gut, hierbei ein Lob an die deutsche Sprachausgabe (ausgenommen die Prinzessin ... ihre Stimme klingt wie Kratzen auf einer Schiefertafel). Diese ist - was ja selten genug passiert bei deutschen Synchronisationen - wahnsinnig gut ausgefallen.

Mein Fazit zu Enclave: Sollte man mal gespielt haben, wenn man Hybriden aus RPG, Hack&Slay und "Ich will ein neues Schwert haben!" mag. Die Spielzeit ist kurzweilig, gerade wenn man es zum gef√ºhlt hunderdsten Mal spielt, aber ich kann tr√∂stend sagen, dass ich trotzdem immer noch dann und wann sterbe. Weil ich mich f√ºr den krassesten Helden der Welt halte mit meinen tollen Schwertschwing-Animationen. Na ja ... acht Pfeile holten mich zur√ºck auf den Boden der Tatsachen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995329323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1454450328}
review:
[h1]Liebevoll gestaltetes Rollenspiel[/h1]

[i]Enclave[/i] habe ich von vielen Jahren einmal auf einer CD aus einer Videospiel-Zeitschrift gefunden, gespielt und geliebt. Leider ging die CD irgendwann verloren, weshalb ich mir das Spiel hier noch einmal gekauft habe.

Zum Spiel:
Bei [i]Enclave[/i] handelt es sich um ein wundervolles, kleines RPG. Es spielt sich klassisch: Third-Person Perspektive, verschiedene, levelbare Charakt√§re, man kann neue Waffen und R√ºstungen kaufen und k√§mpft wahlweise gegen die Horden des B√∂sen oder die M√§chte des Guten. Soweit so unspektakul√§r.
Die Story ist soweit ganz in Ordnung und schl√ºssig - weder zu fantastisch noch zu n√ºchtern. Das besondere an dem Spiel ist zweierlei: 1. Die wundersch√∂n gestalteten Level. Ich wei√ü, die Grafik ist nicht die aktuellste, aber jeder Level ist mit Liebe zum Detail designed worden und macht einfach Spa√ü zu erkunden. Jedes Gebiet ist einzigartig und fordert den Spieler durch R√§tsel und besondere Gegner heraus. Und 2. Der herrliche Soundtrack. Auch dieser ist wirklich gro√üartig und versetzt den Spieler immer in die passende Stimmung. Ich h√∂re ihn mir tats√§chlich heute noch gerne mal wieder an.
Sowohl die "Kampagne des Lichts", als auch die "Kampagne der Dunkelheit" sind herausfordernd und haben nicht nur die gleichen Level, es sind also zwei komplett andere Erfahrungen. Auch die im Spiel vorkommenden NPCs sind liebevoll gestaltet und vertont worden. Besonders die fiesen, kleinen Goblins mag ich irgendwie besonders gerne. Ich bin ein absoluter Fan des Spiels!

Alles in allem kann ich [i]Enclave[/i] wirklich jedem ans Herz legen, der sich f√ºr ein klassisches RPG begeistern kann und keinen gro√üen Wert auf HD Grafik legt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055813817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1493820269}
review:
Bon jeu sur le papier, que l'on pourrait qualifi√© de pr√©-Dark Souls...grossi√®rement, hein ! 
Le jeu, sortit en 2002, accuse d'une certaine anciennet√© et donc ne peut que rebuter. Mais tout n'est pas mauvais dans ce jeu, loin de l√†. 
Les graphismes, bien que d√©pass√©s, offrent tout de m√™me des textures d'une qualit√©s √©tonnantes pour l'√©poque, le tout baignant dans une esth√©tique Dark Fantasy vraiment prenante. Le gameplay ressemble √† un m√©lange entre celui d'un Dark Souls et d'un Gothic, le tout simplifi√© vu qu'il les pr√©c√©dait. Le point fort de ce jeu est √©videmment son background fouill√© qui donne envie de continuer l'histoire qui reste assez simple √† premi√®re vu. 
Petit point noir bien √©trange (je ne sais pas si √ßa vous le fait) les animations du personnage principal ne s'affiche pas correctement, ce qui me plonge, parfois, dans la confusion en plein combat. 
Et le gros point noir du jeu, celui qui me force √† ne pas le recommander malgr√© ses bonnes qualit√©s est : Les sauts du personnage...oui c'est con ! Mais dans ce jeu, le personnage doit effectu√© certains saut pour passer des obstacles ou des trous. Les passer ne rel√®ve pas du miracle sauf si votre personnage choisi o√π et quand faire des sauts normaux ! Parfois le personnage fait un petit saut tout mignon, puis d'autres fois il vous fait un bon √† la Mario. Au final, quand j'√©tais poursuivi par des ennemis et que je devais filer en sautant au dessus d'un trou...j'avais beau prier, mon personnage me faisait un saut ridicule qui me menait tout droit au d√©but du niveau. 

Donc oui, un bon jeu sur le papier avec un visuel r√©ussi et une √©criture int√©ressante, le tout g√¢ch√© par des sauts techniquement √† la ramasse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082490286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1492960776}
review:
this was one of the games that i was blown away by a demo back in the day, but never really got around to play it. recently saw it on sale, and just jumped at the opportunity.... and boy i'm glad i did. before buying the game read some reviews which complains about the game crashes and some sort of adware... but for me game only crashed once, and i can clearly tell that there is no adware ( as far as i understand it was removed by the publishers after the complaints).

back to the game, enclave  certainly is somewhat dated, old school fantasy action game with ver limited rpg elements. the graphics were a joy to behold back in the day and still they hold up pretty well. the gameplay though is not that impressive. hit detection as mentioned by many is just utter crap. especially with melee weapons whole thing becomes a big clunky mashing game. there is a parry mechanic but i was never able got around to it. and this hit detection thing makes game really difficult. so what we have is not a challenging game because of it's design but rather because of the bad mechanics which is the worst kind of challenge. my advice is to use ranged characters in medium and hard difficulties and melee character in easy difficulty.


at the end of the day, i liked the game, and i will recommend it if it's on sale, because what you have is a game with two campaigns, cheesy yet ambitiously told story, bunch of characters and weapons/shields and stuff, definitely a fine ride even with the terrible hit detection issue which is a small problem that you can overcome with ranged units. other than that if you can find it on sale and you are a fan of fantasy, swords and sorcery sort of stuff and love action games definitely worth a buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992143146', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1492470369}
review:
If you're looking for a nostalgic romp, this game will work for you.
I find the loosey goosey hit detection rather frustrating.  And as a core mechanic, it drives me away from the game.
This title pales in comparison when compared to other similar titles from the era.
Skip this game and grab Rune Classic for a similar game with tighter and more nuanced combat.  Fable is another game from this era that puts Enclave to shame on every level.

This game was pretty meh. 3/10 by today's standards.  6/10 by 2003 standards.

review:
EIn etwas √§lteres RPG, das zugegeben vollkommen klanglos an mir vorbei gezogen ist. H√§tte ich es nicht kostenlos bekommen, h√§tte ich es warscheinlich nie bemerkt.
Dennoch: das Spiel ist relativ gut. Ich mag das sehr einfach gehaltene Gameplay. Besonders Titel mit so schlichten Equip-Systemen, wie hier finde ich immer wieder erstaunlich. Man hat nicht viel Auswahl, aber die Auswahl, die man hat reicht auch! Getreu dem Motto, warum 3 Sorten Butter kaufen, wenn nur eine schmeckt?
Es gibt verschiedene Klassen, die allesamt zwar unterschiedlich sind, was Tempo, Schaden und einige Skills angeht, √§hnelt sich dennoch teilweise stark - aber ok.
Die Kampagne ist in wenigen Stunden durch, aber danach wartet eine √úberraschung, f√ºr die sich das weiterspielen lohnt.

Insgesamt gut spielbarer Titel, der auch grafisch verh√§ltnism√§√üig gut ist.

Preisempfehlung: 3‚Ç¨

Un juego que pese a su argumento e historia engancha al tener por cada cierto niveles nuevos personajes a usar, buenos gr√°ficos y ambientaci√≥n sonora para el 2002,  al jugar cada vez es mas dif√≠cil sortear las etapas lo que nos dar√° un buen desaf√≠o, personajes y animaciones bien logradas es un juego para el quiera acci√≥n por unas cuantas horas quedara bastante satisfecho y ning√∫n problema ejecut√°ndolo bajo Win7 usando la gu√≠a del foro steam de la pagina, nunca lo hab√≠a jugado a pesar de esos a√±os y me gusto, si se recomienda.

Nota: 7/10
