author: {'steamid': '76561198021291033', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1626569615}
review:
Absolutely amazing and FANTASTIC game!
One of my all time favourites from my childhood.

This game is definitely a must get!

You play as both sides in the end, the humans and I think they're orcs? or whatever.
The game can be very difficult, level/instance based levels, plenty of monsters, challenges and so forth.

The combat system is very good, blocking is definitely needed if you're to survive on the harder levels and difficulties.

Many secrets across the levels (I had to use a guide to find them all!)

You get gold if my memory serves me correct, then you can get better weapons, shields, bows, arrows, etc....

Do I recommend this game?

HELL YEAH!

author: {'steamid': '76561198110334770', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1634306259}
review:
This game is one of those that has aged pretty badly, but it has a frustrated swedish goblin, so my nostalgia-glasses are gold-rimmed for it.

In all seriousness though, it is a pretty janky and mediocre game by modern standards, and as others have highlighted, it has some gamebreakers which require a restart of the level. But I will honestly say it is an enjoyable game once you get into it. If nothing else, it's more player-friendly than TES: oblivion.

And it costs the same as a box of mediocre chocolate, but lasts at least twice as long. What's not to like?

author: {'steamid': '76561198149729328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1510760987}
review:
[h1]Ein Klassiker mit immensem Nostalgie-Faktor![/h1]
Ich habe das Spiel schon vor etlicher Zeit bei einer guten Freundin gespielt, als ich Steam noch nicht kannte und es war episch! Zumindest f√ºr die damalige Technik. Deshalb werde ich wohl auch einfach der Nostalgie wegen ein bisschen positiver bewerten, ich bitte daf√ºr um Verst√§ndnis. :)

Enclave ist ein klasse Spiel, welches Abwechslung und unterhaltsame Szenarien bietet. Es ist einfach nur grandios zu spielen und dar√ºberhinaus sehr unterhaltsam. Die Story ist aufschlussreich und die Kampfmechaniken waren zumindest damals eine Sensation ^^.

Ich verstehe daher nicht, wieso es nicht 100% positive Empfehlungen hat? :P

Es ist gro√üartig und einzigartig und wie bereits gesagt, war es f√ºr die damalige Zeit das beste Spiel welches ich je gespielt habe :3

Kauft es und wenn ich denselben Geschmack wie ich habt, dann werdet ihr das Spiel m√∂gen. Man muss sich nur darauf einlassen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085466689', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1488286209}
review:
I'll try to be as fair as possible with this game. I've played both campaigns on difficult setting with 100% gold, though I had sometimes the urge to just quit the game. First of all, the game looks neat, especially by 2002 standards, the basics of gameplay are pretty easy to learn, the AI is ok and the soundtrack is really atmospheric. So much for the positive aspects of the game.
The story is rather lame, run-of-the-mill fantasy with some steampunk elements. But the cutscenes and the presentation of the story make up a little for the weak story. 
The biggest problem with the game are the messed up hitboxes. And that's a big issue in a hack 'n slash game. Arrows going right through enemies, melee fighters can't hit enemies on stairways if they are below them and missiles going right through massive obstacles. That seems to be intended for magic missiles, but I have noticed some examples where enemy bowmen attacked me through a solid wall while I couldn't hit them, which is pretty frustrating. Also, the 1st person view is rather glitchy, especially in narrow spaces.
The balancing is a mess. Sorcerers spam homing missiles at you which drain 1/4 of your life AND do damage over time while most melee fighters are push overs. Since the overall difficulty isn't very high (except for level 13 in the light campaign, that one was really tough), you can rush through most of the levels. You can beat this game with difficult setting and a 100% score in less than 15 hours.
I've never even read a single word about bugs referring to this game, but it has its fair share of them. Enemies dropping of cliffs who were supposed to drop gold => 100% no achievable. Traps not triggering. Even important NPCs tend to get stuck in the environment, so you have to start all over again. To be fair, most of the levels are pretty short (sometimes even ridiculously tiny), so that's not a big problem. 
In summary this game could have used a lot of testing, it feels a little unfinished in some places. But for 5 ‚Ç¨ you can't go wrong, and as a hack n slash fan you should definitely try this one out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996124728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1488098427}
review:
I was in the mood for a little early 2000s hack-and-slash. Saw enclave and thought 'why not' ?

Well? Its a mediocre game, but for about 10 minutes it seemed mildly amusing. Then i got to a part in section II where you kill an orc where there is a broken ladder. After killing the orc, I was trapped in a snall room! After about 10 minutes of frustration: I looked online. Apparently the orc is supposed to drop a key. Well? No key.

That means: the game is literally broken. Don't buy it.

review: This is a mildly amusing game which originally came out in 2002. By 2017 standards, the graphics are chintzy & the gameplay is functional but no good by the standards of this point in time. Graphically it is about as good as James Bond Goldeneye 007 for the Nintendo 64, which was fun when I played it as a 15-year-old caddy at Rolling Greens Golf Course. That was a long time ago! After 15 minutes, I'm still trapped in the castle which is the starting point of the game. That means that this game has been uninstalled.

review:
Looks and plays like a trashy PlayStation game from the nineties. If you're looking for that, you found it.

Music and sound are generic fluff. The voice acting is atrocious, and I just couldn't care about the story.

The combat feels like the game isn't done yet. Colliision, animation, and weapon balance are all a mess.

On the plus side, the controls are simple and rebindable, and some of the character designs are cute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027872398', 'num_games_owned': 1350, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1487000167}
review:
I have a strange suspision that Enclave might not be a very good game. On the other hand, I enjoyed this third person hack 'n' slash enough to finish both of its campaigns (the Light one and the Dark), so maybe it's not all that bad either.

I wish I knew what the story in this game was about, but it was delivered in the most boring way, so my mind began to wander everytime I was exposed to it, making me unable to take notice. Basically, what you get is something that I like to call "a talking book" - cutscenes showing nothing but an old looking book with a voiceover put on top of it. I guess, all you really need to know is that the good guys fight the bad guys, right? What really matters, is the gameplay...

...And the gameplay is quite engaging. You play through different levels unlocking new characters that you can choose between at the beginning of each stage. All the playable characters are essentially split between three classes - a fighter for melee combat (sword, axe, hammer + shield), a ranger for ranged combat (bow, crossbow + different types of ammo) and a mage for... ranged combat also, but with MAGIC (various staves that shoot magic missiles). As you go along, you are also provided with better equipement, that you can chose from based on the collective amount of gold you aquired on your adventures. Good stuff.

Graphics are quite nice too. Must have been really nice when the game came out. Not much else to say. Overall, I had fun with Enclave. Might recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088108561', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1489452273}
review:
This game has problems.

It has very clearly just been straight ported to PC from its original Xbox none; game speed seems to be tied to CPU clock speed, controls are wonky. Melee combat is fucking pointless and mages are hilariously OP as long as you can manage your mana.

You don't typically level so much as each stage you complete has gold hidden in it, as well as a set reward at the end of each stage. You get that gold, and can use it on items at the start of missions. You don't buy it permanently, just for that character for that mission, although you keep the gold if that makes sense. This rewards exploration, which isn't bad. What is bad is that it's typically hidden in the most ridiculous places, sometimes involving parkour, and if you die on anything but easy after you've hit a checkpoint, you start the level over.

That being said, I got it for $0.99, so it was worth it at that price. The voice acting and story isn't bad. Recommended at a buck, but certainly not worth $5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984914446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1497645879}
review:
I love Enclave. It's a dumb hack 'n' slash but with a great soundtrack and atmosphere. Though the character models don't hold up well (they weren't great for the time) the environments are amazing. It's a button masher with simple upgrades. There's light exploration but you can't get lost. The story is pretty generic action fantasy stuff. There isn't much else to say about Enclave. It's cheap and well worth it if you dig this kind of run around and kill everything sort of thing. You either "get" this game or you don't. 

Also, it runs on Linux using a Wine wrapper. Other than a brightness glitch when changing video settings, that disappered once I restarted the game, it runs great on Elementary OS (Ubuntu 14.04 LTS).

author: {'steamid': '76561197996758493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1459858738}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044081373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1485837852}
review:
Most of my experience with Enclave has been via the DotEmu and original Xbox releases. So don't let my Steam stats fool you.

Enclave was released at a time when third person action games were really gaining an edge: the 6th generation (early 2000s). What sets Enclave apart is its RPG-like character unlocking, character swapping, upgrades, and back stories. During the 5th generation (PS1/N64/Sega Saturn) we had the likes of Tenchu and Syphon Filter, but nothing quite like Enclave. While the likes of Blood Rayne and Prince of Persia were backed by bigger budgets and better marketing, it was games like Enclave and MDK 2 that injected the third person action genre with this thing called "replay value".

Whether you're a fan of the steam-punk aesthetic or third person action games or just want a fun (and very cheap) boredom killer, Enclave is a worthy addition to your PC gaming library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048532211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1484394560}
review:
this is a great old school game. i used o play it a lot as a kid.
back then the game was very buggy and crashed quite often, but it has been fixed it seems.
if i play the game now it never crashed anymore and runs really smoothly.

the only bad thing about it is that the weaponblows sometimes seem to miss when they should've hit.

the game is even hard on easy mode at several points in the campaigns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076774071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1636, 'last_played': 1483548920}
review:
[b]Enclave[/b] - jest¬†to gra akcji z du≈ºƒÖ domieszkƒÖ RPG, rozgrywka zosta≈Ça tutaj osadzona w ≈õwiecie fantasy nazywanym Celenheim. Gracz wciela siƒô w jednƒÖ z dw√≥ch frakcji (Enclavers lub Outlanders), kt√≥ra to jedna z nich ma uchroniƒá ≈õwiat przed potƒô≈ºnym demonicznym lordem zwanym Vataarem, druga za≈õ pogrƒÖ≈ºyƒá go w chaosie. Zatem ≈õwiat Celenheim zosta≈Ç podzielony na dwie czƒô≈õci i tylko od gracza bƒôdzie zale≈ºeƒá, po kt√≥rej stronie konfliktu siƒô opowie i kto tak naprawdƒô przejmie w nim kontrolƒô.

[b]Silnik graficzny:[/b] Ogier Engine

Za Enclave odpowiedzialno≈õƒá bierze Starbrezze AB. Na swym koncie √≥w deweloper ma r√≥wnie≈º produkty takie jak Knights of the Temple: Infernal Crusade, Kroniki Riddicka, PayDay czy te≈º Dead by Daylight, a nawet nowo≈õƒá nazywanƒÖ BROTHERS: Tale of Two Sons. Jednoznacznie pokazuje to godziwy dorobek owej firmy, je≈ºeli chodzi o umilanie czasu nam graczom. Starbrezze nie mo≈ºna r√≥wnie≈º zarzuciƒá braku wyczucia, jak i do≈õwiadczenia w omawianej bran≈ºy tj. bran≈ºy gier komputerowych, ale i nie tylko, gdy≈º nazywany przeze mnie StarAB ukazuje sw√≥j zasiƒôg wp≈Çyw√≥w wydajƒÖc gry r√≥wnie≈º na platformy takie jak XBOX, PlayStation, iOS czy nawet Android. Enclave podbi≈Ço moje serce ju≈º dawno temu i wielu innych zapewne r√≥wnie≈º, przez swojƒÖ unikalno≈õƒá co oznacza ≈õwiat pe≈Çen magii, potyczek i przer√≥≈ºnych stworze≈Ñ oraz co najwa≈ºniejsze kawa≈Ç dobrej opowie≈õci o dobrze i ≈∫le. Jednym zdaniem Starbrezze odwali≈Ço tutaj kawa≈Ç dobrej roboty co mo≈ºemy zaobserwowaƒá tak≈ºe w przysz≈Çych produkcjach.

[b]Kampania ≈öwiat≈Ça (Enclavers) i Kampania Z≈Ça (Outlanders):[/b]

- 33 misje (w tym 6 misji typu ‚Äûwyzwanie‚Äù, z czego 4 podzielone na trzy etapy trudno≈õci).

- ≈ÇƒÖcznie dla obu kampanii mamy a≈º 16 grywalnych klas postaci (z czego 12 odblokowywanych w trakcie gry. Dodatkowo po jednej klasie do odblokowania po przej≈õciu ka≈ºdej z kampanii i 2 po zdobyciu ca≈Çego z≈Çota w obu kampaniach).

[b]Zbrojownia:[/b]

- bro≈Ñ do walki wrƒôcz (12 typ√≥w mieczy, 10 typ√≥w topor√≥w bojowych, 10 buzdygan√≥w i pa≈Çek bojowych),

- 11 dostƒôpnych w grze tarcz,

- 5 kusz (w tym 3 typy strza≈Ç),

-mikstury leczƒÖce,

- 3 typy pancerza dla ka≈ºdej z klas (lekki pancerz, ≈õredni pancerz i ciƒô≈ºki pancerz),

- 5 typ√≥w ≈Çuk√≥w (w tym 7 typ√≥w strza≈Ç),

- 5 typ√≥w sztylet√≥w,

- 9 typ√≥w magicznych lasek (w tym 3 unikatowe, z czego dwie z nich dostƒôpne sƒÖ dla kampanii dobra za≈õ jedna dla kampanii z≈Ça (jednƒÖ z nich dostajemy w trakcie i na czas trwania pewnej misji za≈õ dwie kolejne (po jednej na frakcjƒô) sƒÖ dostƒôpna dla jednej z 2(4) klas magicznych dla obu frakcji),

- 4 typy pu≈Çapek (bomby i napalm).

[b]Plusy:[/b]

+ grafika, choƒá stara to jednak wciƒÖ≈º daje radƒô,

+ ≈Çadne p≈Çynne animacje (choƒáby te, kt√≥re widzimy, kiedy machiny oblƒô≈ºnicze niszczƒÖ r√≥≈ºne struktury),

+ klimat (bardzo mocna strona, je≈õli chodzi o tƒô produkcjƒô gdzie podczas rozgrywki niejednokrotnie na my≈õl przychodzi≈Ço mi dzie≈Ço, jakim jest choƒáby W≈Çadca Pier≈õcieni: Dru≈ºyna Pier≈õcienia),

+ dwie kampanie (≈ÇƒÖcznie 33 misje do rozegrania),

+ 16 grywalnych postaci (ka≈ºda z owych postaci r√≥≈ºni siƒô sposobem rozgrywki co oznacza stosowanie innej taktyki przy ka≈ºdej z nich, oczywi≈õcie do czasu),

+ spory arsena≈Ç broni (dok≈Çadnie jest ich a≈º 60, z czego ka≈ºda r√≥≈ºni siƒô od siebie wyglƒÖdem, si≈ÇƒÖ i zastosowaniem),

+ ≈õwietne soundtracki w lokacjach i nie tylko,

+ proste ≈Çamig≈Ç√≥wki i zagadki, a tak≈ºe ukryte pomieszczenia (mo≈ºe to niewiele ale nawet takie szczeg√≥≈Çy sƒÖ na plus, je≈ºeli chodzi o urozmaicenie rozgrywki),
  
+ edytor map (o kt√≥rym chyba ju≈º wszyscy na ca≈Çym ≈õwiecie zapomnieli),

+ obszerna fabu≈Ça/≈õwiat (oczywi≈õcie, je≈õli kto≈õ czyta strony ksiƒôgi podczas ≈Çadowania misji i oglƒÖda cutscenki),

+ wciƒÖgajƒÖca rozgrywka (nawet je≈õli gramy na poziomie hard po wielu nieudanych pr√≥bach wciƒÖ≈º ma siƒô ochotƒô doj≈õƒá dalej),

+ prosty system walki (dla niekt√≥rych mo≈ºe byƒá nawet zbyt prosty),

+ karty Steam (co jednak nie wp≈Çywa na ko≈ÑcowƒÖ ocenƒô tego produktu).

[b]Teraz nadszed≈Ç czas na to, co lubiƒô najbardziej. Zatem wytknijmy palcem to, co ujemnie wp≈Çynie na mojƒÖ ocenƒô tej produkcji.[/b] 
 
[b]Minusy:[/b]

- cena 4,99e (gdzie po rocznym op√≥≈∫nieniu premiery w Polsce gra kosztowa≈Ça 15,90z≈Ç, zatem oferta Steam jest swego rodzaju kpinƒÖ, je≈õli za≈õ gra pojawi siƒô za 1e warto kupiƒá (czƒôsto zdarza siƒô to na przecenach)),

- brak osiƒÖgniƒôƒá Steam (drobny minusik, kt√≥ry nie zawa≈ºy na ko≈Ñcowym werdykcie),

- brak mikstur dla mag√≥w kt√≥re odnawia≈Çyby manƒô (w niekt√≥rych misjach np. w ‚Äûwyzwaniach‚Äù 
mog≈Çyby bardzo u≈Çatwiƒá nam sprawƒô),

- brak jakiejkolwiek mapy (mo≈ºe i ciƒô≈ºko tutaj zab≈ÇƒÖdziƒá, ale mimo wszystko mapa by siƒô przyda≈Ça),

- system walki, choƒá prosty to jednak s≈Çabo rozwiniƒôty (co tu du≈ºo m√≥wiƒá walka skupia siƒô na machaniu orƒô≈ºem a≈º przeciwnik wyciƒÖgnie kopyta, brak tutaj jakich≈õ specjalnych kombos√≥w, chyba ≈ºe zaliczamy do tego zmianƒô ataku podczas zmiany kierunku ruchu),

- b≈Çƒôdy, glitch‚Äôe (nieraz skaczƒÖc mo≈ºemy zrobiƒá sobie krzywdƒô zawieszajƒÖc siƒô na sta≈Çe w jakim≈õ miejscu bƒÖd≈∫ jak to okre≈õlam ‚Äûp≈Çyniƒôcie po ziemi‚Äù chodzi o to, ≈ºe nawet kiedy nie wciskamy ‚ÄûW‚Äù nasza postaƒá potrafi przebyƒá pewnƒÖ drogƒô),

- wywalanie do pulpitu (najczƒô≈õciej po zdobyciu karty Steam, ale zdarza siƒô i bez)
-brak polskiej wersji (mo≈ºna pobraƒá i zainstalowaƒá spolszczenie co jednak czƒôsto i gƒôsto powoduje problemy z grƒÖ),

- s≈Çabo zbalansowane poziomy trudno≈õci (Easy ‚Äî przeciwnicy zachowujƒÖ siƒô niczym s≈Çomiane kuk≈Çy, Medium ‚Äî optymalny, mo≈ºna przyjemnie spƒôdziƒá czas grajƒÖc, Hard ‚Äî a raczej poziom trudno≈õci dla masochist√≥w tutaj wrogowie zachowujƒÖ siƒô niczym mieliby ADHD, brakuje r√≥wnie≈º check point√≥w co sprawia, ≈ºe mo≈ºna siƒô poczuƒá jak by≈õmy grali w Dark Souls czy Lords of the Fallen, co mo≈ºe zniechƒôciƒá nas do dalszej rozgrywki),

- brak check point√≥w na poziomie Hard,

- po aktywowaniu check pointa, je≈õli zginiemy odrodzenie odbiera nam 10 z≈Çota (mo≈ºe byƒá uciƒÖ≈ºliwe),

- mimo ≈ºe w grze do wyboru mamy a≈º 16 klas postaci jak p√≥≈∫niej mo≈ºna zauwa≈ºyƒá zmieniajƒÖc stronƒô walki (frakcjƒô) owe postacie nie r√≥≈ºniƒÖ¬†siƒô ju≈º stylem rozgrywki, a jedynie wyglƒÖdem.¬†

[b]Podsumowanie:[/b]

Enclave jest zatem typowƒÖ i nietypowƒÖ grƒÖ akcji, potrafi zapewniƒá sporo dobrej zabawy i trzeba przyznaƒá, ≈ºe Starbrezze postara≈Ço siƒô przy tym produkcie (choƒá z pewno≈õciƒÖ mog≈Çoby byƒá jeszcze lepiej). Dawno temu mia≈Ça narodziƒá siƒô druga czƒô≈õƒá tej gry jednak≈ºe prace nad niƒÖ zosta≈Çy wstrzymane i nie bƒôdƒÖ kontynuowane jak poinformowa≈Ç graczy developer, c√≥≈º mimo tego mam nadziejƒô, ≈ºe jednak niegdy≈õ uka≈ºe siƒô druga ods≈Çona opowie≈õci o ≈öwietle i Mroku. W ≈õwiecie Celenheim bawi≈Çem siƒô ca≈Çkiem dobrze i jeszcze d≈Çugo bƒôdƒô wspomina≈Ç przyjemny czas spƒôdzony na rozgrywce w Enclave.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045512373', 'num_games_owned': 1324, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1483513111}
review:
A great title for RPG fans though keep in mind this isn't an open world or story-rich experience. There's no loot system here, it's mostly simple linear pathing over two seperate campaigns. You only deviate to find currency collectibles which carry over for the entire game, allowing you to purchase a selection of weapons and armor from a wide arsenal before each mission. That, combined with the ability to change your hero class is what keeps this game fresh and interesting. Combat is similar to Rune but sharper and more customisable - pretty reminiscent of the early 2000's but genuinely fun. 

Performance wise I've had no issues with Enclave. Actually I was surprised to see it has a decent options menu for such a dated game, which includes support for modern resolution scalings. As far as I'm concerned, Enclave is a damn fine game. Its biggest crime is a lackluster story. 

Edit: In closing I'd like to address negative feedback for Enclave which concerns an in-game advertisement. You will [b]not[/b] be subjected to advertisements when booting Enclave as they no longer exist. It was unfortunately forced in from the new publisher, but has long since been removed.

I wanted to like this... i just don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967876062', 'num_games_owned': 832, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1483128956}
review:
Interesting game.  I enjoyed what I played of Enclave eventhough it's clearly dated by this point, but unforunately, I decided to uninstall the game and move on because of crash troubles.

Enclave plays fairly well.  The controls are straight forward and not overly complicated.  It's easy to dive into it with a minimal tutorial.

I wanted to keep playing it, but the game randomly crashes too often (windows 8.1).  I has to reload and start the last mission each time; the in-mission checkpoints aren't save points, just start points if death occurs inside that particular mission.  I found a fix that describes how to change a line in the config file from Direct3D to OpenGL.  This fix stabilizes Enclave quite a bit so that it doesn't crash quite as often, but it still crashes.  I found that my chances of crashing increase if I die and restart the mission, or die and load at a checkpoint.  

Maybe someday I will revisit it and try to finish it, but due to the crash problems, I have to give Enclave a thumbs down.

*edited for grammatical errors*

author: {'steamid': '76561198004734912', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1606427630}
review:
Generally speaking, I hate console ports: I hate their menu interfaces (no mouse, move a cursor around as if you had a gamepad, etc.) I hate checkpoints, I hate controls where you hit one button and watch your character do a 5 second animation wtih 18 sword swings, and I hate the total lack of hardware options.

This game has all of that.

For some reason, I'm still giving it a thumbs up.

Ultimately, the menu isn't terrible.  The checkpoints don't matter since gold gathering makes every level be its own challenge to not die at all (like getting an achievement, but back in 2003) and you can replay any level you want, the difficulty isn't so crazy high (until the end of the first act) that you reply levels 18 times.  The graphics can be manipulated through the nVidia control panel (and for a game this old, you can't expect much).  The play control is tolerable, though slow and frustrating.  If this doesn't sound like a glowing review, it's because it isn't.  But it's one of the extremely few console ports that I tolerate enough to play and get some enjoyment out of.  That says something.

Let me be clear, though, as a message to game designers of the future -- don't do any of the things that this game does wrong.  Enclave is just lucky enough to not do them *so* badly that I delete it.  And, it does enough of the rest of the game well enough to overcompensate for the console-suckiness.

Oh, I should also mention that I got this game from DLH as a promotion.

....

I guess to be fair to those who put their time into making this game, I should mention things that are positive about this game.  The story is intriguing and a little nuanced.  The enemies all have their own sometimes quite humorous personality.  The levels are well designed and a good length.  They are also not carbon copies of each other.  In fact, each level is quite different.  One particular bonus level has you firing a canon in a kind of tower defense mode.  There are several tournament style bonus levels, also.  There's only one (so far, I'm just about finished the first act) of the "go fetch keys" type level.  All in, there's a lot of good variance in the level design objectives to keep the entertainment value high.  From a scenary perspective, each level is radically different.  They all take place across a wide geographic region, and the graphical design embodies that perfectly.

And then there's the little things that keep it interesting.  For instance, in the first level, there are a few ways to walk through the 2003-era "open world" town, and depending on how you do it, you might trigger scripted sequences that change the challenge.  In later levels, some enemies set traps, and in one level, you even become a sort of godzilla and fight as a giant sized monster.  These are minor, but they all add up to increase the enjoyment level enough to make you forget about the downsides.  That is, until it crashes again, reminding you that you can't save your progress.

Anyway, overall it's a decent game.  I'd buy it if I didn't already get it for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118392184', 'num_games_owned': 3465, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1482816853}
review:
[i]Le Dark Souls du pauvre[/i]

[b]Enclave[/b], sorti en 2003, est RPG TPS/FPS o√π l'on incarne un petit voyou ne voulant pas payer ses imp√¥ts (sauf que lui, il part pas en Suisse) et se retrouve en prison. Fort heureusement, il arrive √† prouver sa valeur √† la reine, et s'en va pour sauver le monde. Ca, c'est pour la premi√®re campagne.
Pour la seconde, vous incarnez simplement un sous-fifre d'une m√©g√®re des t√©n√®bres.

[h1]Les plus :[/h1]

- Un univers m√©di√©valo-fantastique vraiment sympa. Le background du jeu est tr√®s int√©ressant et aurait m√©rit√© d'√™tre un peu plus pouss√©.
- La campagne de la lumi√®re est relativement int√©ressante, dynamique, et on peut suivre avec int√©r√™t le d√©roulement de l'histoire, la seconde par contre...
- Sur le papier, le fait qu'il y ait deux campagnes est tr√®s int√©ressant. En effet, on d√©couvre deux fins diff√©rentes, une avec le bien, et une avec le mal. Cependant, la campagne du mal est insipide.
- Le jeu impose une certaine difficult√©, et d'apprendre les patterns des monstres (et les glitchs)
- J'h√©sitais √† le mettre dans les aspects n√©gatifs, mais finalement, ils m'ont tellement fait rire que je le met ici. De qui je parle ? Des dialogues et de leurs super acteurs (qui n'ont que le nom). Tout sonne faux avec une maitrise √† faire palir des films sur NRJ12. Mais l√†, c'est marrant.
- De pr√®s, il est vilain, mais cependant, les d√©cors (faut se remettre en 2003 aussi) sont vraiment r√©ussi.
- Une bonne dur√©e de vie, avec deux campagnes d'environ 8h pour la premi√®re, et 10h pour la seconde, o√π l'on revisite les diff√©rents niveaux du jeu, mais avec une approche et une continuiti√© diff√©rente. Il y a une bonne rejouabilit√© des niveaux car il y a un bon nombre de classes √† tester, avec ses diff√©rentes caract√©ristiques, armes, etc...
- Beaucoup de classes disponibles, avec leur particularit√©, et un syst√®me d'√©quipement... d√©routant, mais qui reste coh√©rent. En effet, pas de point de comp√©tences pour am√©liorer son/ses personnage(s), mais de l'argent qui vous servira √† vous √©quiper des meilleures armes et armures. Fait int√©ressant, mais qui ne laisse aucun choix d√©cisif dans la fa√ßon de monter son perso, est que aucun achat n'est d√©finitif ni punitif. C'est √† dire que si vous achetez une arme mais qu'il s'av√®re que c'est nul, et bah, pas grave, sans probl√®me, vous √™tes rembours√©s au p√©cul pr√®s. Il est donc facile de se monter un perso √ºber-cheat√©, apr√®s avoir test√© tous les √©quipements et classes possibles.
- Un bon level-design, avec beaucoup de d√©tails, et plein de pi√®ges, pleeeeeeeein.....

[h1]Les moins :[/h1]

- La seconde campagne (celle des t√©n√®bres) est inint√©ressante au niveau histoire, ainsi que les classes disponibles (compar√© √† celles de la lumi√®re)
- Un gameplay un peu cass√©, avec une hitbox hasardeuse (oh mon dieu, cet arc...) et des combats qui peuvent tourner au ridicule.
- Pendant un niveau, (car le jeu est d√©coup√© en mini-missions) vous ne pouvez pas sauvegarder √† votre guise, et donc vous devez vous taper le niveau en entier. De plus, les points de contr√¥le sont rares, donc si vous mourrez (ce qui va arriver), c'est retour √† la case d√©part.. Rageant.
- Une IA... remarquable par sa stupidit√©, vraiment. (Sauter dans le vide reste son activit√© num√©ro 1)

[h1]Conclusion :[/h1]

[i]Enclave[/i] est au jeu-vid√©o ce que [i]Les Tuches[/i] est au cin√©ma. Un ovni, atypique, mal jou√©, avec une IA aux fraises, un gameplay cass√©, mais avec un univers int√©ressant, et un charme intriguant.
Je le recommande car, malgr√© ses d√©fauts, il m'a fait pass√© un bon moment (moins avec la campagne des t√©n√®bres mais bon, l'id√©e est toujours bonne, mais mal r√©alis√©e)

_ _ _ _

[h1]Si vous avez trouv√© cette √©valuation utile, et que vous voulez en discuter autour d'un verre, venez rejoindre notre [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/AlternaTyff#curation]page de curation et nos forums ![/url][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197986991063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1482651166}
review: I originally played this game on XBOX and absolutely fell in love with it. The gameplay is great, but what really makes this game stand out to me is the seemingly perfect blend of graphic style, sounds effects and music that all work together to create a strong atmosphere for this game. The combat mechanics are somewhat simplistic, but the ability to use different characters that can be upgraded and customized with different weapons keeps things interesting and adds to the replay value. Also, the ability to play as both the "good" side and "evil" side is an interesting element that adds more replay value and adds more to the story of the game.

review:

review:
Although not an open world,  it is very similar to Oblivion.  You can choose character classes with unique specs, and you gain gold as you beat levels which you use to equip your character with weapons and armor,  

Can play on linux and older computers very well.

Only $5, really cheap for someone who wants an Elder Scrolls-like game for linux.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989620359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1515256752}
review:
This game can be a steal in steam sales periods. Going for only 49 cents.

This game is extremely nostalgic. Back in 2002 this game had a demo with only 2 playable levels. It was one of the most downloaded demo's on the site games.telenet.be. :) I loved that site. I didn't have internet at home, so a friend of mine burned the demo on a disc for me. Sadly I never found a physical copy of the game in stores. 

The graphics. I love these kind graphics but I don't like hack n slash games. Especially when they are top down (Diablo, Torchlight...). Since this is a 3th person game, It's forgivable. At the time I thought hacknslash was awesome. This is a kind of game they don't make anymore. A lineair action game. Follow the path, kill everybody, progress through the story.  Repeat till you see the credits. The sword fighting feels a little bit like the Jedi Knight series btw...

It's an ok game. At 50 cents it's a steal.

review: Played this game back when it came out long time ago.  Came across a game manual recently and remembered how much fun it was, and low and behold found it on sale on Steam for super cheap.  Got exited to play again, install went great.  First couple hours went great! But then ended up crashing to desktop every 5 min.  Looked up online to try and fix crashes with multi core/ modern computers.  Found some suggestions but were no help.  Game is fun, if you get to play it.  Lots of different gameplay opportunites.... if you can get to it play with out crashing.

review:
Un tr√®s bon jeu. Les deux campagnes sont longues et le challenge est difficile. L ' histoire est interessante et les personnages sont attachant. Je suis tr√®s heureux de trouver un  hack and slash de cette qualit√©. 

J  'y joue depuis 11 heures, sous ubunut 2016 LTS et le syst√®me a crach√© cinq fois, probablement au fait que le jeu se lance avec les pilotes 3D. Je n' ai pas essay√© de passer en version OpenGL. Tout se passe bien s'est beau est fluide, m√™me sur un portable en double coeurs 2.0 , avec 2 gigas de ram. ( jeu de 2003)

C 'est beau, les monstres sont agressifs, s'est dur, s'est fantastique. J 'adore ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035150567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1477464414}
review: Not horrible, but poorly made. You get more characters as the game goes on that carry different gear, otherwise they are all the same. There is no leveling, just new gear.  The new gear isn't always better, just more expenive.  There's no stats on any of the gear, just guess.  It is hard to hit targets, as they jump around like some kind of multi-player game.  Your jump however is very limited and painful to get on a box or jump a hole that will kill you.  Jumping looks very awkward, and is also required in every level of the game.  The melee fighting sucks the most, just use a crossbow or a staff. The story is stupid, just skip that and play. You basically get thrown into fighting and collecting money, without teaching you how to do much. Traps will kill you, and appear without reason, so use your psycic ability(not real).  There are checkpoints, costs money to revive, unless you haven't found one, then restart map. So it's a cheaply made game, bugs won't get fixed, it's too old.  It's not worth more than $1, and only if you're really bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142594150', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1494564224}

author: {'steamid': '76561198103640309', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1477331759}
review:
Great game. Other reviews already tell why it is great so I'll leave a recomendation here:
When you pick up this game, stay away from bows, they're complete garbage, stick to crossbows and you'll be happy with how they play around. The green dot turns red when you're aiming at a valid target, it works in a weird way, if you have it red it will score a hit regardless if your character actually has line of sight or not which also means that when enemies come into close range you'll most likely miss them unless you put the dot on top of them, anywhere else it'll shoot across the enemy dealing no damage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963849780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1477271849}
review:
Cool game for its day, to bad I can't get it working well enough to give it a full playthrough. 

GFX: I'm sure I remember the graphics being amazing way back when pre-rendering was all the fad; which it does use for some things (intro/menus), and scripted scenes in game! 
Music/SFX: Decent enough music but some sound-fx are a bit odd. 
Story: Seemed engaging enough, though some of the dialog was a bit hammy.
Gameplay: Again, I remember it being great back in the day but I couldn't get it working well enough to tolerate more than 3-4 levels. 

[b]Game Breaking Bug:[/b] Moving the mouse to look around, or change your heading, while moving causes the forward speed to increase by some huge amount. Sometimes the same bug would cause forward movement to continue without any input. Sometimes it would cause mouse look to get a serious case of the jitters.

TL;DR
While the game is cool enough to recommend, the bug killed it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330757259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1602879992}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066636068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1477166216}
review:
It's not bad, but not great either. I don't see any popup ads, the game looks decent in 1080p, and it runs fine on my 8 core Windows 10 computer. So all those old problems must have been fixed.

I'm 9 levels in, I've unlocked most of the characters. The melee fighting never gets good, eventually your weapon will one hit kill most enemies, except a few stronger ones with 10x more hitpoints. I can only kill them with ranged weapons and running away. Killing them with a sword doesn't work because their AI spams their attack nonstop, and their attack is just as fast as yours, so you end up trading damage - which could work if you buy lots of potions.

The third person crossbow shooting is kind of fun, and the level designs are interesting.

It's a decent game if you like third person shooters and can get it on sale or in a bundle.

review: this game is abusolutly horendous. the graphics are good but unless you buy this game for a dollar or less thats the only good deal. story line is dull and the gameplay machanics are impossible. shooting is hard since you couldnt hit the broad side of a barn. thats an exaggeration but they act more like a missle than an bow. there is no real rpg eliments and you mostly sit there playing a dull hack and slash. still i may be something to do for some of you especailly me

author: {'steamid': '76561198116363960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1476401747}
review:
so it says I only have a few hours on this game. HOWEVER I only have this many due to me leaving it on while at work so I could write a review.

I played the ENTIRE game offline so I have over 30+ hours in this game (I was playing it in class and had to stop every once in a while to pretend I was paying attention)

This game is INCREDIBLY good! it is old and from the "golden years of gaming", so the graphics aren't fantastic, but they are FAR better than what did come out at the time.
The gameplay of this is fun, kind of a rogue-like with increasable difficulty. 
You earn gold to buy items and make your Character stronger. Sometimes you gotta grind a level a little if you want a specific item, but it was never boring to do so.

Overall, this game gets a solid 8/10 because of the age of the game and how awesome it is. 
Good buy for $5.49 HOWEVER get it on sale when its $1.37 and save yourself a couple dollars! trust me, this game will be waiting for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080502550', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1476393896}
review:
It's a nice old game. The combat system works. No glitches so far. a mix of 3rd person hack & slash and a 1st person shooter. so far I have unlocked three characters warrior, archer, druid.... despite classes they are the same, just use different weapons. The gold serves as a sort of an XP system here... before each mission you can pick one character and use gold to choose their weapons... the higher the price the better the weapon... gold stacks up for the party and doesn't dissapear. so after each mission you have more gold for more equipment. there is at least one arena location with waves of ennemies and different difficulties.... 

all in all it's not a bad game from the old days... graphics are dated and so are the game mechanics but for the sake of old times I'd give this 7/10 

Play it!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001174552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1476155163}
review:
I got the game and tried to play on a Windows 8.1 system and it was way to fast.
The movement of the character was impossible to control becuase of the speed.
I tried all suggestions I read in the discussions and nothing worked to slow the game down.

I asked steam for a refund and it is processing.
If you have a fast multi-core system the game could be to fast on your system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053502314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1474083971}
review: I really was excited about this game. I saw the reviews, I saw the preview videos and thought it looked like a great game to get into. However, on Windows 10, it is impossible to play. The age of the game truly prohibits it from being played today on today's operating systems. I tried everything that was mentioned throughout forums, posts, and steam forums to try and play this game because I truly thought it looke like a great game but to no avail. If you are running anything over Windows 7 you most likely can't play this game regardless of the hardware you have. You can try Compatibility Mode, running as Administrator, using assisting files that you find from elsewhere to support DX9 and DX10, hacking the config file, etc... but I was not able to get this game to work and ended up asking for a refund. This is in my 1% range. Everything else, ,with persistence, I've been able to get to work with the exception of this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102596796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1475868434}

author: {'steamid': '76561198112989387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1476429295}
review:
the game isn't bad. not exactly. The story isn't the worst, the combat is pretty basic and the graphics are good for it's time. i don't have any major problems with it, except for the fact that the Wine-ported Mac-OSX version is so bad it is almost unplayable. Textures will not loads, levels will not load, setting won't take effect (brightness, graphics) and the game crashes frequently. i would love to give this a good review, but until they fix the Mac version, i cannot recommend this game. on windows, fine. mac. no.

**EDIT**
**bugs have now been fixed, and game runs smoothly**

author: {'steamid': '76561198066991153', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1573301311}
review: Vechi dar bun. Imi place in special atmosfera si coloana sonora a jocului, te faci sa te simti de parca ai fii acolo, are imersivitate. Povestea iarasi este interesanta si dupa ce termini campania cu aia buni ai sa poti sa joci cu aia rai. Luptele sunt dinamice si simple, te feresti si ataci in stilul hack&slash, fara abilitati sau combo-uri. O simplitate placuta in stilul de lupta care nu se mai gaseste de mult in jocuri, acum specifica doar jocurilor old school. Si ai mai multe personaje din care poti sa-ti alegi, poti sa joci cu orice personaj vrei.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138530927', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1603622899}
review:
Excellent pour un jeu d'il y a 13 ans

Niveau graphismes, rien √† dire √ßa pique pas les yeux

Niveau jouabilit√©, pas de gros probl√®mes √† part la cam√©ra et la hitbox un peu mal foutues dans les phases de c√†c avec la souris, doit s√ªrement mieux passer au gamepad

2-3 petites modifications √† faire pour am√©liorer la version steam : 
- ajouter la ligne : BINK_SOUNDTRACK=2  dans le fichier environment.cfg pour avoir les voix fran√ßaises dans le jeu (steam ne le fait pas automatiquement pour celui-l√†)
- si le jeu coupe d'un coup lors d'un niveau, plusieurs fois, modifier la ligne avec VID_RENDER=Direct3D8 par : VID_RENDER=OpenGL
- sur Windows 10 pour jouer en 16:9 s'il n'appara√Æt pas dans les param√®tres, executer en mode de compatibilit√© Windows 7 et plus aucun souci ;)

Au final bien sympa, tout est dit dans les pr√©c√©dents commentaires

Je l'ai re√ßu gratuitement, mais pour 5‚Ç¨ je le recommande sans h√©siter !

author: {'steamid': '76561198275495972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1514242108}
review:
The game is old, so I don't mind the graphics. The only thing I have to say it that it seams to take A LOT of patience to play this game. Sometimes, the objectives aren't really clear (and you turn around for half an hour for something that would be supposed to take ten minutes...). I have to say it's not a big loss for this price, but I would not recommend it unless you like searching for long...

Le jeu est vieux ; je m'attendais donc pas √† des graphiques de ce niveau. Cependant, je crois qu'il faut √™tre TR√àS patient pour jouer √† ce jeu. Parfois, les objectifs ne sont pas vraiment clairs (et vous tournez en rond durant 30 minutes pour une mission qui aurait d√ª se terminer en 10 minutes). Ce n'est pas une grosse perte au prix que le jeu se vend, mais je ne le recommenderais pas, √† moins que vous n'aimiez particuli√®rement le genre de jeu o√π vous cherchez √©ternellement le moindre petit objectif.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130516505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1472207797}
review:
Enclave is a 13-year old game which was defined as an RPG, although I think it is more of an Action-RPG. The game is consideribly good considering the time period in which it was released and offered me quite a bit of fun.

Pros:
-Reasonably easy to play, linear story and closed maps, so no getting lost or searching for objective
-Combat is fairly simple and with the right loadout, you can defeat anything quite easily
-Trading cards are available, and the game comes at a reasonable price

Cons:
-Graphics and sound is dated, so might not appeal to some in that sense
-Mouse sensitivity issues, can be corrected setting it to 125Hz
-Although the game is widescreen enabled, the menus are locked to 4:3 aspect ratio
-Game becomes repitive and tiring after some time, you do the same things over and over again

The game is okay considering its time, if you are into old games, get it (DLH.net was giving free keys out a while ago). For the more modern gamer, I advise you steer clear
5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197988271944', 'num_games_owned': 1346, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1471958182}

Nonostante la storia sia la forza di questo gioco, lo sconsiglierei fortemente, semplicemente perch√® ci sono titoli di spicco di quegli anni di cui non far√≤ il nome ora, ma questo non lo √® mai stato e non lo sar√†, quindi perch√® ricordarlo per ci√≤ che non √®? SCONSIGLIATO

author: {'steamid': '76561198002444399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1479083433}
review:
Couldn't play the game when it was first released over 13 years ago.
Jumping right into it when I found a free key of it!

So far, this game was as enchanting to me as I first remember wanting it more than a decade ago. It has a graphic that fairly aged well, and an interesting story line.

I would recommend this game to any of you that like an Action-RPG game, like an alternative-medieval-aged-based game a la Lord of The Ring, or both of above!

And if you'd like see more gameplay footage before deciding on the game, I'm having a Let's Play Series just right here!

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0LwcUqbaZcqO3LA_N2cy7g

author: {'steamid': '76561197972538083', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1470221750}
review:
One of the jankiest, most unbalanced games I've played - I love it. The graphics hold up fairly well and the game supports modern widescreen resolutions (although the menus are all pre-rendered to 4:3). The game does seem to crash without warning sometimes, but not even that was enough to prevent me from enjoying everything this game had to offer. Completing both campaigns took me about eight hours.

The combat is very basic, but I found it oddly satisfying. Just hit things until they die. In each level you can choose from a selection of characters and then outfit them with various weapons, magic and equipment using the gold you find scattered in each area. Finding the most overpowered loadouts and putting them to use is a lot of fun and makes the difficulty of the later levels a lot more tolerable.

The story and setting of Enclave certainly could be described as 'generic western fantasy,' but I did find some of the visual designs to be quite interesting and original. The music is fairly standard stuff, but is effective. I would recommend this game if you like old PC fantasy games and can put up with the possiblity of crashes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159751107', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1476896264}
review:
Titolo: Enclave
Genere: GDR
Sviluppatore: Starbreeze 
Editore: Topware Interactive	
Data di rilascio: 10 mar 2003

Gioco che all'inizio non mi aveva convinto, pero poi ho cambiato idea.

GAMEPLAY
La giocabilita di Enclave √® sicuramente uno dei fattori pi√π importanti del gioco.Infatti prima di ogni livello potremmo scegliere un personaggio (esempio il cacciatore) in base alla fazione che scegliamo,una volta che abbiamo scelto il personaggio possiamo anche scegliere le armi e l'equipaggiamento, per dare modo di essere perfettamente adatto alla missione che stiamo per compiere.

COMPARTO TECNICO
√® importante  ricordare che Enclave √® un  titolo originariamente uscito per XBOX e che ha subito da poco la conversione su PC con ottimi risultati, in quanto sono state tappate delle falle nel motore grafico e migliorata la struttura del sistema di lotta.
I personaggi sono stati disegnati in modo ottimo , tanto da mostrare anche i dettagli del volto (rughe della pelle o le piaghe dei tessuti).
Gli effetti di luce ed ombra sono strutturati in modo tale da rendere minima la visibilit√† a seconda delle distanze o degli agenti atmosferici quali nebbia o pioggia,mentre qualora incontrassimo un tratto colpito da forte vento, vedremo gli oggetti intorno a noi muoversi con esso; tutti questi elementi contribuiscono fortemente a fare di Enclave un gioco con un buon livello di realismo.


DIFETTI
Enclave potrebbe risentire eccessivamente della scarsa variet√† di missioni da eseguire. Tuttavia abbiamo alcuni elementi particolari che possono stuzzicare noi giocatori a proseguire il gioco con lo stesso interesse con il quale lo iniziamo, come ad esempio l‚Äôinterazione con la catapulta o la possibilit√† di scegliere strade diverse per completare i livelli o il fatto di sbloccare personaggi nuovi avanzando nei livelli.

Sintetizzando quello che ho scritto Enclave √® un gioco valido che mi ha dato (almeno a me ) parecchie soddisfazioni , lo consiglio a tutti quanti sopratutto agli amanti del genere , pero a mio parere √® consigliato giocarlo con calma perch√® alle lunghe potrebbe diventare noioso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164458835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1470587977}
review:
Per essere un gioco del 2003 √® davvero ben fatto, ancora al passo con i tempi. Pi√π simile come azione al buon vecchio Baldur's Gate Dark Alliance per PS2, anche se qui la visulae √® diversa. Uno slash'em up piacevole, che vi convincer√† a rigiocare le varie missioni per il gusto di scoprire i tesori nascosti che vi sono sfuggiti la prima volta.
L'azione √® sostanzialmente ripetitiva, ma ho molto apprezzato la funzione dei checkpoint che consentono di giocare praticamente all'infiniito. La scelta dei personaggi √® piuttosto vasta, ma non mi √® piaciuto molto il fatto che solo il cavaliere possa giocare le prime missioni. Bella la possibilit√† di scegliere il percorso luce o ombra, e ottimo il sistema di acquisto armi. Pi√π tesori scoprite, migliori sono le armi e l'equipaggiamento che potete portare in missione.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041940329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1466988369}
review:
I played this game when i was little on the original xbox.
The game was decent for its time but didnt age very well compared to todays standards.

Pros:
+Good level design
+Hidden areas with loot
+Decent looking for its time
+Good or Evil campaigns (28 Levels in total)
+3rd person with option of 1st person
+Cheap Price
+Supports high resolutions
+Simple combat
+Good soundtrack
+Difficult at points
+Multiple classes

Cons:
-Ranged combat is a joke
-Very scripted enemy encounters
-Combat can get boring
-Not many rpg elememts
-No achivements
-Linear gameplay
-Some graphical glitches

7/10 If you can get it on sale its worth a try.

review:
Short version: this game is bad, don‚Äôt play it.

Slightly longer version:  Do not buy this game, do not play this game.  The whole thing is clunky and awkward.  The animations for everything are awful.  The textures look like they belong in an edgy version of the original fable, and I don‚Äôt mean that in a good way (if you even think there is a good way to interpret that).  The combat is worse than many free to play rpgs.  The characters (to the point where I couldn‚Äôt take it anymore) were uninteresting.  The combat consisted of A. sniping enemies with ranged attacks and never fighting anything, or B. running forward at the enemy and left clicking.  There are many free to play games of much higher quality than this, play anything else.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198203101418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1466734982}
review: I have recieved this game from a friend who gave me a key they got for free. I like this game, its graphics is decent. Ive had my moments with this game, took me two days to find the entrance to a house to retrieve a key for some dude that claims "Celinhiem needs this gold." When I saw the stache of gold I stopped playing and thought to myself...im going to be rich, but now I relized it was not even enough to upgrade your armor to light armor. I progressed just to see a goblin with armor as thick as my roof, I shot it with my "Dwarven Crossbow" just to see it jump out of a tower and slaughter me. Now im stuck on level five and have no life. It has a nice combat system I geuss. All you need to run it on max graphics is a stone-age "Stonehenge 68 windows 64 .1 gb ram computer." Overall, I love it...

author: {'steamid': '76561198078370309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1472004166}
review: In my tens if not hundreds of seconds spent playing this game I can tell you it is up to par with other games of its time such as Elder Scrolls: Skyrim and Grand Theft Auto Five. This game is simply no exception when it comes to astounding gameplay and combat mechanics, not to mention the next gen graphics. Enclave simply put, is a masterpiece and should get the attention it deserves as a true work of art.

review:
Enclave - Gostei 7/10

√â um rpg divido em fases, nada de mundo aberto.

Inicialmente  voc√™ possui apenas  um cavaleiro para jogar, a medida que voc√™ progride na hist√≥ria novas classess√£o liberadas.

O jogo possui duas campanhas, a da luz e a das trevas.

O ouro √© obtido nas fases e pode ser utilizado para fazer melhoria em seus personagens, todos personagens tem acesso a mesma quantidade de ouro e forma independente, todas as compras s√£o revers√≠veis. Isso torna poss√≠vel testar diversas configura√ß√µes em batalha.Existe uma variedade de armas para cada classe.

Outro ponto positivo s√£o as armadilhas que o jogo possui, mesmo com capacidade t√©cnica limitada (jogo criado em 2003) √© poss√≠vel ver paredes desmoronando, pedras rolando, tiros de canh√£o, espetos que saem do ch√£o, eles se esfor√ßaram nisso.

Agora vamos para os pontos negativos:

Mesmo considerando a idade do jogo (2003), temos alguns problemas:

1- Bugs, algumas vezes atacamos o inimigo e ele n√£o √© atingido.

2- Manipular arcos e bestas √© muito ruim neste jogo pois, o tempo de recarga √© elevado.

3- A cura s√≥ ocorre com po√ß√µes de vida, n√£o existe regenera√ß√£o.

4- Efeitos como veneno, fogo, maldi√ß√£o  s√£o fortes demais nesse jogo, quando voc√™ recebe um desses efeitos √© preciso usar po√ß√£o ou √© morte certa

5- O sistema de combate n√£o √© variado e a quantidad de inimigos √© limitada.



Bom, eu gostei do jogo, n√£o √©  o melhor de todos os tempos mas, isso aqui √© uma an√°lise do jogo e n√£o competi√ß√£o de qual √© o melhor rpg de todos os tempos.

√â poss√≠vel se divertir algumas horas, o jogo possui alguns enigmas bem legais .

Recomendo o jogo, ainda mais porque ele frequentemente est√° em promo√ß√£o ou de gra√ßa !


Conhe√ßa meu canal no youtube :
https://www.youtube.com/user/faraquito

author: {'steamid': '76561198056832501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1462750267}
review:
Vorweg:
Dieses Spiel ist nur dann zu Empfehlen, wenn man ein Fan von √§lteren RGP Spielen ist. Das dieses Spiel gealtert ist, merkt man sehr gut.

Pros:
- Man kann M√ºnzen einsammeln, was daf√ºr sorgt, dass man immerhin irgendwas zu tun hat.
- Die Musik war nicht soo schlecht.
- Die Geschichte wird in Videozenen erz√§hlt. DIese sind am Anfang und am Ende eines jeden Abschnitts und an manchen Stellen zwischendurch.
- Es gibt Sammelkartet, falls das wen interessiert

Kontra:
- Keine offene Welt, bzw gro√üe Abschnitte ( eher viele kleine Maps, die man nach 10min durch hat ).
- Nat√ºrlich schlechte Grafik.
- Eine KI, die rumspinnt ( wenn hinter einer T√ºr ein Gegner ist und der einen angreifen will, kann man die T√ºr nicht √∂ffnen ).
- Langweilige K√§mpfe. Bosse sind nur str√§ker, sonnst aber nichts besonderes.
- Ein sehr karges Men√º
- Eine Storry, wie man sie nicht √∂fter h√§tte haben k√∂nnen.


Grobe Storry = SPOILER !
Erst ist man gefangen
Bricht aus
K√∂nigen verzeiht es einem, weil man die ganze Stadt gerettet hat
Mann muss dennoch irgendwas f√ºr sie tun
Man bringt einen H√§ndler sicher irgendwo hin
...

Dannach hatte es schon kein Spa√ü mehr gemacht.

FAZIT:
Ein sehr altes Spiel f√ºr einen nicht gerechten Preis. Es gibt meiner Meinung nach viel bessere alte Spiele.
Also NUR dann kaufen, wenn er Geld √ºberhabt und alle Spiele auf Steam die besser sind schon gespielt habt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060437455', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1629906892}
review:
This game is good the first time you play it.
Has decent graphics for it's time and kinda encourages exploration.
The game is nothing amazing but I am kinda biased towards it because it's one of my first games I played on a PC.

[h1]Review[/h1]

----
[h1] Story [/h1]

Did not pay much attention to it, it's very generic and not memorable but it does the job ( I doubt you will get hooked on the story and expect awesome twists and stuff)
The typical, good saves the world from evil. (or vice versa if you play with the evil side)

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

The cool thing is that you can choose between good and evil.
The good guys are not very balanced, you will end up playing the Paladin only since he is the strongest one of them ( Also the defeault character)

The evil guys on the other hand are more balanced and you have a reason choosing one over the other. ( They are also more interesting to play as, Assasin, Orc, Goblin, Berserker and a Sorceress. ( I probably missed a guy or two).

Now the actual gameplay, not things that affect it.
- It gets pretty repetitive, you mash the left mouse button to attack and the right one to defend.
You can switch between a shooting weapon and a melee weapon and upgrade them with gold after each stage.

You can buy arrows from the shop and health potions if you need them.

 [h1] Presentation [/h1]

- The presentation is good, the way the menu transitions in to the stage select is pretty well done for it's time. Altough the menu has a pretty bad quality since after you choose something the animation is CGI and it's old 2003 CGI.
Altough this game brings nothing new to the table.

[h1] Soundtrack [/h1]

The soundtrack isn't bad and it's kinda memorable ( Atleast I remember it since I was a kid, I thought it was scary and 
stuff).

    
       [h1][b] Overall Score [/b][/h1]
            [h1][b]  7,5 / 10 [/b][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198202287824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 3980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3464, 'last_played': 1700260938}
review:
Enclave is special to those of us who remember playing it on xbox. To everyone else, this game is clunky, dated, and requires Controller Companion in order to operate correctly. Had I not originally played this circa 2003-2004, I'm not really sure if I'd enjoy it at all. 

However, considering I was touched by this game briefly when it was new, playing it to completion on PC (numerous times) has been rewarding time and time again. The $5 price tag is more than worth it, for the small few of us.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993633055', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1460870566}
review: If you're here for the nostalgia, rock on; I'm sure you'll have fun. However, if you're like me and this is your first exposure to this game, you'll probably hate it. There are games that age well and games that don't. Time has done Enclave no favors and my first exposure to it was mind-numbing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083430407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1689363640}
review:
Enclave is a good game.

Now, take my word for what it's worth because I am very, very much biased in favor of this game; I've completed it at least ten times on disc with another two since I purchased it on steam.
But, in my opinion, the fact I like it enough to have played it this many times is something of a statement as to it's quality.

The pros are easy to list:
-Very intuitive.
-Fast paced.
-Hitboxes are very much what you'd expect.
-Hitting someone with a melee weapon has the weight and impact you'd expect.
-The way the missions are handled makes shooting for the 100% both very much doable and rewarding.
-The paradox of "But I might need it later" never arises. You use what you need, when you need it, and it's bloody satisfying blasting a bunch of armored knights with a bomb.
-No serious difficulty spikes; the game picks up the pace as you go along, not suddenly bombards you with something unreasonable you've never seen before.
-Stealth works the way you'd expect.
-Multiple weapon types that actually feel different and require different timings for their attacks to actually land. Each of the several staves also has a very different main and secondary attack.
-Has a great cast of diverse characters for you to play as that actually have an impact on their playstyle; each of them has different equipment that they can use, different size hitboxes, different health and damage modifiers.
-Locational damage is very accurate and makes aiming for the most vulnerable part of your enemy a good way of removing them. This mechanic works well with the fact different characters have different armor types for different sections of their body, depending on armor class.

The cons are also easy to list:
-It's too short.
-Sound design. On multiple occasions I found the voice lines got sped up, raised in pitch or what-have-you.
-It's duration leaves something to be desired.
-Soundtrack is not that great.
-It's very, very brief.
-It's pretty old, and hasn't aged too well in most areas.
-It's gone too quickly.
-The story is stupid. Not even funny stupid, just flat out stupid. It's not offensive or anything, though.
-And yeah, it's length is insufficient.
-By now I'm so proficient in this game I can complete any mission of either campaign with just the starting bow and arrows, armorless and without consuming health potions. Send help.
-It's clock-time isn't all too great.

Yes, you could say I'm crazy, but I'd be far too busy hearing you over the dying grunts of an orc being shot in the neck by my magical arrows to notice.

Far as I'm concernd, 10/10. Would shoot hundreds of enemies in the neck with magical armor-piercing arrows again.
-Sleepy

review:
Are you looking for a good, solid RPG that doesn't waste your time or bog you down with side-quests, skill-trees, sandboxes and crafting?
You get a lot of weapons to choose from, different armor, lots of classes to unlock and play and two factions, good and evil.

Lots of negative reviews but check their hours, it's a good game.
It's old but still better than a lot of way newer games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141602674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1430402608}
review:
Experience incredibly atmospheric and intense medieval combat action! 
Go ahead and enter a new world, the award-winning world of ENCLAVE! 

The people of Light and Darkness are divided by a bottomless rift that split the earth many millennia ago. The lands of light are an Enclave of truth and order surrounded by the twisted and barren lands of the dark, known as the Outlands. Over the centuries the rift has started to close‚Ä¶ 

And now it is only a matter of time before the forces of Light and Darkness will clash in an unprecedented, merciless struggle for survival! 
Remember... When a storm comes up, for some it‚Äôs better to keep out of its way‚Ä¶ while for others it‚Äôs time to block its path! 
FEATURES:
Breathtaking combat action 
Amazing 3D graphics with latest Shader technolgy support 
2 separate story driven single player campaigns: Light and Dark Campaign 
25+ highly detailed fantasy themed missions 
Secret bonus games 
12 different playable character classes 
5 mighty end bosses 
Epic musical score and impressive sound FX.
My rating 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042648018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1575391624}
review:
Encalve is a great game for what it is - an action focussed Hack and Slash. There's no character development but you find money on levels which you can buy better gear with. This creates a cool puzzle/platform element as it's no easy task to find it all as there are some very interesting places the money is stored. 

I played this a lot years ago and on the hardest difficulty it will give you a run for your money. It's of an older vein of games that will be frustrating at first as you need to place arrows carefully and time your swings exactly or you'll be flailing around hitting nothing.

2 Campaigns with plenty of replayability due to around 6 different characters for both the light and dark faction. They basically mirror each other - so there's a warrior/archer/wizard/engineer/etc for both factions. Each character requires a different play style as you can imagine and get some unique equipment that you can buy.

I was pretty excited that this was on discount on steam - 47p or thereabouts. However I've only been playing about 30 mins and the game crashed on the second level. Tried again and crashed right at the end again. Very frustrating -- and I imagine all support for the game will be gone now so no hope of a fix. The error message only flashed up for a brief second so apologise for not giving the exact error. Hopefully it's just me but worth bearing in mind if you're paying full price.

For what is a game you'll easily get 40 hours playtime out of, it's a shame that the steam version seems a little unstable.

The game itself is a solid 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197973786715', 'num_games_owned': 1942, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1460087361}
review:
I have over 600 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game. 

One Hour Reviews #56 - Enclave

I'll start with the good, since it won't take me very long.  The graphics are really nice considering this game came out in 2003.  I also enjoyed the music.  A little less impressive is the level design.  I did like the way the game encourages exploration to find hidden gold.  But the levels are very linear.  There's definitely nothing open world about Enclave.

I didn't play long enough to get a good sense of the story.  But the main character seems to be the "silent protagonist", which personally I am not a fan of, but sometimes it can work.  Other characters do talk however, and I found the voice acting to be somewhat uneven.  Some of it was good, and some of it sounded like they asked someone in QA to fill in for a day.

Also, you might notice the game is tagged as "RPG", but don't make the mistake of thinking it is one, because it's really not.  It's more of an action adventure game in a fantasy setting.  But it lacks many of the things you'd expect in a typical RPG, like an inventory screen, or character customization, or skills or stats, or a map of some kind.

For a game that focuses on action, I wished the actual action was a little better.  Combat just seemed to be your basic button mashing.  There is some variety in the sense that you can change weapons and use a ranged weapon instead of a melee weapon, and the weapons can have different speeds.   But that's about it for the variety, and mostly I found myself just mashing the attack button.

Speaking of the mouse button, I found myself wishing the game supported a controller, but it doesn't.  Another annoyance I found is, even though the game uses keyboard and mouse, from the main menu the mouse doesn't work, so you have to navigate solely with the keyboard, which made the initital setup and configuration annoying.

It's a shame that the developers didn't put a little more work into the gameplay, instead of just making the game pretty.  Perhaps if I had reviewed this in 2003 I would have been a little kinder.  But even so, there were far better RPGs to play even back then.  What little is good about this game is outweighed by the bland combat and gameplay, and other annoyances like having to skip credits when you quit, which for me it's been the last time.  Don't even need to finish my hour on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071206793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1458305790}
review:
It is medieval fantasy TPP hack-n-slash with bits of platforming actions.

Looks decent and level design lets you have some fun looking for hidden treasures. But fighting is boring. Like really boring. It just doesnt work at all. And as for h-n-s it is major issue so nothing can save this game.

On the bright side game has two nice 'twists' that could interest somebody.

First is multiple of characters to play as. During missions you can meet some NPCs in trouble and if you manage to save them they will join you and act as playable characters for the rest of the game. On the other hand this undefined main character causes story to be unrelated to characters. So dont expect any story from this game. Just almost random stages, enemies and your character of choice. It could be arena-type game and it wouldnt be any different.

Next 'twist' is that you can outfit your hero before every mission. Equipping your character is based on limited budget mechanic. Every piece of gold you collected adds to the pool of gold which limits gear you can wear. Every piece of equipment substracts from this pool so you have to pick if you prefer balanced setup with average elements or maybe you will sacrifice armor in favor of better weapon. You cant pick your playstyle and enjoy the game your way without being forced to play some fixed archetype.
Mentioned gold you receive for completing every mission and even more you can find during the mission as extra hidden treasures that require from you taking extra risk. And risk here is high - death equals restart of the level. But thats fine, levels are short and fun part is mastering every level.

To sum it up: game is quite interesting and as such curiosity you could grab it to have a look, but i was unable to finish it - simplistic fighting mechanics are boring and no amount of customisation of character can change that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292561744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1459515770}
review: The combat in this game is very clunky and simple. There's no real strategy to it, you just run up and spam left click to do your combos. You can use a shield but it isn't very useful since it doesn't knock an enemy back when they hit it or stun them. You will often find your strikes missing even though you can clearly see that your weapon hit the enemy. Just assume that your weapon is always half as long as it looks to be. Your enemies are also usually just as fast if not faster than you. Once they get close there's no escaping them, they'll stick to you like a tick until you kill them. That can be pretty annoying when you have to fight groups of enemies at once. I got this for 59 cents and for its time I can see that it would have been a good game but melee combat has become more complex since then. It all feels very dated and is honestly pretty boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033699915', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1459013797}
review:
Good Old Old but Goodies. You know these games which you player years back? When you were a kid or when video games were in their childhood? This is one of these games. Now this means two things. Firstly, if you're looking for a game to tickle your nostalgia, you'll love it. Second if you expect a game up to today's standards, you'll be disappointed.
          Enclave is kind of an adventure/slasher game. Considering its age it holds up surprisingly well. You get to control various characters with various fighting styles and complete levels. As you go you can collect coins and look for hidden ones to unlock rewards.
          The game also offers two campaigns - light and evil. Each campaign has its own version of the missions and its own mirror characters.
          
To sum up, this is a nice old game for anyone who's nostalgic for the past times and for anyone who's willing to put up with the fact that, well, it is old.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091570921', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1462102221}
review:
Enclave is an excelent classic RPG one of "the greats" for me -for its time. Allthou it can be compared with Gothic alot its alot diferent and offers another direction character progretion wise and story wise. Good and rich story and dinamic and interesting gameplay with a dark fantasy tone. The recognizable Main menu with the sreaching steampunk Raven brougth pleasent memories from this game from when it was popular. Allthou it hasnt aged well graphics and  animation wise -it still holds its charm and value as a nostalgia playtrough game and holds alot of replayebility.  In that sense i recomend this game. 

;-}

author: {'steamid': '76561198124237935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1440767522}
review: I have to say... this is really bad. First of all you have exactly one attack. No block, no roll, etc. Just wildly spamming left mouse. Second, this is easy on the hardest mode. Third, this is a TERRIBLE console port. You can't even navigate the menu with your mouse... that's how lazy they were. No real graphics improvements either. Ironically you can't use a controller to play either. They did not make the gold fun to find either, its always just hiding behind the rock you are passing or stairs you are going up. And the saving is automatic at start of level with no checkpoints in between, meaning if you fell off a thin flight of stairs or something, you are stuck repeating the level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983277323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1456778622}
review:
ein gutes und stabiles RPG aus dem Jahre 2003.
Man darf keine zu hohen Anspr√ºche an die Grafik stellen, wenn man das Release-Jahr bedenkt.
Allerdings ist die Spielmechanik sehr fl√ºssig und spricht sofort auf die Befehle des Spielers an.
In einer ganz passablen Elder Scrolls Manier h√§ckselt man sich so durch die Level und sammelt dabei Gold ein um seinen Char aufbesern zu k√∂nnen.
Die Pr√§sentation der Story h√§tte etwas umfangreicher und sch√∂ner ausfallen k√∂nnen, allerdings kann man dem Geschehen einfach folgen und alles wird verst√§ndlich erkl√§rt.
Nach ein paar Stunden des Spielens kann ich das Game aber guten Herzens an Freunde der Monsterjagd empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054192259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1404853885}
