author: {'steamid': '76561198073600298', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1456430546}
review:
Really starting to show its age. 

Enclave is an RPG where you can play both as the good guys and the bad guys in two different campaigns. Its story is slightly boring and not very insteresting, failing to pull me in at all.

Decent amount of classes, but only a few actually do any good. Ranged is king since the combat is so floaty. You get a certain amount of money each level and you can look for optional bonus gold by finding it hidden in spots on the map or certain enemies that are optional to kill which will drop gold upon death.

The combat is really boring and flaky. You just swing and shoot arrows constantly at enemies who dodge them like they know when your shooting. The boss combat is also bland and uninteresting. You also die at random events if you don't watch your every step and checkpoints are pretty few and far between. 

Graphics are average for its age, nothing special to write home about. The levels are neat, being pretty full and there is room for exploration. 

5$ isn't what I would pay for it, wait until its on sale for a dollar or two, but even then I would just put that money towards a better 5$ game.

Personal Rating 1.5/5

Podemos jugar dos campa√±as bien diferenciadas, que juntas dan una duraci√≥n no muy larga, pero suficiente.

Aunque a d√≠a de hoy existen propuestas mucho mejores en todos los sentidos, ser√° recomendable si te gustan √©ste tipo de aventuras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136891928', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1456061235}
review:
Not terrible. But not good.

The combat is a bit clunky, feels like a 4 year old swinging a really heavy stick around. On a plus note, the game runs smooth with little to no framerate loss.

The graphics... Extremely dated.

The sound, basic but nice. Suprisingly it has 7.1 surround support.

I can't really say much more than that. Overall:
6/10 Can recomend to casual gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132503739', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 543, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1455980735}
review:
I thought that this will be a fun game despite of its bad graphics because it's an old game. I was wrong. Actually, i want to finish the game before even reviewing this game, but i can't really stand it anymore.

This game doesn't have any RPG or adventure feeling at all; you have to beat a stage in order to continue the other stage. Your map is limited to the stage and there is nothing to explore at all (except if looking for coin can be called as exploring).

Just as the other reviews said, melee is really a bad choice in this game. Sometimes the hit isn't registering at all, forcing you to take some damage. The swings have a long animation which could render the shield useless because you hardly can use it (unless if you play it slow).

I want to say that bow is a good choice in this game, but sadly, (again), the animation is very slow, not to mention that there are delays between shots. Your walking speed is slow, which means that you can't really use it for a very long time, which is a bad thing. I doubt that there is a head shot though, but i think there is an area where you can deal more damage on the enemy (maybe the head? who knows.)

Well, despite all that, i must say that the environment and sound really create a good atmosphere to the game. You really can feel the environment to the bone. I can't really deny that i somewhat enjoy it up to some point, although it's crumbled with the very poor battle mechanic.

Pros:
- Two campaigns, lots of stages.
- You can choose the difficulty level.
- Multiple characters available.
- Secondary weapon available.
- Great atmosphere.

Cons:
- Long and slow attack animation speed.
- Slow movement speed.
- Bad graphics.
- Auto death in some stage (yes, forced restart) if you fall in a pit or such.
- Camera rotation suck.

I might redo this review when i finished the game. But for the time being, this is how i think about it.

There are tons of better games out there rather than this game. This game might be good in 2003, but it's not in 2016.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978135231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1455666573}
review:
Never mind the 13 year old graphics >> you play the game for the experience, right?  Right.

Pros: 

 - hack n' slash goodness.

Cons:

 - horrible, and I mean HOOORRRRRIBLE gameplay.

 - absolute fail physics, or, the Warrior is completely drunk off his keister and couldn't hit the 
   broadside of a barn with his sword; not sure if it's a hitbox thing, or what, but melee in this game is
   horrendous.
 - Due to the physics fail, the Warrior takes A LOT of damage.  Health potions don't help much.
 - Terrible balance; why do some baddies take one or two hit, and others take 50 to kill?

I feel pretty stupid spending money on this game.  Bleh....

author: {'steamid': '76561198135951756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1446225529}
review:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie 

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Eat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024730417', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1452848881}
review:
This isn't an RPG at all, its a typical hack and slash action game. There has barely any loot accept gold and health pots and very rarely a particular level will reward you with an upgraded item for the various characters you'll unlock as you progress. The combat is a mess with button bashing the par for the game, blocking serves limited purpose as you'll be wildly swinging your weapon around hoping for actual contact with enemies, sometimes it doesn't even register.

The defence Enclave has is its age, its quite old now - but even so, back in 2003 there was RPGS around that did a better job in the third person action rpg genre. Levels are all extremely linear in nature, and some areas are quite confusing and its easy to get lost and frustrated.

Graphics wise, its above par considering its age - this is probably why it got so many positive reviews. But in terms of actual gameplay, its sub-par and the difficulty increases quite rapidly to a point you'll rage over cheap deaths from traps or other stupid game mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026316931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1455473180}
review:
A basic non rpg hack and slash puzzle game with lots of problems and lack of imagination. As for graphics they aren't bad, sound is ok, but gameplay is horrible. You basically get to gather gold coins while you kill some monsters in the "levels" which allow you to pick weapons and armor for your level playthroughs. Combat is as simple as face the monster and push the mouse button until dead. You have range combat which is ok for sniping at the start of encounters that you can snipe, a early headshot gives you extra damage, plus some foes like archers like to sit out of melee range requiring you to use a ranged weapon often.

Now as to the bad parts, the game really is just "go through the level kill any foes that are there and collect gold coins". Thats it. Its like Mario with sword and crossbow. Your goal is to get all the gold coins in the level and finish it, which will unlock other characters to play, and lets you choose better items during each mission beiefing. The bad part about the game is that there isn't really any save points other than start mission-finish mission. If you die during the mission either 1 of 2 things happen. 1, if you didn't reach a "checkpoint" you have to redo the whole mission from start. If you did reach a checkpoint, you rez at the checkpoint, but lose gold, which means you can't collect all the gold coins in the mission which is why you are doing the mission in the first place, thus, making you restart from the beginning.

This is especially annoying in missions where the bad jump mechanics make you fall down a hole and die often, or hit a trap badly, or something else making you pull your hair out having to re-do missions over and over from the very beginning. Sadlly this bad game mechanic made me quit the game very early just gritting my teeth over "hey, we are going to make a badly designed jump mechanic in the game, which by the way will get you killed a lot making you restart that annoying mission where you have bad jump mechanics to die, over and over. Have fun.". 

Sorry, not fun, and I didn't think twice after quitting and deleting the game and moving on to a much better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031081255', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1453985063}
review:
Go to Store (Featured), Click on Games, Narrow by Feature (Steam Trading Cards), Relevance (Lowest Price).
Then skip to Page 9 or 10, until you find the .50 - $1.00 games.
Add them to your Wishlist, games that are a dollar can go on sale and you may be able to purchase for cheap!
A game at .50 may give you that value back in trading cards.
Search and Install "Idle Master" which will run your games even without the game being installed.

I may or may not ever play this game, but some games I have installed and messed around with on a rainy day!
@ .50-$1.00 it's hard not to recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029677022', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1404681507}
review: A simple but very fun Hack-and-slash. The story is a little hard to follow sometimes, and it's not the most rivetting game you'll ever play, but it at least sets the ground for some fun gameplay. Different classes and multiple campaigns give this game fairly good replayability. At $5, it's not a bad deal. When it's on sale, it's undoubtedly worth the price. It's definitely worth at least trying.

review: With nowadays standards this game is horrible. Jumping mechanics are clunky, sometimes you can jump on something sometimes not. Ladders work as they please. Shooting with a bow is a disaster (always choose crossbow). Hit detection is poor - you need to have hope for some numbers to come up. AI is stupid and acts weirdly. What is strange, despite all of this I enjoyed coming back to this game quite a bit. I suppose it is how nostalgia works.

review: The graphics are outstanding for such an old game, and it has a beautiful soundtrack, but the combat is really starting to show it's age. I guess it's an okay buy if you are getting a discount, but I couldn't justify spending the whole 5 dollars to myself if I knew that the combat would feel so repetitive and boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035959001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1454379102}
review:
Enclave doesn't stand out in any one facet of gameplay, but the overall product is decent. While it isn't a game I can see people truly getting invested in, it can certainly be a "pass the time" standby.

As I implied, most of the features are average. A few inventory options, decent graphics, normal story, fairly fluid movement and reasonably intuitive controls.

Overall I'd recommend it for those who aren't expecting a lot, and are looking for a stop-gap solution between games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098781390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1769, 'last_played': 1454337350}
review:
This game is all around average, story, music, combat (meh kinda messy when you try ranged combat). Why i recommend it? Because if you can see through the outdated graphic and play this on hard, you must learn how to control swing attack and positioning for ranged, and after that you actually feel rewarded for right use of your strategy to beat levels. 

Not the best game in the world but is good enough to buy it when is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033247481', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1453986687}
review:
I went in the game with no expectations at all and after lauching it I actually was pleasantly surprisied how similar it looked and fellt like my all time favorites action rpgs.

As much as I tried to enjoy this game, it's just plain broken.

I haven't seen a game this bugged in my life and I've played all bethesda games and AC Unity.

If you move your mouse too fast in this game it completely freaks out and it's very hard not to do so.
Your character begins to move at mach 5 in a random direction and the camera can't keep up with that. I tried to endure this by moving the mouse as slow as possible but in the third mission, where you had to escort a merchant it was imposible for me to do so because I allways fell from the rooftops due to the mach 5 bug.

I tried to use the second class "the huntress" but the ranged combat is just a complete joke. 
It was completely random if I'd hit or not regardless where I aimed at or if the radical was green or red... and the most stupid thing about it is that there's a headshot multiplier and without it you don't deal nearly enough damage to kill the lowest of the enemies.

The enemies bug a lot aswell.
Sometimes they just stand there and do absolutley nothing even when you hit them and sometimes they rund against you and press you INTO a wall where you get stuck and have to leave the game.

Every minute of playing this game I found another hand full of game breaking bugs.

I bought this for 0,64euro so it's not a big loss but don't buy this shit for 5 euro... just don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132799979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1453636644}
review:
+Puro old-style
+Variet√† nei livelli
+Doppiaggio italiano
-la mia balestra?
-Combat system troppo semplice
-Fisica di gioco "pupazzosa"
-Suoni ambientali semplicemente stupidi

Vale poco

La storia sembrerebbe decente, l'impressione √® che abbia la giusta profondit√† e la giusta variet√†; variet√† che ho ritrovato nel design dei livelli fin dove l'ho giocato ma non nel sistema di combattimento che √® davvero troppo semplice visto che ci si limita a tenere il dito sul tasto sx del mouse facendo avanti e indietro nel caso del melee e ha solo un accenno di combattimento a distanza anche se dopo un po' mi √® sparita la balestra senza spiegazioni (un bug probabilmente), non sono andato avanti nel gioco e non posso parlare per gli altri personaggi ma il gioco di per s√© non prometteva nulla di buono e DOVEVO interromperlo.

La grafica √® decente anche se visibilmente datata ma la fisica del gioco √® indegna anche tenendo in considerazione gli anni trascorsi dal suo sviluppo, i nemici saltano come degli stupidi invece di salire delle semplici scale e salgono grosse casse come fossero gradini.

Piuttosto buono il doppiaggio italiano, le voci dei personaggi e della narratrice riescono a coinvolgere il giocatore, falliscono nell'intento i suoni ambientali e le vocine dei nemici non umani che rovinano la sufficienza che avrei potuto dare al comparto sonoro dotato anche di musiche passabili.

Il sistema di salvataggi peggiora l'esperienza, alla propria morte si dovr√† cominciare da capo l'intero livello e non ci sarebbe niente di male se qui e l√† non fossero sparsi eventi che ci uccidono immediatamente come ad esempio il crollo di un ponte.

Vale i 15 centesimi che l'ho pagato ma √® molto facile trovare qualcosa di meglio pur rimanendo sotto l'euro quindi non consiglierei di comprarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012778917', 'num_games_owned': 2877, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1453426221}
review:
This game is really clunky, the characters can be pretty strange when attacking and you can actually take a lot of damage because of that. It is hard to block most of the damages that the enemies do.
The graphics are pretty outdated, since this game is old, but it is actually not bad.
You can have some weapons, but I didn't really notice that much of a change between them.
The story is pretty simple. That can be either good or bad, if you don't mind a simple history with not much depth in it.

Overall, the game is not bad, and it is cheap, if you want you may buy it for an even cheapier price and prove this somewhat of a 'classic' game. It has some things to do in here, like some exploration, that probably will make you get into it for some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012226867', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1521103001}
review:
Nunca he sido demasiado fan de los RPG porque en mi opini√≥n suelen ser o inmensamente grandes, y por tanto apabullantes, o excesivamente nost√°lgicos y simplones, con los peores defectos de los antiguos juegos. Ninguna de estas dos opciones es muy invitadora.

Pero Enclave tiene un equilibrio perfecto, creo yo, y la ambientaci√≥n y gr√°ficos son una buena muestra de ello: nada de excesos, pero sin quedarse corto. 

Lo recomiendo para quien, como yo, no sea muy rolero. A los aficionados a ese g√©nero no ¬¥se si les parecer√° descafeinado o poco ambicioso. A mi me ha cautivado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977158883', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1453055130}
review:
C√≥mo mejorar la estabilidad, poner las voces de los v√≠deos en espa√±ol y aumentar la resoluci√≥n de Enclave:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=594806567

[h1][b]AN√ÅLISIS DE "ENCLAVE":[/b][/H1]

Es la tercera vez que escribo un an√°lisis de Enclave. He de reconocer que los dos primeros eran negativos y con raz√≥n. 

Enclave no es un mal juego, de hecho es bastante entretenido y bonito, pero su sistema de guardado y sobre todo lo inestable que es el juego actualmente (no s√© si debido a los equipos y gr√°ficas modernas o a los nuevos SO), hacen que terminar Enclave sea toda una odisea.

Es un juego que me qued√© con las ganas de probar en su d√≠a y que ahora, en una de las muchas ocasiones en las que lo regalan, he podido jugar por fin.

Gr√°ficamente es muy bonito, luce muy bien, algunos escenarios est√°n muy bien hechos y poseen un dise√±o bastante currado, en ese aspecto ha envejecido bastante bien. 

El modelado de los personajes principales es muy bueno, podemos ir mejor√°ndolos con armaduras nuevas, armamento, pociones, etc. Tenemos una variedad ENORME de personajes que elegir, que iremos desbloqueando conforme vayamos avanzando en la aventura. En un principio solo tenemos uno, pero llegaremos a tener un n√∫mero bastante grande de personajes totalmente diferentes para controlar, cada uno con sus habilidades propias.

El juego no s√© si antes tambi√©n era as√≠, pero en equipos actuales es MUY INESTABLE, constantemente te mandar√° al escritorio sin venir a cuento, sum√°ndole a esto su p√©simo sistema de guardado de partidas que te har√° repetir el nivel desde el principio como no hayas llegado a un punto de control intermedio, que a veces se hace eterno de encontrar (sac√°ndote de tus casillas en m√°s de una ocasi√≥n como me ha sucedido a m√≠), hasta tal punto de haber abandonado el juego en un par de ocasiones. 

Termin√© retom√°ndolo porque como os comentaba antes, es un juego bastante entretenido aunque he de reconocer que he estado a punto de abandonarlo definitivamente antes de terminarlo. 

Los puntos de control repartidos por el nivel mejoran m√≠nimamente este cutre sistema de guardado consolero (en el que si nos matan tendremos que empezar desde el principio si no hemos alcanzado dicho punto de control), pero que de poco servir√°n cuando el juego nos tire al escritorio y tengamos que comenzar desde el principio cada nivel, cosa que pasar√° de forma muy habitual. 

El hecho de haber podido completar la primera campa√±a y jugar la segunda, comprobando que mejora mucho la estabilidad y la calidad del juego conforme vamos avanzando, me ha hecho continuar hasta terminarlo finalmente.

Compar√°ndolo con Blade: Edge of Darkness que es a lo que m√°s me recuerda, Enclave es peor en pr√°cticamente todos y cada uno de los aspectos, aunque tiene escenarios de una gran belleza. Eso no quiere decir que sea un mal juego, pero Blade me pareci√≥ una obra maestra en su d√≠a. Otro juego al que me ha recordado es al genial Rune de Human Head Studios, salvando las distancias.

Un peque√±o resumen con la lista de pros y contras:

[H1][b]PROS:[/b][/H1]

- Gr√°ficamente es muy bonito, visitaremos escenarios muy bellos en los que dar√°n ganas de recrearse

- El modelado de los personajes est√° muy currado, menci√≥n especial a las f√©minas

- Gran variedad de armas

- Est√° traducido y doblado al espa√±ol (adjunto gu√≠a para poner las voces de los v√≠deos tambi√©n en espa√±ol)

- Jugaremos con los dos bandos

- Algunos efectos visuales, como el efecto del agua entre otros

- La destrucci√≥n de los escenarios conforme vamos avanzando es espectacular

- La variedad de personajes a elegir es ENORME

- Tiene dos campa√±as totalmente diferentes

- La banda sonora es bastante buena

- Podemos ir mejorando a nuestro personaje conforme vayamos avanzando en la historia y recolectemos el oro que encontraremos por los distintos niveles

- Tiene cromos Steam

- F√°cil de encontrar de forma gratuita o a un precio muy bajo

[H1][b]CONTRAS:[/b][/H1]

- Muy inestable, constantemente te mandar√° al escritorio

- P√©simo sistema de guardado, te sacar√° de tus casillas repetir una y otra vez un nivel o un mismo recorrido

- Los cutr√≠simos numeritos que salen mientras golpeamos a nuestros rivales indic√°ndonos la 
vida que les hemos quitado

- Control muy tosco, los saltos te pondr√°n de los nervios en m√°s de una ocasi√≥n

- No tiene logros Steam

- Algunos fallos de doblaje

Recomendable solo si lo encuentras gratis o por 1 o 2‚Ç¨ como mucho.

Si mi an√°lisis te ha gustado o te ha servido de ayuda, agradecer√≠a que dejaras un voto positivo para que pueda llegar a m√°s gente. Tambi√©n se agradecen los premios. ¬°Gracias por leerme! No dud√©is en dejar vuestros comentarios o dudas, responder√© lo antes posible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082529997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1453197170}
review:
This game is quite old, and yes, it crashes sometimes (Actually now seems fixed by removing v sync) frame rate is embarassing same is the camera angle, but still I think the game itself is quite enjoyable: Many characters to play with, many weapons, 2 different campaigns. 
The graphics are not that bad for a game of more than 10 years ago, and some effects and plot twists are almost surprising. 
It has even the right level of difficulty. In particular, it is damn hard to find all the coins in all levels, but doing so is unsuitable and annoying 'cause of backtracking. 
I am actually enjoying playing it again after so much time. It was one of the first game in bought as a 11 years old :')

review: Analisando como um jogo de 2003, feito por uma produtora em seu primeiro jogo at√© ent√£o [b]- produtora essa que hoje tem em seu curr√≠culo [i] [u]Syndicate[/u], [u]Payday 2[/u] e [u]The Darkness[/u] [/i]  -[/b] temos um puta jogo de RPG bom, com classes, part√≠culas caindo das paredes EM UM JOGO DE 2003, suporte a 1080p dif√≠cil de achar em jogos antigos e ainda  levando em conta que √© f√°cil consegui-lo de gra√ßa hoje na internet [b]-embora por um 25%OFF j√° vale a compra-[/b] a nota do tio √© 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164699130', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1470, 'last_played': 1452623595}
review: Un action appena sufficiente, ma proprio appena. Ok √® un gioco del 2002 e oggi i difetti vengono pi√π a galla rispetto al passato, tuttavia ci sono lacune inescusabili: il combat system ha le hitbox sballate e i danni spesso senza alcuna logica, il level design √® a dir poco mediocre e spesso si trovano scorciatoie o si raggiungono posti probabilmente non previsti dagli sviluppatori, bug a quintali, IA dei nemici nonsense, collezionabili che spesso vanno persi non per errori nostri ma per errori che il gioco produce da s√® (e vi lascio immaginare quanto sia fastidiosa la cosa), sezioni di salto che ogni volta preghi il santo di turno per farle andare a buon fine, morti improvvise che non riesci a capire come siano potute avvenire.. insomma un po' di beta testing? Se poi ci aggiungiamo che in certi frangenti il gioco √® gi√† punitivo di suo (solo per il gusto di esserlo tra l'altro) direi che complessivamente ne esce con le ossa rotte.. neanche le telecamere mi hanno convinto, ci ho messo qualche ora prima di abituarmi e nonostante ci√≤ ho sempre avuto la sensazione che fossero scomode entrambe. La trama d'altro canto sembrava accettabile ma per qualche strana ragione non ho avuto interesse nel seguirla, ho preferito giocarlo come dungeon crawler prestando particolare attenzione solo alla ricerca dei collezionabili. Doppiaggio italiano ovviamente osceno, come da tradizione. Se volete giocarlo tenete a mente i difetti prima di acquistarlo (o in saldo o niente), se invece non ne avete intenzione tranquilli.. non vi perdete niente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999456374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1453766256}
review:
The medieval fantasy setting is well done, the levels are short, but well designed, the voice acting is pretty good.  Character classes have distinct styles, visually and functionally.  

The money/loot/equip system makes you balance the weapons, armor, and ammo in your loadout, since you can't change it during play, though you can occasionally pick up extra things during a level.

Unfortunately, the age and porting shows on this game.  Melee combat is clunky, blocking is randomly effective, ranged combat is an exercise in frustration.  All the enemies are faster than you but the AI is rudimentary. The menus are keyboard navigation only, an artifact of the porting, I presume. There are occasional unrecoverable errors and CTD's, some of which go away if you change to OpenGL, some if you change back to Direct3D8.

Overall, it's an average game suffering from a mediocre porting.  For a single-player fantasy action/adventure game, it's brief, but decent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060656659', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1451740359}
review:
It's alright, haven't seen any major bugs, combat tends to be a bit finicky but it's pretty good, sometimes the shield feels useless buuut you always get proven wrong, the game can be very very challenging at times, take mission 3 for example. mean fuck those necromancers, I wound up using god mode after a bit because the game was getting to harsh and I just wanted to have fun and I can easily see how much more difficult it can get.

One thing I like however is your gold collection is shared between your races/classes which is quite nice, like you can power through the first like, I unno, 6 or 7 missions as aKnight then you'll have enough gold to instantly kit out a Druid, I have noticed that in certain stages other classes do much better, take that fire level for example, where you get that frost blade, doing that on a druid is difficult, those little fire golems are like 96% resistant to your attacks.

Would be cool to have achivements tho, in regards to cheating it's very limited and all you really have is God Mode and Finish Mission, that's it.

Graphically and mechanically I'd say it's fairly decent for the time it was made, the voice acting in-game (not cutscenes) is pretty weird but eh, sub titles help alot.

The price seems to be spot on for a game such as this, I recomend it if you want a decent medieval game with some nostalgia, I deffinately recomend getting it while it's on sale, it's pretty fun.

review: –û—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω–∞—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞, —Ö–æ—Ç—è –∏ –Ω–µ —Å—Ç–∞–≤—à–∞—è –∫—É–ª—å—Ç–æ–≤–æ–π, –Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–ª—ë–∫—à–∞—è –∫ —Å–µ–±–µ –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–≤–æ–∏–º –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º –∏ –Ω–∞—Å—ã—â–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–æ–π —Ñ–µ–Ω—Ç–µ–∑–∏–π–Ω–æ–≥–æ –º–∏—Ä–∞. –ì–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –æ –Ω–µ–π –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ, –Ω–æ "But that is another story, to be told another time‚Ä¶"

author: {'steamid': '76561198030205911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1452461140}
review:
Einfach klasse, dieser Klassiker.

Habe dieses Spiel damals schon auf PC und Xbox (1) gespielt rauf und runter gespielt.
F√ºr damalige Verh√§ltnisse war es optisch Spitzenklasse, und dabei technisch sehr ausgereift und problemlos auf fast allen Systemen spielbar.

Und siehe da: Es sieht immer noch h√ºbsch aus. Klar, leicht gealtert, aber immer noch sehr ansehnlich.

Und vor allem: Das Gameplay zieht immer noch.
Wunderbar fl√ºssig spielbar, RPG-Motivationselemente, zwei umfangreiche Kampagnen, mehrere unterschiedlich spielbare Charaktere zur Auswahl - alles hier schon drin!

Damals war der gr√∂√üte Kritikpunkt schon der Einsatz von Checkpoints anstatt von freiem Speichern, was sich ja heute wiederum leider praktisch durchgesetzt hat.
Ausserdem  entwickelt die Handlung nicht wirklich sowas wie einen Spannungsbogen; bleibt aber zweckgem√§√ü.

Ansonsten ist es echt klasse, was man da f√ºr ein Preis-Leistungsverh√§ltniss in Sachen Action-Acventure-Spiel bekommt.
Auch f√ºr 2015 noch.

F√ºr mich ist halt auch etwas Nostalgie drin, aber auch neutral betrachtet immer noch ein super Spiel im Gegensatz zu vielen anderen Kulttiteln.

Klare Empfehlung f√ºr alle, die zumindest halbwegs etwas mit dem Fantasy-Setting anfangen k√∂nnen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082698408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1450895416}
review:
Enclave is a very good third-person hack and slash game set in medieval fantasy world.

- Gameplay is fun, can select many different type of characters
- Two campaign, could play the good and evil.
- Graphics is very nice for its time
- Solid combat
- Doesnt require powerful hardware to run

I recommend this game if you like oldschool hack & slash games.

review: A very good third-person action game where you just murder a lot of beings. Very good combat system and gameplay, albeit it's not on the level of Severance's, the game is well worth playing. Great visuals too, albeit audio (voices, sounds and music) is average at best. Story and characters are quite bad too, but who cares anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043667101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1184, 'last_played': 1447947652}
review:
I was playing the demo of this game when it was first released on PC.
Then I thought it was a good game.
Now, after i've completed it, and even after so many years, i think this game is amazing!
Clever and interesting design, surprisingly smart enemies, distinctive player characters - overall feeling of the game - it is just so much more, than you expect.
And then, there is the dark campaign...
It exceeded my expectations in so many ways and i think it, definitely, deserves more recognition and positive feedback from the players.
:enclaveskull:

author: {'steamid': '76561197989421071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 2079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1707317687}
review:
7/10 - An enclave you'll not regret to visit.

Got this game in a bundle and what a pleasant surprise! 

Everything about this game is retro in the best possible way. The map design, the models, the graphics, the effects - it all has that 00s charm from games that made the best out of technical limitations.

++PROS++ 

+The maps are actually pretty small but with every design trick in the book (the one still used for Half-Life maps) you can run around quite long until you've been to every corner. Maps are very diverse from temples, dungeons and caves over castles and even whole villages but due to the small size there are no wilderness areas.

+Combat is rather demanding with melee weapons, bows and spells. Everytime you thought you found a working routine a new kind of enemy or tactical situation makes you throw it over board again.

+There is a lot of action apart from combat, your character can swim, dive, jump ledges, climb ladders, and pull levers. There are several TR-like puzzles and on occassion you can use physics to kill enemies.

+The menu is simple and accessbile and the controls work properly most of the time.

+You get additional characters along the way (who sometimes accompany you in the maps you find them) and you can choose for each new map which cahracter should tackle it

--CONS--

-The game is completely railroaded. Everytime you finish a map,a new one gets available.

- Some of the characters you get to use are pretty useless

- The range of equipment (different for most characters) is very underwhelming and there is actually not much choice how a character is equipped at every stage of the game

- Sound effects are not good, Mostly a torch or waterfall is as loud in the next room as it was standing in front of it only to vanish completely once you're far away enough.

- After a dozen maps or so it gets a little repetetive, I admit I haven't played it to the end.

All in all I had a lot of fun and I can recommend it as one of the games to can play if you just have an hour or two and want some fast&fun action in between.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788488', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1450224202}
review:
[b][i]Enclave[/i][/b] is a fantasy action-adventure game. The rift that separated the Enclave of Magic from the Outlands is slowly closing, and heroes emerge from both sides, either to defend or conquer the Enclave.

[b]Pros[/b]: The game offers two campaigns, first the light campaign where you defend the Enclave from the invaders, and then the dark campaign where you are a minion seeking the glory of conquest. As the story progresses, you find or unlock additional equipment and up to six characters (per campaign) to play as. At the start of each chapters, you get to pick your character and equipment, limited by how much gold you found in each mission. For the most part, you can backtrack as much as you want for each missions, and replay any of them at any time if you missed out on some gold and want to try to do better (allowing you to select more equipment).

[b]Cons[/b]: I don't know why this was tagged as an RPG on Steam, 'cause it sure isn't: you have no stats, no upgrades, no character interaction or dialog choice. You don't even really purchase and manage an inventory, gold serves as "points" that determine how much equipment you can bring in a mission, being able to swap out at full value any item in between chapters. It is a Hack & Slash in the most basic fashion, battles consisting merely of slashing in the wind, only knowing whether you hit anything if damage numbers appear, while the AI is monstrously bad (enemies just jiggle about, only occasionally chasing assuming you don't break line of sight, like passing behind a chair). Voice acting is horrible, the story is rather poor, character progression is absent, and having up-to-date resolution doesn't save the graphics that have aged so badly that most 3D Fantasy early access indie titles are doing better than this blocky 2-Gen-Old world. 

[b]Verdict[/b]: ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ - May it rot in your backlog

It's not horrible, but it is pretty bad by today's standards. I simply cannot get myself invested enough to ever play it again, leave alone complete a playthrough of even the first campaign. Maybe once upon a time it was considered a good game, but I can't see how I could recommend it to anyone, even for the low price.

[quote][b]P.S.[/b]: At the time of my review, there were dozens of Steam Recommendations that were fake, just to raise the score. They all said "gg" or "ggg" with usernames starting by X or ending by XYZ and all had the same account picture (once my review topped the store page for a few months, the fake reviews were removed or altered to make them more subtle). Seriously, dev/fans? You sank so low that you wanted to "cheat" the Steam score to make more sales?[/quote]

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198013735252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1449994530}
review: Enclave is an ARPG that has gone terribly wrong. The "action" portion of this game is a joke, completely mundane and extremely repetitive. If you are a melee character all you do is hold down the mouse to swing your weapon like a mad man (and your attacks will randomly hit or miss), and if you're a ranged character you can shoot enemies from range since the AI is not smart enough to detect you. While attacking you can just keep dancing around your enemies and they have nothing to answer your dance. Furthermore, there is no skill tree or any character customization besides equipping your character with different items at the start of each mission. That's right, there is no continuous character with quests, instead you get a mission selection screen where you can pick a specific character and choose your loadout. You can purchase different items by finding gold, which are all scattered throughout the levels making you run around looking for bags of gold instead of focusing on the action and the combat. Lastly, the story is nothing special and is your generic save our kingdom for the bad guys - easily forgettable. Luckily I was able to get this game for free, and I do not recommend anyone picking this one up when there are much better ARPGs out there!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990289519', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1449866972}
review:
Enclave est un bon jeu d'aventure, un peu simpliste mais avec pas mal de potentiel. D√©bloquant les personnages au fur et √† mesure du jeu, trouvant des armes de mani√®re r√©guli√®re et l'histoire en elle-m√™me assez int√©ressante, le jeu n'est pas un bijou, mais un bon petit jeu sur lequel bloquer un peu quand vous n'avez rien d'autre √† faire. Les graphismes sont loin d'√™tre au top, mais le jeu se rattrape par une petit bande-sonore agr√©able. Avis √† ceux qui veulent juste tuer le temps, et pas aux gros gamer fan de Skyrim.

Note : 5.5/10
Les plus : pas vraiment de syst√®me de qu√™tes, r√©gularit√© des armes et armures et plut√¥t simple.
Les moins : vite ennuyeux, des graphismes √† faire mal aux yeux et peu d'int√©r√™t pour le gros gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120383370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1449274981}
review:
First off, this game is NOT worth full price.  I bought it for $0.50 with a coupon I got from badge crafting, and might have paid $2 or $3 at most for the content.

This game runs fantastically smoothly on my potato and does look fairly good.  However, the controls, especially in combat, feel very inaccurate and inconsistent.  Evclave was basically a hack n slash the way I played it, just attacking continuously except to heal occasionally.  Sometime what you are supposed to do is very vague as well.  I got stuck on the second level because I had no idea what to do, and there weren't really any noticeable pointers toward what ended up being a cannon near me.

Overall, this game is worth it with a discount, but has somewhat aggravating controls.  I'd recommend it if it's cheap because it is worth it when cheap.

review:
Certes le jeu date de 2003, mais fonctionne bien s√ªr les windows r√©cent et on peut monter la r√©solution jusqu'√† 1080, et il est enti√®rement en fran√ßais m√™me si le doublage pr√™t √† rire. La mod√©lisation n'est pas trop mal pour l'√©poque, malgr√© un manque d'animation et les d√©cors sont eus aussi correct. Bref le jeu reste honn√™te  et fonctionnera sur la plupart des config et tout √ßa pour un petit prix.

Cheat Mode

Ouvrez le fichier "environment.cfg" dans le dossier d'installation du jeu ( Steam\steamapps\common\Enclave ) avec un editeur de texte  le Bloc-notes de Windows fera l'affaire .
Ajoutez la ligne suivante CON_ENABLE=1 et sauvegardez le fichier.
Pendant le jeu, appuyez sur ~ pour ouvrir la console.

Voici des cheat codes √† taper dans la console :

(WIN MISSION)Terminer la mission
CG_MENU "CHEATMENU"Invincibilit√©
CMD GIVEALLInventaire plein

review: Very fun game, for what it is. Gameplay is a lot like an early beta of Morrowind or Oblivion, except in 3rd person instead of 1st. Great grab if you can get it for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085979609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1450443771}
review:
I recommend this for hardcore gamers. Gameplay reminds to Blade: The Edge of Darkness (AKA Severance: Blade of Darkness) but with a simplified approach. Graphics are on point despite its age, music its also great. Story is good but nothing mindblowing.

However, Enclave can be overwhelming sometimes since there is no quick save, only checkpoints. Some mission can take hours if you don't take the necessary care or if you made wrong choices.

Still, I found it enjoyable and recommendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095404968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1448970613}
review:
20 minutes in it crashed when I tried to reload a level. But until that happened, I enjoyed the simple controls and gameplay, and it felt more like a baby Skyrim than Morrowind or Minecraft did. If you're looking for a quick fix of third-or-first-person fantasy adventure that can run on your Windows XP with ease, this game will do you good; especially if you got it for free! :D

Just know that not paying your taxes is a serious crime, and the only way to prove your loyalty to the kingdom from there is to stab goblins. The Dre'gatar are grateful for what you have done for the Dre'gatar, servant of the Dre'gatar. Goa'uld.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008050398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1448645032}
review:
[ENG] Seriously, if it wasn't for reading it was released in 2003 i would have no mercy, but let's be objective.
The gameplay is banal without attention to details, the graphic overall is ok (considering the old release date) but the shadows are so bad quality that i'd prefer playing without them. The menu interface is also something really unpleasant, it's rough because it's a scripted video as background, so it results in a real bad interface. Perhaps the storyline could be interesting, but i can't judge the plot because i'm not going to finish this game.
Maybe it's just me, but i find this title so empty, i just don't feel to play it anymore. Just leaving it in background for steam cards.
Guess this is one of those games that only old-gen guys who played it during childhood can enjoy it, in fact i never heard of it.

[ITA] Seriamente, se non era per aver visto la data di pubblicazione del 2003 non avrei avuto nessuna piet√† nel scrivere questa recensione, tuttavia sar√≤ obiettivo.
Trovo il gameplay molto banale e non curato, la grafica tutto sommato (considerando che √® del 2003) √® ok, ma le ombre sono un qualcosa di veramente fatto male che preferirei godermi il titolo senza esse. L'interfaccia del menu √® veramente sgradevole, questo perch√® √® stato impostato un video scriptato come sfondo, risultando in un'interfaccia esteticamente rozza.
Forse la trama sar√† interessante, ma non posso valutarla poich√® non avr√≤ intenzione di finire questo gioco.
Forse sono io, ma trovo questo gioco cos√¨ vuoto, non mi d√† proprio nessuna sensazione, nessuna voglia di continuarlo. Lo lascier√≤ in background solo per le carte di Steam...
Immagino che comunque questo sia uno di quei giochi che solamente i ragazzi della vecchia generazione che magari lo hanno giocato durante l'infanzia possano apprezzarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028099773', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1448771822}
review:
This game is a single player hack and slash 3D fantasy game. Imagine linear skyrim from 2003, mixed with elements of counter strike. You play as a hero you chose, saving your city from invaders. If you want to cut, shoot, burn, corrode, blow up, or squash orcs, goblins, sorcerers, golems and other monsters, this game is for you. After you beat the good side, you can also play as the evil side, taking over the city and cutting, shooting, burning, corroding, blowing up, or squashing humans for a change.

Pros
[list]
[*] Interesting Story, provides backstory
[*] Many classes
[*] Customization
[*] Beautiful Scenery
[*] Amazing physics
[*] Multiple Storylines
[*] Level replayability
[*] Optional first person
[/list]
Neutral
[list]
[*] Checkpoints respawn you as you died, without resetting, leaving the world as it was on death.
[/list]
Cons
[list]
[*] Glitchy Jumping
[/list]

Overall, I really enjoy this game.
Edit: The adware is gone, so you can ignore reviews solely complaining of that.

review:
Bon jeu, graphismes splendides (c'est terrible si l'on dispose d'une machine r√©cente), musiques de haute qualit√©, Enclave √† tout pour plaire !!!! Attention, il ne s'agit pas d'un RPG, mais plut√¥t d'un Diablo like ! Petit b√©mol pour la maniabilit√© parfois hasardeuse et le placement de la cam√©ra lourde lorsqu'on est bloqu√© contre un mur. Un petit conseil. Les seuls d√©fauts de ce jeu sont, √† mon sens : la trop grande lin√©arit√© des qu√™tes (il faut tuer tout ce qui bouge). et le manque de diff√©rence entre les personnages disponibles du sc√©nario lumi√®re et du sc√©nario t√©n√®bre. En effet, on retrouve exactement les m√™mes classes des deux c√¥t√©s avec des noms diff√©rents avec un petit plus, la possibilit√© de passer en 1st/3rd person qui est pratique dans les endroits confin√©es.
Jouez en mode Hard et √©vitez le mode easy, car sinon le jeu est trop facile et se boucle tr√®s vite !

review:
No voy a mentir. Este juego ni siquiera lo he comprado, me lo han regalado. Pero ha sido la cosa mas genial que he jugado esta semana. Es viejo, pero los gr√°ficos no est√°n tan mal, est√°n bastante bien, de hecho (claro, no le llega ni a los talones a los nuevos COD o BF, pero tampoco est√° muy a lo DOOM). Es bastante entretenido, tiene diferentes campa√±as y diferentes personajes para que escojas con el que mas te acomodas. Tiene una gran variedad de misiones y tiene cara de que es largo (llevo casi una hora de juego y a penas voy en la cuarta misi√≥n). Por el momento solo he jugado unos 50~ minutos, en la campa√±a de la luz. En el segundo en que la termine, vengo, cambio mi rese√±a y me pongo a jugar en la campa√±a de la obscuridad. Tambi√©n tiene una historia bien formulada, que me ha llamado la atenci√≥n.

Definitivamente un juego RPG hack n' slash que debes tener.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028018534', 'num_games_owned': 1325, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1446812188}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B0mGH27bNuU

I didn't finish the game, so keep that in mind

Have you ever wanted to like a game, that looks fun and you hope it really is, but in the end you got bored and never finish it? I'm sure you have. This is the case with Enclave for me. After 6 h (around half of the game, I think) I just stop playing it. The game is not bad, but few things I don't like, contribute for my boredom.

For such an old game it have a lot of video options. Resolution, separated menus for graphics and textures, sliders for sound and music and even syncing with refresh rate. Last but not least, you can rebind keys, use a controller, on and of damage number indicator and so on. But make no mistake, the game is ugly, but not unbearably ugly. Graphics didn't age very well, textures are bad, enemies tends to jump really high, levels don't have enough details, but it's an old game, so it's expected. 

The story is simple ‚Äì you have to save the world and it is the worst part of the game. There somewhat interesstig backstory, but the developer didn't capitalized the fun premise. In the end, one can say it is absent. Even other reviews pointed this. It is clich√© fantasy story, not develop enough.

So, next is gameplay. It is where I had some fun and there is a lot to talk about. Here you can find some interesting ideas ‚Äì character classes and fighting system. Let's dive in.

The game have two campaigns ‚Äì Light and Dark. As far as my knowledge, first you have to start with the Light and beat it to unlock the Dark. Enclave is hack 'n slash third-person action game with options for first-person, focusing on strategic combat for melee classes. If you enter thinking that this is similar to Devil May Cry or Dynasty Warriors, you will be killed really fast. The combat is slow and methodical. I think the best comparison is Dark Souls, but probably not that hard. Your shield is valuable as much as your weapons. The game is tough, but I can say with some patience every challenge can be overcome. The character you start is a Knight class. He is using melee weapons primarily. When you enter a battle, it's with your shield raised. You have to keep track of enemy hit patterns to find when is the best time to strike. You have to be patience. Interesting thing here is that size matters. What I mean is you may raise your shield, but your feet and head are not protected. You have to consider where to put it. In the beginning you will encounter short imp-like creatures and lowering the shield is crucial and vice versa. If your characters is short, taller enemies are easy. You can even use the terrain at your advantage, if you manage to get the enemy on higher ground. When using a melee weapon you can do a three hit combo and with every hit your damage increase, but it leaves open for attack. So, it's up to you to decide do more damage or hit once and bring up the shield. It's risk-reward situation. Depending on your movement, you make a different swing with the weapon and this add to the strategic gameplay.

Through the most of my play time, I used the Knight class. At some point I decide to see the other classes. What I found is range classes are boring. The combat with them is like any other third-person shooter and they weren't interesting as melee classes.

Every character have a melee and range weapon, but depending on the class, they are specialize in certain play style, so don't expect Knight class, for example, to get the best range weapons and vice versa. And speaking of classes, they are total of 12, but you don't get them right away, you will unlock them by playing the game. I don't like that. Why? What is the point of that? Unlock them from the beginning. But there is one interesting thing about that. You don't level up by getting XP. You just have to gatter gold for new gear. And since this is the case, the dev decide after each level, for all unlocked classes, you will get additional money, so you can swap character before entering a level and not playing the whole game again. New gear is unlocked by beating a level. This is all it required. They don't have statistic, so i assume, if it's cost more, it's better. Weapons include swords, crossbows, maces, bows, axes and so on. Some classes have can equip additional stuff like bombs, different types of arrows and so on.

One of the things I don't like is the AI. I feel enemies can walk only in a straight line and when get the chance I use this the get them to suicide or to stuck in the environment. The other thing is range enemies. Their projectiles can go through solid surfaces and it was annoying. The third things is the level design. Building after building after building. There are some places like vulcano and small harbor town. Although their design is somewhat diverse, in the end I find it boring and not very inspired.

Enemies are not very creative. Small imp-like creatures, orc without armor, orcs with armor and shield, big ogres, spell casting enemy and so on. But most disappointg are the bosses. I only saw two. They also have uninspired design and they are boring to fight.

Sound design is meh. Noting to remember. Music feels like typical for fantasy game, sound fx are okay and the voice acting is average. Don't expect something groundbreaking or something to remember here.

I'm somewhere in the middle about this game. Although old, there is something to see, something to enjoy. Melee characters are worth playing in my opinion. Everything else is like sound and level design, some of the classes, the AI are average and story ‚Äì completely forgetable. I couldn't bring my self the finish the whole game. I almost reach half of the journey and got bored, so take my opinion with a pinch of salt. Nothing exciting happened during my time with the game. There is enough here that pushed me away, but it still have my cautious recommendation. Get it on sale. Why I recommend it? Because I can see something that others might enjoy, but not me. Melee classes have more interesting play style, than the others. The game is not garbage, I had some fun, but there is nothing here that could hold my attention for a long period of time. Maybe someday I will revist it to see if I can enjoy it more and finish it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015927399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1443633793}
review:
I played this back in 2003 and enjoyed it. Now it's on Steam I had to play it again. So, what did I think?

I really LIKE this game! Graphically it holds up very well by today's standards. Story is ok and interesting enough. Combat... well it's all right but does feel awkward and clunky, especially melee. Probably ok for its time but not now.
NPC's, which are there to help and aid you usually end up doing nothing or getting in the way. AI isn't too bright.
You get to play the game all the way through as a 'Light' character and a 'Dark' character. So you get to play the game twice but it's all different. I like that.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198243760210', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1447349740}
review:
The adware has been gone for a long time now, so don't worry about that. Disregard anyone's negative review if it is soley based upon adware. 

Okay now for the real review, 
Game: Enclave
Dev: StarBreeze
Publisher: Topware

PROS: 

Complex level design

2 campaigns (Light and Dark)

Multiple character choices (classes if you will)

Optional first person mode

Scripted Events

Multiple different kinds of enemies

Challenging but not too challenging (from 1-10 (1 being some rediculously easy kids game and 10 being DARKS SOULS) 
I'd say about a 5)

Headshots insta-kill (enemies without helms, although most of those guys still die from a headshot) (you'd understand why this is a pro if you have played Skyrim)

Different damage for different body parts, hell, you can even hit them in the weapon if you get lucky.

Pricepoint (I mean seriously, only $5)
________________________________________________________________________________
MEHs:

Sounds

Music

Voice acting
________________________________________________________________________________
Cons: 

Topware's main RPG problem, the story isn't great. Most of the plot points don't make sense, like WHY THE HECK AM I IN A FREAKING FIERY VOLCANO PLACE, WIELDING A DANG ICE BLADE... Just why.

No multiplayer.
_________________________________________________________________________________

All in all, an fun game. GO GET IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046869008', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1447125872}
review:
tl;dr version first:

+ Solid graphics that aged pretty well
+ Serviceable music
+ Okay level design

(Yes, the only positives are still just "OK" and not great...)

- Literally everything else:
- Terrible clunky controls
- Overly simplistic and boring combat
- Generic medieval fantasy setting
- Even more generic story
- Voice acting ranges between mediocre to comically bad

Detailed version:

Someone gifted me a free key, so I went in with an open mind and low standards, and... it's still pretty terrible. I absolutely don't mind older games, and still play games from several generations ago and still enjoy them, but this is beyond janky. The controls are atrocious, even for the time. Older games like Soul Reaver and Ocarina of Time still manage to have fluid and serviceable melee combat and character movement and they aren't even necessarily purely combat-driven; this  is a hack-and-slash with little else than combat, yet it moves horribly stiffly, the hack and slash combat is repetitive and boring, and the hitboxes are a total joke. Ranged combat is even worse, aiming is clunky and painful. I didn't even get far enough to try any kind of magic, though I unlocked a druidess (who honestly looked more like a stripper than any kind of priestess or adventurer) but I was too bored to bother continuing.

I don't know why this is tagged as an RPG, this is a hack-and-slash action/adventure game (which isn't necessarily a bad thing, I love those too, but don't go in expecting an RPG); there are no RPG elements such as stats, character progression, looting, story choices, etc. Missions are linear; you buy the best loadout you can afford, and go in (again I don't have a problem with that kind of structure, but don't expect tons of exploration or non-linear progression or anything like that), and levels are short, with okay level design I guess. The only gameplay element are killing boring monsters, sometimes jumping, and picking up gold and keys or flipping switches. Oh yeah, the second mission is an escort mission, and gods help you if the NPC AI decides to walk in straight into the monsters and get himself killed. Because yep, that can happen. Oh, you activated a checkpoint, and died? Cool, you lose a bit of gold, but respawn with everything else exactly as is, which in theory would be fine except... meanwhile monsters are attacking your NPC escort and you've failed the mission before getting back to where you were.  Oops?

Don't waste your time on this mediocrity. Even if you're really really starving for an old-school hack-and-slash game, there are tons of better options out there. Like, say, any of the Ys games, or Dark Souls, Dragon's Dogma, Salt and Sanctuary, hell even the otherwise mediocre Bound By Flame and Lord of the Fallen are still much better than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255378939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1448310774}
review:
Ukonczylem Enclave tylko po stronie dobra. To byla jedna z nielicznych gier ktore naprawde mnie wciagnely. Piekna grafika, i ta MUZYKA tworzyla naprawde wspanialy klimat. Trudnosc walki byla wystarczajaca, jednakze byla zbyt zubozona. Granie naprzyklad takim maiem bylo dosc nuzace. Ani on potezny ani urozmaicony, oplacalo sie wlasciwie grac tylko luczniczka albo rycerzem. W punktach: 

+ grafika 
+ M U Z Y K A 
+ urozmaicone lokacje, zrobione z rozmachem i pomyslowoscia 
+ calkiem ciekawa fabula i intro, dosc ciekawie realizowana jak na taki czysto 'pleyowski' typ gry 
+ bardzo ladnie wymodelowane i zroznicowane przedmioty, z czasem poprostu czuje sie i widzi ze ma sie lepszy sprzet 
+ gra jest nawet calkiem dluga 
+ Taka piekna grafika - a chodzilo jak burza na wysokich detalach na przecietnych sprzetach - enginowy majstersztyk 

- system save'owania 
- trudnosc gry po stronie zla 
- zbyt uproszczony system walki, a takze nie przemyslane wszystkie klasy pod wzgledem skutecznosci (np Mag) 
- brakowalo mi w tym wiekszej ilosci elementow rpg, wiecej wspolczynnikow wiecej charakterystyk postaci

author: {'steamid': '76561198058075753', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1500486794}
review:
All right, Enclave is a very old game, more than 10 years old. But it's a good, old-school, sword-shield hack and slash game. 

You know, the story sucks, voice acting is meh, graphics are outdated. But that's not what counts. That old-school feeling back when we were playing crappy games (but they were their time's BEST of the best), that feeling of controls being a little clunky but somehow also familiar and nice, that feeling. That's what's in this game.

Level design is good. The hitting/shooting/casting effects are satisfying. Story doesn't make sense, but like I said. Killing weird creatures with joy is what counts.

It's $5 anyway. I would say it's worth for a couple days of nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999850394', 'num_games_owned': 899, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1560512334}
review: I was very pleasently surprised by this game. Having played all of the Dragon Age titles, Elder Scrolls Skyrim and other titles in this genre, Enclave still managed to keep it interesting through its plot telling and gameplay. Of course I can not compare it graphically to the above titles, however it does not dissapoint and still has a 'sharp' look. I believe this will be a welcome adition to your collection, specially if you are a fan of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123825216', 'num_games_owned': 2181, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1446868401}
review:
[Positive]
- Really nice GFX
- Nice Sound Effects
- Nice Ambient Music
- Good Story/Movies
- Good Controls (*)
- Good Gameplay
- Trading Cards

[Negative]
- (*) Controller Support totally bugged (But works great with Pinnacle Game Profiler)
- Crashes to Desktop often (To stabilize it, run it from Pinnacle Game Profiles in Admin Mode)
- Steam Overlay bugged (if it works it will CTD, if started from PGP Steam Overlay not accessible)

review:
En primer lugar pongo nota negativa porque me es un 51%-49%

En segundo... no es un mal juego, lo √∫nico es que... no es para m√≠ gusto, una historia muy lineal... los objetos son muy limitados y si no encuentras oro es un poco imposible conseguirlo, tambi√©n hay que tener en cuenta que a partir del tercer y cuarto nivel las cosas se complican con los enemigos... entre que van en bandas y algunos est√°n en el tejado y no bajan ni de broma a no ser que tengas una ballesta o arco... encima llevando tu mejor arma y sin dinero para ballesta (ejemplo, y a m√≠ me ha pasado) es complicado jugar... encima... muchos de mis ataques supongamos 10 espadazos s√≥lo daban en el blanco 4 y eso en dificultad f√°cil (si fuera dif√≠cil... me coger√≠an de las pelotas el primer enemigo...) POR ESO HE PUESTO UNA NOTA NEGATIVA, PORQUE PARA PERSONAS DE MI GUSTO NO CREO QUE LE GUSTEN.

En teor√≠a no es un mal juego, un juego para ese a√±o con esos gr√°ficos (exprimieron bien el gr√°fico a pesar que no exist√≠an gr√°ficos potentes...), una idea, no es excelente porque he jugado a otros juegos de rol mejores que ese y de m√°s antiguedad, buena, una idea buena para lo que cabe.

Recomiendo que os lo compr√©is, rebajan much√≠simo este juego, y encima hay webs que lo regalan, literalmente y es legal.

Saludos

author: {'steamid': '76561198049527900', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1445354623}
review:
Just for the combat alone it's earns a big fat NO vote. I get it that it's old and clunky but there's ''clunky'' and then there's the ''dancing around melees hoping to time the hits to hit them and avoid getting hit''.
There is ALMOST no strategy in clicking attack or raising the shield since from what I have seen your shield doesn't always block and trying to hit enemies that dance around you constantly going back and forth while you do the same to avoid getting hit makes this combat probably the worst I've seen yet in this genre.
At least other ARPGs make the combat dull but functional this piece of work fails in the most basic of foundation.

review:
Bon, au fond, ce jeu est int√©ressant. Il est dynamique, tu tapes tu tapes tu tapes tu tapes tu tapes, et tu trouves √ßa fun.
MAIS MY GOOOOOOOOOOOOOD !!! le noooooombre de fois que je me suis fait tuer soi parce que j'√©tais coinc√© dans les d√©cors, ou parce que y'avait un bug √©trange qui me faisait tomber quelque part, ou le personnage qui continuait dans une direction que je ne voulais pas. Par ailleurs, l'intelligence artificielle est si pourrie, d'un coup t'as les mobs qui sont suuuuuper intelligents, genre qui sautent partout comme dans counter-strike pour √©viter tes coups, et d'un autre c√¥t√©, ils restent plant√©s en attendant que tu les tues...
Bref, c'est un jeu avec √©normement de potentiel, mais non exploit√©. Si vous voulez mettre votre argent au bon endroit, n'achetez pas ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965743021', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1444619982}
review: It's decent. My biggest complaint is how unreliable the combat is. I'll swing my sword through an enemy and not hit probably half the time. The starting crossbow sometimes does 5 damage and sometimes does 120. The Huntress class doesn't start with ANY melee weapon, not even a knife or fists, so you spend your time backpedaling and firing arrows that miss the hitboxes. Since the game is 99% combat this kind of ruins it for me, but maybe I just suck at swinging a sword. If not for that I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997855717', 'num_games_owned': 949, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1444239327}
review:
This is actually a really nice little game with a decent selection of characters over two campaigns. It is old and really not all the complex, but it's got a fun mission-based bite sized approach and the gold system it uses allows for experimenting without being punished. 

Enclave isn't an amazing game, but it is a cheap and surprisingly solid little hack and slasher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117861731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1443640617}
review:
Visuals and music are great, but the generic story line leaves me wanting for more. 

Also, I can't get over the fact that half the time when my weapon passes through an enemy it does nothing. When an enemy attacks me though, his weapon can hit me from way too far. There are plenty of times where a weapon doesn't even make contact with my character, yet I take full damage from that attack.

Hit detection is poor and that's why I've stopped playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149408731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1444160590}
review:
Enclave is an old 2002 game which brought to steam in 2003, exactly 12 years before i played this game.
The game itself is about medieval-style hack and slash game with a great graphic (from 2002 timeline perspective).

I tried to like this game but.... somehow i felt something missing from the game while playing it, something that should be exist in game, enjoyment.

I know it's subjective matter about enjoyment, but even an old game like Crash Team Racing can give me enjoyment while playing it better than this game.

So here are the pros and cons of the game :

Pros :
+ Great and enticing graphic from 2002 game
+ Nice UI game
+ Smooth even in low spec PC (why can't this implemented in any other games? Dev?)
+ Many weapons and armors choices

Cons :
- [b]THE STORY[/b], it's so bland and so obvious. Something that makes this game can't meet its expectation
- Unresponsive control and stiff movements
- Combat system and movement is so dull from 3D perspective. Should make it 2D side scrolling instead
- Not too intelligent Artificial Intelligent (AI)
- still too expensive for and old game (subjective but i got it free from friends lol)

Still, i can't recommend this game for who seeks a great story based hack-and-slash game (because the game itself is trying to be one).
But i if you don't mind about the bland and so-so story, you can try this game.

4/10 because bland story and dull combat movement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014704153', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1444191906}
review:
A game that is surprisingly enjoyable even though old with ugly old graphics. Not bad at all for a game I got for 50cents. If you don't mind ugly graphics and rather sub par combat you're likely to enjoy it.

Has a variety of characters that you can play each mission with though at first you only start with 1 character and get more as you progress. It's important to collect as much gold as possible as in between missions you use it to upgrade characters with better weapons and armour.

And there are two campaigns to play light and dark.

Swapping weapons is so slow. And blocking doesn't seem to work well. 
Sure it's not perfect but I still find it fun and enjoyable.
It's still an ok game, better than some triple A titles. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081780579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1443865166}
review:
Un titolo del passato non troppo conosciuto, ma sicuramente di discreto valore e ottimo da recuperare, soprattutto in saldo.
Pi√π che di un GDR si tratta in tutti i sensi di un onesto action dalle meccanici semplici e immediate, per certi versi pu√≤ ricordare una versione 3D del buon vecchio Golden Axe (con tutto il dovuto rispetto al classico SEGA, il quale rimane certamente superiore).
Buona la scelta di armi e personaggi, discretto il level design, con livelli non troppo lunghi e tutti differenti tra loro. Anche la grafica, nonostante l'et√† sul groppone, fa ancora la sua figura. 
Peccato per qualche bug di troppo nelle collisioni e inspiegabili scelte artistiche (ad esempio il nostro personaggio non ha l'animazione della morte, oppure i boss poco ispirati, quasi aggiunti tanto per far numero).
Insomma, non ci troviamo di fronte ad un capolavoro, tuttavia per chi cerca del sano divertimento con l'intento di mettere in stand by il cervello per qualche ora pu√≤ rivelarsi il titolo giusto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128796075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1444040607}
review: Enclave is a gem of a game from the original X-Box era back in 2003. Its a third or first person medieval fantasy hack and slash with engaging combat and exceptional environments. For the rogue in all us there is a dark campaign where you play as several evil classes like assassin, berserker, lich and sorceress to name a few. If there are any good hearts out there, you also have the light campaign with their human counterpart classes such as knight, huntress, druid, wizard and half-ling. Each campaign lasted me a fun and joyous seven hours. At the start of each level you select your class and assign their equipment from the money you have. Nothing is permanently bought, so if you want expensive armor and a weak weapon with a few potions, you can do it or if zero potions, expensive weapons and armor is more to your liking go for it. The money is never spent, just assigned. These classes, play styles and different equipment go a long way to making each play through different, even if its your twentieth time on a level.
