author: {'steamid': '76561198052495745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1443310880}
review:
First released in 2002 on Microsoft's Xbox, Enclave later witnessed a PC release in 2003. Though Enclave is without a doubt not without its flaws, it's still a very enjoyable game that offers a considerable degree of replay value. 

Enclave picks up after the end of a brutal war between the Kingdom of Celenheim and the forces of the demon lord Vatar, known as the Dreg'Atar. During the final battle between these two warring factions, the wizard Zale gives his life to cast a spell that tears the land asunder, thus preventing the Dreg'Atar from sending reinforcements to aid their main force. One thousand years later however, the rift separating Celenheim from the rest of the land begins to close and Vatar prepares to rise once again to take control of his mighty armies. Although Enclave places little emphasis on character development, the game still manages to present a fairly interesting narrative, driven to a greater degree by the events of the story rather than the characters. Siding with either Celenheim or the forces of the Dreg'Atar outland tribes, you assume control of a collection of nameless characters who are entrusted with important tasks by their leaders, that eventually lead them on a journey across the rift and beyond. Key developments in the plot are depicted primarily through a number of short, in-game cut-scenes. While Enclave's story doesn't do anything spectacular, it does present a few unexpected twists and turns towards the end, resulting in a satisfying and decent plot that gives context to the main characters' actions. 

After choosing a side, the player embarks upon a number of missions that lead them through various locales, including deserted temples, castles, forested areas protected by elemental guardians and virtually every other setting that one might expect to come across in a typical D&D setting. Each mission usually involves getting from A to B whilst collecting gold and defeating the numerous enemies that block your path, in some cases acquiring several key items along the way.

Between missions you'll be given an opportunity to change the selected player character as well as his/her equipment, with the ability to purchase new weapons and armour using the gold collected during missions. Characters are divided into one of three types, including those focusing upon melee attacks, ranged attacks and magic-based attacks. While melee characters are capable of wielding strong melee weapons and shields, their ranged combat skills are somewhat lacking. Ranged characters in comparison are adept in the use of bows, but have no means with which to block enemy attacks, while magic-based characters are able to attack foes from a distance as well as block enemy attacks at the expense of some mana. For the most part this formula works well and the missions feel well-paced with plenty of action, and moments of respite when required. 

Near the end of the game, the unavailability of checkpoints on the highest difficulty setting can become a minor annoyance, as you approach the final portion of a long mission, only for a key character to die, thus forcing you to restart the mission from the very beginning. None of the missions from either of the campaigns are all that long, but it‚Äôs still an issue all the same, if only because it‚Äôs a step in the wrong direction: one that‚Äôs directed towards the introduction of ‚Äòartificial difficulty‚Äô. If you already figured out how to get past a section of a specific level and died during the next section, then why is there any need to repeat the former part of the level? Surely the player should be allowed to re-attempt only the part they failed at, rather than re-doing every area that they already demonstrated they know how to get past. After all, that‚Äôs exactly what happens on the default difficulty level. Repeating portions of a mission you‚Äôve already done doesn‚Äôt add any extra difficulty ‚Äì it just adds padding. A greater issue however is the mission design itself. Some missions are clearly geared towards a certain character, which becomes evident after the fifth failed attempt at making it past the third group of enemies encountered, after choosing a character whom the developers didn't seem to expect anyone to choose for that particular mission. A prime example of this can be seen in the penultimate mission from the Celenheim campaign, in which the player is presented at the start of the level with a powerful melee-focused enemy, as well as a minimum of two ranged combatants who can easily whittle down a magic-based character's mana by forcing them to stop incoming attacks, before reducing their health to zero within mere seconds. Hit detection issues are also present, though this is more noticeable when playing as a ranged character.

Most of the time the AI does a good job of presenting you with clever and fierce adversaries to fight, but on rare occasions enemies will freeze up and stand on the spot until you move past a certain invisible line drawn on the ground. Other times enemies can be easily fooled into committing suicide by walking into environmental hazards. One mission in which this can be put into practice sees the player coming to shore and arriving on a beach guarded by a few ranged combatants. If the player moves close enough to each one, they'll draw their melee weapons and proceed to follow the player wherever they go ‚Äì including into the water, which proves fatal for them (though for some reason, not the player). 

Despite these flaws, Enclave's gameplay is still a very fun and enjoyable experience, and the option of replaying most of the missions as any character from that mission's respective campaign ensures a great deal of replay value, even if this can sometimes present some scenarios that are nearly impossible for certain characters to overcome. Then again, experimenting is fun right? 

Most of the character models are fairly well detailed, though some of the characters' faces are lacking in areas and look too basic in comparison to the rest of the model. Environments also benefit from a high-level of detail and lighting effects, the latter which often create a powerful atmosphere for each setting. Water has been surprisingly well animated and; from a distance; looks fantastic. A scene that stands out as a prime example of this can be found during a mission titled 'The Sanctuary' while staring out towards a lake set against the backdrop of a golden sunset, as the sunlight reflects of the water. 

Enclave features a subtle, if well-crafted soundtrack. Each track lends itself to give each setting a unique feel, even though a number of tracks are re-used for certain missions. Dynamic music adjusts to fit the situation, with its tempo increasing and decreasing when the player is in combat and out of combat respectively. The sounds of bowstrings being drawn, swords clashing and explosions going off all sound as they should. The majority of characters have also been well-voiced, though a few characters seem to have suffered in cases where their voice actor/actress has over-exaggerated and tried too hard. 

Enclave is a game that; despite its flaws; ends up being a relatively solid game with decent gameplay and an interesting plot to back it up. A fun game worth purchasing, even if it is a little rough around the edges.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006077632', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1440167827}
review:
Enclave is a 2002 action game from Starbreeze studios, the studio that went on to develop Chronicles of Riddick, The Darkness, and even Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons. The first few steps of a storied team.

Your first mistake will be to think that this is a roleplaying game in the slightest. It is not. Campaigns are divided into an odd 13 missions (14 for Light), and you begin each one by picking a class and loadout. Collecting gold within levels only increases the amount you can purchase with your persistent loadout. 

This was originally intended as a multiplayer experience, perhaps even solely multiplayer, and it shows. From "You are leaving the mission" messages when you stray too far from the intended game arena, to several "Capture the Castle" missions left wholesale in the Dark Campaign.

For the most part this isn't actually a bad thing. It lends itself positively in some other areas - the variety of playstyles is appreciated, and the open-ended levels (whilst obviously meant to accommodate multiple players) make the levels infinitely more interesting than if they were linear. This has all the trappings of a typical Pandemic title in a single-player only package.

However, your second mistake is to buy this game, because it's terrible. 

It's a real letdown that it is. The graphics are nice - much better than the screenshots let on, with some of the Dark Campaign levels being outright beautiful. The character models are comparable to Fable's in quality and art direction, both of which have aged very well, and even the OST is excellent, with battle music and environmental shifting out of each other seamlessly.

Though the VA is terrible (narrators aside), it's endearingly so, with exaggerated movements to make up for their lack of emoting that only early 3D titles could provide. 

Enclave is terrible because it plays terrible. 

Melee is a wet fish slapping affair, madly bashing the single attack button as you desperately play footsies in a sad display that makes QWOP look elegant, and ranged will see you backpeddle through entire levels as you fish for headshots (along with some hopelessly onesided shootouts against the lazer-sighted AI), In both cases, the hitboxes are completely shot, with both melee and ranged strikes regularly phasing through opponents. Even when you do connect, don't expect any hitstun as you continue dancing like a puppet held by a Parkinson's patient, because this is still a multiplayer title in all but name,

It's a disgrace that makes shovelware indie titles look good by comparison. You feel like you're compensating for lag that isn't there, trying to play by the rapidly shifting rules of this broken shoddy gameplay. 

You shouldn't buy this game, and I don't recommend it. Not because of the "aging graphics", or the pricetag, or even the single save file that gets annoying when your Dark Campaign overwrites the unlocks of your Light Campaign, but because even when compared to its contemporaries, it is an absolute nightmare to actually play.

Enclave, a sloppy start to a long career, belongs to the annals of time. You should move on to greener pastures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053406413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1439818335}
review:
Don't judge this review by my time in steam, I've played alot in non-steam version.
The story is enjoyable albeit not one of the best stories out there.
Combat is pretty fluid.
I like the setting and the crisp graphics for it's time, even now it looks really appealing in my opinion.
The idea of having limited gold and potions is great, you always have to be on the lookout for the gold and potions in levels and not chug countless potions while having unlimited gold, alot of games that are like that are easy.
This game isn't the most difficult either  but it isn't too easy... the difficulty is just right.
 
I played this game in my childhood and never knew that people had kinda mixed thoughs about it (More positive thoughts  than negative which is nice).

The game is also really atmospheric.

There are some bad points in the game -
Paladin is probably the most useful in the Light side and the others are kinda just there, the Dark side is more balanced.

Alot of the Negative reviews are outdated, the game no longer pops up any ads for Raven's Cry so you can enjoy it without ads.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111811875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1578869920}
review: I read weird reviews about how the game tries to make pop-up ads come on, but as I saw myself and as someone else who I saw reviewd this game, it doesn't do that anymore. I don't even know why that's a big deal in the first place. Anyway, this game was kind of fun. It had its moments and it was surprisingly difficult. It suffered from a lot of gameplay and level design issues. At times the game mechancis made the experience frustrating, although in the end the hardest levels were not impossible, but required immense precision and determination in order to overcome the questionable gaming mechanics and level design. Like some other people said before; collecting gold is KEY. It's the only way to have good equipment in the game. Thankfully you can replay levels to collect more gold in order to have better equipment before moving on to the next level. Ther are 14 missions and I missed like 2000 gold, but I was able to get the best equipment for each character. Anyway, it's a good time waster if you wait for it to be on 95% off, like I did. Otherwise I don't think it's worth 4.99.

review:
Do you love to randomly kill goblins?

Do you love to hack and slash your way through hoards of enemies?

Do you like older style graphics?

Do you like bad voice acting?

Then this game is for you!

It is an action RPG that is focused on hack and slash.  While it is fun, it can be frusterating at times, as you will have trouble hitting your foes that are shorter than you, and taking damage over time, without any indicator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186946641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1439397830}
review:
[ITA] Enclave √® quello che √®: un gioco divertente!

Inizialmente scettico sull'acquisto di Enclave, ho deciso di prenderlo in saldo e devo dire che sono i 0,69 cent meglio spesi finora.

Uscito originariamente su Xbox, torna a nuova vita su PC, ahim√® con alcuni problemi di compatibilit√†. Il gioco pu√≤  presentare, con alcune configurazioni, continui crash ingiustificati, che rendono il titolo praticamente ingiocabile, tuttavia eliminando il file "enviroment.cfg" manualmente dalla cartella di gioco, il tutto torna stabile, anche se dovrete fare a meno di quanto c'era di buono nel comparto grafico della conversione per PC.

Tolta questa piccola bega, vi rester√† un titolo divertente, dall'alta rigiocabilit√† grazie alla presenza di due differenti campagne e con ben 8 personaggi giocabili a campagna.

Non √® un gdr, piuttosto √® un hack 'n' slash con componenti platform, impostato come il pi√π classico dei giochi arcade, ossia a livelli. La progressione sar√† lineare, livello dopo livello, con l'aggiunta di alcuni intermezzi filmati di tanto in tanto, che narreranno i progressi della storia. In ogni livello potremo raccogliere monete, che serviranno per potenziare i personaggi, acquistando nuove armi, nuove munizioni e nuove armature. In pi√π, collezionando tutte le monete a disposizione in ciascun livello, verr√† sbloccato l'ultimo, devastante personaggio bonus. 

All'inizio di ciascun livello, potremo scegliere non solo quale personaggio utilizzare, ma anche come affrontare il livello, preparando il suo arsenale.
La differenziazione dei personaggi, anche se a volte sembrer√† solo estetica, √® in realt√† ben bilanciata tra i parametri di resistenza fisica, resistenza alle magie, velocit√† e forza. Anche se questi parametri non saranno quantificabili, giocando vi renderete conto che alcuni livelli possono essere affrontati con pi√π facilit√† selezionando il personaggio giusto.

Il gioco √® localizzato completamente in italiano (audio e video - anche se alcuni filmati sono rimasti doppiati in inglese) e le musiche sono coinvolgenti, delle vere perle.

Il vero problema di Enclave √® proprio nella struttura a livelli, poich√© non √® possibile salvare a proprio piacimento, ma per salvare i progressi sar√† necessario terminare il livello. Alcuni livelli saranno brevi, altri piuttosto lunghi e questo non permette una agevole programmazione delle partite. 
Il livello di difficolt√† sar√† ostico in alcuni punti (soprattutto in modalit√† difficile!), ma nella maggior parte dei livelli saranno presenti dei checkpoint (in realt√† dei semplici punti di respawn) che, una volta raggiunti, saranno attivati ogni volta che morirete, senza limitazioni. Il personaggio sar√† semplicemente teletrasportato all'ultimo checkpoint raggiunto, con l'arsenale e le pozioni disponibili al momento della dipartita. Probabilmente, quando ne vedrete uno, la prima cosa che farete sar√† precipitarvi ad attivarlo!

Consiglio Enclave, √® un titolo che non si pone particolari obiettivi in quando a memorabilit√†, ma fa il suo lavoro: diverte, e parecchio!


[h1]VOTO: 7/10[/h1]

review:

I have not beaten the game, but in my opinion it's not bad, especially for a PS2 re-release.  The combat can get a bit repetitive and difficult to use properly, but the game overall is pretty fun.  If you can get it on sale or are bored out of your mind, Enclave is a  pretty fun title, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend it otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037920209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1205, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1439305171}
review:
[h1]Nice visuals and sound are trying to cover the remaining gaps.[/h1]
The game has more than 10 years, although it is at pretty good technical level. When the game starts, greets us a little rather dynamic and impressive intro, but which fulfills its role as it should be - give the stories being pretext for threshing, which is to take place.  After this introduction, we have to choose side for which we'll be fighting for - good or evil. I chose the path of light (I'm such a thoroughly good man). Interestingly, this choice is important. Because each party has a completely different missions and different course of the game. It is worth to finish the game twice (that's what I did).

After passing each stage we get access to new characters. Accessories, or rather equipment, does not impress anything in particular more fasting RPG fans. Besides, the Enclave is not rpg, although it may give such an impression, especially the world of game, full of mages, orcs and dragons. But returning to the equipment. We have swords, axes, hammers, but also bows or crossbows, ideally proven in the battles at distance. There is also something for the defense - shields and armor.  Everything we gain as you progress in the game. As far as we can afford it ... After each mission in "shop" there are new, better, items, and to buy them, we must have enough gold. Installment system in the world Enclave unfortunately does not exist, so the only solution is to keep your eyes wide open. Gold is scattered throughout the stages - often in various nooks and burrows.

As I said, the game was created a few years ago, but the graphic design looks passably well and still manages to attract the eyes to the screen without feeling disgust. Game menu looks impressive, being a foretaste of what awaits us in the game. Graphics look nothing less than more, as nicely. Textures are highly varied, and also flattering for a single pixel. Also, light effects and shadows have their charm. I must also mention about the interesting animation of monsters (large stock of movements). I have only caveat to NPC's faces. During expression in the cutscenes look like they had founded mask. The movable is only jaw, which gives quite unsightly visual effect. But the water ... the water looks beautiful. It is true that the whole persists to today's productions, but heck, this game is already on his neck showing its age! Soundtrack is another strong element of Enclave. The soundtrack is great, and the sound effects round out the rest.

The game is based roughly on the exploration of stages, which generously dotted with monsters, gold and various necessary to complete the map objects. We have a whole range of enemies. Some may complain about the level of difficulty, because the monsters were waving the weapon incredibly fast and agile. You need to skillfully put tactic, otherwise death will take us quickly. I played at the level of medium, namely the middle, and I have to admit that the level of irritation pierced several times the national average.

The combat system and the game itself falls moderately. The title is linear. Is it negative? I do not know, maybe, but for me not having any meaning. The combat system is extremely simple. Click the mouse and our soldier is attacking what he has in his hands. We will not experience any finesse. Attack, Defense, that's all.

However, this game was able to catch me on a couple of good hours. Somehow I got this game for free. And I'm not sure if it's worth it for the moment these 6 euros. But do not hesitate to buy this game if it will be on promotion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052373347', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1439130606}
review:
They must have fixed the advertizement that everyone is complaining about, but that still doesn't fix the game. The story is lack luster, the voice actors often sound like they are reading straight from the script, and the hit box is all wonky.

The Story
The game feels like a rehashing of a rehashing, there is no inovtaion to the story its just "It's time for good people versus bad people." Right away they open up telling you about the Rift, sort of, all you really get isthe people to one side are the good guys and the other side are the bad guys. Theres some story about a Wizard and a Demon that created the rift but the exposition felt long and the voice over was so terrible it put my dogs to sleep.

The voice acting:
Good God. It's almost like they decided to hand their script of to family members with no prior training and have them read it. Everytime some one speak I feel like I'm watching the original Star Trek and Shatner is playing all the parts. There is frequent pauses, and enflexions on the wrong words changing the meaning of sentences in the worst possible way, somtimes it even goes so far as to have to characters talk over each other; but hey, there's subtitles right? So if all else fails and you can stomache the terrible hit box you can always just read what they're saying instead.

The Hit Box:
I don't even understand how some people think this game is even playable.
The hit box is minimal and if the enemy is backing up, even if that means they are backing up into a wall, there is no box at all. On top of that if you happen to hit something esle first; e.g. a wall, then it will just pass right through the enemy entirely, which is a problem because most of the game you're in a freaking corridor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088373545', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2051, 'last_played': 1606086399}
review:
The adware has been gone for a long time now, so don't worry about that. Disregard anyone's negative review if it is soley based upon adware. 

Okay now for the real review, 
Game: Enclave
Dev: StarBreeze
Publisher: Topware

PROS: 

Complex level design
 
2 campaigns (Light and Dark)

Multiple character choices (classes if you will)

Optional first person mode

Scripted Events

Multiple different kinds of enemies

Challenging but not too challenging (from 1-10 (1 being some rediculously easy kids game and 10 being DARKS SOULS) 
I'd say about a 5)

Headshots insta-kill (enemies without helms, although most of those guys still die from a headshot) (you'd understand why this is a pro if you have played Skyrim)

Different damage for different body parts, hell, you can even hit them in the weapon if you get lucky.

Pricepoint (I mean seriously, only $5)
___________________________________________________________________________________
So-Sos:

Sounds

Music

Voice acting
________________________________________________________________________________
Cons: 

Topware's main RPG problem, the story isn't great. Most of the plot points don't make sense, like WHY THE HECK AM I IN A FREAKING FIERY VOLCANO PLACE, WIELDING A DANG ICE BLADE... Just why.

No multiplayer.
_________________________________________________________________________________

All in all, an fun game. GO GET IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079448928', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1449307534}
review:
I picked this game up off steam for 59p using the left over change in my wallet. i bought it thniking it was going to be one of those poorly made, cheap, crappy games you see lying at the bottom of the store, i was wrong. This game is fun, good looking, and runs great. The game features a wide range of linear missions to choose from including survival mode. each map has verious secrets and hidden places where you can find secret pickups to help aid you. You will spend most of your time exploring the wide path. The game also offers a fair amount of customisation. Their are multiple characters you can choose from, each having thier own abilities. Using the money you collected in the previous missions, you can buy new weapons such as hammers, swords, maces, axes, bows, crossbows. You can also buy new shields, armor and other equipment such as health and other items that you come across in the game. the gameplay is great but aiming the ranged weapons could use some improvement. The game also offers a good challenge. the game can also get very difficult from time to time. The checkpoints are also kind of spaced out too far though, with some mission being around 30-45 minuites long, only one checkpoint is usually placed in that map, making it very fustrating if you die. 

Overall i'm impressed, however, very rarely, the game just instantly closes and quits to the desktop without me doing annything, that can also be very fustrating as the game does not save during missions. 

This game is aging well, it runs well on my high end PC and my cheap, low end laptop. 

Besides that bug, this game is great, its not perfect, but at least its fun. 

Should you pick it up? for under ¬£4, yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981029327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1438744111}
review:
I  never played this game back in the day, and I feel some sort of nostalgia off of it. Maybe because the game design is dated. Mainly due to feeling bare bones, and simple. I'm a few levels in 4, or 5. Each one has been the same so far (which I'm sure the whole game will be) fighting enemy's, running through linear levels, The game is dated. It's still very playable. If you're looking for something simple, and that doesn't require a lot of thought, or time I would recommend it. Especially on sale. I got it for 69 cents btw. The music is good, the graphics are pretty good. 

The biggest thing wrong with this game is I think it can only run on one core. It seems if you have more than one core you have to go into the task manager while the game is running and choose "set affinity" and deselect all cores except one. Otherwise the game will be unplayable, and run really fast with a slight bit of lag. I play it on Vista.

Like I said it's pretty much run through each level, kill enemy's, collect hidden gold, wash, and repeat until bored. The enemy's are the same. Finally got a lava type enemy to deviate away from the orc, hobgoblin thing, and magic witch......

The game is not bad, and it's definitely brings nothing to the table. Back in the day it may of been a cool hack and slash, but now it offers nothing. Only buy it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971548533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1438455915}
review:
Un vieu jeu qui est apparu en 2003 sur Steam, au d√©but j'h√©sitais √©tant donn√© l'√¢ge du jeu, mais j'ai √©t√© agr√©ablement surpris par la qualit√© du jeu,

le jeu est tr√®s fluide, les d√©cors sont asser beau et le son est tr√®s bien aussi...

dans le jeu vous aver la possibilit√© de jouer deux type d'histoire, celui de la lumi√®re ou celui des t√©n√®bres, j'ai tester le c√¥t√© de la lumi√®re, (les deux ou trois premi√®re missions, le choix des armes, des bouclier ou de la magie semble asser diversifier avec le temps,

mais comme ce n'est pas un jeu recent, il ne faut pas s'attendre √† un "Skyrim" ou outre jeu du genre, les combat ne sont pas difficile et les commande du clavier sont tous param√©trable, pour la souris, vous pouver configurer 4 boutons,

pour les voix dans le jeu, il y √† les voix fran√ßaise sauf pour le vid√©o du d√©but qui est en anglais, et bien que certaine femelle aie des voix aga√ßante au moin elle sont en fran√ßais...

le syst√®me du "Physic" est bien fait aussi, tout ce qui tombe le fait de fa√ßon r√©aliste...

√©tant donn√© que le jeu est vieu, et que le prix est bas, et que la qualit√© du jeu est tr√®s bonne (meilleur m√™me que certain jeu r√©cent) et bien ce jeu est une bonne affaire,

il est impossible de sauvegard√© durant le jeu, le jeu ce sauvegarde de lui m√™me apr√®s chaque mission, ce n'est pas un jeu ouvert (vous ne pouver pas vous promener n'importe ou dans le monde, il est lin√©aire, vous faite une mission pour en d√©bloqu√© d'autre, et ainsi de suite et vous pouver reprendre d'ancienne mission...,

dans certaine mission vous aurez des alli√©es avec vous, il ne sont pas tr√®s pratique en combat mais il font de leur mieux ha ha ha

bref, je ne veut pas m'√©terniser, donc je termine en disant que le jeu vaut la peine d'√™tre recommend√© pour ceux qui aime ce rem√©morer les vieux jeux, il n'est pas compliqu√© du tout, mais ne vous attender pas √† un syst√®me complexe...

Ah! oui, dans le jeu vous avez le choix de la cam√©ra, vous pouver jouer soit √† la premi√®re personne, soit √† la troisi√®me, pour le syst√®me d'inventaire, ce n'est pas compliqu√©, vous ne le voyer qu'a l'√©cran principal, vous appuy√© sur une touche pour changer d'objet, ect...,

√† la fin de votre mission, le jeu fait un passage en revue de ce que vous avez trouv√© et de l'or ammas√©...

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 400, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1438699283}
review:
Enclave

[b]POSITIVES[/b]

+ sch√∂n gemachtes Intro
+ durch 16fache Anisotropie und gute Welt- und Charakter-Texturen, sogar heutzutage noch spielbar (damals war diese auf dem PC herausragend)
+ sehr stimmige Soundtracks die sich je nach Kampagne unterscheiden (s.u.), die ich auch unz√§hlige Male beim Pen&Paper noch ein Jahrzehnt sp√§ter benutzt habe
+ passende Soundeffekte die √ºberall zu h√∂ren sind (Schreie, Waffenhall, T√ºrgeklapper, Katapultbeschuss, usw.)
+ deutsche Vollvertonung
+ Physikeffekte (rollende F√§sser, aus W√§nden platzende Steine, usw.)
+ Licht- und Finsternis Kampagne
+ Ego-Perspektive oder R√ºcken-Ansicht
+ mehrere unterschiedliche Helden spielbar (ich glaube es sind jeweils acht pro Seite)
+ sehr geringer Preis (ich bezahlte bei Steam nur 69 Cent!)

[b]NEGATIVES[/b]

- leider muss man erst die Kampagne des Lichts durchgespielt haben, bevor die Kampagne der Finsternis beginnen kann
- technisch und grafisch nat√ºrlich angestaubt (ist halt schon 12 Jahre alt)
- besonders in der Ferne verwaschene Texturen der Landschaft
- stets linearer Levelaufbau mit wenigen Abweichungen
- keine Tastenfunktion f√ºr schnelleres Laufen
- Blutlachen am Boden wirken unecht
- komplette Wandsegmente werden an einigen Stellen des Spiels schwarz wenn man mit der Leuchtfackel dagegen l√§uft (Bug)
- kein freies Speichern sondern nur Speicherpunkte
- keine neuen und st√§rkeren Angriffe erlernbar oder sonstige F√§higkeiten

[b]FAZIT[/b]

Der Vorg√§nger von Knights of the Templar ist ein Action-RPG aus dem Jahre 2003, den ich mir eigentlich nur der Vollst√§ndigkeit halber geholt habe, und weil er gerade im Angebot war (s.o.). Dann habe ich ihn doch einmal gestartet um die Abzeichen zu erhalten und siehe da, das Spiel macht immer noch Bock und wurde offenbar noch ein wenig grafisch √ºberarbeitet. Und wenn ein so altes Spiel nach √ºber 12 Jahren noch immer zu unterhalten wei√ü, dann kann ich daf√ºr trotz einiger zeitgem√§√üer M√§ngel nat√ºrlich nur einen Daumen hoch geben.

Wenn ihr an weiteren Reviews von mir interessiert seid, dann folgt meiner [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10868887-Dark-Chummer%27s-Reviews/?appid=63110]Gruppe[/url].

review: Well first of all, it is not about THAT Enclave, and game's story is totally not it's strongest part. Combat part of the game is pretty solid, it does not have that depth of Dark Messiah, but it comes with variety, because each character got different fighting style. Though knight is supposed to be "tanky", he does not feel "tanky" at all. Also like 90% of enemies are smaller than him, so he got a problem with hitting enemies.  In any case, game is alright for it's age and price, but there is nothing great or challenging about it, though collecting all gold is not that easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075807249', 'num_games_owned': 4290, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1441355996}
review:
I got this game for free off of DLH. It's a very old game (2002), and I'm mindful of that. It doesn't even seem to register that my mouse is there. My mouse is a Logitech (#1 brand, mind you) track ball. I'm fairly sure I bought it circa 2004. I've heard about the game having issues with newer laser mice, but with an eleven-year-old (optical) trackball? This thing works fine with DOS games, Win16 games, DirectX, Flash games, you name it. If a game can't deal with my aging USB mouse, there's probably something fairly wrong with said game.

* My trackball IS attached to my keyboard's inbuilt USB hub, that's the only rationale I can imagine. Thing is, with the game being published in 2002, it HAS TO be a Windows app and not the last of the DOS games, right? Anyways, I'm uninstalling and giving it a thumbs down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120182167', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1438039023}
review:
Lo tengo s√≥lo porque regalaban keys en una web.

Vale, el juego es antiguo, se esperaban gr√°ficos de la √©poca, ese no es el problema, el problema est√° en lo siguiente:

- Mal sistema de combate. O "bloqueas" o pegas, nada de contraataques o esquivar ataques.
- La √∫nica progresi√≥n de personaje que hay es comprar una u otra arma / escudo / flechas. Objetos sin estadisticas ni nada que te de una idea de cual es mejor o peor.
- Es bastante monotono. Puedes variar entre personajes que vas desbloqueando a medida que vas jugando, pero nada m√°s, lo que viene a ser un cambio de skin y poco m√°s.

Pens√© que ser√≠a un juego antiguo, pero potable al cual dedicarle unas cuantas horas de aburrimiento, pero no ha sido el caso.

No lo recomiendo ni regalado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089105910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1436586146}
review:
[h1] Enclave [/h1]

[Warning: Long review]

[b]  Enclave is a third-person action game in which you can play as part of either the good or evil armies in an epic fantasy conflict. Though you'll begin on either side with a single playable character, you'll later rescue or unlock other character classes with various melee, ranged, or magic-based attacks that they can use to defeat their enemies.

But fighting isn't very precise, or very fun, in Enclave, since the game has unreliable hit detection; sometimes arrows and swords will pass right through your enemies, and your enemies' attacks will occasionally fly right through your shield (if you're carrying one) and damage you. In addition, your characters generally don't fight very quickly; most ranged weapons take a while to reload, and most melee attacks consist of a series of slow-moving, preset animations that take a while to conclude and leave you vulnerable to a counterattack. And most of Enclave's characters don't move very quickly either, so you can basically expect to take hits from your enemies no matter what, especially when multiple enemies swarm you (as they often do in later levels of the game). Your character can pick up and drink health potions, but you'll do this just as slowly as you fight, run, or change weapons, so this can be of limited use in small areas crowded by multiple enemies.

Enclave was an extremely difficult game on the Xbox, and its difficulty has been toned down in the PC version so that enemies don't kill you with a single blow, but you'll still suffer severe damage when hit by unseen traps for the first time, and you'll most likely find the game's limited save-game system to be frustrating. You can save only at predetermined safe areas, which, in certain levels, are few and far between. Make a wrong move or get mobbed by too many enemies, and you'll be sent all the way back to your previous save point. In addition, Enclave's levels, while not particularly huge, are still fairly big and will often require you to backtrack through them several times. It's safe to say that Enclave would have been a much less frustrating game to play if it had featured both a better save-game system and an in-game map. Enclave isn't a particularly lengthy game otherwise, and since it has no multiplayer options, you may not get much out of the game in the long run.

In many of the game's levels, you'll need to backtrack to find a particular item or enemy or to lead a computer-controlled companion to a specific goal area. Unfortunately, Enclave's AI for both allies and enemies is inconsistent and occasionally quite bad. Any allies you must lead or escort through a level will stop dead in their tracks if faced with even a small obstacle. There's no way to issue any commands to your allies, so you'll often have to leave them behind, even if they were supposed to help you fight your way through the level.

The enemy AI is usually good about attacking you when you come within range, and some enemies will even taunt you when they have you outnumbered. However, some enemies will get stuck on environmental objects as they try to follow you around them, and other times, if you back away from them a short distance, they'll simply stand still for no good reason. When this happens, they're easier to pick off than when they mob your slow-moving character who's poorly equipped to handle attacks from all sides, but the game's unreliable AI and equally unreliable control make for fights that are mostly unsatisfying.

It's too bad that Enclave has these problems, because its presentation is otherwise quite impressive. The game's sound effects and voice acting are passable, but you may be too busy paying attention to Enclave's great soundtrack to notice. The game's somber, oppressive music does a great job of providing atmosphere for Enclave's often-dark, gothic fantasy setting (which consists of dimly lit fortresses, secret passages, and ancient temples of evil, among other things).

 Enclave also looks extremely good. Though it was originally developed for Microsoft's Xbox console, it holds up quite well on the PC. Even though the game's textures begin to show seams and jagged edges if you play the game at resolutions of 1024x768 or higher, the quality of Enclave's graphics and design is unmistakable. The game's developers clearly put a lot of effort into creating the detailed textures that adorn its levels and its highly detailed characters, who speak with animated facial expressions in the in-engine cutscenes. Though many of the game's levels consist of generic-seeming fantasy locales, such as a dungeon, a temple, and a medieval town, their good texture work and lighting, especially shadows cast from torchlight, make even the most run-down areas look good. In fact, some of Enclave's environments look surprisingly original, even artistic, such as an abandoned sorceress's lair that's filled with both deadly traps and breakable glass cages of fluttering butterflies.

Though the game's developers clearly put a lot of work into the way the game looks and sounds, Enclave's gameplay just doesn't measure up to its presentation. If you do pick up a copy of the game, you'll probably appreciate Enclave's sound and graphics, but you may also find that the game itself has too many problems to be enjoyable for long. Enemy AI in this game was quite well done; a challenge to play against and that is what Starbreeze Studios needed to do with this game, is make a challenging AI. The AI is quite clever. Enemy archers will draw their blades for close quarters combat and take cover during reloads. Enemy soldiers will draw their shields to defend against your arrows. Overall the AI provides for challenging opponents in the game. [/b]

Sorry for this really long review XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198186861303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1435423587}
review:
I cannot, in good faith, reccomend this game to anyone. DO NOT BUY THIS FOR FULL PRICE.
This game... It's basically a mixture between click-to-win simulator and resident evil's voice acting. Combine that with crossbows basically asking you to 360 noscope in order to fucking hit someone, and you have a jolly old time.
Pros:

-It plays! Hasn't crashed once...

-Enemy variety, you verse literally the same 3 orc things until level 3, then you go up against a shit ton of random people

-FMV has gamecube graphics

-Music only makes me want to kill someone after an hour

-Theres customization? (after level 2, you can spend gold to get better weapons, but via shitty menu)

Cons:

-THIS GAME TAKES ITSELF WAY TOO SERIOUSLY. It'd be funny to watch if I wasn't busy-

-CLICKING TO WIN. This game's combat consists of swing sword until enemy dies, pull out your crossbow to try to shoot someone you can't swing your sword at, and jumping sometimes to vary the combat. Rinse and repeat.

-Cutscenes are "beautiful"

-The story consists of Oblivian's "break out of a dungeon" trope mixed with doing stuff for the queen

-Did mention the voice acting? It's nothing to shake a Jill sandwhich at, I can tell you

-Cheap deaths from random ass pitfalls cause you to restart the entire level

-Enemy AI consists of charging at you, then halo jumping away. Unless you go up against a ranged enemy, then its stay put until they try to shoot you, then spasm the fuck around until they reload and attempt another shot.

Overall I'd give this game a

Atleast its not Bad Rats/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198057675136', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1435270887}
review:
I don't know about the adware other people have been getting, as I haven't gotten it yet. So I will just point out that either the adware has been removed or I have a glitch, so the adware will not have an affect on my review.

So, get this out of the way before the rest happens: The menu is ugly. However, that's the menu. In game, the graphics are good for a 12 year old game. Don't expect any nice landscapes, however. You're essentially closed in all the time, and everything is pretty linear.

I got the game for free from somewhere. I noticed my friend had the game and asked him how good it was while it was downloading, and he said it was meh. When I got in, I played the first two missions, and thought it would get boring quickly as the only thing that was happening was I was running around with a sword and crossbow. I was hoping that wasn't it, but I uninstalled the game.

I came back to the game today because I noticed it had trading cards and I figured I might as well play a bit and get some money. I played the first two missions, but noticed that when I finished the second mission I unlocked a new character called the huntress. I played with her. The only difference between them is instead of having a sword and shield she could have a bow and crossbow, however the knight could already have a crossbow and the huntress could have a dagger. While I was glad there was another character and was expecting more, the huntress really wasn't worth it. And up to this point, the combat has been pretty much the same. 

I played and unlocked a new character, the druid, which involves magic! She has 3 staffs, of which 2 are the same rapid fire and one is a charge up and summon. One of the rapid fire staves can poison but is very expensive (all equipment you take with you is limited by your money) and you can't either other staff, so it's better to go with the cheaper rapid fire and the summon. However, having the summon and rapid fire shot is interesting for gameplay, as it does mean there are different gameplay styles. The druid, while having massive damage, takes damage very quickly.

I just finished playing and to my surprise- there was a boss! The boss can't exactly be damaged just by hitting it, but there is a different way you are supposed to do it. So the bosses aren't just dodge and hit, but they are more zelda style bosses. The only issue is that while fighting the boss there is no indication of wether or not you are actually doing anything until you do it quite a bit, and then he starts changing color so you know you're doing the right thing.

I also unlocked the engineer, who seems like he'll have an interesting gameplay style as well!

Overall, this game is quite fun. Worth $5? I would say so, as long as you're fine with not-so-amazing graphics (they are decent) and being mostly closed in all the time. If you want something better, an open world game might be more for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158569389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1434646959}
review: I have to say... this is really bad. First of all you have exactly one attack. No block, no roll, etc. Just wildly spamming left mouse. Second, this is easy on the hardest mode. Third, this is a TERRIBLE console port. You can't even navigate the menu with your mouse... that's how lazy they were. No real graphics improvements either. Ironically you can't use a controller to play either. They did not make the gold fun to find either, its always just hiding behind the rock you are passing or stairs you are going up. And the saving is automatic at start of level with no checkpoints in between, meaning if you fell off a thin flight of stairs or something, you are stuck repeating the level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233287988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1558842289}
review:
Scripted within an ancient tome, which lies beneath centuries of dust in the guarded library of Meckalon, is the story of how I began playing this game.

I grew up on this classic hack and slash, played it for years. If you're a fan of an engaging lore, descriptive graphics, cool weapons, even cooler characters, and smooth controls, then this game is for you. Yeah sure the graphics are extremely outdated but for a game made in the early 2000s its pretty good. There is an xbox version of this game but compared to that the controls on this PC version are a LOT easier to work with. I do like the walk feature on the xbox though. And you won't have to worry about having certain requirements with a game like this. I ran this on a Compaq Presario CQ62 late last year running Windows 7 on a 32-bit system, before switching to my current 64-bit Windows 8 Toshiba.

And as someone who recently bought and played the game, I can confirm that the adware HAS been removed. However I've played this game for almost half an hour and I haven't received any trading cards yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129257148', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1434378488}
review:
[b]Mechanics[/b]
Have you ever swung a sword in a zero-grav environment? Well it feels that way, You do get used to it super fast and it's easy to look past.
The movement/Mouse movement is actually really decent and better than I expected.

[b]Graphics & Sounds[/b]
The graphics are amazing for a game port that's over 10 years old! I personally adore the art/graphic styles.
The shading is nice, the blood, and the enemies look nice as well! I'm actually very pleased with the "new" feel to it.
The only issue with the graphics I have is they seem to degrade during cutscenes.
I also dislike how the main menu screen is in a 4:3 ratio though if you have a 1080p res.
The sounds are perfectly okay in my book for the type of game/way it was put together.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
The story so far is nice and enjoyable, however it is very easy to get lost and no real indication that certain environment elements can harm you. (Which I love that, but I'd like a tiny heads up.)
I spent my time feeling like I was playing a maze game running around trying to find the next area to enter. (I could just be blind.)
I also find it funny that the goblins speak Swedish.

[b]Overall[/b]
For 5$ it's worth it, I'm enjoying it and I'll be returning to playing it shortly for the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042073132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1433913283}
review:
Unless you're EXTREMELY bored, or have access to a time machine, DON'T BUY THIS GAME.

Pros: 
-Lots of characters to choose from.
-Can play as Light Side or Dark Side.

Cons: 
- Only the Knight, and Druid classes are good. (Only after Darkness Staff)
- Can only play Dark Side after suffering through the Light Side.
- Terrible writing / story.
- Clunky fighting, a lot of aimless swinging.
- Terrible writing / story. I really can't get over this.

I love RPGs of all shapes, sizes, and ages.  While this one was great for the first 20 minutes. There's no real story to get behind, and the combat is surely not worth it to play. Might be worth picking up if you want to take what little time you have on this Earth, and spend it rolling around in this shit that is an RPG.

review:

La qu√™te d'un chevalier pour lib√©rer le royaume de Celenheim des guerriers de Dreg' Atar. Enclave se d√©roule dans un univers m√©di√©val enchanteur. Des personnages √©tranges, gobelin, sorci√®re, berseker, druide, ing√©nieur et d'autres s'ajoutent au rythme de l'aventure. 

Un jeu d'action avec vue √† la premi√®re et troisi√®me personne selon votre choix. Un arsenal vari√©, arbal√®te, arme blanche, bouclier, grenade, pi√®ge et plus encore. Organiser votre riposte en changeant de combattant pour l'adapter contre l'ennemi. Un gameplay efficace et facile √† prendre en main.

Une r√©alisation sans faille contenant un roman histoire original et une bande son collant √† l'√©poque gothique. Un graphisme aux textures magnifiques et des cin√©matiques de premier plan.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976867030', 'num_games_owned': 898, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1433391115}
review:
I really wanted to like this game, sadly it's not the case. For this price I'd say go ahead and try it out but don't expect too much.

Let's begin with the good sides :

+ The graphics are really nice looking. I'm not being sarcastic^^, it's dated of course but it aged very well
+ Lots of secrets areas to discover, exploration while limited is rewarded
+ Two campaigns (Light and Dark)
+ Multiples characters and weapon unlocked during the game
+ The gameplay is kinda fun I guess, when it's not frustrating (we'll get to that in a minute)
+ Targeted damages
+ Some ideas are really cool like the fact you can shoot multiples arrows from your bow (even if I didn't understand how it works exactly and ended up wasting a lot of arrows), so I'll see which other games this studio has made, they might be cool if they improved from this one (Edit: Actually, they did good games after that! https://www.wikiwand.com/en/Starbreeze_Studios ).

And now for the bad sides. These are small gripes that adds up and make the game really frustrating to play in the end :

- Combats (especially melee) feels really clunky with no sense of impact. If it wasn't for the damage counts displayed over enemies and player, I wouldn't even know when I hit or being hit. 
In melee, you just mash your mouse in hope to hit the enemies, there is absolutely 0 strategy involved
When ranged, you wait for your bow/crossbow to be loaded, then you shoot to see the enemy move at that exact moment, back to the waiting... It's infuriating when you have to shoot an archer on a roof.
Sometimes, when an enemy is too close to you, the arrow pass right through its body without dealing any damage
- Switching weapons takes forever
- No sense of achievement when you kill an enemy because there's no XP, loot (usually) or anything -> ok, this one depends on your tastes. I feel like the game would have benefited from some minor RPG elements
- Escort missions that you lose if the NPC gets killed
- Once you lose a mission, you have to restart it all over again, which isn't fun one bit... I'm not against difficulty but the combats feels so random that I don't feel like I learn from my errors or something, it just feels like I have to start over for no reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081429170', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1486856284}
review:
Oh, man, the stories behind this old goldie. I discovered this game way back, introduced to it by my brother, and it has remained one of my absolute favorite games from the 2000's. The story, the lore, the missions and fighting, and the incredible appearance of everything made this a game I treasure.

There are quite a few easter eggs and hidden treasures, and a unique feature: you can play as both Light and Dark, with the missions reflecting each other. Overall, astounding for its time, and I can't believe it still holds up today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116098403', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1433202770}
review:
I'm surprisingly shocked at how much I enjoy this game. 

about the adware thing.
All the negative reviews talk about some kind of webpage that opens at the start of the game (not a virus just an advert popup from what people have said). i checked the forums and people were saying it had been removed so i risked it and bought the game. I thought for the low sale price i might as well, When I opened the game there was no adverts or web page that opened so they must have removed it. it's a shame that  such a good game is let down by a mistake someone has now fixed.

the actual gameplay review:

The gameplay is excellent. for me the story plot is the interesting part of this game I find myself wanting to know what has happened and the game really does feel immersive. the game controls and actions are ok but not the best mallee attack are pretty solid along with the block move but the ranged move are a little shaky, no where near as bad as some people in other reviews have made them out to be however. 

The actual game characters aren't the best, the first character seems good and well made but the female characters like the druid and the second character you get the huntress i think it is are not as good as they could have been. the main problem I have with them is the action noises they make, it sounds like a child sighing, but to be honest that seems to be as bad as it gets.

It seems to me that this is an ok game. It‚Äôs just been let down because the game creators annoyed everyone by advertising other games in the actual game which is no longer the case because they fixed that. they are probably trying to boost positive reviews by making the game so cheap and fix the bad reviews but bugger it, it's a good game I got it for about ¬£0.60 so I can‚Äôt complain.

I just noticed the price just went up to ¬£3.99 while I was writing this. I would still recommend it at that price for people, now I know what the game is  like,

author: {'steamid': '76561197968716621', 'num_games_owned': 1563, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1526071148}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lu7aXMqY5Hc

One of the best 3rd person hack and slash games ever made. Sure it's clunky now and the graphics are a bit outdated but the fun is still there. Tear through the single player campaign with verve as you mow down monsters with ever increasing weapons, shields and addons.

The game can be had for cheap (right now it's -86% so about 0,69 euros) and it really is worth the money. You'll get hours and hours of fun out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097546875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1433532908}
review:
I haven't played it for long but it seems decent so far. I was a bit worried reading some of the reviews before I bought it, but I haven't experienced the supposed "adware" problem people are talking about. Graphics are better than I would have expected from a 2003 game (a bit better than Fable: Lost Chapters). So far the gameplay is moderately enjoyable, mechanics pretty easy, but not stupidly simplified. Can't say much about the story yet, but it does seem rather dumbed down lore-wise, and nothing too original in that respect. 
I would recommend this game if it is on for a sale price (I paid C 0.76$) but when it goes back to 5$, you could probably find something better.
But hey, I'm just a weird person who likes Two Worlds more than Dead Space.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960759094', 'num_games_owned': 1256, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1554, 'last_played': 1653640340}
review:
Considering the release date of this game early 2003,u have a very nice graphic, ton of character to choose from,many weapons and items. Starting with hunter,assassin, with Bow and crossbow (at least 6 type each),to berseker, Soldier class with many types of sword, axes and hammer..finishing with druid and wizards class.with many types of staves with different effects and powers. ah u can choose class like engineer and the equivalent dark classes if u wanna use Bombs and Molotov. U need to find some ore and gems in the levels to please the need of money and with that  buy new powerful weapons and armor.
There are 2 campaign, the light campaign and , and this is the geniality , after completing the light u can play as the bad guy, in the dark campaign..with same clases with different looks!!
Combat melee could be a little better regarding Hit detection and moves..it's to simple, but archery is satisfying.
exploring the levels u can find some bonus maps that unlocks some Arena mode (3 levels of difficulty) where u have to kill all the enemies and earn some money.
Considering this game costs  near to nothing it's a must buy, story is good too. 
i hope the sequel which was in plans years ago,will be finally released sooner or later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037603856', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1432765057}
review:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!!! It is a generic third person hack and slash that is only fun for the first level. Which only lasts about five minutes. To try and redeem itself the third level is... an escort mission. Escort missions are terrible, no one likes them, and this one is the worst. The merchant you have to protect takes insane amounts of damage from one enemy, and you are too far away to do anything about it because you move so slow. If you try to shoot at the enemy, good luck. All of the attacks only hit when they want to, and even then. The basic crossbow barely does any damage to the first enemies of the game.

All in all. don't buy this game, even at 69 cents it's not worth anything close to that, and to think they are asking five dollars for the normal price is appalling. During the Christmas sale you can usually get Skyrim for seven dollars.

Whatever you choose to do. Do not buy this game. It doesn't take much effort to figure out why this game is on sale for so little.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093593620', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1432647854}
review:
Le peu que j'ai joue a reussi a me saouler.
Je n'ai pas fini le jeu et ne compte pas le finir parce qu'honnetement le peu que j'ai joue m'a largement suffit je me suis ennuye pendant toute la duree.
Je sais que ce jeu a deja plus de 10 ans, mais il y a 10 ans on savait deja faire des bons rpgs non ?
Le principal defaut de ce jeu contrairement a ce dont on pourrait s'attendre pour un jeu de cet age la ne sont pas les graphismes (qui sont tres beau pour l'epoque) mais plutot les doublages (honnetement ce sont les pires doublages que j'ai entendu de ma vie (ou presque), je sais que des tas de jeu ont des doublages pourris mais moi je trouve que pour un rpg c'est vraiment handicapant) 
L'histoire  n'est pas originale du tout (vous etes un prisonnier, la ville est assieg√©e et vous vous echappez butez les mechants et vous engager a aider la famille royale a tuer les mechants etc.).
Et en fait meme le gameplay est nul (les ennemis sont supers cons pour la plupart et il suffit de parer/taper et on ne prend aucun dommage meme skyrim en difficulte debutant est plus dure)

Finalement le meilleur point du jeu c'est quand meme ... les graphismes.
Heuresement que j'ai eu ce jeu gratuitement sinon ca aurait √©t√© de l'argent gach√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061740176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1431128333}
review:
Let me start by saying, I REALLY tried to like this game. And at first? I loved it. Enclave is an action-based RPG where you hack and slash your way through levels (depending on your class) all while collecting gold so you can afford better gear at a shop you visit in-between levels. Collecting gold is HUGELY important. In later levels archers are OP with their damage and warriors are brutally tanky. You NEED to collect gold otherwise you stand no chance. Let me also state one thing. 

THERE IS NO ADWARE IN THIS GAME. THESE MANY REVIEWS THAT SAY SO ARE OLD, AND HAVE NOT CHANGED EVEN THOUGH THE ADWARE HAS BEEN REMOVED. 

So what does this game have going for it?
+From 2002 I never would have expected these kinds of graphics. 
+The soundtrack is amazing. 
+And the sound effects aren't too shabby either. 
+The level design and placement of enemies is genius.
+The destruction in this game is fantastic. In buildings during sieges the roof can fall on your head, fatally damaging you. You can slash the beam of a wooden watch tower and bring it falling to the ground. Crates can be broken into flying pieces by explosives that are essentially flying wooden weapons.

UNFORTUNATELY.
-The story is really...bland. A 3 year old that watched lord of the rings could have thought this story up.
-The enemies are very generic and repetitive. Again, a 3 year old that watched lord of the rings could have created these extremely generic characters.
-The voice acting is mediocre. 
-The AI is nonsensical is how it acts. Enemies are jumping and breakdancing all over the place while you're supposed to be in a serious fight.
-The combat. The core element of ARPGs, the COMBAT. Is the worst combat I have ever seen in an RPG in my entire life.  Ranged weapons work around a little dot you see in the center of your screen. Place it over an enemy and shoot, and you hit. Miss by an inch and you miss completely. It's pathetic. The melee combat is even worse. You just spam left mouse click to swing a sword aimlessly, missing tiny enemies completely unless you can get down to their level most of the time. Your shield is basically useless because there's a delay between raising it and lowering it that you could have used to get attacks in, that your enemies WILL use to attack you. The swordplay is also very unresponsive. I mouse click twice and suddenly my character is doing a 4-move sword swinging fiasco while I'm right clicking and trying to raise my shield. So an enemy pummels me while my character is having fun being some kind of sword dancer.

Even if you get this for free like I did I would not recommend playing it. Maybe this kind of gameplay was good in an ARPG once, but at the same time, RUNESCAPE had better combat than this. So I could never condone a game that flops on its main element so badly. STAY AWAY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028263156', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 1515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1566511790}
review:
An underrated game with beautiful narration and cutscenes. 

You will see that character voice acting is awful, that is partly because of this game's mediocre budget, it doesn't reflect the talent of the developers. If you take this game and consider that, it really is amazing because for what little the devs had to work with it came out being a fairly challenging, fun, and interesting game.

The story was actually very unique, and I loved the cutscenes. I had this on Xbox a long time ago and enjoyed it then, and it's just as good now.

This game isn't going to blow your mind but it is definitely entertaining, and they have TWO campaigns. I very rarely see games that let you play as the enemy, and this game came out at a time when that concept was almost never employed.

I enjoyed the character customization, and the level design was pretty nice.

The only downside is that due to low budget the voice acting is mediocre, and the new publishers are shit. This is a good game to spend a few hours on. Unlike the other people who reviewed this game, mine never opened any windows or anything, I use Adblock and AVG, and skip through the developer logos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108899326', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1437903027}
review:
Another of my childhood classics. I played this alot more than Steam says due to the fact that I got it a long time ago thanks to a gaming magazine. This is a great example of a game that passed the test of time: both the graphics and the gameplay are amazing even by today`s standards.
The combat is the meat of this game and everything blends in nicely. The weapons are AMAZING...swinging a giant orcish axe never felt so satisfying and being a stealthy assassin is just amazing due to the multitude of tools available (all the arrow types remind me of the Thief series). This game also has one of my all time favourite levels in video game history: the haunted mansion. Evading all the traps in that place was just amazing.
There is not much more I could say about this game other than the fact that it`s a must have for all lovers of classic old games. If I`d use a raing system this would get a perfect 10 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041885352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1429856385}
review:
Uno de los t√≠tulos que m√°s se ha hecho de rogar en la historia del software l√∫dico es, sin duda alguna, "BLADE, The Edge of Darkness", al menos para el p√∫blico espa√±ol, patriota como el que m√°s en esto del videojuego. Tras una espera m√°s bien tirando a larga, el resultado no dej√≥ indiferente a nadie. Hubo quien recibi√≥ a "BLADE" con los brazos abiertos y acab√≥ despotric√°ndolo, mientras que el resto lo alab√≥ de tal manera que pr√°cticamente se convirti√≥ en el mejor juego espa√±ol habido y por haber, con permiso de su majestad "La Abad√≠a del Crimen".

Por otro lado, meses antes hizo acto de presencia otro juego de similares caracter√≠sticas, el m√°s que correcto "RUNE", de Humanhead Studios. "RUNE", programado con el prol√≠fico motor Unreal, aport√≥ una jugabilidad que, para muchos, era lo que le faltaba al simpar "BLADE". No cabe duda de que el control del programa espa√±ol fue el punto m√°s criticado, hecho por el cual fue bastante comparado con el sencillo manejo que ten√≠a "RUNE", al m√°s puro estilo de un t√≠pico y t√≥pico first person shooter. Y es que la obra de Rebel Act pose√≠a una metodolog√≠a de juego m√°s compleja, m√°s real si cabe... y que para muchos era la principal baza del atractivo l√∫dico de "BLADE".

author: {'steamid': '76561198031328124', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1384560319}
review:
Yuck.. Just yuck!  I dont even want to take the time to do a proper review, as it was so bad... 

Terrible combat, and combat controls.. 

Its old, and  Not in a good way... In the way nostalgia allows Morrowind, or Baldurs Gate, Or Dragon Age, Icewind Dale, or any other childhood favorie/classic to remain playable, and more importantly, enjoyable still today, this does not.. Nor can I imagine this having ever been! 

Dont let the very misleading screenshots fool you.. You probably wont wanna play beyond the intro..

Everything was little more than a narrow hallway.. Admittedly, i barely played an hour..So i couldnt even say if it gets better.. It was just.. I cant even put it into words.. If you tried that really bad Game of Thrones rpg, youll know what i mean by bad.. 

I have nothing good to say about it..

author: {'steamid': '76561197979108414', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1549829437}
review:
Apesar de antigo, bel√≠ssimo jogo construido na engine Unreal 2 (se n√£o me engano). Come√ßa tranquilo no in√≠cio e, na medida que vamos progredindo, a dificuldade vai aumentando muito, exatamante como tem que ser. Trilha sonora espetacular e visual muito bem feito... √â um jogo bonito de se ver at√© mesmo pros dias de hoje, com √≥timas texturas e efeitos de luz. A jogabilidade tem alguns pequenos problemas, mas nada que n√£o d√™ pra se acostumar e dominar com poucos minutos de jogatina. Enfim, um game relativamente desconhecido mas que pode agradar os amantes de um bom hack n' slash em 3¬™ pessoa. E os que gostam de vis√£o em 1¬™ pessoa tamb√©m, j√° que Enclave disponibiliza que se jogue por esse ponto de vista, o que √© especialmente √∫til quando disparamos flechas ou proj√©teis m√°gicos.

Played it for a little while. Had some fun. Would I recommend it? Eh... not really. I got this in a bundle, and it made the bundle worth the money, but would I recommend buying it outright? As a game, it's ok. Buy it cheap or in a bundle if interested.
