author: {'steamid': '76561198039137828', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 320, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1428569149}
review:
[h1]Enclave [/h1]

Ein Action Rollenspiel welches schon ein wenig die Jahre gekommen ist.

üìù [b][u]Story[/u][/b]

Die Fantasy-Welt und die Story sind recht interessant, auch wenn man nur sporadisch zwischen den Missionen davon etwas mitbekommt. Oft scheint die Handlung auch nur als Alibi zu dienen, um dem Spieler wenigstens irgendeinen Grund zu geben, dass zu tun, was die Mission von einem verlangt.

üéÆ [b][u]Gameplay[/u][/b]

Die K√§mpfe machen √ºberwiegend Spa√ü und gehen gut von der Hand. Die M√∂glichkeit jede Karte mit den verschiedenen freischaltbaren Charakteren zu Spielen, egal ob Krieger, Magier oder Sch√ºtze, bietet reichlich Abwechslung. Zumal auch der Spielstil dadurch individualisiert werden kann. 14 Missionen gilt es zu absolvieren wenn man f√ºr die Guten k√§mpft, 13 sind es bei den B√∂sen + ein paar Zusatzmissionen. 

Damit ist das Spiel zum einen recht umfangreich, zum anderen hat es einen gewissen Wiederspielwert, da in jeder Mission eine gewisse Goldmenge liegt und ein Teil davon gut versteckt ist. Mit dem Gold kann man sich dann vor jeder Mission neu ausr√ºsten, weshalb es auch von Vorteil ist die Gegend zu erkunden und nach Gold zu suchen und nicht stupide von A nach B durch die Mission zu hasten. 

Mit kleinen R√§tseln, Fallen und Sprungabschnitten wird ein wenig Abwechslung zwischen die K√§mpfe gepackt, wobei die Sprungabschnitte meiner Meinung nach eher nervig sind, da man gerne mal an kaum sichtbaren Kanten h√§ngen bleibt und einige Abst√§nde wirklich Haargenau abgemessen wurden.

üé• [b][u]Grafik[/u][/b]

Wer bei solchen Spielen viel Wert auf eine gute Grafik legt sollte von diesem Spiel die Finger lassen, denn das Spiel ist schon √ºber 15 Jahre alt und sieht dementsprechend aus. Viele Dinge sind noch recht kantig, was zu der Zeit ja standard war und auch einige Gegner (z.B. Werw√∂lfe) sehen sehr merkw√ºrdig aus bzw. ohne Namen w√§re gar nicht erkennbar was es sein soll. F√ºr die damalige Zeit ok, nach heutigem Standard aber kaum noch zumutbar. Es sei denn man verbindet damit Nostalgie oder kann diesem ganz speziellem Charme etwas abgewinnen.

üé∂ [b][u]Sound[/u][/b]

Musik und Sound sind ganz ok, nur die Synchronisation h√§tte im deutschen etwas besser sein k√∂nnen. Vor allem dass die eindeutig weiblichen Schatten-Assasinen (ja die Br√ºste sind kantig aber dennoch als solche erkennbar) eine m√§nnliche Stimme haben ist etwas merkw√ºrdig. Ebenso st√∂rend ist, dass der Untertitel oft nicht mit dem gesprochenen Text √ºbereinstimmt weil er zu fr√ºh oder sp√§t eingeblendet wird.

‚ù§Ô∏é [b][u]Fazit [/u][/b]

Alles in allem ein akzeptables Spiel, was einen eine ganze Weile besch√§ftigen kann. Der Preis ist durchaus noch vertretbar, ansonsten kann man aber auch auf die regelm√§√üigen Sales warten und es f√ºr unter 1 Euro holen, dann macht man definitiv nichts mehr verkehrt. Man sollte aber etwas f√ºr solche alten Schinken √ºbrig haben!

[quote]Wenn euch die Review gefallen/geholfen hat dann folgt doch unserem [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/8049466/] Reviewprogramm[/url] und wenn ihr mir etwas zu dieser Review mitteilen wollt dann schreibt gerne in die Kommentare.[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198045226937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1428549196}
review:
I got this for cheap, and I have to say, even with my expectations kind of low, I'm still a bit disappointed. However, I've noticed that many of the negative reviews here can be summed up to, "Adware is bad!!1! ecks dee." While adware is despicable anywhere, including here, (though calling an easily deleted script that opens a web browser page "adware" is extremely generous as far as I'm concerned), I'm going to try and judge this on its own merits, just the game itself.

To describe it without context: Enclave is an action game with RPG elements. The player controls one of several classes, fighting through often linear levels to accomplish a specific goal. Along the way, the player will collect gold and jewels. The more of such items the player collects during the level, the better equipment he or she can apply to said classes, increasing the player's effectiveness in combat.
From that description, I can't label exactly what is wrong. It's not one big thing; It's a bunch of little things.

Graphicaly, the game is hitting that point where you can see how old it is, but  everything looks detailed enough. Aside from the occasional 2D models and flickering skyboxes, it's fine.

The music all sounds the same.

The story is forgettable. I mean, I really tried to care about it, but it's just one of those things that tries way too hard to have lore, and fails because I have no real way of connecting the piles of orcs and goblins I'm slaying with what is happening in the story. The levels just feel like levels, not actual places with depth. It's backed up by some fair voice acting. I particularly like the goblins' dialogue.

The levels are mostly linear. On a very rare occasion, you'll be given some open areas to explore, but for the most part, the goal is to just reach the end. On a side note, it also seems to have a very subtle physics engine, though it's more likely to get you killed than the platforming controls... which also often result in death.
I've also noticed that the game has an unhealthy addiction to scripted events. Not the "quick-time event, rail-shooter" kind, but the "invisible trigger, something you can't prepare for" kind. Let me give an example. The harbor level. I go up some stairs, a goblin jumps out, I kill it. Later, I'm running across the bridges while some orcs beyond the fog shoot cannonballs at me. One of them hits the bridge, the bridge breaks, as I fall into the water, I can see how the bridge fell apart. By this time in the game, I've been playing long enough to know that this sort of event always happens the same way. So, I figure, next time, I'll just inchworm my way toward that part, and then jump over after the gap (which I fell through) has appeared. Because, you know, my first instinct when someone fires a cannon at me is to wait patiently.
Now, I'm starting over from the beginning of the level, because I want all of the gold, and you can't get all of the gold if you restart at a checkpoint. I get to the part with the goblin who jumps out at me when I go up the stairs, but I stay at the bottom of the stairs. I'm playing as the Druid, who has an attack capable of shooting through walls. I know exactly where the goblin is going to jump out from. So, I take a few shots at where the goblin would be before jumping out, and what happens? Nothing. Nada. Diddly squat. The goblin doesn't even spawn until I go up the stairs.
My point is, if the bridge event is going to require trial and error, why can I not take a cautious approach with the goblin as well? It feels like the game is just jerking me around.

Anyway, getting as much gold as you can is pretty important. The difficulty ramps up fairly quickly, and you're going to want to be able to afford the best stuff. Yet this can also fall victim to the scripted sequences, sometimes dropping gold out of reach, or sealing it off after crossing some invisible trigger, which requires playing a level again to get it all. The fact that they made anything this hard to obtain in as linear a game as this is, is in my opinion, an amazing feat.

The combat, oh boy. Clearly, this was the focus of the game, as diplomacy won't get you far here. Melee combat feels floaty. It's hard to control where you swing weapons, especially if the weapon is a tiny little dagger. You can use a shield if you want, but I find it to be useless most of the time. The slower enemies can be outmaneuvered, while the input lag is so bad that faster enemies can easily hit you whether you're trying to block or not. Consider the fact that the game also likes to have multiple enemies surround the player, and I often find myself just running into crowds, mashing the left mouse button.
Theoretically, this would mean that the best option against enemies who don't have a ranged attack is to just walk backwards and shoot them with your ranged weapon until they bite the dust, and sometimes it works, when there's nothing on the ground that blocks their path. When something does block them, good lord. I want to know who designed this AI, because this is just so weird. When an enemy is not walking directly at you in a straight line, anything can happen, it's unpredictable, it's like fighting a Smith guy from the Matrix. They can vault 5 foot boxes, they can weave left and right more than Florida between election years, they can stub their toes on thin air and as a result just stand in place. Couple this with the fact that the game doesn't really have effective hitscan weapons, and it's Tribes: Ascend Syndrome x1000.
The ultimate effect that all this has on the game is that there's little way to prepare for battles without a lot of trial and error, especially with the enemy funnels and often one-sided approaches to level completion.

If I have to say a few good things, I can. The classes, for the most part, feel different and unique, like a good class system should. The extra "Dark" campaign provides some extra gameplay value, and I have to say that I enjoyed it more than the "Light" campaign, for its more open mission and level structures, which allow for more creativity. It also has some pretty sweet modding tools if you can get your hands on them. I suggest following this: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=216527593

In the end, I have to say, as a whole, it just feels mediocre as a game. It's frustrating, it's boring because so much of my gametime has simply been trial and error. It just feels unfinished and unpolished. I'm sure there's something else out there that does what this wanted to do, but better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156589641', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1428456159}
review:
I am sorry to say this, but this is either the most broken game out of my selection or just the most un-directed game.
What i mean:
On the first level, the game did not tell you anything (besides from how to draw your weapons).
I was practicly stuck on the first level for roughly 30 min. because i did not know what to do next. Also thought it was a glitch so i restarted it many times aswell.
PS- I finally found that there was a lever that was at the first room with out any hint that it was there, besides from spamming MC2 (the use button in this game)
On the second level, the main idea from the "compainion" was that you needed to defeat a few, easy monsters, simple right? Well yeah they were easy, but after you defeated them i could not go anyware, only advice from the so called "compainion" was "We need to protect the Outpost!" Well, ok, lets go! But there was nothing there, not even a letter or another monster to lead way, NOTHING! You could not go back where you came from or open or destroy any doors, so what then? Well i wasted another, rough 30 min (In my opinion) looking for something, and because i am pretty tolerant towards games i, restarted it many times to see if it was a glitch. NOPE . . .
Disappointed in this game, had hopes for it.
Although there are Pro's and Con's with every game here are a few i can say

Pro's
Constant 60fps 
Note bad graphics for 2003
Unique game style (names areas and ect.)
Fast load time
*For you to decide*

Con's
No help (beside from "what buttons do what")
Short areas
Bad voice actors (sounds dull and not into the game style)
Either buggy or hard (could just be me)
*For you to decide*

author: {'steamid': '76561198026050130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 668, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1639739548}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist eigentlich nur noch etwas f√ºr Low Budget Nutzer. Story technisch ist es auch nur ganz okay.

Jeder der eine GTX 760 4GB VRAM sein eigen nennen kann oder nur eine 2 Dual Core ala Core2Duo E6xxx-8xxx, wird mit diesem Titel nicht besonders gl√ºcklich! 
Sehr alte Mechanik, welche ganz okay ist.. man kann es Spielen, ich w√ºrde es aber nur raten wenn man wirklich einen sehr schlechten PC/Laptop nutzen muss!

Ich habe diesen Titel nicht √ºber meine Intel UHD 630 laufen lassen sondern es lieber mit meiner GTX 1660 TI 6GB VRAM..meine GTX sagte mir sogar das dieses Spiel 0% Ihrer leistung dauerhaft beanspruchen musste ROFL
Mit dem Forceware Settings auf Maximale Bildsch√§rfe und MSAA 2x und game MSAA off sah das Spiel dann doch recht in Ordnung aus und machte Texturen m√§√üig sogar besseren eindruck als mein zuvor gespielter Titel "Duke Nukem Forever" was mich verwundert hatte da diese Titel dann doch 8 Jahre auseinander liegen was das Steam Datum mir preis gegeben hatte.

Alle anderen werden wohl gleich auf MMO¬¥s etc umsteigen, da hat man doch schon einige Free Titel die deutlich besser sind auch ohne Echtgeld zu Investieren!

Ich w√ºrde dann doch auch lieber zu der Gothic, Earth Serie greifen oder Knightshift holen. Sind diese Titel doch um vieles besser vom Gameplay und haben √§hnliche Anforderungen an die GPU!

Fazit: Nur f√ºr 10 Jahre alte Rechner/Laptop oder Liebhaber des Spiels . Alle anderen werden gnadenlos Frustriert vom Gameplay, entt√§uscht von der Story und Augenkrebs von der Grafik bekommen! Ich Empfehle es aus einem Grund, es war und bleibt ein Klassiker der nicht so bekannt ist.


Gespielt auf diesem Laptop System: https://valid.x86.fr/4zvdwc

author: {'steamid': '76561198068937354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1637879512}
review:
La realidad es que Enclave es uno de esos t√≠tulos que con una trama desarrollada de manera simple y con algunas lagunas,  vista desde dos perspectivas (campa√±a de la luz y superada esta, contin√∫a con la oscuridad), con escenarios variados, gr√°ficos decentes para su tiempo y una inteligencia artificial m√°s que cuestionable, consigue que te olvides de todo esto con una jubabilidad en la que necesitar√°s adaptarte al entorno y usar el personaje adecuado. 

Dispone de tres modos de dificultad y cada facci√≥n cuenta con una serie de personajes que van desde Caballero, Mediano o Mago hasta Goblin, Asesino o Hechicera, con un sistema de personalizaci√≥n basado en desbloquear nuevo equipamiento con el oro y diamantes que vayamos encontrando. En definitiva, si lo pillas de oferta (o gratis en mi caso), no te defraudar√° siempre y cuando no tengas las expectativas por las nubes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000604423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1425497432}
review:
Ein sch√∂nes Spiel, das schlecht gealtert ist. Ich habe es vor Jahren gespielt als es noch halbwegs aktuell war, doch mittlerweile ist alles, was "Enclave" spielenswert macht, in ausgefeilterer Form in anderen Spielen enthalten. 
Die Story empfand ich schon damals als ziemlich plump - zusammengeschusterter Fantasyquatsch eben. (Ich liebe Fantasy - aber warum muss man sich innerhalb von Subgenres immerzu auf ausgelatschen Pfaden bewegen? Eine Frage, die hier zu er√∂rtern den Rahmen wohl sprengen w√ºrde...)
Sch√∂n ist, dass man in Enclave schnell zwischen einzelnen Charakteren wechseln kann. Die Level haben tats√§chlich einen hohen Wiederspielwert, da man das in ihnen versteckte Gold braucht um die Charaktere auszur√ºsten, um mit diesen dann auch in sp√§teren Leveln bestehen zu k√∂nnen.
Das allein ist f√ºr mich jedoch kein Grund eine Kaufempfehlung auszusprechen. Wer es, wie ich, kostenlos erh√§lt, kann es sich jedoch gerne anschauen - totale Zeitverschwendung ist es noch lange nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184552887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1804, 'last_played': 1446472370}
review: Enclave is a Real under rated Hack n Slash RPG Gem... I played it on the XBOX A Long Time Ago and after configuring the controls to my liking and setting the graphic to 1080P... I am totally digging it....It has a neat 1st person 3rd person camera switch that makes your shield, Sword, Bow transparent in 1st person mode..... its one of the little things that make this game different. Some have reported an adware in the game but I havent seen any of that. The game Runs Great and with it on sale less than a Dollar its a steal. As you collect gold in the levels you buy better gear and you can replay the levels after you complete them with any unlocked character to look for the missed gold. There are both light and dark campaigns to unlock 2 hidden characters not seen in the campaign and there is a config hack to unlock console commands but it is reccommended to back up your save before you try it. Also a level editor exists for the game, which has been updated if you look for it... I really wish the MOD community gave this game some Love....Do yourself a favor and add it to your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012934956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1428431531}
review:
An old school action-adventure game.  It's old, so don't expect anything ground breaking.  Premade characters with premade fighting styles that get upgrades as you progress through the story & earn money.  The combat is hack/slash with different styles between which character you choose to play.  There are archers & mages which play like a 1st/3rd person shooter of sorts.  Just make sure you have mana before starting fights.  Enemies don't have much variation between them.  You'll encounter the same types throughout every level with them getting harder & more armored as you progress.

STORY

There isn't really a good story here.  It's mostly about you being in a war & your leader telling you to go do stuff.  There are good & evil stories to play through but you can't play the villain story until you beat the good one which is a bummer.

GRAPHICS

Don't expect much visually since it's an older game.  It's not bad looking but everything does look brown/grey.  Like they were going for a more realistic tone.  It's pretty bland & boring overall.  The character models look good at least.

AUDIO

Nothing major here either.  The game does have basic 3D surround sound, but I'm not sure how it is since I don't have a setup for it.  Music is generic & loops through the levels.  Voice acting is good & tolerable.  Sound effects are basic explosions, clangs, footsteps, etc.  Nothing super impressive.

UI

There is no map in this game, but levels aren't that big so you won't really get lost.  Before each mission you equip your character with weapons & armor. You choose the missions to play via a world map.  Each mission is repeatable but you can't earn bonus gold from replaying each mission unless you earn more gold than you did in your previous playthrough.  Depending on how much gold you've earned you can equip yourself with better items & more potions.  You don't really "BUY/SELL" stuff in this game.  You find gold throughout the levels & it adds to your total gold pool.  The higher your gold pool the more you can equip.

GAMEPLAY

The gameplay changes depending on the classes & there are 3 class types.  Warrior, Archer, & Mage.   You start with the warrior & unlock the rest as you play the game.  You unlock different versions of each as you progress as well.

WARRIORS  The combat can get cumbersome for warriors.  You'll need to be constantly moving & attacking to avoid being hit & to get around some enemies defenses.  The Warrior is tall & a lot of your enemies are short so you'll keep swinging over their heads from time to time. He also often swings at an odd angle so even if the enemy isn't short you'll still miss.  You can use shields to block arrows & attacks, just make sure they hit the shield or you'll take damage.

ARCHERS  They play pretty much like you'd expect.  You have to draw & time your shots.  Headshots do 10x bonus damage & are pretty much instant kills.  You get a variety of arrows like fire, explosive & sniper arrows.  Gameplay is slightly different depending on what bow you use.  You pretty much need to headshot enemies & that's easier said than done.  Each shot has a delay as well.

MAGES  Mages equip staves & shoot things similar to the archers except they are more versatile. Each attack uses mana & their playstyle changes depending on which staff you're using.  The 1st staff is the most balanced.  A slow attack with a wide berth to give you room for errors.  The 2nd staff requires much more precision & is similar to using a bow without needing to draw an arrow.  The 3rd staff poisons your enemies & allows you to damage them over time.  Some enemies are immune/weak to certain staves so it's best to bring 2 staves with you if you can afford it.

OVERALL

The game is monotanous & poorly designed.  

The enemy AI is terrible & goes from being completely stupid to jump around & avoid all your attacks while they bash your face in.  If you play a ranged character you're gonna have a hard time because the enemies are constantly moving & have tiny heads and you NEED to headshot them in order to kill them.  If you play a melee character you're gonna have an even worse time because every enemy is so small your swings will always go over them or he'll just swing at wierd angles so if the enemy isn't short you'll miss anyways.  

The levels are really linear as well.  It's pretty much a straight line, with one offshoot that unlocks if you can save someone from dying & some dead ends that hide more gold.  Enemies also spawn out of no where.  You'll often walk through an area with no enemies only to have them spawn behind you.

The games not unplayable, but it is frustrating.  I'd not recommend it unless you get it on a good sale.

Les points forts de ce petit jeu qui ma couter 0.58 cents ma divinement surprient. La possibilit√© de jouer seulement solo am√©liore l'int√©r√™t tout en restant tranquille sans limite de temps. author: {'steamid': '76561198040736490', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1427204626}
review:
Where should I start about this game.
It cost me ‚Ç¨0,69 and my life has been changed.
It all began in the main menu when I was going to start a new adventure.
The game gave me a choice if I wanted to play the light or dark campaign, because I'm an edgy guy I wanted to choose the dark campaign.
Up untill this moment I thought the game was fine but then when I wanted to pick the dark campaign I couldn't because it was unavailable for some reason.
Well alright I'll go with the light campaign not what I wanted to but oh well.
Then I spawned and some random chick got blown up and then just disappeared.
The moment I found out that collecting the maximum amount of gold each quest was more interesting then the quests and the whole storyline my whole view of the game was changed.
This isn't an ordinary RPG, this game was made to see if you're persistent enough to collect all the gold.
But this game does not only have action it also has some Mirror Edge like parkour.
So not only can you fuck up ugly goblins you also run around collecting gold like a maniac.

12/10 Would play again for dark campaign gold collecting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971468331', 'num_games_owned': 2411, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1427094338}
review:
This isn't an RPG at all,  its a typical hack and slash action game.  There has barely any loot accept gold and health pots and very rarely a particular level will reward you with an upgraded item for the various characters you'll unlock as you progress.  The combat is a mess with button bashing the par for the game, blocking serves limited purpose as you'll be wildly swinging your weapon around hoping for actual contact with enemies, sometimes it doesn't even register.

The defence Enclave has is its age, its quite old now - but even so, back in 2003 there was RPGS around that did a better job in the third person action rpg genre.   Levels are all extremely linear in nature, and some areas are quite confusing and its easy to get lost and frustrated.

Graphics wise, its above par considering its age - this is probably why it got so many positive reviews.  But in terms of actual gameplay, its sub-par and the difficulty increases quite rapidly to a point you'll rage over cheap deaths from traps or other stupid game mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147655519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1527316845}
review: Enclave feels exactly like what is it: a RPG developped in the early 2000s in Germany. It's grim, unpolished, set in a typical uninspired dark fantasy world where everybody is required to have a shitface and wear armor designed by anguished teenagers. The game is working but doesn't deliver any fun and lacks any sort of appeal to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044337564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1426627678}
review:
This game is far better than I expected, when I first bought it on sale I expected a cheaply made, linear rpg.
What I ended up getting was a well-made dungeon crawl that keeps me very entertained; with classic graphics, simple controls and easy but fun combat coupled with a complex story and some great voice acting, I find this is definitely a game for the western rpg fan or anyone who wants a return to the classic games of the late 90s and early 2000s

If I had to make a complaint it is only that the game requires some back-tracking but it keeps it relatively interesting with events that only occur when you return to various areas and creating reasons to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142472664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1426610907}
review: Having read some of the other reviews, the game has never directed me to purchase another game. That being said, I cannot sit here and play a game that cannot register attacks properly. After attempting to kill one of the early and easily killable enemies near the beginning of the game for a full 5 mins before I accomplished it, I really have no reason to recommend this game. You would be more frustrated at the game instead of being able to enjoy what could have been a really good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096888128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1426369566}
review:
Die Grafik ist nicht mehr auf dem neuesten Stand, aber dennoch ordentlich.
Im Sale zugegriffen f√ºr unter einem Euro - da kann man auf keinen Fall was falsch machen.
Story ist nicht so sehr vorhanden, aber das ist auch nebens√§chlich.
Der Soundtrack ist gut und eing√§ngig.
Das einzige, was negativ zu erw√§hnen ist, ist die fehlende Speicherm√∂glichkeit. Einmal begonnen muss ein Level auch beendet werden, um den Fortschritt nicht zu verlieren. Und die Levels k√∂nnen schon mal 30-40 Minuten lang sein.
In den Levels gibt es sp√§rlich ges√§t Checkpoints. Hat man diese erreicht, wird man immer wieder belebt ohne Nachteile.

Im Sale ist das Spiel zu 100% zu empfehlen, ansonsten darf veraltete Grafik nicht st√∂ren.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982506006', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1426353756}
review:
Zun√§chst sollte ich erw√§hnen dass ich Enclave konstenlos durch eine Promotion erhalten habe.

Das Spiel beginnt mit Erz√§hlungen und Videosequenzen. Bedingt durch das Alter des Spiels fallen einem sofort einige Makel auf, diese sind zum Gl√ºck nicht allzu wichtig und die Engine macht einiges her.
Die Welt ist nicht so detailreich und f√ºhlt sich wirklich leer an.
Die Leere wird durch die instanzierten Level verst√§rkt. Der Spieler kann jedes Level beliebig oft spielen und alles erkunden, ihm stehen sp√§ter auch andere Charaktere zur Seite.

Das Kampfsystem finde ich pers√∂nlich sehr schlecht, obwohl es einem auch Freude bereiten kann. Als Krieger reicht es aus wenn man vor und zur√ºck rennt und w√§hrenddessen angreift, so besiegt man nahezu alle Feinde und wird selber kaum getroffen.
Der Fernkampf kann sehr effektiv sein, allerdings machen nur Kopftreffer richtig schaden und K√∂rpertreffer machen relativ wenig Schaden, besonders bei Magiern.
Das Zielen ist zum Teil eine Katastrophe, sowohl im Nah- als auch im Fernkampf.

Allgemein kann ich das Spiel nicht weiterempfehlen, konnte mich kaum dazu begeistern weiter zu spielen und ich war immer froh wenn der Level endlich geschafft war.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031225726', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1425849263}
review:
[h1]The Look[/h1]
*If you have a fetish for graphic then is maybe not for you because is from year 2003
+Turn up the setting if you want 
*Never played "Gothic 1" but the properties are similar: medieval, third-person-view
*You start as Knight and can playing as that for each other Chapter

[h1]Some facts[/h1]
+More Classes get unlocked and each Chapter is aviable to repeat
*You can colect coins; Health potion (medicine in a bottle); hidden ammo (unless you using melee-weapons or magic)
*If you respawn from a Checkpoint- you don't win back your ammo (important as Hunter). Just repeat the Chapter than
*Amazing Menu with that Crow
*Because is from year 2003 they don't have Game-Pad support/option (Could be a good "Play Station 2" title)

[h1]Summary[/h1]
10/10. Perfect mechanism with a big world in Chapters (and with funny glitches)

author: {'steamid': '76561198077079975', 'num_games_owned': 1699, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1425598808}
review:
A 2003 version of Skyrim. Not very good graphics, but for a 2003 game, the controls aren't clunky, the hack-n-slash is kinda cool, the characters are well designed (for a 2003 game), and this is a game where you can clearly feel the medieval danger in the air when you play it.

6/10

review:
It's got a good storyline and fairly interesting lore,and exploring feels very rewarding at some times.
There's not much character progression though,I've pretty much only used the knight as far as I've played.
But the fact that you just unlock a character and buy gear for it,
and then get to jump straight into the game is very nice however.
The game is very challenging at some times,even in "easy" difficulty,
but thanks to that,it just makes the game more interesting and more fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992690466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1425140501}
review:
Bonjour.
Ce jeu est √† prendre √† la l√©g√®re, sinon on se surprendrait √† se faire des r√©flexions du genre :
-Pourquoi les golems de lave br√ªlent ils dans la lave ? 
-Le gobelin m'attendait-il dans ce meuble depuis 6 ans ou a-t-il eut une vision du future pour pr√©voir mon arriv√©e ?
-Une fois, j'ai r√©cup√©r√© de la sant√© en mettant les pieds dans l'eau. Pourquoi cela ne s'est il jamais reproduit ?
-Les gens parlent r√©ellement de cette fa√ßon dans une autre dimension ?
-Je sauve la reine et son ch√¢teau mais j'ai pas pay√© mes imp√¥ts, alors il faut que j'aille jusqu'en enfer tuer Satan pour racheter ma dette... Logique non ?
-Chevalier brutal avec une grosse √©p√©e, une grosse hache ou encore un gros gourdin plein de piquants fait moins de d√©g√¢t qu'une sorte d'elfe en string avec un b√¢ton magique !
-Ouille .. aie ... oulala j'ai mal, vite ! Un gorg√©e de vin rouge et c'est reparti :D
-Pourquoi cette porte m'a tu√©?
-Oh putain ... encore une √©chelle ...
Bref... !!

En clair :
Le jeu est plut√¥t cool au final puisque je l'ai fini et je me suis bien amus√© !

Point par point :
-Les dialogues :
Mon dieu... les dialogues sont horribles!! Personne ne s'exprime de cette fa√ßon ou sur ces intonations! Entre Marcus qui a un talent divin pour pr√©voir les embuscades " Je sens qu'il va y avoir une embuscade." BIM ! Embuscade ! La princesse qui pousse des cris aigu avec une voie de raton laveur castr√© et furieux, les mages compl√®tement bourr√©s, rempli de vin rouge "Haa tu craindras mon courOoOoOoux !"," J'appelle la force des √©l√©meEeeeeEnts BoOoOouhaaAaaaAaa...". Les dialogues sont tr√®s r√©p√©titifs et tr√®s nuls, vide de contenu ou apportant des r√©flexions √©videntes, le tout avec un vocabulaire qui n'existe pas !
+. De plus, les √©crits ne sont pas toujours traduits, du genre : " Trouver la clef.","You need a key to open the door".

-Le gameplay :
Au corps √† corps, c'est l'enfer! Une marche, un escalier, une pente, n'importe quoi qui vient apporter un relief vient fausser la Hitbox et vous tapez dans le vent! Votre adversaire, lui, en revanche, ne vous rate pas! Vous frappez furieusement avec votre √©p√©e dans tous les sens √† parfois plus de 2 coup par seconde pour, au final, vous rabattre sur la veille m√©thode du : "J'avance pour mettre un coup, mais je recul pour esquiver, et je r√©p√®te en boucle." C'est dommage! Les personnages corps √† corps sont int√©ressant mais on ne peut pas les jouer correctement.

A distance, tout s'√©clairci tout √† coup. Le DPS est largement correct, voir plus √©lev√© que les classes corps √† corps et vous permet de rester "safe", ne pas perdre de vie et tuer vos ennemies tranquillement. Le jeu est √©norm√©ment plus simple avec un vieux b√¢ton de bois des t√©n√®bres qu'avec une √©norme hache du meilleur forgeron de l'espace.
+. De plus, j'ai remarqu√©, lors des premi√®res missions cot√© t√©n√®bres qu'on est parfois dans des situation √† la con du genre : 
Je ne dispose que d'un arc et, COMME PAR HASARD, dans cette mission il y a des gars en armure avec un gros bouclier qui bloquent mes fl√®ches! N'ayant pas d'arme de m√™l√©e pour combattre je suis oblig√© de les laisser me mettre un coup d'√©p√©e pour pouvoir leur tirer une fl√®che... C'est pas de bol ! Et je n'ai que deux choix : 1. Je me fais chier √† finir le niveau entier comme √ßa. 2. Je recommence tout depuis le d√©but pour pr√©parer mon stuff.

Les d√©placements ne sont pas horrible, √ßa va, c'est plut√¥t dynamique etc ... Y'a juste les √©chelles qui sont mal foutus. Suite √† un combat endiabl√© avec 3 truands de l'enfer, apr√®s avoir bien transpir√©, avoir perdu du sang et vaincu vos ennemies... il vous faudra encore monter cette √©chelle, un d√©fis plus dur encore !!
Aussi, j'ai parfois surpris des PNJ compl√®tement fou qui sautent dans tous les sens pour monter une marche ou franchir un petit obstacle... C'√©tait marrant jusqu‚Äô√† ce que je me rende compte que je suis oblig√© de faire exactement la m√™me chose! Et d'ailleurs ... Se coincer entre 2 marches d'escalier pendant qu'on vous bombarde de fl√®ches c'est pas toujours marrant! Aussi, il y a des petites interactions pratiques et sympa du genre : Clique droit pour sortir de l'eau .. Ouf!

L'IA est tr√®s basique, suffisante mais pas terrible .. Les ennemies, parfois, entrent dans une sorte de fr√©n√©sie et lors d'un combat sautent par dessus un rempart et vont s‚Äôaplatir tout seul au pied de celui ci pour je ne sais quelle myst√©rieuse raison... ils avaient peut √™tre peur ! Les grenadiers sont d√©biles, ils tirent des bombes partout " HAAAAAA JE SUIS UN PNJ COMPLETEMENT TAREEEEEEEEE !!!!! " .. Et ... Ils tirent rarement des bombes sur nous! Aussi, certains mobs ont une hitbox mal d√©finie et pour les distants, ce n'est pas toujours facile de trouver le point d'impact d√©terminant qui permettra de tuer tel ou tel mob, par exemple : Les esp√®ces de singe touffu on une hitbox au pied, leur tirer en pleine figure ne les affectent pas, non, il faut leur casser les jambes ! Puis encore, en avan√ßant dans le jeu on rencontre des archers qui tirent des fl√®che 3 par 3 ou 5 par 5 .. C'est bien beau tout √ßa mais le probl√®me c'est que si celui ci vous allume au corps √† corps ( Ce qui peut arriver ci vous le croiser √† l'angle d'une ruelle sombre et lugubre ! ) et qu'il vous tire dessus, vous prenez les 5 fl√®ches d'un coup ! ONE SHOT !!

Level design :
L√†, par contre, je n'ai pas trouver grand chose a redire. Pour l'√©poque je trouve √ßa beau, c'est propre. Pas vraiment de bugs de textures superpos√©es, de "trou" menant au n√©ant du moteur graphique. C'est plut√¥t bien r√©alis√©, les b√¢timents sont grands, bien fournis. Les textures de biblioth√®ques sont sympa, les meubles aussi... C'est bien de voir que les portes peuvent s'ouvrir dans les 2 sens et que certains √©l√©ments du d√©cor peuvent se d√©truire. Les level designer n'ont pas √©tait faignant pour la r√©alisation de tout √ßa !

En revanche, il a des tableau qui sont super "kitch" du genre : Tableau de 2 m¬≤ repr√©sentant une princesse guerri√®re blonde avec des gros seins en face d'une photo d'une vierge qui prend la pose de la Joconde.. S√©rieusement, qui mettrait √ßa dans son salon ? √ßa n'existe pas !

Aussi, l√† ou j'ai ressenti un peu de "flemme" de la part des level designer, c'est sur les fameuse zones dans lesquelles on a pas le droit d'aller qui affichent une message par d√©faut : "Abandon de la mission dans 5..4...3..2......" C'est bacl√© ! De m√™me pour les murs invisibles emp√™chant le joueur de sortir de la map ou de s'enfoncer trop loin dans la foret.

Les "bonus" sont compl√®tement "obvious" , on en vient de se dire : Est ce que je vais chercher les pi√®ces d'or secr√®tement cach√©es √† droite et √† gauche du ch√¢teau ... ? Ou est ce que je m'en fou compl√®tement de je trace mon chemin ?" Parce qu‚Äôon sait qu'il y a des pi√®ces cach√©es toujours aux m√™mes endroits, ce n'est pas du tout subtil.

Le gestion de l'inventaire est cool ! Pas la peine de se tracasser √† se demander s'il est rentable ou non d'acheter tel ou tel produit avant de commencer une mission. Tout revient si on enl√®ve notre choix. C'est √† dire que si je commence une mission avec 2500 gold et que je prend : 1 b√¢ton des t√©n√®bres a 1500 , armure 500 , 4 potion 400 gold. Il me reste : 100Gold. Une fois la mission termin√© , je n'ai gagn√© que 50 gold et utilis√© mes 4 potions. C'est pas grave ! Puisque j'ai maintenant un capitale de 150 gold +1 b√¢ton des t√©n√®bres a 1500 , armure 500 et 4 potions 400 gold qui ne se sont pas d√©duit de mes achat. J'ai , en v√©rit√© 2550 gold. C'est des achat permanent et interchangeable a souhait sans perte. Et √ßa .. c'est cool !

J'ai appr√©ci√© aussi le fait de pouvoir upgrade mon armure et de pouvoir incarner diff√©rents personnages.

En bref, le jeu est plein de probl√®mes ... Mais objectivement, il est plut√¥t cool ! :D Je le conseille !

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1490405026}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a really old action rpg  game.



[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

2 Different Campaigns.
There is a difficulty settings available.
You are able to play with your controller.
There are some different resolution sizes available.
You can play in windowed mode or fullscreen mode.
There is a brightness volume slidebar available.
There is a sound volume slidebar available.
There is a music volume slidebar available.
You are able to toggle Blood, Damage indicators or subtitles.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

The game is really old as the game is released in the year 2003. This is a simple RPG action game with subjectives and other situations. The game could be really buggy at times or something will happen and you will raise your eyebrow. If you grew up and played this game in your childhood then you will know what to expect. But if you do not know the game at all then i would consider to buy this game with a discount.

You are able to skip cutscenes.
There are different classes and characters to be unlocked.
Some parts has been voiced-over.
There are checkpoints available.
Graphics and soundtrack is okay.
Levels are short and sceneries are basically the same or bland.
Camera is third person and there is fall damage.
You are able to see the enemy Health bar.
Combat doesn't feel smooth and crossbow doesn't have a zoom-in which makes it difficult to use.
There are collectables in the game. You are able to find gold which you can use to upgrade things.

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

One orc was able to hold an entire battering ram all by himself to break down a door.

-------------------

I Give this game a 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198012882309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1425345190}
review:
UPDATED: Adware is removed but everything else stays (windowed mode/alttab crashing, etc). I'll give it a few days and if it's still gone I might recommend it, because it's a pretty OK rpg game basically. 

-

No matter how Enclave was as a game when it came out, all that is screwed up with this edition in a very rude and simple way.

As many here pointed out - when you run the game it first opens the browser automatically, by itself to Raven's Cry steam store page, another (new, latest) Topware game. It's basically a popup/spam/adware and the kind that hijacks your default browser to open an ad whether you like it or not. An ad that then runs trailer from that game in the background while this game runs on top.

This happens everytime game runs! If the game runs/loads before your browser, then you can't turn off Raven's Cry trailer and close that page because Alt+Tab or Win+D or Win+Tab is not working and the game crashes when those are used (Win7 Ultimate 64bit). Same thing when it's in windowed mode.

Very not cool, Topware, not cool. Why would you do this? This is pretty much anticonsumer as it can be.

So I would say "no" to this... [strike]at least until they remove this stupid spam, adware bs.[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198075220826', 'num_games_owned': 849, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1424420499}
review:
Get this game only if its really cheap!

Pros:
- Great voice acting
- Good level design
- Good sound effects
- Story is okay.....nothing great. Same things we see in the fantasy setting.
- Can play as good or evil
- Menu design

Cons:
- Clunky combat
- Predictable AI
- Only warrior class effective, rest are crap.
- Very generic enemy design
- Bad role playing elements
- Linear gameplay
- Many graphical glitches

Conclusion: Good game to play if you have nothing to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011546793', 'num_games_owned': 1147, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1424324868}
review:

Haters are going to hate, especially those with crappy comps or who have not even hit 17 years old or older - everyone with a steam account thinks they are a big critic now-a-days and that their googled terms to post up a review may look impressive, but ignore it. Youtube some game play before you let the critics steer you from this little gem.

Even if the gem doesn't shine as brightly as others, it still has some worth and worth your time to check it out :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198174875746', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1425865899}
review:
Bought this game at a cut price; such a classic style Action RPG. Great combat, solid controls which are easy to learn and remember. Haven't got a controller to work with it yet, but with programs like XPadder, I don't see why it would be difficult; not necessary, but it shouldn't be too hard if you really dislike keyboard and mouse.

The only downside is the low graphical quality; which is understandable when you consider the 2003 release date. Character models are pretty good for the age, but landscape textures are very blurred. 
Resolution goes up to 1080p, which is awesome, and for a port, the options menu is pretty detailed.

I probably wouldn't recommend you buy this game at ¬£3.99, since the game is so old now, that just sounds unnecessarily high. Like I said, I bought this in a sale and it cost me ¬£1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105178498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1424121452}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114195950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2841, 'last_played': 1588569957}
review:
Like any game out there, there are pro's & cons// I have to say that the AI & the engagement of enclave is a unique one, set in graphics while not the most detailed- I found have continued to age well... there are some very challanging (even infuriating) moments to this game: one of the more notable coming from a single witch doing her best catwoman impersonation from a set of roof tops...

its not a game that will particularly punish you for one mistake, but one that feels rewarding for having played it

hack n slash, magic, ranged weapons, even lighting your enemies on fire with grease bombs & watching as they wither at your feet... if you dont enjoy simple combat, then this isnt your game... lots of fun can come from just exploring areas to find all the booty (and deal with the enemies that spawn for grabbing the goods) there are times that it can even feel unfair... but it is after all, just a game; one I happen to enjoy- & for $5 USD... i believe you will too

author: {'steamid': '76561198030250363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1424023468}
review:
I don't set my bar very high when I buy an obscure fantasy game for under $5 bucks. The odd unexpected gem, occasional clever art design, or just experiencing the personal projects of earnest developers. Enclave is none of those. I've only played through maybe the first third of the Light campaign (there's an entire second one that you need to unlock), but my patience is officially dried up.

The game starts with a lengthy cutscene that could have just as easily been titled "How Not to Write a Fantasy Story 101," opening up a quasi-mystical looking tome while a bored-sounding woman rambles on about the setting's origin story, throwing in some made-up fantasy words like "Dreg'atar" every third word in a deseperate effort to alienate the audience before the game even starts. (Tip for writers: foreign-sounding words are the deep end of the pool. The bigger the plot point the less likely you want to have to pull out a glossary to understand it.)

Once the game starts it's a pretty bog-standard sloppy hack-and-slasher, paving through orcs and goblins because of course you are. Survival can get pretty finnicky as the clunky combat controls make tapdancing around your opponent the best means of defense, and occasionally an unpredictable exploding setpiece can kick you back to the start of the level. Still, not something I lost sleep over seeing as how it cost less than a dollar.

The quality just sort of slowly slides downhill from there. Ranged attacks are borderline useless as they require extreme precision, which in a game where no one ever sits still and your rate of fire is roughly the same as horse droppings, means that at mid-ranges you'll miss, at close ranges you'll miss and get stabbed, and at long ranges you might hit and give your target a small papercut.

Basically every level introduces a new class to play as, most of which are slight variations on your standard sword/shield/crossbow Knight that you started with. The most distinct one (that I've unlocked, anyway) is the Druid, who takes any semblance of class balance and crushes it between her gratuitously exposed thighs (you can unlock armor with pauldrons, but not pants. How does that make sense?). Her most basic staff summons spectral ravens that home in on their target and has a secondary power to summon an elemental as a disposable meatshield, and her mana restores so fast it basically serves only to slightly limit your rate of fire.

Now if this were a sensibly balanced game, the average class would be able to plow through levels with moderate difficutly and the hilariously overpowered Druid would just sort of wander through spamming magic like you snuck Starkiller into a game of Star Wars Battlefront. But this isn't a sensibly balanced game, and the clumsy controls will have your melee characters limping with no potions inside of five minutes, basically giving you the options of "play Druid or get really familiar with the first room of each level."

My patients burned up around level seven, which seemed easy enough like all the rest: wander around murdering ugly green people, grab loot, find exit. Unfortunately, the level is also littered with archer assassins, who use the same burst arrows as your Huntress class, but with unlimited ammo and impeccable aim. They can, and will, take you from full health to dead in one shot before you can even make out their silhouette through the game's heavy fog, and in a game where each level has MAYBE two checkpoints, there's only so many times I can try and play Russian Roulette with trying to snipe them through the fog before I give up and chuck the game in the trash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019205444', 'num_games_owned': 4251, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1423613782}
review:
Enclave is a gem of a game from the original X-Box era back in 2003. Its a third or first person medieval fantasy hack and slash with engaging combat and exceptional environments. For the rogue in all us there is a dark campaign where you play as several evil classes like assassin, berserker, lich and sorceress to name a few. If there are any good hearts out there, you also have the light campaign with their human counterpart classes such as knight, huntress, druid, wizard and half-ling. Each campaign lasted me a fun and joyous seven hours. At the start of each level you select your class and assign their equipment from the money you have. Nothing is permanently bought, so if you want expensive armor and a weak weapon with a few potions, you can do it or if zero potions, expensive weapons and armor is more to your liking go for it. The money is never spent, just assigned. These classes, play styles and different equipment go a long way to making each play through different, even if its your twentieth time on a level.

So why is this game so good? Let's start with the controls and movement. While this was an X-Box game, there doesn't seem to be controller support. You're stuck with your keyboard and rebindable keys. Its more than that though, your character seems to have a good sense of movement. You'll climb ladders, duck to crawl through tunnels, jump up boxes and over collapsed bridges. Even jump from rooftop to rooftop. Each class has its own speed. For the most part the heroes of the light campaign feel slower than their dark counterparts. Knights and berserkers move slow, while half-lings and goblins are the fastest. There is no run button, heroic classes are so slow that it really feels like you need to fight.

Getting there is half the fun, but along the way you'll of course find enemies and you've got the fantastic combat to take them out with. I can't call it deep combat so much as its fun. Each class can have a melee weapon that you really just mouse click bash to flail it around. Each weapon has its own strength, speed and range. Others have enchantments that will light enemies on fire. Most classes also have a shield too. Hold the right mouse button to have your shield up to block arrows and wow you will be blocking a lot of arrows. With some enemies that can fire a shotgun of bolts at you, it becomes mandatory if you're going to survive at close range.

To add some depth there, each time your shield gets bashed, that will knock it away for a split second leaving you open to attack. So if two archers time it just right they can break through your defenses. This goes for enemies with shields too. They're just like you, when their shield is up, you need to knock it down to hurt them.

Wizards, sorceresses, lich and druids have magic. Each magician has a magic meter that refills over time.  So if you run out from fire balling an enemy, you've got to wait, where the enemies see your weakness and will rush at you. You can equip two spell staffs, so you have a variety there in the level. A lot of the spells make the game easier. Plenty of them seek out enemies and turn in the air to hit them. Instead of a shield, the right mouse will raise a force field, but I never used it that much, since mages are such long range classes. Some staffs also have a summoning ability to raise an ally to help you. Oh and the spells can't get blocked. You still take damage.

Form there, non magic classes can also have a long range bow or cross bow. Even the knight and grenaders can use them, but you need to equip them at the start of each level, you can't just find one. I've gotta say crossbows and bows are far too difficult to accurately hit anything. Sure melee enemies running to you will take arrows til they're dead. Its shooting the other archers that becomes incredibly difficult. They can dodge arrows just as good as any human player. Its difficult to accurately hit them, so to compensate, there are several different tricks. You can load several bolts into a bow at once by pressing the right mouse button. Then release so one of them will hit its target if not all to instantly kill a close enemy. There are also fire bolts that will ignite enemies or the ground on fire. The abilities add some interesting facets to the game when you're forced to play as an assassin for the dark campaign's original character.

You have a quick health potion button that really plays into combat, because you need to chug the potion. Its not just instant energy, so if you're getting beaten to death, you need to hide and chug the potion before you can attack or defend again. It adds a lot to the combat and gives the enemies a better chance.

You'll need to unlock the classes as you go through the game. This means you'll be rescuing your comrades in their levels. With them freed, they'll temporarily aide you, fight shoulder to shoulder with you and guide you to the next part. They can die too, but as long as you've saved them and complete the level, they're unlocked.

Enclave puts you into incredible environments and assets are not used from level to level. So each level has a completely different look and feel. Crypts, tombs, caves, castles, lava caverns, shadowy towns, human towns. There is a ton of variety here. Between the light and dark campaigns only a few levels get reused among the two. Even if it is a shared level, you start from the opposite end of it, to make it feel fresher. The levels feel like they're just the right amount of time. Each level has plenty of exploration and a lot of levels feel open enough where you can look around without feeling like you're forced down a corridor. They never overstay their welcome. I never think of it as a chore, because there's always something new and beautiful to see around every corner.

The pre rendered cut scenes and menus are pretty dated with low resolution quality so they don't look as gorgeous as the game itself. Not that the game itself is high definition, but over a decade later it still looks amazing. The only thing lacking are the ground textures. Grassy fields could have used Oblivion style grass, but for a game that came out when Morrowind did it still looks better than its contemporaries.

Its not all roses and sunshine in this dark enchanted world. The game goes from a fun treat and knuckles down on you in later levels to beat you down. I appreciated the challenge, even if some levels took me five minutes to make it across a bridge. If you die, you need to restart the level. To balance it out, if you can make it to a checkpoint, you will respawn there when you die. There's just one catch. You need enough gold collected in that level to respawn. I'm thankful for the checkpoints even at a cost. Having each revive cost gold gives you incentive to return to each level after you complete it. Oh by the way, you only keep the gold if you beat the level. So if you died ten times, you spent one hundred gold, so you can return to the level, not die and get an extra hundred gold to spend. Assuming you collected what you had before. That's the beauty with all the exploration, you can find things or miss them.

You won't get limited to combat, there are some puzzles and a few brief, yet fun turret sections that don't tie you to the turrets. The bosses are giant and feel engaging without being overwhelming or frustrating. A giant dragon, a huge lava monster and the mega evil boss has you shooting its hanging heart. If that wasn't enough for you, there are unlockable mini games that are actually fun. You'll find maps in levels that will unlock games like a survival mode and a cool turret gallery.

The music is also something to take note of. Its great and really fits the medieval epicness of the game. Its beautiful and touching, but with big and bold moments too.

Once again, this is just a gem of a game that I would have paid full price for when it was $50. Thanks to someone from Sweden for giving me the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001285557', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1424703801}
review:
This game is quite old, and yes, it crashes sometimes (Actually now seems fixed by removing v sync) frame rate is embarassing same is the camera angle, but still I think the game itself is quite enjoyable: Many characters to play with, many weapons, 2 different campaigns.
The graphics are not that bad for a game of more than 10 years ago, and some effects and plot twists are almost surprising.
It has even the right level of difficulty. In particular, it is damn hard to find all the coins in all levels, but doing so is unsuitable and annoying 'cause of backtracking.
I am actually enjoying playing it again after so much time. It was one of the first game in bought as a 11 years old :')
Totally worth it for 1 $ on Steam (actually 0,65 ‚Ç¨ in my country).

75/100

Update: Each time you start the game a browser page open up with raven cry page, really annoying !!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986409488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1426783107}
review:
I only don't recommend this game because it's full of errors, too much unrecoverable errors for me. 
Graphics are ok, sound too and gameplay is addicted but getting stuck with errors that make your game crash never is good.
If you have a recent mouse you have to put down your polling rate to 125Hz because it get's buggy everytime you turn your character; If you have more than 1 Core CPU you have to set your affinity to 1 core (core 0) in the task manager;
Still not enough, you will find the unrecoverable error in start of some missions and the random errors you will find in your quest for Light or Dark path.

So, in my point of view from 0 to 10. This will get a 3.5

author: {'steamid': '76561198108470916', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1409784959}
review:
Buggy game, personally i'd give it a 5/10, For the sole reason that the game for it's time is pretty decent, If it was 2004, I'd say it was horrible. The two years are distuinguished hugely. But like i said for it's time it's a really good game. It's... I'd like to say a learning curve because though it's a old game most of the people who play games nowadays don't realize how much more dependant as a player you need to be to finish a game. Games really really easy. But loses interest when the first bug hits you, which is pretty much the first "quest" or "Tutorial" seeming where it starts it ends up glitching. The scenario is great though. In the end overall i'd recommend buying it. 

I bought this game because it was cheap at the time, An the results of buying it is what i expected from a older game. I didn't feel any nostalgia from it. But the art is pretty good for when it was made as i said. An overall it's a good game. I'll update this review if i ever decide to re-play the game, an have a less hypacritical oppinion. (Only played less then an hour an you get stuck due to a glitch on the first area not enough "help" or information on playing the game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198117742654', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1465582435}
review:
Ovviamente, guardando al momento al panorama videoludico, oltre a essere un gioco con i suoi anni sulle spalle, si tratta di un titolo con meccaniche e scelte di design/progettazione e sviluppo in generale che ormai da diverso tempo non ho visto pi√π nei titoli da me giocati.
Non ho completato tutte le missioni secondarie, cercato tutte le monete e quant'altro; mi sono limitato a giocare la storia, sia "Luce" che "Oscurit√†".
Enclave ha i suoi difetti, come tutti i giochi. Per me √® stato soprattutto frustrante capire le meccaniche dei combattimenti, con colpi mancati e innumerevoli partenze dai vari checkpoint.
Tuttavia, consiglio questo gioco perch√© √® stato divertente sotto molti aspetti e cos√¨ dovrebbe essere un gioco (difetti inclusi).
Infine, in tutta onest√† mi dispiace non abbia un seguito, davvero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068769124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1467495926}
review:
So I got this game for $0.82 during the final days of a christmas sale, and I thought "for 82 cents I don't expect much. I didn't get more than about 8-15 minutes in before I got bored and gave up to go play some Super Hexagon instead. Controls are acceptable. atmosphere, which is glorified in the trailer and the description, is as atmospheric and interesting as a generic action/adventure game of the later 90's. The actual gameplay is fine, the graphics are quite dated and the overall quality of the game is subpar, but not bad. It's not a matter of graphics or controls with this game, so much as its fault being in its boring landscapes, strangely disjointed combat and utterly generic feel. Nothing interesting, new, innovative or even remotely eye-catching is done with this game. It rides its way comfortably into the safe zone of action/adventure gaming set in a bland and uninteresting medevial world devoid of anything that might make it stand out of the hundreds of its boring and generic cousins at the bottom of the value priced games you find in a cardboard bin at a department store, left to wallow in all they're boring blandness. for $0.82, it is ok, but for full price of $5.60, I think I would rather go have some tempura dynamite sushi..

Better that awful, but can't muster the strength to jump over that "Berlin Wall of Generic Gaming" fence - 5.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198070371986', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1702575023}
review:
An√°lise em PT-BR: Esse √© um bom jogo, o jogo est√° indo muito bem para mim, n√£o √© um jogo com uma hist√≥ria foda, n√£o √© um jogo com gr√°ficos incr√≠veis, mas √© um jogo divertido. Tem uma customiza√ß√£o de personagem n√£o muito boa, mas d√° para voc√™ upar seu personagem, ele n√£o √© um RPG comum, pois n√£o existe XP para ele, voc√™ apenas faz as miss√µes e consegue moedas de ouro para ir comprando armas, escudos, bestas e tudo mais. Aconselho para quem gosta de jogar sozinho e curte um pouco de RPG. Por  enquanto, estou jogando com um Cavaleiro. Devo dizer tamb√©m para quem n√£o sabe ingl√™s, n√£o existe tradu√ß√£o para Portugu√™s, ent√£o aconselho depois dar uma olhada na tradu√ß√£o. Seria √≥timo ver uma remasteriza√ß√£o desse jogo, ou um remake, ou at√© mesmo um Enclave 2. :) Nota: 8/10

Review in English: This is a good game, the game is going very well for me, isn't a game with a fucking story, isn't a game with amazing graphics, but it is a fun game. It has a customization of your caracther, but isn't incredible, but gives you level up your character. Remember, this game isn't a ordinary RPG, because there is not XP for it, you just do the missions and get gold coins to go buying weapons, shields, crossbows and everything. Advise those who like to play alone and enjoys a bit of RPG. For now, I'm playing with a Knight. I must also say those who do not know English, don't have translation for Portuguese, then, I advise then take a look at translation. It would be great to see a remastering of this game, or a remake, or even a Enclave 2. :) Grade: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000943417', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1434717200}
review:
There's a reason this game goes as low as $0.69.

From what I played, it hardly felt like an RPG since progression and events seem pretty static since it's mission based. This game would be fun playing if this were still 2003, but now it just doesn't hold up.

By all means, the game itself isn't bad, but it just felt like theres much better games in the genre that just play a bit better if you're willing to spend a bit more.

Also it kinda has slight performance issues, so theres that as well. Oh, and it has a built-in advertisement that opens your browser without your permission and shows you a newer game that the devs made. That was a huge turn off for me.

Get it if you like fantasy RPGs but have don't have a nice computer and not that much money/nothing else in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025120504', 'num_games_owned': 973, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1427397124}

author: {'steamid': '76561198092250777', 'num_games_owned': 1167, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1424422646}
review:
Would like to recommend this game, but it's glaring issues make this game more frustrating than enjoyable

Pros:

+Some interesting hidden areas to find giving you bonus coins
+Looks great for game released 12 years ago
+Fun classes

Cons:

-You're greeted with a redirect to your browser telling you to BUY PIRATES COVE everytime you load up the game
-The aiming can be very inaccurate especially with bows or mage staffs, which can lead to some very frustating moments
-Very steep difficulty curves, ranging from super easy to the next level being extremely frustrating there doesn't seem to balance at all
-Daggers are absolutely useless
-Very linear levels
-Story is mediocre and voice acting is terrible 

Save your money and buy something else instead, this is not worth your time at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993362526', 'num_games_owned': 2641, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1432160488}
review:
Changing my review... I was criticizing the publisher choice of including an adware, opening the browser to advertise Ravens Cry- but thankfully they came to their senses and removed it.

Enclave is an oldschool action hack n' slash on the similar veins of Heretic II (a personal favorite of all time), Rune, Deathtrap Dungeon and the like- with nice controls, first and third person view, an intriguing storyline and a nice lore and setting that still looks rather nice on modern computers unlike so many other oldies. For me its a newfound classic, a game i hadn't the chance to play on release... so yeah, no nostalgia here. If you like any of the games mentioned, you're bound to love Enclave.

review:
Bon action RPG √† la 3eme personne.
 
Point positif.

+ Graphisme qui ont bien veilli.
+ L'histoire est simpa et deux camp sont jouable ( Lumi√®re et T√©n√®bre ).
+ Un bon nombre de missions, personnage √† d√©bloquer avec des style diff√©rent ( Combat C√†C, Magie et archerie ), √©quipement √† acheter grace √† l'argent qu'on trouve dans les niveaux.
+ Bonne Dur√©e de vie. ( 17h et seulement fait le cot√© lumi√®re pour l'instant ).
+ Difficult√© assez Hardcore.

Point N√©gatif.

- Combat C√†C assez al√©atoire des fois ca touche aucun dommage et des fois on rate ca fait des d√©gats ( aussi bien pour vous que pour les √©nnemis ), combat √† distance pas pr√©cis ( magie et archerie ).
- Doublage version fran√ßaise m√©diocre et voix narrative restait en anglais qui elle est tr√©s correcte mais donne un sentiment de jeu bancale.
- Pas de point de sauvegarde pendant les missions, mourrir = recommencer depuis le d√©but, ca augmente drolement la dur√©e de vie et la difficult√© des missions, certains aimerons, moi pas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046847947', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1424437625}
review:
If you look for a good RPG/ARPG or Hack-n-slash - you've taken a wrong turn.

First and only reason why is game is not even remotely worth your attention - this is a bad port from original xbox game.

1) There's no proper gamepad support, at least I didn't manage to make it usable with both x-input and d-input. What make matters worse - game doesn't react to keyboard keys bound to gamepad buttons, so I had to stick with mouse + KB. And yes, you cannot use mouse in main menu (makes sense since it's a console game in first place).
2) The gameplay itself constantly suffers from random camera spins, random teleportation of your character and sometimes illogical reaction to commands - it can react slowly to button presses, it can execute your attacks way faster than usual. Hitboxes are quite off as well, in fact they are so off from visuals that it's obvious just a few minutes into the game.

I see no point in describing the gameplay itself since I didn't see much, the only thing I can point out is that the combat is really too simple and narrows down to some kind of hit-n-run M1 spam, ranged weapons are almost unusable due to technical issues described earlier. Character development is also pretty much non-existent. Probably was okay for 2003, but now I'd not recommend playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055662076', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1405058699}
review:
Enclave is a fun action game in a fantasy setting (though I wouldn't call it an RPG). You can find it cheap (sometimes FREE if you look around), and for such a low/no cost it's worth a playthrough.

Pros:
[list]
[*]Action-packed combat
[*]Some environment interaction (exploding barrels, siege weapons)
[*]Decent story/lore
[*]Hidden areas to promote exploration
[*]Well-designed maps/levels
[*]You can play the game from two "sides" (good and evil), with different objectives.
[/list]
Cons:
[list]
[*]Less gear options than expected (especially since any progression is gear-based)
[*]Only 1 character to start with (unlock others as you play)
[*]Some areas are very difficult using certain characters
[*]You must complete the first campaign to unlock the second one (IIRC)
[*]No controller support (but it plays fine on KBM)
[*]Most multicore systems will freak out the game. You can run it on a single processor though (the forums have info on how to do this).
[/list]
My biggest complaint is that the game has no multiplayer, which would've been amazing as a battle arena/map feature. Otherwise, it's a decent game for a few hours of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107882088', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 2184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1907, 'last_played': 1525222414}
review:
Its a fantastic fantasy, Rpg game for its age!!!!! This is a 14 year old game Its graphics are impressive for a game of its age and the controls are fantastic. Although yes this may not have steam achivements, this gamestill has trading cards.

I belive its trully a solid game with a lot of character customizations, wepons, character styles and many other choises. The story is to the point so you can get on with the action, filled with hords of enemies, different unique playable characters that you can destory them with and amazing enviroments that will take ur breath away. There are aslo secrets in each level as well as a solid amount of content. Its price its great also but when its the holidays and its gets cheeper its well worth, its basically a steal!!!!

I honestly cant praise this game enough, its really that amazing, i was shocked when i bought it and gave it a try. Definatly worth if ur into first person and third person, action, magic, fantasy, medival sort of thing, just like me ^^
Definatly a 10/10!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129331848', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1424660129}
review:
While the game has aged rather well in a graphical sense, the game play and story are lack luster.¬†

The game feels very unbalanced at times, in some cases you can knock everything the game throws at you down, but in others your fucked.  The mechanics seem broken at times good luck landing a hit with a ranged weapon in close quarters or actually blocking your enemies attacks. Both the player and enemy hit boxes are broken, and the is coupled with the lack of balance is real a shame.¬†

The story is forgettable and generic, but it is nice that the player is given the option to choose a dark side story route.

This game is really not worth the time or money, but if the opportunity presents itself and you can get the game for less than a dollar go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960342473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1418771960}
review:
Fun Hack and Slash action adventure with that certain Conan the Barbarian fantasy pulp feel.

Evil is afoot or whatever so you kill stuff. Theres no leveling, you pick up gold in the levels which after completion gets added to a total you use to not really but kinda buy and sell - its more of a point limit you get to spend on equipment. For example with 100 gold you could equip a sword and armor for both 50 or a bow for 100. Theres usually one checkpoint each level (no quicksaves) and dieing means losing 10 gold - if you manage to find the checkpoint, else game over.

Theres multiple character types to unlock altho some are just straight upgrades (in one case not strangely).

Levels are well designed and varied, for such an old game it really looks amazing if you put all the sliders to the right. Gameplaywise it starts out abit slow but picks up pace along with higher difficulty. 

Melee fighting is rather simplistic tho, you can block and do a 3 strike combo. Something seems off with hitboxes, i had attacks whiff which really should have connected, this is especially noticeable using bows and such in very close range, shots pass right thru enemies if you dont aim at their feet or in first person. Annyoing but workable.

Other minor cons:
- very crashy if not in XP compatibility mode which breaks the steam overlay
- rename or delete install.vdf in the reg folder in the games folder or have a steam store page for some shit open each time you start this

If you remember Severance: Blade of Darkness - this is kinda a lite version. Good fun, recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063662730', 'num_games_owned': 4729, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1424736350}
review:
Good, solid action-RPG

Story: 18/25 Gameplay: 16/25 Graphics: 20/25 Sound: 15/25

OVERALL: 69/100

Enclave is just a good old game, and like many old games, suffers from being an old game. The story was good but not at all memorable and I felt the dark campaign's story was way more intriguing than the light campaign's. The gameplay is a bit all over the place, some levels are hard, some easy. Some classes are overpowered, some useless. It also suffers from occasionally poor hit detection. The graphics are pretty decent for the age and there is a wide variety of locales, but they seem really bland after a while. The the sound is fair but repetitive and the grunts got annoying very quickly. I would get on sale or in a bundle.

Final Note: The Dark Campaign, just ... why, it gets so stupidly hard. Hard in the "unfair" and not the "difficult" aspect of hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090534499', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1459205134}

author: {'steamid': '76561198098823104', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1418530892}
review:
+ Fun and fast paced combat.
+ Interesting plot.
+ Beautiful game for its time (2002).
+ Unique gold and character system.  Instead of sticking to a character from start till end, the player can switch classes and equipments at will before the beginning of every stage.  No need to replay the whole game to try different classes, yay!

- No autosaves, so this game is hardcore (but it can also be a good thing!)  There are checkpoints in the longer stages, though it takes a while to get to them.
- Crashes on me 50% of the time.  

Despite the frequent crashes, I still play Enclave because it's just that awesome.  Go ahead and grab it during sale!
