author: {'steamid': '76561198107869009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1427137937}
review: Das Spiel beinhaltet zwei Kampagnen, einmal darf man die Welt retten und einmal auf der B√∂sen Seite - naja, das Gegenteil eben. Ich habe nach 3h die H√§lfte der hellen Kampagne durchgespielt und das Spiel ist schlichtweg genial. Wenn man schafft, sich mit der zugegebenerma√üen ziemlich alten Graphik anzufreunden, dann ist es perfekt. Die Levels sind insgesamt etwas schlauchig, das mindert den Spa√ü am Spiel aber nicht. Vor Beginn eines jeden Levels ist es m√∂glich, den Charakter zu w√§hlen, mit welchem man das Level spielen m√∂chte, und diesen nach eigenen Bed√ºrfnissen auszur√ºsten. Mit dem fortlaufenden Spiel erh√∂ht sich die Charakterauswahl und es gibt auch mehr Gegenst√§nde, die zur Wahl stehen. Die Motivation, nach M√∂glichkeit alle Charaktere mal auszuprobieren und in verschiedenen Varianten zu spielen ist gro√ü. Bemerkenswert ist au√üerdem der Schwierigkeitsgrad. Selbst auf "Leicht" nimmt dieser n√§mlich ganz sch√∂n rasant zu und bestimmte Situationen gestalten sich als ziemlich knifflig. Ein kleines Manko gibt es dennoch: die Kameraf√ºhrung ist an wenigen Stellen ab und zu etwas suboptimal, aber das ist mir bisher nur sehr selten aufgefallen. Gr√∂√üere Bugs habe ich nicht bemerkt. Hier steckt f√ºr wenig Geld sehr viel Spielspa√ü drinnen, gro√üe Empfehlung! Man bedenke, das Spiel ist von 2003!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038892067', 'num_games_owned': 3918, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1417549588}
review:
Enclave is a fantasy action game. You unlock new characters with different weapons and abilities as you play and depending on your saved budget and unlocked items, you can equip your selected character with a choice of weps, armor and potions, and thats pretty much all the "rpg" aspect.
The game has a story which is not bad but pretty basic and you can play it from the perspective of two opposing factions, you can chose the "light" or dark" campaign at the begining of the game and you will get to play different characters with different stories.

The game stands out by its very well made fantasy setting and an excellent soundtrack. Personally i found the graphics and the music to be outstanding back in the day.
The graphics aged of course but they aged quite well, for the most part they look good even by today standards. They might be technically dated but artistically they are still great.

The combat is solid and quite varied for a hack and slash game. The choice of character is vital because the game is pretty difficult and some characters will do a lot better than others in certain levels. Every level can be completed with any character but the difference in difficulty can be unforgiving.
The levels are not very big but most of them are intricated enough to allow some exploration in search for hidden stuff.

It was one of my fave PC action games back in 2003 but i still enjoy playing it today.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967572794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1417279892}
review:
One of these great games underated you should play at least 'cause of action/adventure gameplay basis it founded !
It's a well managed port of an 1st & 3rd person action rpg xbox game... To be honest, this pc version has way better optimized graphics and controls than this last one. Kinda pr√©cious thing i could estimate while todays developers are not getting confortable with pc for mercantile and pessimistic reasons.


Graphics are clearly outdated from nowadays, lots of clipping, little bit tearing when speeding up camera movement, global cubic rendering but it also works like a charm. Textures are clean even if obsolete and non-HD designed. The game offers quite a few graphical settings very pleasant for a console port. 
Generally, the good quality  level design and architecture serves the medieval fantastic ambiance, environments are inspired and never get redundant. Levels stay linear but some of them are very wide-open ans submited to a labyrinthine path, so it's easy to walk round while you are looking tirelessly for a wood key that will bring you to the next room.

Gameplay is very interesting and fun. As you complete levels , the game gives ability to unlock and play characters with its own skills, and retribute you with coins you gather during the mission. Indeed, before each mission, a menu lets users spend budget in new weapons such as enchanted crossbows, tremendous magical swords, big boom bombs, powerful magical sticks, warrior armors,... Each of these new supplies has a certain cost and doing the cupid globetrotter roaming through the entire level will make you quickly one of the best bashing champions all over the enclave. 
In game, controls are very reactive but aiming is a little bit buggy ; the shots given by your character don't reach ennemy each time you wanna touch its, in fact lots of shots with no damage are expected.The game has a very hard feeling mostly because of this part of the gameplay. It remains thought fairy difficult and at any moment, it become nonsense of frustration as demon's souls can be often.

Soundtrack is a classical variety of dark medieval themes and participates in making the ambiance immersive. However, it is repetitive to hear all the same themes for differents levels so It doesn't offer necessarily an audio consistency to each level that make this boring and annoying after hours. Vocal dubbing is correct, voices actors are convinient despite conviction missing for some of them.

Two campaigns : light and darkness... Very cute and original. Player start first with the light campaign which has a storyline better exploited, longer and devoided with narrative ellipses instead of dark campaign less rich lingering on crucial moments that can be rapidly sent over.

Now it's your turn to save people of the light and/or darkness... And kill them above all, that's the real purpose and leitmotiv of this outlet epic game !

author: {'steamid': '76561198124023743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1416705771}
review:
This was an old favorite on the Xbox classic, so I was excited to check out the PC port all these years later. It still plays exactly the same aside from the new checkpoint system and compatibility bugs which may cause random crashes during gameplay.

The graphics are a bit dated by this point, but for the time they were quite nice and I don't think they have aged that badly. Combat is a little gimped and awkward, but  you can get a feel for it.

Recommended for fans of medieval fantasy hack n' slash.

Polecam wszystkim, ≈õwietna do odstresowania siƒô po ciƒô≈ºkim dniu. Sporo broni, element√≥w uzbrojenia do odblokowania. Walka sprawia przyjemno≈õƒá, mimo ≈ºe nie nale≈ºy do skomplikowanych. Fabu≈Ça jaka≈õ tam jest, ale to przecie≈º nie jest najwa≈ºniejsze w tego typu grach. Jak dla mnie [b]10/10[/b]. Dodam, ≈ºe grƒô mo≈ºna wyhaczyƒá za darmo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046010361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1581363678}
review:
It's fun, but there are some really cheesy issues.  Aiming is awful, and even if your reticle "guarantees" a hit by turning red, you may still miss.  There are some suddenly falling floors or traps in the game that lead to instant death, which is fairly sinful in a game that requires you start the entire stage over upon character death.  Melee attacking has its own problems too, in that every encounter is basically a slap fight with weapons.  Hit detection is iffy and any nuance like spacing or positioning is out the window.  Click, click, click.  Beyond that, the game is still fun and looks ok, player models aside. 

I can't recommend this to anyone but the morbidly interested.   It's not all bad, but it would have been a 6/10 in 2002.  If you just need something to play, then maybe go for it?  Or work on your backlog first, you lazy bum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124632559', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1415633822}
review:
First off! only problem i have seen from the game, was the starting up the game, but the 1 thing i found REALLY a problem...the damn story's don't match up...play light...ok then you go to play dark guess what it seems dark has a time traveling portal that made you kill the light hero in mission 2(dark) then out of no where...your mission 9(dark) runs in with mission 2(light) where did that come from? and how the HELL did dark lose? if they got time travel? in light makes little sense...and the fact that...in some missions...you seen the same things happen from light end up in dark when the maps meet?

 other then that HOLY CRAP this is the 1 of the very few games that run smoother then hell! i have played torchlight 2...guess what little lag here little lag there...here epicly no lag 100% smooth play thru and best part is...i stayed up from 4PM to 9AM X_X beating both light and dark full gold! on my first play thru! :D it really kept my interest which not alot of games do these days! good work! hope i can see more of these smoothe games :3

thing i think would be alot better...if the ranged people wouldn't bust sooo freaking much damage! in hard mode...i mean only toon i could kill them was the...knight...and the berserk the whole game X_X the archers are the WORSE they 1 shot even on easy :P cuz i did a 2nd run from hard to easy to see the damage differents holy crap do archers still 1 shot after mission 8 seems the only way to kill them is by melee block with shield then CHARGE them and...it seems the nightmares need a HELL of a nerf...hardmode...any armor...=1shot seems they got an attack no heros can do which is 100% ignore armor and dark side gets the worse of it WAVES ON WAVE ON WAVES ON WAVES!! in the dream mission :P on the escape mission...i believe i killed around...140? or so...before i noticed they don't end... i think over all...PC is better then xbox with this game :P and i can't believe it took me 9.4hours to 100% gold/bonus mission in both games xD IN HARDMODE! anyways this game was AWESOME!! in my opinion :) also...hint hint...if you disable the auto open browsers on your computer the ads go away :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198002641716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1414938866}
review:
Bought it during the halloween sale for less than a dollar and, considering the number of positive reviews, it really looked like a good deal. 

Well, I decided to write this review so you won't be fooled by the people who say the game is awesome and looks good even for 2014 standards. [b]That's not true at all[/b]. 

In fact, [b]the graphics are really, really outdated.[/b] 

I could live with that, but unfortunately this game has a number of serious and infuriating issues.

First, they use a script to shove ADs down your throat. EVERY TIME you click the "Play" button, it will open a browser tab and show the steam page for a different game from the same company. 

That could create a stupid situation in which you have the game loading in the foreground and a video loading in the background at the same time - IF I could get the game to load right from start. 

For some reason, though, I have to kill the game process and start it again, otherwise the game simply won't open. As a result, it will load the same steam page TWICE. 

Can we have a round of applause for that awful business decision? They managed to make me hate their company even before I could load up the game for the first time, and that is something not even Electronic Arts had done before. Impressive. 

Well, after actually loading the game, I found out it's quite generic and unimaginative. There's some loooong narration to set the scenario but it's not particularlly interesting or engaging. 

The battles are boring and repetitive. Run up to an enemy, hit him, step back. Rinse, repeat. And you'll have to repeat that a lot, because the hit boxes are very small and it's very common to miss swings that should have connected.

I couldn't feel a real sense of progression. There are no shopkeepers, but you can buy your equipment from a virtual shop before starting a mission. Didn't find any loot besides coin, potion and the starting sword/shield. There's a limited amount of money you can find in each level too. 

So far the game looks ugly and boring, but those are subjective aspects and they might not prevent you from actually enjoying Enclave. 

However, there is a very objective issue that can and most likely will ruin your day.  

Enclave has a tendency to crash with a message that says "UNRECOVERABLE ERROR FOUND, press any key to close". It can happen anywhere, any time, for any reason or for no reason at all. 

Well, if you're thinking [b]"I could live with the occasional crash"[/b], think again, because [b]you cannot save the game[/b]. There are a few checkpoints scattered around the maps and you will respawn in one of them if you die, but [b]if the game crashes, all your progress is lost[/b] - you will have to restart the mission from the beginning. All the puzzles, all the enemies, all the traps and doors - you will have to do everything again. 

Unfortunately, the game crashes [b]frequently[/b]. It happened six times in the two hours I tried to play. I wanted to keep going but it felt like a chore and I wasn't having fun anymore. 

I didn't have great expectations (it was only a dollar after all), but  Enclave still managed to let me down. 

I can't in good faith recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065494653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1452611173}
review:
Lo primero que debes saber si dudas en adquirir este juego es que s√≠, tiene m√°s de diez a√±os, pero no por eso deja de ser una estupenda propuesta hoy en d√≠a.

No he jugado demasiado, pero lo justo para explicar un poco qu√© puedes encontrarte aqu√≠.

Primero, es un juego con una ambientaci√≥n de fantas√≠a (medieval fant√°stico, como tantos otros) pero no tan cerca de lo que solemos encontrarnos en los juegos de rol de toda la vida. Es m√°s oscura, m√°s t√©trica incluso, con entornos solitarios plagados de enemigos.

Lo primero que descubres es que la historia es una excusa para recrear un mundo (dividido en misiones relativamente cortas) variado, de dificultad ascendente donde poner a prueba tu habilidad. Es simple (hasta donde he podido jugar) y los protagonistas se ven envueltos en ella por puras casualidades.

Hasta ah√≠, lo "malo", si lo que realmente te interesa es una historia profunda, bien hilada y con personajes carism√°ticos no es la mejor opci√≥n que tienes.

Avanzar implica superar misiones cortas, en las que tu objetivo es completar la tarea o tareas que se te encomienden al principio (ve del punto A al punto B, encuentra X objeto, escolta a X personaje...) y recoger las monedas que hay escondidas a lo largo del nivel.

Cada misi√≥n toma lugar en un espacio no tan lineal, muy bien ambientado (desde una fortaleza-prisi√≥n a diferentes aldeas, pasando por misteriosos templos o escenarios infernales) donde encontrar√°s varios caminos para poder superar cada nivel, variedad de enemigos seg√∫n avancemos en la trama, y objetos ocultos que requerir√°n que repitas alg√∫n nivel o explores concienzudamente el mapa.

EL sistema de lucha depender√° del personaje que escojas utilizar al principio de cada misi√≥n (entre un elenco bastante amplio que iremos desbloqueando) donde podr√°s elegir al guerrero, al arquero, al mago, al p√≠caro, etc.  Personajes a los que armar√°s al comienzo de cada nivel utilizando las monedas que hayas ido recogiendo para obtener mejores armas, munici√≥n para el arco/ballesta, armaduras nuevas, etc. Esto supone una gran libertad a la hora de superar cada reto (Atacar cuerpo a cuerpo con el guerrero, acabar desde lejos con los enemigos utilizando el arco de la cazadora, derribar a varios objetivos con hechizos, etc) y el sistema de "mejoras" de los personajes implica plantear una estrategia antes de lanzarte al combate (¬øGasto mis monedas en una mejor defensa? ¬øComienzo el nivel con m√°s pociones de salud? ¬øMejoro las armas a distancia o consigo una buena espada para atacar de frente?). El sistema es original y las opciones variadas, te encontrar√°s "pic√°ndote" a ti mismo para conseguir todas las monedas de cada nivel para mejorar a los personajes, incluso repitiendo niveles que parecieron dif√≠ciles con el nuevo equipo que has conseguido.

En conclusi√≥n, la acci√≥n tiene un peso mucho mayor que la trama, pero a√∫n as√≠ nos encontramos con un juego de buena ambientaci√≥n, con un sistema de combate decente y un nivel de personalizaci√≥n y mejora original y variado. Adem√°s, algunos enemigos y niveles suponen un reto m√°s divertido que frustrante. Un juego que realmente ha envejecido bien y con un precio por el que merece la pena probarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160053920', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1414434457}
review:
Neben viel Fantasy-Action l√§sst Enclave einem fast immer die Wahl, mit wem welche Aufgabe wie gel√∂st werden soll. Ob man mit der Halblingskriegerin per Flammenschwert den Gegnern einheizt oder als b√∂se Hexe Giftwolken verspr√ºht, ist einem selbst √ºberlassen. Au√üerdem lohnt sich das Erkunden der Levels: Mal findet man einen alternativen Weg √ºber die D√§cher einer Stadt, mal bricht man durch Holzw√§nde und entdeckt unerwartet Sch√§tze. Grafisch kann sich das alte Enclave immer noch sehen lassen. Leider ist der Umfang mit ca. 10 Stunden f√ºr beide Kampagnen etwas schmal, die freigeschalteten Charaktere erh√∂hen zumindest den Wiederspielwert, da jede Mission erneut probiert werden kann, um auch dort noch den letzten Edelstein oder Goldsack finden zu k√∂nnen. An Spiele wie seiner Zeit ‚ÄûSeverance‚Äú reicht Enclave durch leichte Detailschw√§chen und das minimalistisch umgesetzte Kampfsystem allerdings nicht heran.

[h1]Motivierendes Action-RPG aus vergangenen Zeiten.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198089891604', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1438859746}
review:
I hadn't heard of Enclave before I got a coupon code for it and downloaded it for practically nothing, and I have to say, for a game that's over 10 years old, it has aged shamelessly well. The game runs perfectly, and the graphics are surprisingly good, really. The combat system reminds me of the third-person view in Skyrim, only better. A lot better. The game isn't too complicated, and that suits me very well, but if you're looking for a game to completely dive into and a virtual world to be emerged in, this might not be the best game for the task. Nevertheless, this is great value for the money, at least if you buy it on sale.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008831247', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1675494566}
review:
I already owned the game before I added it to Steam. For the time it was made the graphics were amazing and still hold their weight  today. Textures are crisp and I can play this game at 1080p with no issue, the only downside is FoV is locked, though at 95 it isn't that bad.  

Story progression is ok. Light vs Dark and a rift that divides both. Unfortunately the rift is shrinking and both sides are now butting heads. I only wish the characters you meet in playing through the game had at least some back story or names, rather than just Warrior, Druid, Halfling, etc.. 

Combat is fine. Melee combat offers 3 weapon classes, Sword, Axe and Hammer.  Melee weapons also have some form of a combo in where if you swing successively 3 times it produces an end effect. Bows offer a wide range of ammunition from sniper bolts which lets you zoom in at far away targets, standard bolts that allow you to stack them up for a burst shot, fire bolts for damage over time, and explosive bolts for aoe damage. Crossbows are your medium ranged weapon and can be used by both ranged and melee classes. Staffs used by your mages offer a standard attack, close ranged aoe attack, and a shield to block melee and ranged hits.

Character customization goes as far as how much gold you've collected in your play through. Gold acts a point system and it's scattered throughout the game world, some in pots and others in the form of gems.  The more gold you've collected the better things you can equip. This can range from better armor, weapons, shields, staffs, more ammo for bows, etc... I would say your bow users as well as your engineers/bombardiers are more demanding in gold requirements due to how much stuff they can equip while other classes like warriors don't require much at all. Gold you've collected stays with you for your entire progression. Also collecting it all awards something special in the end.

The only sad part about this game is there's no multiplayer, which at the time would have been great as it looks like it could have supported at least 4 players (Just judging by the wave levels in the campaign). All in all it's a good game.

I also still hope for an Enclave 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983520094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1465895952}
review:
Kind of a fantasy third-person action, more of an arcade than classic RPG, which surprised me. Looks fine even between contemporary games with similar mechanics and settings ([i]Fable[/i] is the first thing comes to mind, don't know why). Setting is a bit creepy, by the way - but it's a fantasy game, after all.

Recommended, especially if you missed it when it was released, like it happened with me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998934483', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1413025402}
review:
Tried to play this game, sadly it keeps bugging out at start-up. It kept flickering and stuttering, even fast-forwarding through the menus so much that I couldn't even start the game. I spent a few hours online looking for a fix, and saw that this was a common problem for PC's with multiple cores (which is pretty much all of them these days).

I tried reconfiguring the config files, setting admin start, even setting the affinity to one processor core, but nothing worked. Sadly this game seems to be one of the older games Steam sells that just won't run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006590187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1412029227}
review:
Excelente juego de acci√≥n en tercera persona que nos sumerge en un mundo donde seremos parte de una importante lucha entre el bien y el mal, pudiendo elegir cualquiera de estos dos bandos. Cada lado que elijamos cambiara el destino del mundo a medida que vamos cumpliendo con las misiones.

El juego adem√°s, cuenta con una gran variedad de personajes que podremos elegir y cambiarles el armamento a nuestro gusto, siempre y cuando contemos con el oro necesario que iremos encontrando en cada misi√≥n y que muchas veces tendremos que rebuscarnos para alcanzar.

Los gr√°ficos son algo feos, pero muy bien ambientado. M√°s teniendo en cuenta su fecha de lanzamiento, creo que se han tomado muchas molestias que en juegos con motores gr√°ficos de √∫ltima generaci√≥n no prestan atenci√≥n, adem√°s de que carecen de una buena y atrapante historia como este.
Repito, contamos con fren√©tica acci√≥n en tercera persona (a veces te van a cagar bien a palos y vas a putear por ello), muchos personajes y arsenal para equiparlos, un poco de puzzle (si es que se quiere completar debidamente) y una historia muy interesante donde podremos apreciar dos futuros diferentes a causa de nuestra influencia.

En resumen, para todos aquellos que a√±oran la √©poca de las pentiums 3 con placas voodo de 125MB (como una animalada de potencia XD), que sepan apreciar una buena historia y no solo gr√°ficos excelentes, este juego es para ustedes.

Saludos y espero que lo disfruten tanto como yo =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198091838988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1412296888}
review: So far so good! I bought this for a dollar and it is one of the best values out there at that price.  It is just a fun little action/roleplaying game.   You go around dungeons and by saving characters it adds them so you may play them in further dungeons.   The graphics are dated but still have moments of pure beauty.  There is not a whole lot to be said.  It is not the greatest game ever, but, it is definitely fun and playable.  I found it to be a pleasant surprise and purchased a few extra copies to give to friends when they are having a bad day and need a little pick me up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076487302', 'num_games_owned': 1175, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1412700589}
review:
Nice graphics for the time, shit gameplay for the ages.

For it's era it has nice graphics and they knew that. They push the graphics all over your face. Every menu transition has overly elaborate and unnecessary transition animations. But now that it is a decade later and the graphics have aged all of these are just tedious instead. The game is an obvious console showcase title, and I could tell this was originally a console game just from the menu screen without prior knowledge. It just feels like a console game.

Music is nothing special, I forget all about it about in 5 seconds as soon as I quit the game.

Story is non-existant. Sure there is a huge plot dump with cutscenes and inter-mission logs but it is entirely forgettable. It's the most generic Good vs Evil plot ever. NPCs have no character and neither does the guy you control for that matter. And speaking of the guy you control, you can actually control many different types of classes. They unlock one by one after completing the first few missions. It's rather pointless since they all unlock just a few missions in.

So you can choose what class you want to play as and by choose I mean choose Druid or suffer. Why? Because combat sucks. Hit detection is terrible. Picking an archer might sound nice but it is not so nice when you realize it is impossibile to hit enemies yet enemy archers have perfect aim. Even melee sucks, you just go next to and enemy and mash attack and maybe hit one third of the time. Hit detection is down right broken.

The only class that is worth playing is the Druid because she has a staff that can cast "homing magical bird missiles" and summon a golem to fight for you (although don't expect golem to do much, the AI is terrible). Even homing missiles don't hit all the time, they just circle around the enemy and dissipate but it is your only choice if you want to beat this game without losing your shit over the stupid combat.

But even with the Druid and her gamebreaking weapon, the game is still boring. Because the way the game is designed is more like a corridor shooter than anything else. There are no side objectives and absolutely ZERO exploration. In fact it does that annoying thing where if you steer of the road, it counts down and fails your mission, all because you wanted to get out of the linear path and maybe go for a swim.

Levels are short and all you have to do is get to the next objective. If your objective doesn't include killing enemies you can just ignore them and go the next waypoint and beat the mission. One guy wrote that this game had varied mission. Phwahaha, bullshit. This game has only ONE mission: Get to the objective area and kill enemies in your path if they block you from getting to the objective area. Every single mission is this. Even escort missions are like this. I didn't even have to escort the guy I was suppose to protect, I just ignored him and went to the waypoint and he turned out fine.

Don't waste your time on this one, there are so many other games to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022413675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1443314812}
review:
Hace a√±os que complet√© este juego, pero teniendo en cuenta que tuve la oportunidad de conseguirlo en Steam de forma gratuita no est√° de m√°s que aparezca en la biblioteca. Y no ha envejecido mal del todo pese a sus a√±os.

El juego sigue derroteros similares en cuanto a desarrollo al a√±orado Blade y al sobrevalorado Rune, pareci√©ndose bastante m√°s tanto en mec√°nica como en sistema de combate al segundo. El juego es s√≥lido, con escenarios interesantes que aportan variedad al juego (ciudades, volvanes, parajes des√©rticos, etc), cuya duraci√≥n es aceptable. Es interesante recorrer cada uno de los rincones de los escenarios en busca de oro, pues resultar√° imprescindible. Podemos manejar a varios personajes que ir√°n apareciendo a lo largo de la aventura, t√≠picos (caballero, amazona, hechicera...), pero el detalle diferencial es que se pueden intercambiar al comienzo de cada misi√≥n, aunque lo ideal es comenzar y terminar con uno, y luego pasar al siguiente.

El sistema de combate es tosco, mal calibrado e irregular, al igual que los enemigos, necesitaba mayor pulido, el nivel de Blade dif√≠cilmente ser√° alcanzado de nuevo por desgracia. Eso hace que el juego resulte dif√≠cil, pero m√°s por dem√©rito del mismo que por la propia dificultad. El equipamiento va apareciendo a medida que completemos las misiones, cada vez m√°s potente, y se podr√° adquirir con el dinero encontrado en √©stas. Est√°ndar pero efectivo.
Otro punto es el sistema de guardado, con puntos de reaparici√≥n en el que apareceremos al morir perdiendo unas monedas tan s√≥lo, mal resuelto.
La m√∫sica cumple pero no contiene melod√≠as destacables, al igual que el sonido.

En definitiva, un juego entretenido y dif√≠cil, que no pasar√° a la historia por su originalidad o sistema de combate, pero que se deja jugar y puede resultar un entretenido pasatiempo para horas muertas. Interesante sin m√°s.

Nota: 6,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198101058585', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3225, 'last_played': 1691630442}
review: I first played this game on the original Xbox and beat it many times, but I was honestly sad that it wasn't compatible with the Xbox 360. Our original Xbox works great so I can play Enclave on it again, but I found this game on Steam long before we got the console repaired. The checkpoint system makes the game a little easier to play for rookie players, and the removal of the lock-on circles equalizes the use of all ranged weapons and staves. The difficulty settings are also neat for a classic game. Honestly, I was ok with the original game featuring the lock-on circles, no checkpoints (except for Durzu and Mordessa in the Light Campaign), and no separate difficulty settings. However, I was so excited to see this game again and I just love to be able to experience part of the very beginning of my pre-teen years once again. I just play on the Hard difficulty so I can avoid having the checkpoints, and the game is easy enough to beat anyways. I would recommend this game because it is very simple and straightforward, but it can be also challenging as well because I have still not been able to perfect all characters for all levels just yet. The graphics were excellent back when it was released and the gameplay was just fine back then too. So anyone complaining about the graphics and gameplay can just go back to their overdone next-gen games because this is my favorite all-time game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044991542', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1540433001}
review:
There are very few games which manage to bore and frustrate me so much that I decide not to play anymore not even an hour in.

Pros:
[list]
[*] the graphics are OK for a 2003 game
[*] the premise laid out in the intro seemed interesting
[/list]
Cons:
[list]
[*] imprecise, clunky and boring melee combat
[*] ranged weapons aren't very satisfying to use and bows are completely useless
[*] the first few levels were small, linear and not very creative
[*] the story within the game itself wasn't as good as the intro led me to believe, but it might get better later on
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198071727541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1485774529}
review:
[b]Enclave[/b] √® sicuramente un ottimo gioco. La cosa che ho notato subito √® stata l'azione lineare del gioco e talvolta ripetitiva. Non √® cos√¨ facile proseguire verso la fine delle venti missioni, a causa del livello di difficolt√† abbastanza elevato, ma non proibitivo, quanto per un difetto che, secondo me, √® molto fastidioso: la funzione di salvataggio √® inesistente nelle fasi di gioco e per poter salvare i progressi, dovremo attendere la conclusione di ogni missione. Questa cosa si fa sentire dopo alcune missioni, dato che sono lunghe ed impegnative.

L'ambientazione fantasy ci colloca in un ipotetico periodo medievale tra castelli, fortezze inespugnabili e citt√† racchiuse da mura. Come in tutti i GDR, Enclave ci offre la possibilit√† di controllare ben dodici personaggi (sei per la [i]Luce[/i], sei per l'[i]Oscurit√†[/i]), caratterizzati da una differente classe di appartenenza, struttura fisica e abilit√†. La scelta di un personaggio piuttosto che un altro si rivela determinante per le sorti dell'avventura dato che ognuno ha una differente forza fisica e un diverso stile di combattimento. Allo stesso modo sbloccheremo delle armi sempre pi√π potenti.

La realizzazione tecnica di Enclave √® la parte migliore del gioco, e questo lo rende un capolavoro audio-visivo. Texture ad alta risoluzione, e allo stesso modo i modelli poligonali dei personaggi, gli effetti di luce, le ombre dinamiche ed anche alcuni dettagli come il cielo e le superfici liquide. Anche il comparto sonoro √® di altissima qualit√†.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094118655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1404655907}
review:
One of those games where my memories of it were WAY better. Its too hard to get past the awkward "oldness" that permeates the game at every level. The crummy UI, ultra-shallow combat, imbalances, and the missions that fail to "pull you in" story-wise all just make the game feel dead and empty.

Granted its usually on sale for less than a dollar. But mark my words. If you buy this, you'll be like "man i should have spent that dollar on something else."

author: {'steamid': '76561198052897765', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1426203676}
review:
Before you make your descision on buying it or not it is VERY IMPORTANT to know that this game came out in over 10 years ago, in 2003(?), meaning that if you need your fix for high graphics, walk away now. It's not that they are bad or are comparable to a game like Nidhogg, however you are able to see it's age by all of the flat and repeating textures, lack of any anti alising and even a few very pixely items.

It also has to be mentioned that the menus do not have mouse support, meaning you have to use the arrow keys, Enter and Esc to navigate the menus.

That being said Enclave can be a fairly fun experience if you enjoy it's combat and exploration, the only problem being that the combat is very simple, somewhat cluncky and even unreliable as far as the hitboxes go when it comes to using ranged weapons close up to enemies. No matter who you choose to play as (will be explained upon better later in the review) it feels like an M1 spam fest as that is your only way of attacking with your sword/axe/hammer/dagger. Your other other ways of doing damage is (depending on the character) by pulling out your crossbow/bow/staff, and pressing M1. For it's time it was OK however in a day and age where we have a long list of games with numerous abilities and ways of doing damage, Enclave begins to show it's age. Though it has to be said that the combat is fairly satisfying. When you pull off a combo (depending on the weapon, M1 x Type Of Melee Weapon) the last hit will do double damage, and even give the attack splash damage so any nearby enemy will also take damage. This alone isn't much, but paired with a nice 'smashing' sound and a little bit of screen shake, it truely does feel good when you finish off multiple enemies with your final swing.

Exploration is a different story, whereas the age of Enclave has been hurting it, Enclave shows how older games did their exploration and it made you want to explore the land you were put in. When you start a mission you are put inside a medium/large sized area where there are a number of pickups that will become extremely important in your journey through each level, and ultimately the game itself. You will come across ammo pick ups for your crossbow/bow (may you have one on you or not), health potions, checkpoints and even gold. The health potions and ammo are given and taken away on a mission by mission basis, where you can find 3 potions in a mission, however they will be taken away after the mission is over.

The gold on the other hand is collected and kept for a equipment screen you will use before each mission. When you select your mission, you will be given the option of who you want to use for that mission. Each character has their own loadout (the Druid is the only one who can use staffs, etc.) that you can fill up, which is where the gold comes into play. You use the gold as more of a borrowing system then a buying system seeing as you choose your items from the equipment screen by just swapping through them, taking or returning gold depending on the quaility/quantity of the item. An easier way of thinking of it is by switching out gold with a weight system. Instead of gaining +5 gold, you picked up +5 max weight, allowing you to use better/more weapons/armour/ammo/health potions. The better equipment comes back to help you complete more difficult missions and get more gold.

If you enjoyed playing through the game once then you will be very happy to know that there are actually TWO campaigns to Enclave, the Light side where you face the forces of evil, and a more difficult Dark campaign where you face the forces of good. Besides that there are hoard mode missions on both sides of of the game where you face increasingly difficult groups of enemies to gain gold for the main missions and other hoard missions. These missions can be found by finding maps in the main missions which will open up a new spot on the mission select screen.

All in all, Enclave can be a fun game if you can get past the fact that it's over 10 years old and has nearly everything that comes with it being old. Personally I wouldn't buy it for $5.00 US dollars, but if you can get it while it's on sale (75%+), then I would recommend giving it at least an hour of your time just so you can at least experience what Enclave has to offer. It's not a bad game, it's just dated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012843277', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1409852932}
review:
I was genuinely surprised when I picked this up for $0.94. First of all, after looking at the graphics in the screenshots, I was shocked to read this game is from 2003. The graphics are absolutely wonderful for its time, and even don't look half bad by today's standards; the fact that 1920x1080 is a supported resolution is just icing on the cake. (only the game textures support 1080p though, so the backgrounds look horrendus.) It reminded me a bit of the Champions series mixed with The Witcher.

The combat feels satisfying, aside from the stiffness and slight repetition; timing your blocks and blows is very immersive and can make you forget how clunky other aspects of the game can be.

All that being said, there is a slight problem with misdirection; this can be justified a bit because a lot of games from this time didn't exactly hold your hand, but there were times when I had no idea what to do, and only when I backtracked (or maybe just moved on to an identical area; I don't know), did the game move forward. Certain NPCs don't follow you when they should and seem to have the ability to teleport if you don't stay right on them. 

All in all, I'd say it's worth the $0.94 I paid for it, though I don't know as if I would have bought it at full price. It's certainly worth a play, and it's enjoyable enough to justify the price, even if you only play it a few times.

tl;dr: Can be misleading at times, but the combat and graphics are nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140840508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1409720009}
review:
Ugh, this game...*In Jontrons voice* OOOHHHHHHHH! 

I picked it up for a buck, because why not, ya know? I saw the graphics, and said "Wow, this looks really good for 2003!" Well, looks and plays are two different things, my friend.

To compliment this game, yes, it actually has very nice visuals. Nothing groundbreaking by todays standards, but for its time, they were pretty good. Aside from that? This is kinda terrible. But! it does fall under "So bad, it's good". The combat is just an M1 fest, with absolutely no strategy. Simplicity is one thing, but this is pretty braindead. Enemies either just stand there and take it or run. Actually, I gotta say, the combat reminds me of Kings Field on ps1...all the bad aspects of it. Run forward, slash once or twice, step backward, repeat. It's incredibily dull, to say the least. Oh, and hit collision is choppy.

Not much to say about music or voice acting, nothing stood out. Nothing good, nothing horrible, it's all just kind of...there. The game is very linear. Now, I actually don't have a problem with a game being linear. However, this game is insultingly linear. Not Hallway Simulator 13 linear, mind you, but pretty damn close. 

Overall, Enclave feels kinda like the testing stages for a game. Like, they just finished the engine, impleminted the basic features, but shipped it out before it could be polished up. I guess I could compare it to a beat-em up, but without the satisfaction from said beating up. Can't say I recommened, Enclave, unless you feel like burning a dollar while it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021048386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1409884833}
review: Very well done.  A bit of a different taste of fantasy.  Really well written back story that's given to you from the start, gives you a kind of vibe to start the game with.  Only past the first round now, but it was highly immersive so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046823538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1403413732}
review:
En los juegos de Rol, estamos acostumbrados a participar en la evolucion del personaje a lo largo de la historia jugada. Mejoramos sus estadisticas, su armamento, habilidades, etc. Pero la mayor parte de las veces, una vez que has completado el juego. Es muy, muy raro que nos volvamos a hacer otro personaje y volvamos a jugar desde cero. 
Pues eso es lo interesante del sistema de este juego, al completar las misiones obtienes oro y este sirve para comprar mejoras en cualquiera de los prototipos de personajes existentes. As√≠, si dispones de 100 monedas de oro, podras comprar equipo por valor de 100 monedas de oro para cualquiera de los personajes disponibles.
Y no es que se haya gastando ese oro, porque antes de comenzar cualquier mision puedes cambiar de personaje y emplear esas 100 Monedas de oro en personalizarlo de nuevo, cambiar el arco por una ballesta o decidir que ya no quieres la daga, etc.
La parte mala es que el personaje no evoluciona en s√≠, solo el equipo disponible. Lo bueno es que si tu guerrero ha fracasado una mision estrepitosamente, puedes volver a intentarlo con el mago por ejemplo.
Tambien si el oro no te llega por poco, puedes tratar de repetir una mision anterior y tratar de encontrar todo el oro oculto en esa mision y que antes se te paso.
Los combates no estan nada mal pero el desarrollo de las partidas da una sensacion extra√±a. A veces da mucha pereza empezar partidas nuevas y los escenarios podian resultar tan frustrantes que una partida es mas que suficiente.
En cambio en otras ocasiones enganchaba durante horas.
En fin, un tanto irregular, pero por menos de un Euro (0,89‚Ç¨), lo volveria a comprar sin dudar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103819788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1452821965}
review:
Solitamente non seguo l'idea "gioco gratis/che costa poco = schifezza". Il mondo videoludico √® pieno di titoli particolari, di nicchia o semplicemente datati capaci ancora di divertire (e spesso insegnare come deve essere fatto un gioco). Putroppo non √® questo il caso. Enclave √® gioco gi√† carente, deludente e complessivamente insufficiente alla sua originale uscita. Colmo di bug gravi, un pessimo sistema di combattimento e una storia che invece di coinvolgere f√† addormentare. Riproposto su steam in versione "as is" , senza la minima patch, senza la minima revisione e senza un doveroso aggiornamento di tutte quelle cose che lo potrebbero rendere almeno avviabile. Non st√≤ parlando di modifiche del gioco, ma di cose tanto semplici come:

- correzione di un fastidioso problema che NON PERMETTE l'avvio su sistemi X64 o che montino DirectX 9 o successive (il problema si risolve modificando manualmente un file di configurazione e forzandolo all avvio in OpenGL anzi che in Direct3D). Se non agite manualmente modificando questo file il gioco NON SI AVVIA. Correzione che , per altro, poteva essere fatta in meno di 30 secondi alla pubblicazione su Steam.

-Rilevazione dei controller di gioco "fantasiosa". Nessun controller (joypad) viene correttamente rilevato. Nella migliore delle ipotesi vengono rilevati solo alcuni tasti e, nemmeno sempre, sono assegnabili nel men√π di configurazione tasti. Se avete un pad xbox (un microsoft originale, non una sottomarca cinese...) come me, vi troverete a poter usare 2 tasti (casuali) per confermare o cancellare nei men√π, fine...

Una pubblicazione fatta con i piedi nella speranza che qualche disperato caschi nella fregatura. Considerato che si trova pure gratis, d√† molto da pensare.  All'epoca del lancio lo giocai, e gi√† mi deluse. Ora sono tornato a provarlo esclusivamente perch√® preso gratis, ma , se possibile, noto addirittura dei passi indietro:

Voto 1/10 (considerato che in una scala da 1 a 10 non ha senso scendere sotto 1)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989671763', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1624294369}
review:
Enclave, un juego de Rol con rama de habilidades bastante curioso.

Bastante poco conocido, Enclave ha entrado en el mundo del videojuego sin pena ni gloria, es un muy buen juego, sin duda, pero con una dificultad que sobrepasa lo natural.

Lo de la dificultad es tan dif√≠cil como intento explicarlo, pondr√© un ejemplo literario.

Digamos que estas a 2Km de un checkpoint o punto de guardado, en esos 2Km hay al menos 30 enemigos y no novatos precisamente, a√∫n comprando las mejores armas y armaduras del mercado, los enemigos pueden darte una somanta palos como quien dice "Sup, nigga?" pero ah√≠ no acaba la gracia, para tocarte m√°s los cojo**s tienes que recojer cazoletas de oro por el camino, con 30 de oro cada unidad que recojes, los chechpoints cuestan un dineral, 160 de oro, y si apuras la dificultad te puede subir hasta a 300 que lo he visto de primera mano.

En cuanto a la historia... Ps, es simple, entretenida, no necesitas conocer nada para saber que al final del juego habr√° un super boss m√°s dif√≠cil que derrotar a un Snorlax a pu√±etazos [strike]y todos sus muertos juntos[/strike]

Resumiendo: Es un juego muy divertido, entretenido, un argumento t√≠pico pero con fundamento. Duraci√≥n de unas 10 horas aprox. (Si lo haces todo a la 1¬™ cual Rambo. Yo no puedo jugar porque soy capaz de tirar el ordenador por la ventana y tal...)

MI PUNTUACI√ìN: 9/10

PD: S√≠, le quito puntos a todos los juegos, lo s√©, pero este con m√°s raz√≥n que en ninguno. Su dificultad es tan, pero tan elevada que puede resultar aborrecible si no tienes paciencia y haces un muy buen plan para que no te maten todo el rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067976217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1408813269}
review: Overall it's a very good game both graphically and gameplay wise. Though, if i had to say one thing bad about it, It would have to be along the lines of it lagging and speeding up randomly through the game making the casm clearing jumps very, very difficult. (My computer more than exceeds minimum and recommended specs) That would be my only complaint about the game. In every other aspect of the game you will be stunned at what you find. This game both looks beautiful (given the age of its graphics), sounds amazing, have much diversity with play (both how you play and what you play with character and weapon wise), and above all is it is cheap and easy to get a system to run it. I most definitly recommend this game to anyone that has $5 they want to spend on a game. I enjoy it and I wish for everyone else to enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005908329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1503957078}
review:
I finished this game last night, and i certainly dont understand all the bad rep this game got when i got it.
The game is very good, you hack and slash through the level and collect coin bags and gems stashed and hidden throughout the map to add funds to your "campaign" after a few levels you start getting more characters to use who can also benefit from those war funds.
You can buy your characters weapons, shields, crossbows, bolts (for the crossbow), bows, arrows (i'll let you guess for what), oil flasks, bombs, magic staves, and armor. Not all characters can carry all this, it depends on their class.
You first play as the good guys, and once you finish that campaign, you can turn the table and play as the bad guys which was very rewarding for me. The last few levels (end-game) were dissapointingly easy, but after the madness of missions 8 through 10, it was a welcome break.

I totally recomend the game, you get a few days worth of fun (if you have a busy schedule like i do) for just 5$

author: {'steamid': '76561198109204588', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1408569072}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOhsy5ZkBv265r4eBo6_ZSA/videos

Excelente RPG, le falta un online, pero es muy bueno.
La historia esta fascinante, los graficos tambien, y lo mejor es la optimizacion, con mi notebook, lo corro a 60 fps grabando con Fraps, y con los graficos a tope.
Me sorprendio, la verdad, lo compre por puro aburrimiento, y me lleve una sorpresa.
Felicitaciones a la marca del juego, por sacar esta maravilla.
Especifico:

Graficos: 9/10
Jugabilidad: 8/10
Sonido: 10/10
TOTAL: 9

Conclusion:

Un muy buen juego, una excelente historia, para completar, no se, media hora por dia, como si fuese una novela, y disfrutar de esta maravilla.
EXCELENTE

review:
Positivo:
-Possibilit√† di giocare in 1 o 3 persona.
-Possibilita di fare due campagne (Bene o Male).
-Possibilit√† di gestire l'equippaggiamento.
-Grafica vecchia ma molto gradevole.
-Possibilit√† di sbloccare personaggi giocabili durante la campagna.

Negativo:
-Vari piccoli bug durante il combatimento (avvolte si trapassano i nemici e una volta ero saltato sopra un nemico e mi ero bloccato l√¨, io non riuscivo ad attaccarlo ma lui a me si)
-Storia gia vista.
-Leggermente "tunnelloso"
-Dopo un po' stanca.

Conclusioni:
Secondo me √® un gioco ben realizzato ma esistono GDR molto meglio.
Io il gioco lo preso gratis e ci ho giocato volentieri senza troppi problemi ma dopo un po' stanca.

Voto: 7.5

Well worth the price.

review: Bon petit jeu qui commence a prendre de l'age que j'avais decouvert sur X-Box √† sa sortie. La modelisation des personnages est plus que correct vu l'√©poque, m√™me si els envirionnments semblent ternes et un peu vides. Le gameplay est assez simple bien qu'assez in√©gal selon les classes  de personnages (le coprs a corps semble clairement al√©atoire) et offre globalement un vrai challenge. On note de vrais originalit√© sc√©naristiques (possibilit√© de jouer en parralll√®le l'histoire cot√© t√©n√®bre et lumi√®re), bien que le sc√©nario ne soit pas assez approfondi font de ce titre, un vrai divertissement. A prendre en solde en toutefois, sauf pour les nostalgiques du jeu, ou l 'occasion de d√©couvrir un des hits de l'√©poque.

review:
Caraca, se eu tivesse jogado esse jogo em 2003 acharia o melhor jogo do mundo! Muito bonito a hist√≥ria bem legal. Capricharam bastante nos v√≠deos e tamb√©m nos personagens ele estaria muito a frente do seu tempo, com certeza. Tem v√°rias op√ß√µes de armas e tamb√©m uma armadura diferente para cada personagem (Que s√£o muitos). A movimenta√ß√£o √© meio estranha, por√©m creio que foi bem caprichado para a √©poca, pois √© flu√≠do cada movimento e diferente em cada arma que voc√™ carrega. 

Ele te supreende muito, principalmente quando voc√™ acha que o mapa √© s√≥ aquela parte que voc√™ est√°, mas ainda tem muitos lugares para se ir no mesmo mapa. Por isso √© importante salvar os NPCs que aparecem no meio da hist√≥ria. Eles te liberam passagens secretas :D

Tamb√©m tem a op√ß√£o de jogar em Primeira pessoa que √© muito foda.

Recomendo pra quem quer dar uma variada e gosta de relembrar jogos antigos do estilo Skyrim, e Dark Souls, esse jogo √© muito bom! Vale a compra, principalmente em promo√ß√£o.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054091504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1405283009}
review:
If you're looking for a deep, story driven game, then don't buy this one. However, if you're looking for something to kill time...or looking for a game with a very loose story but mostly serves as an excuse to grind through kills...then go ahead and buy this game. I admit, I haven't played this game for long, so I could very well be proven wrong, but it's maybe worth about the $5 I paid for it. I can't say I love it, and I can't say I hate it. All I can say is...meh. It's OK. The good is the graphics are good for the age of the game and you can (once you have ground your way through campaigns to collect all the characters), play a character to fit your play style. The combat mechanics are simple, but solid. The bad news is it is a bit samey-same and it is, so far a bit of a grind. I can only hope it gets better...at which point I will happily admit I'm wrong, but at first blush it really isn't much to sing about. 

PIty I can only choose between two options here...thumbs up or thumbs down. We really do need a so-so option. I'll go ahead and give this a thumbs up, but with one caveat...if it's more than a few bucks you may be over spending. But if this is your thing, then go for it. It's good, mindless entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030771567', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1405286472}
review:
A decent enough little hack & slash rpg. The combat is a bit...basic to say the least and the AI isn't the greatest. The graphics are decent given the time it was made. The enemies that I have encoutered have all been basic fantasy-ish baddies which is probably to be expected. The biggest gribes, in my opinion, is the story and the voice acting. Moreso the voice acting. The story is pretty much just your average fantasy dribble and is totally forgettable. And, the voce acting at it's best is 'meh' but most of the time it's somewhat of a cringe fest. 

So, yeah, like I said before this is a decent enough little game. It keeps you entertained and, really, isn't that what a game is for?

6.5/10 - I wouldn't pay over what Steam is asking for it but I'd probably wait for it to go on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027274695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1425761979}
review:
Klare Kaufempfehlung:-)
Hab dieses Spiel zwar erst ne std gespielt aber ich muss sagen es ist definitiv sein geld wert und ich kann echt nicht verstehen wieso es nicht bekannter ist. Ich selbst bin nur dadurch drauf gestossen weil ich einen rabattgutschein bekommen habe.
Zum spiel:
Die Grafik erinnert sehr an eine Mischung aus gothic 1 und 2 super gestalltete Figuren, die umgebung hat mehr was von gothic 1.
Es ist halt etwas √§lter das spiel aber man merkts im fast nicht an muss ich sagen.
Das einfachste Kampfsystem das ich bis jetzt gesehen habe aber cool auf jedenfall.
Gegenst√§nde zum Aufnehmen werden ausgeleuchtet und durch einfaches draufstellen aufgesammelt.
In jedem teil gibt es eine bestimmte menge gold zu sammeln von dem die waffen und ausr√ºstung gekauft werden k√∂nnen.
Weitere Spielfiguren wie bei mir jetzt die J√§gerin werden im spielverlauf freigeschaltet.
Es ist kein open world game sondern folgt einer festgelegten story man wusselt halt in einem bestimmten Bereich rum allerdings muss ich sagen das es zum OW fast keinen unterschied hat die einzelnen bereiche sind gross genug und so spart man sich wenigstens das hingelatsche:-)
Ich muss sagen ich h√§tte im nachhinein auch den vollen preis bezahlt so gut wie es mir gef√§llt:-)
Definitiv MUST HAVE GAME

author: {'steamid': '76561197995398449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1404764362}
review:
The Good:
- Great visuals for a game released in 2002
- Good soundtrack (works well enough for the fantasy themes...)

The Bad:
- The combat system is pure garbage. Really bad hit detection thrown in with cheap enemies who seem to strike masses of damage while you struggle to even land a decent blow. 
- Enemy AI is crap (but it often helps me when they jump to their deaths...)
- Storyline and voice acting is medicore. 
- No RPG systems in place whatsoever. Purely gear based (which is not a bad thing), but I am not convinced on its overall execution, as the game's emphasis on combat just doesnt come across as fun. 

The Verdict - A Polished Turd.
Visuals and sound aside, I found little to actually enjoy from the gameplay. If you like this style of this game, go and play Risen, Gothic or Two Worlds instead... They are superior titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009049014', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1406723064}
review:
I remember playing this game on console when it was first released. I loved it then. It looked great, it played pretty well, the story was fun and overall I enjoyed the challenge. That was 11 years ago. Now that I've revisited it, it's a great looking game still, despite all this time, the fighting system isn't the best but the variety of weapons and classes available still makes this game great fun. The story is somewhat weak but for those who haven't played it before, there's enough story to keep you going. Once you finish the light campaign you can replay the game from the bad guy's perspective!

Pros:
‚Ä¢	Visually very impressive.
‚Ä¢	2 complete storylines.
‚Ä¢	Wide range of weapons.
Cons:
‚Ä¢	A lack of direction for the story, it's more of a hack and slash.
‚Ä¢	No character progression.

review:

Die Story macht schon in einer Weise neugierig und man m√∂chte schnell ins neue Level. Die verschiedenen Klassen (Krieger, Druidin, J√§ger, etc.). bringen Abwechslung rein und haben auch jeweils ihre Vorteile. Das System, dass man vor jedem Levelbeginn Klasse und Ausr√ºstung, je nach vorhandenem Gold ausw√§hlen kann, finde ich sehr gutt.

Alles in allem ein sehr gelungenes Spiel. welches die 4,99‚Ç¨ (ich habe es rabattiert f√ºr 0,99‚Ç¨ gekauft) auf jeden Fall wert ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025195556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1686748625}
review:
El juego no es ninguna obra maestra, pero eso no quita que sea tremendamente entretenido y que te pueda dar un buen rato de diversi√≥n. Tiene tanto sus puntos malos como sus puntos buenos, cosas que te sacan de quicio y cosas que dices "Uoh, mola". 
Dos campa√±as con diferentes personajes, y un sistema de equipamiento que la verdad me ha gustado bastante: en cada misi√≥n encontrar√°s monedas (hasta un m√°ximo dependiendo del nivel) que te permitir√°n desbloquear equipo m√°s caro seg√∫n avanzas el juego, el cual cuesta una cantidad de monedas y que deber√°s repartir antes de empezar misi√≥n ¬øDe tus 2000 monedas gastar√°s 1500 en defensa y 500 en ataque o viceversa?¬øMejor espada y peor escudo o me tiro a por la ballesta con cantidad de flechas de varios tipos?
Uno de los problemas que le he encontrado (de los que me sacan de quicio) es que haces m√°s o menos da√±o seg√∫n donde des en el enemigo o seg√∫n donde te den (brazos, torso, cabeza...). Esto en s√≠ est√° bien, pero el problema es que est√° medido al mil√≠metro, y en el cuerpo a cuerpo la mitad de los enemigos son algo m√°s bajos que t√∫, y la mitad de tus ataques pasan sobre la cabeza, y si fuerzas a apuntar bajo, siempre das en los brazos o piernas donde menos da√±o haces. Esto pasa tambi√©n con las flechas las cuales, no se como me las apa√±aba, siempre parec√≠an atravesar al enemigo sin hacerle da√±o en los momentos m√°s cr√≠ticos. Intuyo que pasando entre el brazo y el torso o algo...
Otra cosa buena que tiene es que est√° al 99% en espa√±ol, voces y todo. Lo √∫nico que no est√° doblado son las voces de los v√≠deos, los cuales vienen acompa√±ados de todas formas por subt√≠tulos. 

En definitiva: si os apetece compr√°roslo, sobre todo si lo podeis pillar en oferta, porque si os gusta el g√©nero no os va a decepcionar. Tampoco va a marcar un antes y un despu√©s en vuestra vida videojueguil, pero...

author: {'steamid': '76561198008260372', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1436674874}
review:
Really good old school PC gaming.

Collect new weapons and armor (and even characters during quests if you save them) as you fight to stop the raids of a selfish and greedy people that live across a giant crack in the earth created years ago in a battle. 

Good 1080p graphics
Easy to follow quest system that takes place on a map and opens up new areas to select.

2 different story modes good and evil (evil is unlocked after you beat good i presume, as it wouldnt let me select it right off the bat)

I payed 99 cents and if you are reading this during the sale. DO IT DO IT DO IT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137754312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1404003723}
review:
This game is something else, truly. For starters it has beautiful graphics for it's time, it look wonderful and you can tell the developers worked really hard on them. The same goes for the weapon and shields, they are very nice to look at, and you feel a sense of accomplishment when you can buy that sword, axe, staff, that completely obliterates your enemies in 2-3 hits.

Now, gameplay, the controls are very solid and quite easy to control. At times it feels the mouse is a tad slow when it comes moving around and viewing everything, but it's easy to adjust in the menu. Also, there is no delay in the buttons so it is very nice. 

The fighting is very unispired and makes combat feel more like a chore. After completing the main objective in the quest, towards the end of the game I just bolted out of there. No experience is gained whatsoever, so what's my incentive? Oh, that's right, gold!

Gold, you must collect gold througout the campaign. Some which is hidden VERY well and is extremely UNFAIR to get. When I say unfair, I mean that in this game, there are VERY FEW checkpoints. And if you aim to 100% this, you are going to pull out  your hair. Thing about checkpoints is, if you happen to reach one, but die..you lose gold. And that means you have to start over on the level completely in order to get all gold. Note, you need gold if you want to 100% the guy, buy more items and also  unlock all the characters. Again, it wouldn't be so bad if they weren't in such ridiculous spots. Earlier I said the controls are spot on, which they are, but the way these pots of gold and jewels are placed, it's beyond ridiculous. 

Storyline, it was very meh. You don't connect the chracters at all and the cutscenes and whatnot are very short and semi-informative. I didn't really play it for the storyline, mainly nostalgic reasons. I played it previously on Xbox and just had to relive this games graphical beauties one more time.

Overall, I do recommend this game. And give it a 6/10. The graphics are what really makes this game, but also the nice weapons you purchase as well. The combat is very so so and the story is..well it's a story. Fun game if you want to hack and slash, but that's all you're really getting out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035808481', 'num_games_owned': 1625, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1434277952}
review:
Its a hack and slash game, so there is not a whole lot to expect.
You run around and hack and slash yourself through the enemies. There is a bunch of hidden treasures and even some maps that give you access to hidden levels. You collect gold in each level and in between you can buy better armor/weapons more motions etc. You unlock a bunch of different characters, that repeat themself not only in the form of being the same characters with different looks for both the dark and light campaign, but also by getting, lets say a sworsman in level 1 and in level 10 you can play the knight, that is the swordsman with more life and attack. so why bother with the swordsman? The classes therefor are basically: archer, mage, swordguy, something wird with bombs (never used that guy). The gold part is very interesting by the way. If you have, lets say 1000 gold and you get an armor for 500 and a sword for 200 then you still have 300 for potions or whatever. BUT: if you unequip the armor you get those full 500 back. This means you have a certain amount of gold, with which you can work and which equips whatever you want. Its seperate for each character as well. So you can use those 1000 gold to equip your archer and if you feel like playing mage instead you can use those 1000 gold no matter what your archer has equipped. The graphics are old but they dont hurt the eye or anything. The story is meh, but its about hacking and slashing not questing. you have small levels which you go through one after another and except for hidden treasures and levels there is not a whole lot else to do than to fight yourself through these levels. 

There is two more things you need to know: 1 Its brutally hard. Even on easy mode you will die often. Why is this a problem? Because if you die you have to restart the entire mission, unless you found a checkpoint. if you got one of those you only lose 5 gold if you die and restart from there. the monsters you have slain even after reaching the checkpoint stay dead. what else makes it hard? terrible hit detection. I played through the entire game light and dark campaign and I have no clue whatsoever as to when something counts as hit and when it doesnt. I smash my enemy 15 times and they dont take a scratch, I hit somewhere completely else and they get damage? Same goes for me, believing that hiding behind my shild will block the enemy hit. What a foolish thought.

Fazit and TL:DR:
Its mindless fun. See the enemy, kill the enemy, plunder the gold floating around everywhere and slay more enemys. And die a lot of times meanwhile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988091166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1688658751}
review:
Fun and easy to play. 

Run around in 3rd person with a character chosen from an ever-growing band of classic fantasy heroes (or villains, after 1st playthrough). 
Swing your medieval killing tool of choice. Or zap some fireballs if you selected a mage. 
Jump and dodge, explore and run some more. Soup up with new maces and mail afterwards.
Repeat for two campaigns a ~12 maps each.

Everything is pretty solid- puzzles, character/monster design, pacing, even the music. 
Combat is VERY basic. No complicated combos, chains or counters.

Enclave aged relatively well since...
a) its a small niche 
b) the character designs are rather decent and 
c) -that is the game's main strength- Enclave did aim low but totally gets it right.

Verdict:
Hideous paws arrange 3/5 skulls for Vatar's throne.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998118312', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1403225598}
review:
The Good:

+ Given its age the graphics are pretty decent. Nothing spectacular but I was surprised how good it looked for such an old game
+ Multiple characters to fit your own playstyle. The main element of this game is that you choose what kind of character you want, knight, hunter, druid, wizard etc collect gold in the levels and then outfit your favorite character with weapons and armor
+28 levels between light and dark campaign. 

The Bad:
-Game has no balance, some character are completely useless while others just destroy eveything, 
-level difficulty is all over the place, some levels are a pain in the ass while others you will breeze through with no difficulty 
-the combat in the game is very basic, 
-The story is forgettable and serves only as an excuse to kill things 

Overall:
6.5/10- If you can get the game cheap then go for it but currently I wouldn't really recommend it.

review:
One of the dumbest and worst games ever made...

+Music
+Sounds
+Cutscenes 
+Voice cast did an okay job
+Some interesting locations
+Pre-mission page
+Druid has a nice as.s
+/- Some funny moments
+/- Some wall pictures
+/- Sharks in the water
-Graphics
-Buggy/glitchy mess
-Lack of graphics options
-Very basic characters and background story
-Got this free on Humble Bundle or GOG. Even free it's not worth the bandwidth or the laser energy to burn to DVD.
-Weapon choices
-Texture quality
-Some enemies spawn out of thin air and go back just the same
-A.I. is very very very stupid
-Enemies
-Arenas
-Level design is very very very very bad
-Horrible horrible combat system
-Combat animations and detection are almost useless
-Story
-Script

review:
Muy buen juego realmente, tiene una gran historia, unos gr√°ficos (para la epoca en la que fu√© lanzado) bastante buenos y un modo de juego bastante divertido.
Te atrapa durante horas y no puedes dejar de jugarlo.
Lo unico que puedo decir que tiene de malo es que a veses las batallas pueden ser algo monotonas, pero esto se soluciona con los magnificos escenarios y diversidad que tienen los niveles.
En f√≠n, un juego que vale la pena comprar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001490367', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1500757694}
review:
Enclave is considered as an underrated gem. Even story setup is quite weak, but its gameplay is solid. The combination of 3rd person hack-slash with dungeon crawler feels give us enjoyable experience. The more you progress through the game the more characters and customization are unlocked which give variaty of gameplay. Even some levels likely force the player to choose proper character to beat and there's no checkpoint during one level.
It's still fun and challenge game.
